title: Business Controller - Mass Electric Transportation
description:
Requisition ID: 142419

Job Level: Senior Level

Department: Business Management

Market: Transportation

Employment Type: Full Time

Position Overview

The Business Controller is the cornerstone of finance and accounting functions for Mass Electric Transportation. As a trusted business advisor, this role works closely with management to maintain solid business functions and provide information in a timely manner to support business needs. Similar to a CFO, the Business Controller is accountable for the accuracy and timeliness of financial reporting and developing procedures and controls to maintain integrity over all financial data. This position is also responsible for monitoring and advising on operational strategies, recruiting and developing the future talent of organization, and providing meaningful insight and financial analysis to management. The Business Controller also requires strong leadership skills in the areas of training, communication, professionalism, and strategic thinking.

District Overview

Mass. Electric Construction Co. (MEC) is a subsidiary of Kiewit Corporation, and an industry leader in transit and rail systems’ construction and maintenance throughout the United States and Canada. MEC specializes in the installation of Overhead Contact Systems (OCS), Traction Power Substations (TPSS), Signaling and Train Control, Communications, and Control Centers. At MEC we maintain our commitment to hire the best people, provide the training needed to keep up with the demands of today’s work environment, and the opportunities to grow and advance within our organization. As the most experienced installer of rail and transit systems in North America, MEC takes pride in being recognized as the Systems Contractor of Choice delivering innovative solutions through aligning our technical expertise with our client’s objectives. We self-perform most disciplines providing time, cost and scheduling efficiencies, as well as in-house expertise, resulting in seamless performance for our clients.

Location

One of the many things that makes Kiewit’s culture unique is that we go where the work is, which exposes your career to abundant opportunities. We relocate our teams based on the work that is available, combined with the development plans, skill sets and career goals of each team member. This means your Kiewit adventure is custom-designed to meet our shared needs.

Responsibilities

  • Acts a key leader in the organization by exemplifying the core values of Kiewit culture
  • Be able to analyze and effectively communicate financial results of the organization to management, including revenue, cost, backlog, overheads, G&A, etc.
  • Earn trust, credibility, and buy in of processes from Operations team to create better cohesion and clear communication within the organization
  • Ensure proper implementation and execution of internal controls to maintain highest level of data integrity
  • Develop accurate budgets, drive accountability, and provide integrated ways to improve cost across the entire organization
  • Set aggressive goals and high standards to continuously improve business processes (tools & reports) and targets (projects and overheads)
  • Communicate development goals, constructive feedback, and future opportunities clearly and completely in conversations with all team members
  • Challenge, motivate, and lead subordinates towards a common goal, while providing radically honest feedback along the way
  • Deliver impactful presentation of goals and progress during strategic business planning sessions
  • Reviews all estimate cash flows, payment terms, and Joint Venture agreements in detail for financial risks and opportunities
  • Thorough reviews of each project/department projections, reporting, and risks/opportunities

Qualifications

  • 7+ years of financial/data analysis experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, and/or an equivalent degree is required
  • Strong knowledge of GAAP, internal controls, and accounting practices.
  • Strong financial management skills including cash management, budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
  • Ability to lead a team, manage the monthly and annual reporting processes, and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
  • Excellent organizational, time management, and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and consistently achieve required deadlines.
  • Very detailed oriented, but also able to see the “big picture”. Ability to think both analytically and creatively.
  • Deep knowledge of Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent communication skills, resourcefulness and initiative
  • Must be able to freely access all parts of a construction site in wide-ranging climates and environments
  • Travel may be required for this position (up to 25%)
  • Must be willing to relocate for first assignment location if not local
  • Ability to work in Canada without sponsorship, both now and in the future

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • CPA, MBA, or public accounting experience preferred
  • Financial or accounting experience in construction or engineering industry
  • Experience using SAP
  • Proven track record of developing or managing a team

We believe in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination and comply with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate.

title: Logistics Controller
description:
As the nation’s leading bottled water company, BlueTriton Brands is dedicated to providing customers with healthy hydration options. Alongside that, we’re also committed to developing our people – enabling them to make the most of the many elements that help them to succeed. It’s a chance to use your knowledge, skills and experience to shine brightly and achieve your ambitions – all while delivering healthy hydration to millions of customers.

Choose a career in Supply Chain and Technical & Production and you’ll be part of our logistics backbone – and a crucial element of our success. Our factories are where our products start their journey to the customer. This area of BlueTriton Brands offers you the chance to experience collaboration in its purest form as you work alongside a diverse range of highly motivated and passionate people in our Supply Chain factories spread across the nation.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a Logistics Controller (L6) to be located in our Guelph, Ontario factory reporting to the Northwest Region Controller. Options for hybrid office schedule available.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

Reports to: Regional Operations Controller , Northwest


  • Full financial controllership for 3 Logistics Regions across Canada and the United States which includes 11 factories, 5 distribution facilities and approximately 200,000 freight shipments.
  • Fiduciary responsibility for Logistics financial reporting, controls and analysis. Logistics consists of Transportation, Warehousing, and Planning business activity as well as the inventory control environment. Estimated expense responsibility is $300MM+ annually.
  • Leadership skills and ability to influence with integrity are a must. Partner with the two Regional Logistics Directors in the Region (West and Midwest/Canada). Be a confident, value-add Co-Pilot of the operational business with strong inter-personal skills. Provide indirect leadership for the regional operations team (approximately 20 operational leaders). Own education and training for operations cost structure and the key drivers guiding data-driven business decisions.
  • Manage Period End Close process including accurate financial statements, detailed analysis of P&L, and regular reporting for both the local operation, national operations, and corporate finance.
  • Lead and own the annual budget process for the region by partnering with operations and creating a bottoms-up plan with a high level of detail supporting BTB business strategies and continuous improvement.
  • Produce a detailed monthly dynamic forecasts for the balance of the year. Be able to articulate, with sound support, the drivers of forecast changes via a monthly executive presentation. Must understand the complex dynamics of sales demand, production trends, supply expectations, transportation, inventory obsolescence and labor productivity.
  • Ensure all areas of Supply Chain are compliant with BTB accounting and control policies.
  • Work with local leadership on financial justifications associated with logistics related capital expenditure.
  • Monitor general accounting functions such as A/P, payroll and fixed asset management as it relates to the distribution environment. This includes indirect oversight of invoicing related to 3rd party storage and handling, freight payments, and pallet reconciliation by working with centralized management teams.
  • Provide coaching and direct leadership of the Senior Financial Analysts. People development experience is required.
  • Calculate, review and report on various monthly KPI’s which summarize regional performance in key areas of the business along with leading measures to improve results.
  • Proactively partner with national counterparts to collaborate on Logistics finance opportunities within the entire national network.


Qualifications

Key qualifications include:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business
  • MBA or Master’s Preferred, CPA a plus
  • Minimum 7 years of Finance experience or an equivalent combination of education training and experience.
  • Supply Chain experience required.
  • Leadership skills and ability to influence with integrity are a must.
  • Ability to Co-Pilot and partner with operational leaders to drive business results.
  • Ability to work in a complex, changing environment.
  • Strong systems skills (e.g. Excel, SAP, Essbase, and Business Warehouse reporting).
  • Excellent Analytical ability required. Ability to analyze large data sets and handle high volume of transactional data.
  • Strong controls experience preferred.
  • Some travel required (5-10%).

Position can also be located in Ontario, California.


BlueTriton Brands is the nation’s leading bottled water company. Our water brands include Poland Spring, Arrowhead, Ozarka, Deer Park, Zephyrhills, Ice Mountain and Pure Life. We’re passionate about creating shared value for society in all kinds of ways: from providing careers and benefits to communities where we operate to environmental stewardship – most notably responsible water management, lightweight packaging and advancing recycling in America. As a valuable part of our team, you’ll receive a competitive total rewards package – something that will provide you with the support you need to thrive both inside and outside of work. It’s not just the work that you’ll find fulfilling here though. As you build a career with us, you’ll receive exactly the kind of benefits you’d expect from a leading name in healthy hydration. The only question is, what elements will help you succeed at BlueTriton Brands?

Applicants with criminal histories are welcome to apply.

BlueTriton Brands is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and is looking for diversity in qualified candidates for employment: Disabled/Veteran.

We relocate our teams based on the work that is available, combined with the development plans, skill sets and career goals of each team member. This means your Kiewit adventure is custom-designed to meet our shared needs.

Responsibilities

  • Acts a key leader in the organization by exemplifying the core values of Kiewit culture
  • Be able to analyze and effectively communicate financial results of the organization to management, including revenue, cost, backlog, overheads, G&A, etc.
  • Earn trust, credibility, and buy in of processes from Operations team to create better cohesion and clear communication within the organization
  • Ensure proper implementation and execution of internal controls to maintain highest level of data integrity
  • Develop accurate budgets, drive accountability, and provide integrated ways to improve cost across the entire organization
  • Set aggressive goals and high standards to continuously improve business processes (tools & reports) and targets (projects and overheads)
  • Communicate development goals, constructive feedback, and future opportunities clearly and completely in conversations with all team members
  • Challenge, motivate, and lead subordinates towards a common goal, while providing radically honest feedback along the way
  • Deliver impactful presentation of goals and progress during strategic business planning sessions
  • Reviews all estimate cash flows, payment terms, and Joint Venture agreements in detail for financial risks and opportunities
  • Thorough reviews of each project/department projections, reporting, and risks/opportunities

Qualifications

  • 7+ years of financial/data analysis experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, and/or an equivalent degree is required
  • Strong knowledge of GAAP, internal controls, and accounting practices.
  • Strong financial management skills including cash management, budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
  • Ability to lead a team, manage the monthly and annual reporting processes, and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
  • Excellent organizational, time management, and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and consistently achieve required deadlines.
  • Very detailed oriented, but also able to see the “big picture”. Ability to think both analytically and creatively.
  • Deep knowledge of Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent communication skills, resourcefulness and initiative
  • Must be able to freely access all parts of a construction site in wide-ranging climates and environments
  • Travel may be required for this position (up to 25%)
  • Must be willing to relocate for first assignment location if not local
  • Ability to work in Canada without sponsorship, both now and in the future

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • CPA, MBA, or public accounting experience preferred
  • Financial or accounting experience in construction or engineering industry
  • Experience using SAP
  • Proven track record of developing or managing a team

We believe in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination and comply with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate.

title: Traffic Controller
description:
What does your dream company look like? If it's a fun, hyper-growth startup where you have the opportunity to learn and grow, RenoRun is for you!

As a Traffic Controller, you will be primarily responsible for directing traffic of trucks and personal vehicles in our warehouse yard. You will be part of the safety team and will be crucial in helping keep the team safe. You will be an integral part of the success in our mission to  'empower contractors to build the world around us'.

Compensation: starting at $21/hr + performance-based increases and the opportunity to grow!

Perks:

  • Health, Dental & Vision Insurance 
  • Paid Time Off (vacation and sick days)
  • Employee Stock Option Plan
  • Employee RRSP matching
  • $60 reimbursement for steel-toe boots
  • Overtime paid at time and a half

Warehouse Location: Etobicoke, ON M9C 4V8 (on-site)

Schedule: Full-time, 40 hours per week, shift options:

  • Mon-Fri 5:30am-1:30pm
  • Mon-Fri 1pm-9pm

Your typical day includes:

  • Direct incoming and outgoing traffic in the parking lot for start and end of shift
  • Control flow of traffic at all times for our deliveries / returns and parking lots
  • Protect employees in loading areas from incoming drivers
  • Ensure that everyone follows the safety standards of conduct when operating vehicles in parking lots / loading areas
  • Perform daily safety checks and other tasks as needed

What you bring:

  • Comfortable working outdoors
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs
  • Valid class G driver's license with a clean abstract (from Service Ontario)
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
  • Asset: Flagger certificate / Traffic Controller certificate

For more information visitwww.renorun.com

At RenoRun, we strive to build a workforce composed of individuals with diverse identities, backgrounds, abilities, and minds that will help us to grow, not only as a company, but also as individuals. RenoRun is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Traffic Coordinator
description:
Description

 

POSITION SUMMARY:

This position primarily handles Resin finished goods shipping and manages on-hand inventories for the Resin department. Conducts daily work activities in support of HSE objectives and policies. Use personal accountability to assist with carrying out duties, responsibilities and authority as defined in HSE programs, practices and procedures. Understand HSE policies and programs. Work safely, with respect to health and environmental requirements 

RESPONSIBILITIES

1/ Health, Safety & Environment 

  • Works safely with respect to health, safety and environmental requirements including following all safety rules.
  • Maintains a clean and safe work area.
  • Conducts daily work activities in support of HSE objectives and policies.
  • Demonstrates personal accountability to assist with carrying out duties, responsibilities and authority as defined in HSE programs, practices and procedures.
  • Assures compliance to PSM standards (MOC’s, PSSR’s, Procedures, Audits, etc.)
  • Maintains protection of the environment and the health and safety of our employees, customers, and the communities in which we operate and/or transport our products, as our highest priority.
  • Demonstrates and practices safe handling of hand tools and power tools.

2/ Schedule Resin Finished Goods Shipments to Oxy Vinyls Customer Base

  • Interprets daily, the SAP Delivery Due Reports to identify required customer orders from plant (565) and transload terminal (T425).
  • Determines, using SAP/PRI/LIMS best suitable on-hand inventory to
    meet customer requirements.
  • Communicates with trucking firms, to arrange pickup and delivery of customer orders.
  • Processes resin rail shipments within SAP Database.
  • Reviews previous days shipping documentation vs. system entries, to verify data integrity.

 

3/ Manage Resin on-hand finished goods inventories

  • Maintains sufficient silo storage space to ensure production uptime.
  • Reports Daily PVC Storage inventory and ensures sufficient inventory for upcoming orders. 
  • Communicates with rail crew, to position rail inventory for all trainload shipments.
  • Schedules hopper car loading to meet order requirements.
  • Interfaces with Production, Lab, and Distribution staff to best manage daily production.
  • Isolates and segregates any non-prime production. Turnover material and PRI/SAP database.
  • Co-ordinates re-working of Grade 4 inventory.
     

4/ General Duties

  • Interfaces with Account Reps, Quality/Distribution Supervisors/Managers to resolve Customer complaints.
  • Interacts with carriers regarding transportation concerns.
  • Co-ordinates customer returns and completes SAP system entry.
  • Updates Niagara Hopper Car Fleet daily, within IT system.
  • Authorizes carrier invoices for accessorial charges and forward to Head Office for payment.
  • Completes miscellaneous shipments in compliance with TOSCA and TDGA when applicable.
  • Supports Department objectives.
  • Tracks inbound VCM cars.
  • Reports daily VCM inventory and verifies shipment schedule will meet plant’s production needs.
  • Reconciles daily VCM cars unloaded in SAP.
  • Updates “Railtracs” system daily with hopper car “load and holds”.
  • Works with Oxy maintenance and Dallas transportation to co-ordinate hopper car shop repairs.
  • Works with CMR to co-ordinate on site minor hopper car repairs.
  • Assists plant Controller with month end FG + VCM tracking.
  • Participates in quarterly “transportation and distribution” conference calls.

 

Qualifications

 

Education: Successful completion of a community college diploma, preferably in a (STEM) diploma program (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math). General knowledge of plant distribution processes, logistics of raw materials and finished goods shipments and related systems. General knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and regulations. Knowledge of and ability to operate computer software applications. (SAP knowledge preferred).

Experience: Developed interpersonal / communication and ability to work cooperatively and respectfully within a team. Ability to deal with other staff and corporate with tact, diplomacy and courtesy. Required to work overtime, weekends and holidays as needed to maintain a 24/7 operating plant. Related experience in plant operations with a focus on plant distribution and logistics and be familiar with plant operations, systems, processes and procedures would be an asset. 

Physical requirements – Must be able to perform the physical requirements of the position including sitting, walking, bending, stooping etc. Must have attention to detail and ability to concentrate on computer screens and accuracy of data. Must be able to respond to visual and audible alarms.

title: Traffic Technician
description:
JOB POSTING #:  2022-0176

POSTING PERIOD:  Wednesday, May 4, 2022 at 8:30 a.m. to Tuesday, May 10, 2022  at 4:30 p.m.

DEPARTMENT:  Public Works Operations 

UNION:  CUPE Local 543

JOB CODE: 543123

POSTING STATUS:  Regular Full-Time

GRADE/CLASS: 0.12

# OF POSITIONS: 1

RATE OF PAY: $27.46 - $32.27 per hour

SHIFT WORK REQUIRED:  No

DUTIES:

  • Reporting to the Manager of Transportation Planning, this position independently undertakes, inputs, tabulates and reviews yearly, average daily traffic counts
  • Coordinates summer students and other staff in conducting turning movement counts, warrant studies, traffic studies and surveys all of which require travel to field locations
  • Maintains accurate files, including computer files, of traffic volume and warrant studies; reviews oversized load applications; reviews and arranges detour routes in cooperation with other Departments, utilities and contractors; prepares collision diagrams and accident statistics
  • Provides training and assistance to those assisting in surveys and studies 
  • Reviews applications and prepares comments related to Street and Alley Closing Committee; reviews and makes recommendations regarding site line obstructions and other traffic related matters
  • Reviews and makes recommendations for personal handicap parking spaces; attends various meetings as required including pre-construction meetings and Street and Alley Closing Committee Meetings
  • Handles general complaints from the public and City Council and prepares responses as required
  • Maintains amiable relations with the public and fellow staff 
  • Will perform Occupational Health & Safety duties as outlined in the Corporation’s Health and Safety Program. 
  • Will perform other related duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must have a three (3) year Transportation Engineering Technologist or Civil Engineering Technologist Diploma from a Community College or Ontario Ministry of Education equivalency;
  • Must have over six (6) months of experience working in a computerized and traffic/transportation environment utilizing the Microsoft Office Suite of Products, particularly Outlook, Word and Excel;
  • Must be eligible for certification as an Engineering Technician from O.A.C.E.T.T.;
  • Must hold and maintain a current valid and lawful Class ‘G’ Driver’s Licence in accordance with the Highway Traffic Act, for the purposes of operating a City of Windsor vehicle and provide a driver’s abstract as a condition of employment;
  • The physical demands analysis associated with this job indicates a heavy level of work.
  • Must complete a post-offer agility test in an effort to assist the successful candidate in completing the position tasks safely and to aid in minimizing injuries on the job;
  • Must be familiar with the Highway Capacity Manual;
  • Must be proficient in mathematics and traffic survey techniques;
  • Must have proven oral and written skills as well as public relations skills.

NOTE:

  • All City of Windsor employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment in accordance with the City’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy
  • Only those applicants selected for an interview will be acknowledged
  • We offer a smoke-free office environment
  • Personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Act, c. 25 as amended, and will be used to determine eligibility for employment.
  • The Corporation of the City of Windsor is an Equal Opportunity Employer

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, the City of Windsor will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.  If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the City of Windsor Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Traffic Coordinator
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Traffic Coordinator for our Regina location. This position is the front line role coordinating day to day traffic booking tasks. The Traffic Coordinator will analyze shipping requests, identify options based upon their knowledge of the transportation carrier base, and select carriers to maximize savings and efficiencies.

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. To get the best value when procuring transportation services in terms of timeliness, reliability, price and delivery.
  2. Responsible for day-to-day traffic booking activities.
  3. Utilize agreements created by the Traffic group to procure carrier services as required to meet Brandt’s shipping needs.
  4. Negotiate effectively with carriers to obtain best value. Refuse attempts to impose additional charges for services that should normally be included in base fees, and escalate negotiating impasses to Traffic Team Leader.
  5. Produce purchase orders from requests/requisitions/ analysis of shipping schedules to ensure timely
    pickup and delivery activities. Coordinate with manufacturing to eliminate demurrage and delays.
  6. Utilize the Traffic Booking Online Program to ensure all requests are handled in a timely manner.
  7. Follow standard Traffic Department operating procedures.
  8. Identify and address issues related to the traffic booking process as they arise, escalating unresolved issues to the Traffic Team Leader.
  9. Maintain/improve carrier relationships.
  10. Document carrier performance and participate in carrier reviews as required.
  11. Resolve Accounts Payable issues as it applies to carrier invoices, and provide invoice G/L coding when needed.
  12. Continually develop market knowledge and understanding of Brandt processes, and use this in negotiations with carriers to solve transport challenges.
  13. Participate in sourcing projects related to traffic service as directed by the Traffic Manager.
  • 3 to 5 years of relevant experience.
  • Post-Secondary education in Business Administration or similar discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Fluent in French considered an asset
  • Experience in ERP systems.
  • Knowledge of MS Office software, esp. Excel, Word, PowerPoint

title: Commercial Transport Technician
description:
COMMERCIAL TRANSPORT TECHNICIAN POSTING

First Truck Centre is Canada's first and longest standing DTNA Elite support certified group of facilities in Canada. Representing brands like Freightliner, Western Star, Autocar and Thomas Built Bus, we provide total customer support. Through our values of being honest, a good team player, and having a smart work ethic, we continue to grow and profit into a sustainable enterprise. We offer various sales, vehicle maintenance, necessary parts, and collision services that span across eight branches throughout Western Canada.

Opportunity:

First Truck Centre has an exciting opening for a Commercial Transport Technician in our Fort St. John location. Responsible for performing repairs on class 6,7, and 8 vehicles of our customers, the Commercial Trasport Technician will contribute in one of Canada's best managed companies. Be a part of a team that takes trucking to the next level of quality and professionalism. Our Elite Support certified dealers provide top quality in all aspects of our business.

Responsibilities:

  • Troubleshoot, diagnose, repair and maintain our customer's OEM class 6,7,8 vehicles
  • Replace damaged structures, body parts, interior and exterior finishes.
  • Update the Shop Foreman if technical assistance is required
  • Make any warranty decisions as necessary
  • This position works as part of a team with co-workers, service managers, and outside vendors to ensure professional quality detail and care for customers.

Skill Set:

  • Mechanically inclined with a strong aptitude for diagnostics, repairs, and maintenance
  • Diagnose and repair body damages to fiberglass and suspension components
  • Specialize in surface preparation, sheet metal work, refinishing
  • Light mechanical and suspension experience an asset
  • Ability to work in a physical capacity including heavy lifting and using tools throughout the shift
  • Proficient with keyboarding and comprehensive report writing

Requirements:

  • BC Red Seal Body Technician trade ticket
  • 2nd year Apprentice or higher will also be considered
  • BC Class 5 driver's license
  • Work a 4 on, 3 off 10 hour shift

title: Chef d'équipe signaleurs routiers
description:
La division de la Signalisation Routière de GardaWorld est à la recherche de candidats pour combler un poste de chef d’équipe pour les signaleurs routiers

 

Le chef d’équipe s’occupe d’orchestrer tout le travail des équipes-camion sous la supervision du Coordonnateur aux signaleurs.

Il doit s’assurer que le matériel et l’équipement nécessaires au travail des signaleurs sont disponibles et en bonne condition. Il voit à ce que les membres des équipes-camion respectent en tout temps les normes de sécurité établies par le code de la route. Il doit aussi valider que tous les membres des équipes sont formés pour les respecter les normes de sécurité et identifier toute conduite qui requière une mesure disciplinaire.

 

Ce que vous aurez faire :

  • S’assurer que le matériel nécessaire au travail des signaleurs est disponible et en bonne condition
  • Planifier le nombre d’équipes disponibles pour répondre aux besoins
  • Valider que les membres des équipes sont bien informés des normes de sécurité établies selon le code de la route
  • Gérer le personnel affecté aux équipes-camion en ce qui concerne les feuilles de temps et le temps supplémentaire
  • Faire des inspections régulières sur la route
  • S’assurer que les véhicules attitrés soient en bonne condition et équipés du matériel nécessaire au travail des signaleurs.

 

Ce que nous cherchons :

  • Détenir un permis de conduire classe 5 valide
  • Détenir une carte de Santé-Sécurité au Travail (ASP ou CSN)
  • Détenir une carte d’attestation STC-SIR-1
  • Détenir une carte d’attestation STC-101 (un atout)
  • Au moins 24 mois d’expérience dans un poste de signaleur routier
  • Avoir occupé un poste similaire de chef d’équipe ou un rôle de supervision
  • Être disponible et de garde 24h/7jours via cellulaire
  • Bonne aptitude pour la communication

 

Ce que nous offrons :

  • La chance de faire partie d'une entreprise internationale pour qui l'employé est au coeur du développement
  • Salaire selon expérience du candidat
  • Formation nécessaire pour le poste
  • Environnement de travail sécuritaire et dynamique
  • Excellents avantages

title: Commercial Transport Technician
description:
COMMERCIAL TRANSPORT TECHNICIAN JOB POSTING

Premium Truck & Trailer merged with First Truck Centre and is now part of Canada's first and longest standing DTNA Elite support certified group of facilities in Western Canada representing Freightliner, Western Star, Autocar and Thomas Built Bus. We pride ourselves in offering total customer support in Sales, Service, Parts, and Body Shop services across thirteen branches throughout Alberta and British Columbia.


Opportunity:

Our First Truck Centre location in Kelowna, previously known as Premium Truck & Trailer, has an exciting opening for the position of Red Seal Commercial Transport Technician. Working on the front lines with our customers and staff, the Red Seal Commercial Transport Technician will be responsible for all dealership finance and insurance sales as well as sales coordination activities.


Compensation:

  • Annual tool and boot allowance
  • Company sponsored group benefits and health spending account
  • Company matching RRSP or Pension Plan
  • Uniform service, first aid attendant premium, driver's license premium, and MVI premium
  • Updated state of the art shop with quality tooling, computer systems, and cleanliness

Responsibilities:

The technician trouble shoots, diagnoses, repairs and maintains our customer's OEM class 6,7,8 vehicles in our shop. This position works as part of a team with co-workers, service managers, and outside vendors to ensure professional quality detail and care for customers.

Skill Set:

  • Mechanically inclined with a strong aptitude for diagnostics, repairs, and maintenance
  • Customer service focused with strong communication skills to document customer transactions
  • Proven record of following safety procedures, provincial/federal legislation, and company policies
  • Must be a motivated self-starter able to work in a fast paced, detailed, and processed driven environment
  • Ability to work in a physical capacity including heavy lifting and using tools throughout the shift

Requirements:

  • BC Commercial Transport (Truck and Transport Mechanic) Journeyman Certificate (Apprentice level technician will be considered)
  • BC Class 5 driver's license (Class 3 with air brakes or Class 1 an asset)
  • Must have own tools (required tool list will be provided)
  • Must be able to work Monday - Friday afternoon shifts
  • MVI Certifications an asset

title: Controller - Hospitality
description:
Hospitality Controller

Built on a foundation of integrity, innovation, excellence and an enduring commitment to community, Argus Properties is one of British Columbia's great companies. Based in Kelowna, and celebrating its 50th year, Argus owns, manages and develops a multi-disciplined real estate portfolio, including industrial, retail, office, residential and hotel properties.

The hospitality division has partnerships with many of the world’s most recognized hotel brands, such as Hilton and Marriott. The hospitality division manages Argus’ five hotels and two Marinas; the Four Points by Sheraton, Hampton Inn & Suites, Hotel Resort - Hotel Eldorado, Manteo Resort, Home2 Suites by Hilton, and the Okanagan and Manteo Marina.

The Hospitality Controller will lead and manage the hospitality accounting team. Reporting directly to the Director of Finance, this position is responsible for the daily accounting transactions, and responsible for the success of the hospitality accounting team. You will also be responsible for reviewing and providing continuous improvement of controls and processes, while ensuring successful month and year-end reporting. You will be working with the Director of Hospitality to develop processes, budgets, and maintain accountability across the platform.

The Hospitality Controller has the ability to manage a team in empowering, and accomplishing projects while resolving day-to-day issues that may arise. This person is professional, highly organized and very detail oriented. The ideal candidate has the ability to prioritize and complete work efficiently in a timely manner, and possesses strong problem solving skills, with the ability to analyze, provide analytical reasoning and clear communication to other departments.

Job Responsibilities
  • In charge of all daily accounting activities and internal control procedures;
  • Responsible in overseeing team to produce budgets and reconciliations for the hospitality division on a timely basis;
  • Lead and manage a team of 5 accountants, plus coordinate with hotel on-site accounting staff;
  • Provide mentorship and training to the team;
  • Monthly internal financial reporting including expense analysis, payroll, and consolidated financials;
  • Responsible for preparation of annual financial working papers for all companies; ensure financials and corporate tax returns are completed on time;
  • Review and approve GST returns;
  • Review and approve online payments;
  • Work with, and take direction from the Senior Leadership Team;
  • All other accounting related duties.

Qualifications
  • Certified Hospitality Accountant Executive;
  • 5 years’ experience in a senior hospitality position;
  • CPA designation
  • Prior hospitality experience with multiple brands;
  • Knowledge of Aptech’s PVNG an asset;
  • Experience with Squirrel, and Opera (PMS)
  • Experience leading a team;
  • Strong work ethic; able to work productively, equally with minimum supervision and cooperatively and collaboratively in a team.

title: Hotel Controller
description:
Job Overview
To ensure accurate and timely preparation/distribution of financial information at the property and assist the General Manager by providing analysis/management information to assist in profit conversion while ensuring accurate and timely provision of information to corporate accounting.

Responsibilities and Duties
  • To compile or where appropriate consolidate monthly/quarterly forecasts to achieve accurate forecasting of revenue and expenses by each department.
  • To provide timely summary revenue and profit forecasts.
  • To achieve full and accurate preparation of the monthly/quarterly financial statement identifying and providing guidance on any variances from budget.
  • To prepare a financial statement per accounting standards on a monthly/quarterly /semi-annual/annual basis.
  • To prepare detailed monthly and year-end working paper files for audit or review purposes.
  • To ensure full and proper use of the purchase order system by department managers
  • To ensure all capital/major repairs are processed/authorized correctly.
  • To ensure efficient accounts payable/ accounts receivable/ income audit/ cashiering and payroll functions completed on property within the guidelines of the company.
  • To work with the General Manager and department managers to prepare the budget for presentation to operations working within the agreed time and format guidelines.
  • To encourage team commitment to budget achievement providing proactive guidance and training as necessary to develop understanding and use of financial results/reports.
  • To participate with the General Manager in the monthly/quarterly financial review process by providing additional details.
  • To provide management information to the General Manager to assist in timely and proactive business decisions.
  • To recognize the importance of the role in maintaining ethical accounting practices with any deviations at the property level is brought immediately to the attention of the Regional Controller, Hotels.
  • To ensure adjustments to accounts are carried out/authorized as required
  • To cooperate with internal and external auditors/consultants to achieve time and cost-efficient completion of visits.
  • To ensure accurate filing of information (HST, MAT etc.)
  • To maintain an orderly work environment and prompt access to information by authorized personnel.
  • To provide training and /or assist in other properties as authorized by General Manager and Regional Controller, Hotels.
  • Accurately accrue for items at month-end.
  • Ensure verification and confirmation of daily cash and credit card deposits, with reconciliation of deposits against the front office system and bank records.
  • Responsible for property cash floats and deposits to safes including the issuance of individual cash floats to required staff, spot-checking and regular counting of floats/safes in line with company policy.
  • To prepare and check receipts of change orders to achieve the smooth running of departments.
  • To maintain tracking for all paid out expenditures including refunds to guests, per Company policy.
  • To maintain tracking/documentation records for various items including (but not limited to) calculation/payout of gratuities, credit card, cash deposits, US cash deposits and no shows.
  • To alert the General Manager to cash shortages or deviation from Standards & Procedures laid down by the company.
  • To assist in conducting accurate counting, recording, costing and extension of all food, liquor, and other inventory within the property as required by company policy with additional counts/ proactive measures as necessary to address any shortfalls.
  • To review and ensure full implementation of all accounting/cash/control related procedures as laid down in Company policy.
Qualifications and Skills
  • Education level - Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance or equivalent
  • Experience - 3 years in hotel accounting or internal audit with one year in a supervisory role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Personal characteristics - Ability to analyze; prioritize; delegate, demonstrated ability to exercise appropriate judgment, demonstrates leadership through team building, skillful delegator, strong mediator, and supervisor of staff.
  • Physical abilities - While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate with others and exchange accurate information; operate a computer and other office productivity machinery; move about the workplace; remain in a stationary position for 60% of the time; and extend hands and arms in any direction.
  • Other - Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances are utilized frequently.
Problem-solving, reasoning, motivation, organizational and training abilities are used often.
May be required to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays.

title: Controller
description:
Established in Vancouver, Canada in 2008, ToursByLocals is the provider of choice for private tours around the world. With a presence in 190 countries, ToursByLocals enriches the travel experience by connecting travelers with our network of almost 4500 guide partners. We’ve been selected in 2019 and 2020 as one of BC’s Top Employers and Canada's Top Small and Medium Employer.


Mission

The Controller oversees the accounting and financial operations of the company. Delivers accurate and timely information to drive operational, tactical and strategic decisions, and makes key recommendations on decisions relating to budgeting, reporting, investing and risk management.



Responsibilities


  • Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions and cash management.
  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business results.
  • Coordinating and preparing internal and external financial statements.
  • Coordinating activities of external auditors.
  • Providing management with information vital to the decision-making process.
  • Managing the budget process.
  • Assessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes.
  • Evaluating accounting and internal control systems.
  • Evaluating the effectiveness of accounting software and supporting databases, as needed.
  • Developing and monitoring business performance metrics.
  • Overseeing regulatory reporting, frequently including tax planning and compliance.
  • Provide leadership, support and direction to Accounting team members in all aspects of their role. Facilitate opportunities for Accounting team members to develop and grow in their skills and responsibilities.



Knowledge/Education


  • Bachelor's degree in accounting or business administration, or equivalent business experience and 7+ years of progressively responsible experience for a major company or division of a large corporation. CPA designation.
  • Familiar with Quickbooks.
  • Skilled with Excel and MS Office




Experience


  • Proven working experience as a controller.
  • 7+ years of accounting and finance experience.
  • Full-cycle accounting experience, including month-end process and financial statement creation.
  • Experience working in a multi-currency and multinational organization.
  • Experience with implementing internal controls.
  • Experience managing a team of accountants.
  • Deep understanding of GAAP and ASPE principles.


What we offer

In addition to an excellent compensation package, we offer extended Health and Dental insurance for you and your family (with Sun Life), flexible work location (you can work from home or from our office located in Downtown Vancouver), flexible paid time off, life insurance and flexible schedules.

title: Controller
description:
SeasonedPros.ca is Canada's Recruiter for Seasoned Professionals. We provide executive recruiting services, management recruiting, mentors and advisors for organizations of all sizes. With one free profile, be eligible for project, part-time, full-time, advisory, mentorship and volunteering opportunities and receive content specifically tailored for you. Showcase your experience and identify your interests for potential engagements from the best employers across Canada.


Our client, a Nova Scotia based transportation company offering flatbed, dry van, container, rail operations and a full-service warehouse operation, is hiring a Corporate Controller for a 12-15 month contract starting June 1, 2022. This company is a best-in-class carrier utilizing industry leading technology, is Recognized as an Employer of Choice by the THRSCA and offers a hybrid office and work-from-home environment in HRM, Nova Scotia with an emphasis on appropriate communication and use of technology.


Responsibilities:

• Lead the month-end, quarter-end and year-end close functions, providing senior management and ownership with accurate and insightful financials.

• Managing the process for business planning, budgeting, and forecasting.

• Liaise with external auditors at year-end and be the point of contact for all audit related activities.

• Lead the annual forecasting process with other members of senior management team, including operations, sales, finance, safety, and recruiting.

• Prepare month-end key performance indicator reports related to sales, profitability, and cash management.

• Participate in strategy sessions with senior leadership group.

• Work with department managers to identify and implement technology solutions to drive operational efficiency.

• File monthly HST and quarterly Carbon tax reporting.


The ideal candidate will possess:

• Undergraduate degree in business or finance plus CPA, CMA or CA designation

• Advanced skills with MS Excel and MS suite of products

• Experience with Truckmate would be an asset but not required

• 3-5 years experience overseeing the entire accounting function in an organization

• Experience with contribution margin accounting is an asset

• Experience in the transportation industry is an asset

• A continuous improvement focus, with a track record of opportunity identification and implementation

• Excellent communication skills

title: Controller
description:
Go further, faster and be #StrongerTogether! We are more successful together. This is why you have the opportunity to become a star on our team.


Our passion makes us a leading international development partner and supplier to the automotive industry as well as a pioneer for the mobility of the future. Our product portfolio addresses all crucial issues related to powertrain and air conditioning technology – both for e-mobility and vehicles with combustion engines. Today, more than 77,000 employees work on innovative products throughout 160 production locations and 16 major development centers. Our goal is to shape the mobility of tomorrow – let’s be #StrongerTogether. Join our team MAHLE.


HEAD of CONTROLLING

Your Role & Responsibilities

The Head of Controlling is a key member of the Plant Leadership Team, serving as a true business partner to the Plant Manager.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Works directly with the Plant Manager & local management team to ensure MAHLE is an Employer of Choice by helping maintain an environment where employees are engaged in our business & know we value them.
  • Directs budgeting and forecasting functions for the plant. Ensures effective strategic and financial planning, standard and ad hoc reporting and daily operations analysis for the plant.
  • Actively manages risks and opportunities to ensure achievement of business plans. Provides responsible managers with feedback on financial performance, and actively engages with the management team to develop and track action plans.
  • Leads, manages and develops the capability of direct reports and supports the development of other colleagues. Develops controlling function team through establishing appropriate development plans, goals, and objectives. Provides feedback and coaching to team members, actively supporting them in achievement of their goals and objectives.
  • Inspires and engages with operational and functional managers to understand and achieve Business Unit objectives. Interfaces with all functions in the organization to ensure the financial concepts are well prepared and well understood.
  • Leads management reporting for the plant including cost center performance to budget and product profitability. Provides responsible managers with feedback on financial performance and actively engages with the management team to develop and track action plans.
  • Actively partners with the Plant Manager and the Site Leadership team to identify and implement continuous improvement and cost optimization activities.
  • Actively participates in Regional and Global initiatives for Controlling, Finance, Accounting, and Tax including standardization, process improvements, consistency of practices, and data accuracy.
  • Works directly with project leaders to develop business cases for strategic and improvement projects, including capital expenditures. Supports and actively participates in the preparation of business cases, ensuring all major impacts are considered.
  • Controls working capital and capital expenditures.
  • Establishes effective, well documented procedures and internal controls to ensure compliance with all relevant government and company regulations.
  • Monitors and controls expenses in the plant, holds the management team accountable to ensure that costs are flexed to activity levels.
  • Ensures all matters related to Controlling, Finance, Accounting, and Tax for the plant are properly addressed and manages all foreign trade activities.
  • Collaborates with the BU2 North America Controlling, BU2 North America Plant Controllers at other locations, and Shared Services Finance and Controlling on all Controlling, Finance, Accounting, and Tax matters to ensure consistency of practices and efficient use of MAHLE resources.
  • Prepares and presents comprehensive financial information at a level of detail suitable for the audience for plant management, North American leadership and MAHLE Executive Leadership.
  • Primary interface with MAHLE North America Finance, internal and external auditors, and governmental bodies related to finance, controlling, tax, and foreign trade concepts.
  • Actively collaborates across functions and locations on projects that will improve financial results, controlling efficiency, accuracy of available information, or other topics.


Your Skills & Strengths

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field from an accredited four-year college or university is Required; MBA or professional accounting certification is Preferred.
  • Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience with increasing management and supervisory responsibility required.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Plant Controller role; knowledge of MAHLE or experience in a complex manufacturing setting required.
  • Must have knowledge of United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) and experience managing foreign trade operations.
  • Experience with product cost, including standard costing, in a manufacturing environment (preferable automotive).
  • Knowledge of German Generally Accepted Accounting Principles is desired.
  • Experience sophisticated ERP environment required, experience with SAP strongly preferred.
  • Global or multi-national business experience required.
  • Ability to handle projects with multiple workstreams, with proven leadership success over a wide variety of business problems.
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to influence and build credibility.
  • Proven planning abilities, including successful execution of such plans.
  • Demonstrated ability to work well in a team environment.


In addition to work in a great team, we encourage you to reach your personal potential and through outstanding learning and development opportunities. Exciting assignments and personalized support for your career are available to you.


Closing date for applications

Don't waste any time, apply while the position is online.

Your future at MAHLE

As a team player and someone who thinks ahead, you can deploy all your skills with us. In cooperation with colleagues from different countries and areas, you contribute in designing the mobility of the future. When selecting MAHLE, you choose trend-setting technologies and strategies. Are you interested in working with us and developing efficient and environmentally-friendly solutions, optimizing existing products, and turning innovative ideas into reality? Then MAHLE is the right address for you.

Shape the future with us.


Dual Group Strategy

Based on our Dual Group Strategy, we are strengthening our market position and tackling future trends. Our motivation is to optimize existing technology and to break new ground – having one goal in mind: Mobility should be efficient, environmentally friendly and comfortable. Integrated system solutions for electro-mobility are just one of our priority areas.


We look forward to welcoming you!

MAHLE offers you an attractive international working environment. Our work is characterized by collegiality, flat hierarchies and personal responsibility. Apply now and join our team!

title: Controller (client role)
description:
Our client, a publicly traded food & beverage company based out of Toronto, is searching for an experienced Controller to join their busy and growing team.



Primary Responsibilities

  • Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions
  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business results
  • Coordinating and preparing internal and external financial statements
  • Coordinating activities of external auditors
  • Providing management with information vital to the decision-making process
  • Managing the budget process
  • Assessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes
  • Evaluating accounting and internal control systems
  • Evaluating the effectiveness of accounting software and supporting database, as needed
  • Developing and monitoring business performance metrics
  • Overseeing regulatory reporting, frequently including tax planning and compliance
  • Hiring, training and retaining a skilled accounting team
  • Other duties and responsibilities as may be needed to meet the needs of the business



Qualifications

  • CPA designation
  • Minimum of 6+ years of progressive accounting experience
  • A bachelor’s degree in accounting, business, or similar
  • Minimum 2+ years of managerial experience
  • Experience in the Food & Beverage industry is a strong asset
  • Experience preparing Board of Director materials and dashboards
  • Strong people management experience
  • Proven project management skills
  • Strategic thinker with ability to see the short, medium and long-term vision
  • Strong initiative to pursue opportunities as they are identified
  • Talent for conveying information and ideas clearly and objectively
  • Ability to develop positive and productive relationships
  • Highly organized, able to manage time effectively and is comfortable working with tight deadlines
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to deal with a growing and changing environment
  • Proficient with computers and various software packages
  • Strong attention to detail and a quick learner



To apply for this position, please submit your resume.


While we appreciate the interest of recruiters and talent acquisition specialists, we ask not to be contacted regarding this role.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Would you like to join Canadian operations of an internationally listed company that offers excellent work life balance and hybrid WFH/in office work pattern? Are you interested in leading an established accounting team and playing a key role in their development and execution of deadlines?


We are recruiting on behalf of a mature, stable mid-size company located in the West GTA and easily accessible from major highways. They are currently seeking an experienced Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA-CA or CPA) with Controllership or similar experience.


Key responsibilities and oversight:

  • Oversee an established team responsible for various accounting functions/operations
  • Ensure an accurate and timely completion of consolidated month end, quarter end and year end deliverables
  • Develop strong internal and external relationships including training, coaching and development of staff
  • Lead the annual planning and budgeting processes and ongoing evaluation of key performance metrics
  • Co-ordinate the annual external audit process and quarterly reviews
  • Monitor technical accounting changes and, when appropriate, adjust reporting/accounting processes accordingly
  • Partner with Department Managers to develop and maintain internal controls across the company
  • Support growth initiatives through productive operational relationships


The company is offering an excellent compensation package for this level including an attractive base salary, annual bonus program, long term incentives and RSP matching. Full remuneration details will be disclosed to all candidates under consideration.


The successful candidate will possess the following:

  • Designated Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA-CA or CPA), qualified at a major accounting firm
  • 6+ years of progressive relevant post designation experience including a minimum of 4 years directly supervising others
  • Practical knowledge of accounting/reporting in an IFRS or USGAAP environment is an asset
  • Proven experience working with a major ERP system is preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


All interested candidates should submit their résumé for consideration by applying directly to this posting or via email at careers@cdnconsultants.ca -- one of our consultants will contact you directly. We welcome the résumé of any CPA-CA or CPA currently seeking new opportunities.


Why partner with us?

Canadian Accounting Consultants is a specialized recruiting firm focused exclusively on the placement of CPAs in the Greater Toronto Area. With over 10 years in business and a team of experienced recruitment professionals, we are the preferred firm for Chartered Professional Accountants looking to for valuable career advice and progressive opportunities with top employers. Your Partner in Search Success ®


Stay informed of all postings by following our company page on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/company/canadian-accounting-consultants

title: Controller
description:
Colpitts Developments Ltd., based in Fredericton, is a well established real estate development company specializing in property management, acquisitions and new construction of residential and commercial properties. Our company continues to grow and has a need for a leader for our accounting team. We are looking for a self motivated, highly organized individual to fill the role of Controller with our company.

The position will report to the Chief Financial Officer and will be responsible for financial reporting, management of cash flow, budgeting, and supervision of financial support staff.

The successful candidate will be a dynamic individual who possesses a strong accounting background with exceptional organizational, interpersonal, communication and leadership skills and can work effectively in a team environment. The candidate should also have excellent computer skills and a proven track record of achieving deadlines and management of multiple projects.

A person with a professional accounting designation or candidates with commensurate work experience will be ideal candidates for this position.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Our client needs an energized, loves to learn, curious Corporate Controller, reporting to the VP of Finance. You just need a couple of years post CPA experience and will handle all accounting needs, tax reporting and financial reporting requirements & from time-to-time personal requirements for the Family Office as this is a very small group.



What you will do?

Support the senior management team and the business owner in developing and achieving business goals and objectives. Maintain day-to-day operations and financial management for corporate and the family, including performing full-cycle accounting functions and related administrative matters. Handle accounting and all business & some personal functions of the Family Office. Process payroll, employee and WCB remittance, and administer benefits plan for selected portfolio companies. Be a key member of the team leading the upgrade of current financial and management reporting systems and eliminating manual processes. Ensure compliance with corporate accounting policies and procedures, including internal controls.



What do you bring?

Minimum of 2-3 years post-CPA designated corporate accounting and finance experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

CPA (CMA/CGA/CA) designation

Excellent analytical skills; sound understanding of accounting principles

Proven multi-tasker, able to manage shifting priorities and deadlines, with attention to detail and an ability to work both independently and in a team environment

Must be a motivated self-starter with problem solving skills, the aptitude to think independently, and the motivation to work in a rapidly changing and extremely fast-paced environment

Experience in tax returns preparation and tax planning experience (Canadian and/or US) is considered an asset

Experience in analyzing and/or trading marketable securities is considered an asset

Ability to work with and maintain highly sensitive and confidential information

Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously

Willingness to learn and be adaptive to different working styles

Maintain an unflappable style and bring a positive approach to all you do



Why Join?

The Organization. A fast-paced environment with an impressive executive team that supports & encourages growth and continual learning. An opportunity to stretch your skills!

The Role. Opportunity to leverage your skills and assist in identifying ways to improve existing practices. Embrace every day as an opportunity to demonstrate your accounting prowess and keenness to be challenged. Not comfortable with one approach fits all – you are adaptable, flexible, and not rigid in your style, characteristics that will serve you well

The People. Successful, entrepreneurial – great opportunity to learn from the best!

title: Terminal Controller - Goose Bay, NL
location: Happy Valley–Goose Bay, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada
description:
Position Description

Are you a self-starter always thinking of better ways to do things? Are you looking to be part of a dynamic team focused on providing top-quality services to customers? If yes, please keep reading! As a member of Serco’s dynamic team, your expertise and collaborative skills will make a positive impact towards our military defense and safety of our soldiers.

As the Royal Canadian Air Forces’ prime service provider at 5 Wing Goose Bay, Labrador, our team delivers comprehensive air operations, emergency services, logistics and engineering expertise to the Department of National Defence. We work on behalf of DND’s “no fail” mission at Goose Bay: supporting NORAD operations for the projection of air power on the north and northeast coasts of Canada, while supporting military training for the Canadian Armed Forces, Allies and NORAD. 5 Wing Goose Bay provides effective training facilities, adaptable infrastructures, and a unique, austere, and challenging training location. Currently, Serco Canada has over 1,200 employees across four provinces, including a strong and growing Indigenous workforce.

You will be part of a team that works closely with the military customer and other Serco teams to deliver quality and efficient services to DND. The Serco team has been recognized as one of Atlantic Canada’s Top Employers for 4 years in a row and received the prestigious Atlantic Canadian Aerospace and Defence Association. Industry Excellence Recognition Award for Gender and Diversity Excellence.

Purpose Of The Job
  • Responsible to the Lead Terminal Controller for the overall control of IFR traffic within the terminal control area by applying the rules and procedures defined in NAV CANADA MATS and other publications listed in B-GA-164-000 / AA-001
  • Ensure compliance with all Serco Canada Inc. policies and procedures, including but not limited to Code of Conduct and Ethics, Serco Management System, PDR’s, etc.
Primary Duties And Responsibilities
  • Shall assist in training of Air Traffic Control personnel.
  • May be required to assume the duties of Lead Terminal Controller as applicable.
  • Ensure all assigned deliverables and other reports are completed accurately and on time.
  • Visibly demonstrate Serco Values and work practices while completing duties.
  • Other related duties relevant to this position as may be required.
Other
  • Performs other tasks as assigned.
  • When required, cross train peer(s) to complete relevant tasks (e.g. vacation coverage, perform Acting duties, etc.)
  • This position is located in Goose Bay and it is not a Fly In-Fly Out position**
Requirements

 Qualifications
  • Must possess a valid Canadian Forces, or Transport Canada/Nav Canada, or ICAO equivalent Air Traffic Control License.
  • A previous Terminal/Arrival endorsement is required.
  • Must be able to pass and maintain a Transport Canada Class II aviation medical.
  • Must have or be able to obtain a Transport Canada Radio Operators certificate.
  • Experience in controlling military fighter jets and/or working in a complex terminal/arrival sector would be an asset.
  • Possession of a valid Class 5 NL Driver’s license.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain Secret Level II security clearance is required.
Competencies
  • Effective communication skills and ability to work cross functionally within the organization.
  • Excellent collaborative and organizational skills.
  • Strong degree of integrity and judgment.
  • Willing to take ownership for the outcomes of tasks within scope of responsibility.
  • Strong planning, coordination, execution and analytical skills.
  • Proven ability to meet deadlines and changing priorities.
  • Employees who have to drive a company vehicle must also provide a copy of their Driver Abstract.
Serco Canada Inc. an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes. Consistent with our Values, Serco Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment to all with respect to barrier-free employment and accommodation without discrimination. Serco Canada will provide accommodation for applicants in all aspects of the hiring process. If you have an accommodation need, please contact Human Resources as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements

Company Overview

Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has over 9,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).

To review Serco benefits please visit: https://www.serco.com/na/careers/benefits-of-choosing-serco .

If you require an accommodation with the application process please email: careers@serco-na.com or call the HR Service Desk at 800-628-6458, option 1. Please note, due to EEOC/OFCCP compliance, Serco is unable to accept resumes by email.

Serco does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies without being a contracted approved vendor. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Serco and will not be obligated to pay a placement or contract fee. If you are interested in becoming an approved vendor at Serco, please email Agencies@serco-na.com .

COVID-19 Regulations: Serco complies with all applicable COVID-19 requirements. This may require employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, provide attestations regarding vaccination status and/or COVID-19 testing, or satisfy other conditions of employment that Serco deems appropriate, and employees may be required to show proof of vaccination and/or negative COVID-19 test results as a condition of employment (except in limited circumstances where an employee is legally entitled to an accommodation).

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Req #2115

 Friday, May 6, 2022


ONroute Corporate Controller

Looking for an experienced Corporate Controller who thrives working in a collaborative, fast-paced, hospitality industry. Reporting to the VP Finance, the Corporate Controller will manage and direct the organization’s Finance and Accounting functions for all entities within the corporate group. This includes directing and maintaining accounting records and systems, managing, and coordinating the preparation of consolidated financial statements, including financial analysis and management reporting, and reporting to Lenders (Covenants) and other external stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversee daily operations of Finance Department, including setting priorities and ensuring all key department objectives are delivered in a timely manner.
  • Direct and coordinate the Group’s financial reporting activities, annual financial statements and supporting schedules for all entities within the corporate group.
  • Direct and coordinate monthly Management financial reporting activities, including analysis and commentary.
  • Monitor, analyze and communicate operating results against budgets and prior reporting periods.
  • Direct and coordinate external financial audit engagements for all entities within the corporate group.
  • Direct and coordinate all tax compliance, reporting and governance activities, including HST, Income Tax and engagement with CRA
  • Coordinate and direct all other lender, government and regulatory audits.
  • Work with Treasury Manager to support covenant calculations and projections, as well as compliance certifications.
  • Manage Finance project initiatives, using best practices for project management, including process improvements, financial analysis of corporate investment initiatives (including capital investments), as well as financial evaluation of product and market development investment opportunities.
  • Ensure compliance with all federal, provincial, and other regulatory bodies for all corporate jurisdictions.
  • Actively support, collaborate, and liaise with the Procurement and Operations teams
  • Review key financial processes and evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls and business procedures identifying and implementing recommendations for improvement.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years related experience in a similar role [required]
  • Previous experience working in a fast-paced QSR, medium-sized private equity owned (an asset)
  • Bachelors’ degree in accounting or related financial discipline - required
  • Recognized professional accounting designation required – CPA (CA, CMA, CGA)
  • Excellent leadership, communication, problem-solving and organizational skills are essential
  • Advanced knowledge in Microsoft applications
  • A proven, systematic and organized approach to multi-tasking
  • Experience in NetSuite would be an asset

ONroute is committed to providing accessible hiring and employment practices that comply with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (the "AODA") and the Human Rights Code of Ontario. If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter or on the electronic application form.

title: Controller
description:
Financial Controller

Come join our small but mighty team in our brand new commercial bakery, located in Toronto. We are looking for a self-starter, organized and tenacious individual who wants an opportunity to expand their career in leadership for food production industry.


Financial and Accounting Duties:

  • Manages and builds financial planning, budgets, audits, government assistance and all other financial obligations to ensure allocated funds are spent appropriately
  • Subject matter expert in SAP/HANA, our inventory management system and able to utilize system consistently and to its full capacity
  • Conducts investigations for financial expenditure, clerical errors, extra charges etc.
  • Develop and implement cost-saving, compensation and process improvement strategies for finance/accounting for long-term gains
  • Submit final approvals for all compensation strategies
  • Report various financial donations, initiatives, policies, internal decisions and procedures to CFO
  • Directs the development of the budget process for all departments with CFO, and monitors the results of the implementation
  • Establishes and maintains relationships with all managers to ensure collective goals of cost savings and downtime are reached
  • Monitors the local legislative climate, interpreting the impact of legislation on the business and operating to comply with laws and regulations
  • Directs and maintains positive employee relations within department
  • Oversees accounts receivables and payables and steps in to assist when required
  • Establishes and monitors goals and objectives for the business
  • Conducts cash flow, bank balances, expense reports, cheque requests, donor receipts, cheque batches, payroll deposits, priority payables and other financial requirements
  • Conducts various year-end and month-end activities such as schedules for reviews, audits, write-off memos, payroll, balance sheets, journal entries and debt covenants in long term debt financing
  • Completes cash-on-hand summary, accounts receivables analysis, and management-fees spreadsheets
  • Responds to government queries and external agencies
  • Engage in weekly team meetings to review accounting processes
  • Payments for various taxes such as provincial sales and service, non-residence, and property.
  • Bank positions adjustments and bank reconciliations
  • Update monthly tax expenses, depreciation expenses and budgeted capital expenditures.
  • Other duties as required


Teamwork and Leadership

  • Supervises, coaches, and motivates team
  • Reviews departments’ working hours and Time & Attendance weekly for submission to payroll
  • Approves or denies any employee initiated time off requests and coordinates with Human Resources and Accounting Administrator for processing
  • Responsible for overseeing labour trends, performance management and hiring practices while working alongside human resources when required
  • Directs management development plans and provides on-going feedback to achieve desired business results
  • Leads by example for all safety standards, food safety standards, compliance measures, respect in the workplace and other facets of corrective action
  • Train management on new and legacy initiatives to effectively run office protocols accurately


Qualifications

  • Minimum of 6+ years of experience and a Bachelors Degree in Accounting or equivalent
  • Minimum 2+ years of managerial experience
  • Must have exceptional experience using SAP/HANA
  • Background in food manufacturing or other highly regulated industry a strong asset
  • Demonstrated ability to working through problems effectively and efficiently
  • Strong initiative to pursue opportunities as they are identified
  • Talent for conveying information and ideas clearly and objectively
  • Ability to develop relationships
  • Highly organized, able to manage time effectively and is comfortable working with tight deadlines
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to deal with a growing and changing environment
  • Great working knowledge of Excel
  • Accounting designation an asset
  • Previous experience working with HACCP and GFSI (SQF or BRC) is an asset
  • Proficient with computers and various software packages
  • Strong attention to detail and a quick learner
