title: Vault Controller (Afternoon)
description:
VAULT CONTROLLER (AFTERNOON)

Job location: Bradford, ON

Employment type: Fill-time Permanent Employment
Hours: 40 Hours per week

A Little About Us

Hi, we’re Aurora Cannabis, and we’re so excited to meet you!

We’re a global cannabis company driven by our passion to help people improve their lives. We have a diverse team who bring their best every day so Aurora can be the cannabis provider of choice for patients and consumers. We love our work, and we especially love our high quality, innovative brands that make up the Aurora family – from Aurora, Aurora Drift, San Rafael ’71 and Whistler.

Our people combined with our collective passion for the industry is what makes Aurora a special place to work and defines what we call our “A-Team”. We are a high-performing team of cannabis experts, innovators, and champions, that work, learn and win together. We think BIG, act BOLD and execute with PURPOSE in all that we do, and will stop at nothing to cultivate the ultimate cannabis experience for our community.

Job Summary

Are you a cannabis enthusiast with an energetic spirit? Are you looking to work with a fun group of people? If so, we would love to meet you!

We’re looking for an ambitious and hard-working professional to join our Supply Chain Team in the role of Vault Controller!

As a Vault Controller, you will….
  • Package bulk/packaged products into storage totes and label accordingly
  • Retrieve product required for all manufacturing departments
  • Organize and arrange the vault contents in an efficient manner
  • Prioritize and manage requests from various departments
  • Coordinate with Quality Assurance to facilitate release of product
  • Maintain an accurate and current vault inventory
  • Verify product inventory count in the vault on a scheduled basis
  • Complete vault documentation to track incoming and outgoing product
  • Facilitate, document, and communicate outgoing shipments
  • Receive and verify incoming shipments
  • Where applicable, must adhere to Aurora's SOPs and comply with Health Canada’s Cannabis Act. In addition, must adhere to all ISO requirements and the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA)
  • Where applicable, promote and maintain GMP requirements.
  • Complete all required documentation using good documentations practices
  • Attend meetings as required
  • Other duties as required

You would be the best fit for this role if you have…
  • Comfortable working with Cannabis
  • Physical effort is required, lifting, pushing, and pulling up to 30 lbs
  • Ability to work weekends, holidays and after hours as required
  • Repetitive use of hands, wrists and forearms
  • Comfortable working with step ladders (i.e. step ladder/single sided step ladder)
  • Must be able to wear proper PPE (jump suits, safety glasses, hair nets, etc.)

Bonus points if you have…
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to achieve objectives, as well as prioritize tasks
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills.
  • Intermediate to excellent computer skills in Excel, Outlook, S.A.P. and Biotrack

Why you’ll love working at Aurora

Our people are at the heart of everything we do here at Aurora, and we take pride in fostering an inclusive space that inspires our team to love where they work! From rewarding career opportunities to flexible work environments to team activities, we go above and beyond to prioritize your success and here’s how we do it…
  • Flexibility: you will enjoy a flexible work environment that is the perfect blend of work and fun! With flexible working hours to compressed work weeks to paid sick and vacation time, you will be empowered to achieve work-life balance.
  • Total rewards: we will motivate you to go above and beyond with a competitive salary or hourly wage (with shift premiums), stock options, an RRSP program, annual bonuses, and a health and personal care spending account for you to use for gym memberships, ski passes or staycations.
  • Benefits: we will foster your health and wellness (and your dependents) with our employee benefits package including, employer-paid health and dentalcare premiums, life insurance and LTD policies and a medical cannabis coverage program, designed exclusively for our A-Team, that will provide you with $3,000 of coverage each year (because we truly believe cannabis is the best medicine).
  • Life-long learning: we’re lifelong learners here at Aurora and will invest in your professional development throughout all aspects of your career! You will have access to a tuition assistance program, virtual learning activities and annual performance reviews, to ensure you are provided with the toolkit and support you need to succeed.
  • Perks: we love to celebrate our people by providing corporate perks including employee discounts, perkopolis memberships, company SWAG, paid volunteer time, modern technology and snacks and beverages at all our office locations.
  • Team: we are a diverse and global team of cannabis enthusiasts, energetic innovators, fitness gurus, caring parents, foodies and more, with a collective passion to nurture an inclusive environment that helps you grow and provide people better days with medical cannabis.

Next steps

Think you have what it takes to join our team? So do we!

Apply today by submitting your resume along with salary expectations through our website. You can expect your application to be reviewed by a human recruiter (not a robot) shortly after you apply, and our team will contact you via email if we see a fit.

Think you’re the ideal candidate but you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyways! We would love to review your application to see if you’re the right fit or find you an alternative opportunity!

Not the role for you? That’s okay! Visit our careers page to find the perfect opportunity for you or share this posting with a friend or colleague that you think would be a great fit (hot tip: if you are already an Aurora employee, take advantage of the employee referral program by referring this posting to a friend! If they are successful, you will receive a bonus!)

Diversity and inclusion

At Aurora, we are proud to foster and celebrate a diverse community of professionals! We take pride in nurturing an inclusive culture that empowers our people to be their authentic selves, celebrate their differences and love where they work.

Our diverse community combined with our inclusive culture, is what sets us apart in the industry and equips our A-Team with superpowers – and this is why, we encourage all candidates to apply for job opportunities regardless of race, national origin, colour, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital and family status, disability, or any other identifying characteristic. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site or alternate format of job posting) during the recruitment and selection process, please do not hesitate to let our team know! We are here to help.

Health and safety

Our mission at Aurora has always been to improve the health and wellness of our core community. We strive to create a safe, healthy, and inclusive environment for our team and strongly believe introducing a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy will help us achieve this.

As of February 2022, Aurora has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees and as a condition of employment, all candidates must provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19 or receive an approved medical or human rights accommodation prior to commencing employment with Aurora. If proof of vaccination is not provided or a request for accommodation is not approved, the offer of employment will be rescinded.

If applicable, Aurora Human Resources will contact you via your email address provided. We do not contact candidates over Facebook or other Social Media apps. You will never be requested to provide confidential information such as banking information or your Social Insurance Number in the interview process.

title: Contrôleur, grande entreprise dans l’industrie du transport, horaire hybride
description:
Nouveau poste : Contrôleur, grande entreprise dans l’industrie du transport, horaire hybride

Lieu: St-Simon-de-Bagot

Type : Permanent

Salaire: 75k

Horaire: 40h, horaire hybride, possibilité d’horaire réduit le Vendredi, horaire flexible

Début : Dès que possible


Grande entreprise dans l’industrie du transport ayant activités en Amérique du Nord. La personne recherchée devra être débrouillarde et avoir du leadership. Voici les avantages offerts pour ce poste situé à St-Simon-de-Bagot :


AVANTAGES

La personne occupant le rôle de contrôleur (St-Simon-de Bagot) sélectionné profitera des avantages suivants :

• Horaire hybride

• Horaire flexible

• Possibilité de bonus selon la performance

• Possibilité de terminer plus tôt le Vendredi

• 3 semaines de vacances (dès l’embauche)

• Assurances collectives (dès l’embauche)

• REER avec possibilité de participation de l’employeur (dès l’embauche)

• Possibilité d’évolution de carrière


RESPONSABILITÉ

Relevant du directeur de transport, la personne occupant le rôle de contrôleur (St-Simon-de-Bagot) aura sous sa supervision une équipe de 4-5 personnes. Voici les autres responsabilités du poste :


• Analyse des résultats financiers (hebdomadaires, mensuels et périodiques)

• Préparation et analyse des KPI et des rendements financiers

• Préparer les budgets

• Participer aux dossiers de fin d’année

• Préparer et faire le suivi des déboursés majeurs

• Préparer des documents pour le reporting

• Participer au comité de gestion

• Suivi des dépenses pour la loi 90

• Suivi des réclamations transporteurs

• Toutes autres tâches connexes


QUALIFICATIONS

Le poste de contrôleur à St-Simon-de-Bagot requiert du leadership et une très bonne capacité d’adaptation. Ce rôle peut vous intéresser? Voici comment vous qualifier :


• 2-3 ans d’expérience dans un rôle similaire

• CPA ou en voie d’obtention

• BAC en science comptable

• Qui se débrouille bien en anglais

• Expérience dans le domaine du transport (un gros atout)

• Expérience avec un logiciel de type ERP (as-400, un gros atout)

• À l’aise avec la suite office (Excel principalement)

• Bonne capacité de communication, multitâches, bon sens des priorités, minutieux

• Autonomie, organisé, responsable, très à l’aise avec la technologie


RÉSUMÉ

Le poste de contrôleur peut vous intéresser? Il me fera plaisir de considérer votre candidature. Karl.sauthere@randstad.ca ou 514-434-6794.

Merci.

title: Gas Controller
description:
Affiliation: MoveUP

Employment Status: Full-Time Regular

Salary: $3,282.00 Bi-Weekly

We’re looking for new talent to join us as we reinvent the future of energy. Across BC, we have a diverse team of more than 2,500 employees we can’t do without, yet we’re growing as fast as ever.

You may think we’re your standard utility that delivers natural gas and electricity, but we’re also into cool, innovative energy solutions. Think carbon capture, renewable energies and lower-carbon transportation for a start. We believe in creating a cleaner, healthier tomorrow.

If you like meaningful work, a dynamic environment and forward-thinking colleagues, build your career with us. You’ll get opportunities to grow, lead, solve, and create. So what are you waiting for? Let’s rethink energy together.

Responsibilities
  • Controls the flow of gas in the pipeline system of FortisBC and FEVI and potential external systems to ensure safe, efficient operating conditions, reliable customer service and optimum purchases and sales on a 24-7 basis by:
    • monitoring pipeline data such as pressures and flow rates using a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system;
    • analyzing and responding to alarms and other potential problems according to established procedures;
    • controlling pipeline pressures and flows through the operation of remote controlled equipment such as compressors and valves;
    • acting as primary contact in any emergency involving pipeline facilities and notifies management personnel as required, may make initial assessment of incidents, coordinate response and take appropriate action;
    • forecasting daily gas requirements by analyzing current weather forecast information, historical load and temperature data, customer estimates and historical data and current telemetry data;
    • determining the availability of gas for interruptible sales based on supply and economics, allocating available supply to interruptible customers, issues curtailment notices and maintains proper curtailment records;
    • producing various daily, weekly and monthly reports for distribution to management and other departments;
    • coordinating and analyzing field procedures for pipeline construction, maintenance, and repairs, releasing pipeline for work and altering flows and pressures as required;
    • recording all activity related to system operation in the gas control logs.
  • Maintains liaison with:
    • field personnel to coordinate work, report problems and initiate call-outs when required;
    • personnel from other pipeline companies, gas suppliers and customers to coordinate pipeline activity;
    • other company departments including Measurement, Marketing, Engineering, Gas Supply, Data Processing and Customer Accounting.
  • Designs and maintains computer applications as required to perform Gas Control accounting, reporting and data archival functions on personal computers using various software, including spreadsheet, data base, communications and utility programs. Transfer historical data from SCADA system to PC for archival.
  • Creates reports and maintains data records as required by modifying and running customized programs on the company mainframe to:
    • verify daily operating data input to the Gas Control database;
    • produce weekly and monthly reports to check the validity of telemetry and measurement data, reports problems to appropriate personnel;
    • verify accuracy of gas volume statements and records of daily gas transactions produced by other companies;
    • produce historical load reports and graphs from the Gas Control database for use in load forecasts;
    • produce reports for Gas control studies, other company departments and customers as required;
  • Evaluates current demand, determines when demand is at variance from authorized supplies, and makes appropriate changes to storage supply to bring demand in balance.
  • Provides specific information regarding pipeline operation to other departments and management as requested.
  • Upgrades SCADA system software by designing and maintaining screen displays and calculation tables.
  • Performs minor maintenance and repairs on Gas Control equipment. Contacts the appropriate service companies for all major repairs. Diagnoses SCADA system, filed communications and telemetry equipment problems. Initiates repair procedures with appropriate communications company and/or FortisBC personnel.
  • Uses standby electronic equipment to monitor and control the pipeline operation if required due to major Gas Control Centre equipment failure or building evacuation.
  • Processes and extracts volumes from electronic real-time measurement system. Calculates volumes manually from meter readings when required.
  • Develops new methods and procedures to improve efficiency and effectiveness in the performance of the above duties, and to adapt to the rapidly evolving requirements of the department.
  • Must work on evenings, weekends and holidays to ensure a 24-7 operation year-round. Must also be flexible for scheduling on an on-call basis.
  • Performs other minor, related duties which do not affect the value of the job.
Requirements
  • Successful completion of a Diploma from an accredited post-secondary institution in a directly related field (e.g. Power Engineering, Gas Processing)Must be registered or eligible for registration with ASTTBC.
  • Red Seal Interprovincial Certificate in an industry related field (e.g. Instrumentation and Control, Millwright)
  • Ability to pass Operator Qualification Training internal certification. New incumbents must pass certification shortly after beginning work as a Gas Controller.
  • Demonstrated five (5) years directly related experience: Control Room, Pipeline Operations, Plant Operations, Field Instrumentation, Pipeline Hydraulics Planning, Design Engineering.
  • Demonstrated mechanical aptitude and knowledge in pipeline hydraulics, gas (fluids) processes, pipeline operations, field equipment, compression and control systems, and thermodynamics.
  • Demonstrated intermediate level computer literacy including demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft products (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook) and other applicable software.
  • Ability to organize and evaluate data and make related, logical decisions.
  • Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills and ability to exchange technical information.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and work under pressure in an environment which can be high stress.
Our engaging workplace offers a wide range of challenging opportunities, while being safe, inclusive and diverse. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, while supporting life-long career development. We also encourage volunteerism and nourish the need to give back to your community.

Safety is our number one priority, and to maintain the health and safety of our employees and broader communities, we have a number of COVID-19 safety measures in place. This includes a requirement for all new employees to provide proof of full vaccination, prior to their first day of work or the start of their employment. And of course, we will consider an accommodation for anyone who’s unable to be vaccinated due to a protected ground as defined by the Human Rights Code.

To learn more about the recruitment process with FortisBC, please visit the You’re Applying. What now? page for additional information.

title: Corporate Controller, Manufacturing
description:
United Raw Pet Foods Inc., a fast-growing, leading manufacturer of quality raw pet foods in Canada and a subsidiary of the Dane Creek Capital Corp., is recruiting for an energetic, driven Corporate Controller, Manufacturing to manage the financial functions of our Canadian based multiple manufacturing facilities. The role includes the preparation of our consolidated financial statements, corporate reporting and the oversight and management of our plant accountants. The company’s head office location is in Mississauga, Ontario.

We are looking for a candidate that is a driven and personable leader with a “can-do” attitude. The ability to handle changing priorities with equanimity while maintaining open and effective communication are important attributes that you will need to be an effective member of our team.


We are currently recruiting for the following role:

Corporate Controller, Manufacturing


Job Role Summary

The Corporate Controller, Manufacturing is responsible for overseeing the plant accountants and managing the overall financial functions for manufacturing and operations. S/He will be responsible for directing and managing the company's accounting functions, including establishing and maintaining accounting principles, practices, and procedures as well as the preparation of financial statements and reporting to management and externally. S/He will be primarily involved in preparing the monthly, quarterly and annual closings and consolidations and will take the lead with respect to the divisions annual audit; preparing operational financial projections for budgetary purposes while providing day-to-day operational financial management; meeting corporate reporting requirements; managing, training, and evaluating manufacturing plant accountants in multiple locations. Some travel within Canada will be required.


Essential Functions

  • Manage the manufacturing divisions financial systems including budgetary processes and the preparation of its consolidated financial statements;
  • Overseeing all plant accountants and accounting operations for the manufacturing division.;
  • Provide timely and insightful financial operational support to the facilities General Managers;
  • Develop and maintain financial policies and procedures across all facilities;
  • Preparation of financial reports for management to support the reporting requirements for various company stakeholders;
  • Communicate with and maintain working relationships with banking institutions and auditors;
  • Lead the annual audit for the Company’s manufacturing division;
  • Provide feedback and recommendations to senior management regarding the infrastructure for the financial function;
  • Coordinate with other financial professionals throughout the organization to meet overall corporate requirements;


Qualifications

  • University degree and Canadian accounting designation (CPA) is required;
  • 5+ years of progression through financial positions with increasing responsibility;
  • Strong knowledge of ASPE;
  • Experience with external auditors and the audit process;
  • Experience in of the implementation of an ERP or similar system considered an asset;
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and expertise synthesizing and delivering financial analyses;
  • Proficient in technology, such as MS PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and QuickBooks;
  • Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and multi-task effectively;
  • Excellent organizational, time management and prioritization skills;
  • Demonstrates a positive work ethic, is self-motivated, has a strong attention to detail and is a team player;
  • A love of pets

Employment offers are conditional upon the satisfactory verification of a Canadian Criminal Record Check and Employment Reference Checks. Determination of the circumstances that constitute satisfactory verification is the sole discretion of United Raw Pet Foods Inc.

This opportunity will remain open until a suitable candidate is hired.

title: Controller, Yard Movement - Night shift (12 hours)
description:
Description
  • You will supervise a team of unionized employees that includes general workers, electricians, mechanics, mechanic specialists and locomotive attendants assigned to railway equipment maintenance, yard movements and security at the Montreal Maintenance Centre;
  • You will be required to plan and assign work, communicate your expectations clearly, manage employees and perform all necessary follow ups;
  • You will promote and manage a work environment aimed at preventing losses (occupational safety and health, attendance, productivity, etc.);
  • You will demonstrate leadership in developing employee skills while ensuring cohesive work relationships within the team as well as with union representatives and internal clients;
  • Acting as expert in the interpretation of CROR regulations, you will advise both employees and colleagues and report all operational and communication defects regarding any aspect of the train yard and submit improvement recommendations as needed;
  • You will be in charge of implementing and applying the Emergency Measures Organization plan at the Montreal Maintenance Centre;
  • You will coordinate locomotive fuel supplies and manage their day to day delivery;
Schedule

You will be required to supervise a variety of working groups during the night shift (7pm to 7am) as well as the weekend shift. You will work 7 days on 14.

Requirements
  • Diploma of College Studies in Operations Management or an equivalent field;
  • Very good mechanical and/or electrical knowledge;
  • 5 years experience in operations management with supervision duties (experience in railway operations an asset);
  • Good knowledge of computer tools (Microsoft Suite);
  • Available and able to work nights and weekends for several years;
  • Proven abilities in coaching and supervision;
  • Results oriented with a commitment to safety and quality;
  • Able to manage several tasks – organizational and planning sense;
  • Team spirit and collaboration;
  • Ability to make decisions quickly and under pressure;
  • Very good communication skills in both official languages;
  • Must demonstrate self confidence and rigour;
  • Flexibility and adaptability.
Why choose VIA Rail?
  • Competitive salary.
  • Generous compensation and benefits package.
  • A close-knit team of upbeat co-workers.
  • Numerous career advancement opportunities.
  • An environment that supports employee health and well being.
  • A wide range of health and wellness benefits for employees and their families, including unlimited telemedicine service.
  • The chance to be part of a sustainable transportation service connecting Canadian communities.
  • Learn more about VIA Rail at corpo.viarail.ca
What Our Employees Love
  • Participating in the maintenance centre’s key activities.
  • Contributing to major projects to improve customer satisfaction.
  • Being part of an experienced team.
  • Our generous salaries and benefits.
  • Working in an environment centred on employee health and well-being.
  • Our wide range of health and wellness benefits for employees and their families, including unlimited telemedicine service.
  • Working in the growing sustainable mobility sector.
Condition Of Employment
  • VIA Rail is committed to protecting the health and providing a safe environment for its employees and customers. Therefore, in accordance with current policy, VIA Rail requires that all members of its staff be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof as a condition of employment.

title: Controller
description:
We are seeking a hands-on CPA designated Controller, to fill a new position. This role reports to the CFO, and works closely with senior management in processing, development and monitor the financial operations of the company. Some of the responsibilities and qualifications are as follows:

Responsibilities:

· Full cycle accounting operations of the company, including preparation of monthly, quarterly,

and annually financial reports

· Train and manage the accounting team and ensure efficiency of function

· Manage revenue process, review all invoicing and accounts receivable and timing

· Maintain receivable ledger and follow up with collection action, as required

· Supervise and review all accounts receivable functions and work closely with A/R

Administrator

- Supervise and review all accounts payable functions; handle payable calls from suppliers and

schedule payment run reports and work closely with A/P Administrator

· Approval of Expense Claims including expenditure approval as listed on the “Altex Financial

Approval Matrix”

· Assist in the development of department budget and prepare annual forecast and budget

· Preparation of monthly financial statements complete with supporting working paper file detailing what makes up assets and liabilities. Review income and expense recognition for accurate recording and matching.

· Maintain sub-ledgers for accounts receivable/payable and job costing, payroll as well as the general ledger.

· Manage company cash flow to maintain finances within banking covenants.

· All banking functions, including monthly report, deposits, fund transfer, currency conversions, monthly reconciliations and manage EFT system and control use.

· Funding/Cash Management – document control and IT; maintain appropriate insurance coverage

· Job Costing – maintain accurate job costing process to ensure costs are properly charged to appropriate jobs; prepare work in process reports; report individual job results both on an ongoing basis as well as after completion for management information purposes

· Attend weekly production meetings

· Liaise with Tax Auditors

· Work with CFO and year end accountants to aid in finalizing statements and tax returns

· Other duties as may be required

Qualifications:

· CPA designation

· 3 to 5 years of manufacturing industry experience

· Proficient in Microsoft desktop, server applications, SharePoint and Sage 300/Timberline experience are requirements

· Strong interpersonal and communications skills (both verbal and written), along with superior analytical and accounting technical knowledge

· The ability to work independently and collaboratively

· The ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· Motivated, energetic, self-starter, ability to take control

· Uncompromising ethics along with excellent organizational skills

· Intelligent, sound judgement, common sense

· Ability to work well with people at all levels and from multiple cultures

· Must have excellent problem-solving techniques

· People Management – performance reviews, probation, job descriptions and qualification requirements and identify industry mandatory training requirements for each position; monitor absenteeism, discipline were necessary

· Able to bend, crouch and lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs.)

Salary: Based on qualification and years of experience.

Please reply with cover letter, resume and salary expectations.

We thank all applicants for their interest in Altex Industries Inc., only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

*No recruitment agencies or telephone calls please.

title: Flow Controller
description:
The Flow Controller will be responsible of defining and update the supply and stock management parameters.

He/She will insure needs/resources balance for raw material, components, sub-assemblies and finished products by managing the customer's needs and the replenishment backlog.

He/She will insure products availabilities by taking actions to solve backorders and shortages.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Define and update the parameters of supply and stock management including ramp-up to achieve the target service level while reducing stock / SIOP (Master Production Schedule)
  • Ensure the quality and consistency of key data: Lead Time, Quantity, Stocking policy
  • Manage the continuous needs/resources balance (MRP, Kanban…) for raw material, components and sub-assemblies
  • Manage the replenishment backlog (creation and rescheduling of the manufacturing and purchase orders)
  • Manage the backorder portfolio (BOL), the shortage and to take actions to insure the availability of product
  • This position will support the Short Interval Management (SIM) process in accordance with the Schneider Production System (SPS). This requires daily participation in SIM meetings, documentation of barriers as well as barrier resolution.
  • The individual may be required to participate in daily operations meetings with various other functions of the manufacturing team.
  • The individual will work with Engineering and Manufacturing to provide value added lean solutions for material flow and material providing and handling.

Qualifications & Skilled required:
  • DCS (diploma of college studies in Supply Chain Management or Business Administration with Supply Chain is an asset
  • 3-5 years’ experience in Supply Chain Management in a manufacturing setting
  • Proficient with using computers and advanced knowledge with applications (access, excel)
  • Effective communication, facilitation, and strong negotiation skills
  • Problem-solving skills are required
  • Ability to plan and organize effectively and has strong decision-making skills
  • Experience with conflict management and resolution
  • Must be detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

€25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Scott Builders Inc. is seeking a dynamic, highly organized, detailed oriented and motivated Corporate Controller to join the team! This is a great opportunity for someone willing to be hands on while also increase their breadth of knowledge and capacity to provide leadership and guidance to the finance team as well as advice on accounting matters to our operations teams. Experience working in a commercial construction company with working knowledge of both financial and operational accounting would be ideal. 


About Us:

Scott Builders Inc. specializes in total construction services, offering a single point of contact for every phase of a project. Established in 1971, Scott Builders is an employee owned industry leading Design-Build Construction Management firm based in Alberta, with projects throughout Western Canada.


Job Summary:

As the Corporate Controller, the successful candidate will be responsible for preparation, review, analysis and interpretation of financial and management reports, variance analysis, budgeting as well as internal and external audits.  They will be responsible for maintaining monthly balance sheet reconciliations, working papers, preparing year end documents, creating annual budgets in coordination with branch management and the CFO, contract review and analysis, ensuring effective cash management and planning, overseeing and assisting with journal entries, payroll, accounts payable, accounts receivable and statutory reporting. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with operations to define, measure, analyze, improve and control current processes which impact customer quality and influence internal operating efficiency. Experience in developing and monitoring internal cost and financial controls and administrative procedures will be beneficial in this position. A strong understanding of the Canadian Accounting Standards for Private Enterprises (ASPE), as well as all tax and regulatory filing requirements is critical in this position.


We are seeking a candidate with demonstrated experience in establishing strong relationships within the team, management and operations through effective communication, collaboration, ability to influence and build trust. A candidate who consistently meets commitments, is diligent in providing timely and accurate data and reports and has a high level of critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills.


Requirements:

  • Recognized professional accounting designation with at least 5 years of progressive accounting experience
  • Degree in a business-related discipline (a combination of relevant industry experience and education may be considered)
  • Extensive experience and knowledge of all aspects of corporate accounting and financial management required
  • Previous experience as a team lead or in a supervisory position is considered an asset
  • Experience within the construction industry is considered an asset
  • Ability to create, grow and maintain relationships with internal and external customers and co-workers
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and non-verbal (written, visual cues)
  • Ability to approach issues from multiple angles and develop effective & efficient solutions
  • Knowledge of accounting principles, practices and applications
  • Knowledge of budget preparation and analysis techniques
  • High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and/or reasoning to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts
  • Good problem solving skills and the ability to make the necessary decisions to move forward the work at hand
  • Analytical at a detail and aggregate level
  • Detail oriented in completing and reviewing tasks and to understand underlying factors or root causes in a given situation
  • Highly organized and able to handle peak workloads by prioritizing, weighting, and ranking tasks
  • Able to proficiently use a variety of and learn new computerized applications, particularly financial accounting software, spreadsheets and database systems
  • Demonstrate ability and responsibility for providing effective financial controls
  • Flexibility in working periods of overtime and travel to branches/sites on occasion
  • Must have and maintain a valid provincial drivers license
  • Must be legally able to work in Canada without sponsorship. We are unable to sponsor employment Visas.


We provide an excellent work environment and a competitive compensation package.

Our success has been driven by the people in our organization and if you would like to join our team, submit your Cover Letter and Resume in confidence. We thank everyone for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


Scott Builders is committed to the principles of Employment Equity and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, national or ethnic origin or any other factors prohibited by law. We endeavor to provide accommodation at all stages through recruitment and employment in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. If contacted for an employment opportunity, advise Human Resources if you require accommodation due to a disability.

title: Controller
description:
Established in 1973, Birnam Excavating Ltd. is a privately owned, family run company engaged in the sewer, watermain, roadbuilding and general contracting industry. Our work involves upgrading key infrastructure under the ground in addition to providing quality surface works, as well as mechanical systems, process works, water and wastewater and general infrastructure projects.

Why join Birnam? We offer a comprehensive total compensation plan which includes benefits, group RSP, and competitive salary.

The Controller will be initially responsible for the day-to-day accounting functions within the business, with an opportunity to grow into a larger role within the financial department as Birnam transitions into the next phase of Leadership. Under the supervision of the CFO, the controller will assist in the planning, organizing, directing, controlling, measuring, and communicating financial matters of Birnam.

The successful candidate will be responsible for the following, but not limited to:

Responsibilities:
• Maintain an effective accounting system and ensure all transactions within the system are appropriate and properly recorded.
• Perform treasury activities, including banking, A/R & A/P monitoring, etc. to ensure beneficial and reliable cashflows.
• Develop and complete Management reporting on a timely basis to ensure business results are clearly understood by appropriate parties and to support effective decision-making.
• Manage the accounts receivable process to ensure prompt Customer payments and minimize bad debt risk.
• Manage the accounts payable process to ensure balance between timely supplier payments and prudent cash management.
• Maintain an effective and accurate payroll system and oversee all transaction processing.
• Lead regular business planning activities, including annual budgeting and monthly forecasting.
• Assist in Human Resources management, including payroll and compensation structure and administration.
• Assist in managing insurance and other risk mechanisms to ensure the Company is protected from business risk at determined levels.
• Liaise with external accounting firm for quarterly/annual reviews and corporate tax returns.
• Support purchasing activities on day-to-day transactions and provide strategic support for improvements in the purchasing process.
• Lead asset management, depreciation, and loan set ups.
• Manage and provide leadership to department staff, including hiring, communication, motivation, process improvement support, coaching and development, and discipline.
• Perform other duties as required or assigned

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
• Be a flexible team player, and be willing to do the tasks needed to get the job done.
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical ability.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with an ability to work in a respectful manner with a diverse community of staff.
• Detail-oriented with an ability to function and process information with high levels of accuracy and efficiency.
• Ability to take responsibility for own work and ensure that deadlines are met, and outcomes are achieved.

Experience & Education
• Post Secondary education in Accounting or related field
• A minimum 3-5 years experience in an intermediate financial position
• CPA, CA, CGA, or CMA designation or working towards designation
• Construction experience is considered an asset as well as familiarity with the Construction Lien Act

Birnam Values Diversity

Birnam invites applications from all qualified individuals. Birnam is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.

Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please contact Human Resources2

Please Note: We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

Remote/Hybrid Option: No

title: Gate Controller
description:
Dreaming big is in our DNA. Brewing the world’s most loved beers and creating meaningful experiences is what inspires us. We are owners, empowered to lead real change, deliver on tough challenges, and take accountability for the results. We are looking for talent that shares these values, that is ambitious, bold & resilient. We want talent that is looking for fast career growth, cross-functional experiences, global exposure and robust training & development.

Description
  • Managing the offloading of the deliveries of raw materials into the Brewery/Warehouse.
  • Timely receiving of the raw materials into SAP (D8/D4, RFG's, raw material purchase orders/invoices).
  • Physical cycle counting of raw materials on a timely basis as well as inventory count monthly.
  • Ensuring complete and accurate data is entered into the Gate Control Tool and On-Hold Treatment Tool.
  • Check expected delivery schedule of raw materials to ensure materials arrive when scheduled and are offloaded in a timely manner.
  • Check blind receiving from warehouse against; bill of lading/invoice when receiving materials
  • Process paperwork within SAP system. Verification of errors on invoices using the On-Hold Treatment tool.
  • Execution of physical counting of raw materials. Keying of data in tracking spreadsheets. Tracking of outstanding material shipments by contacting suppliers and/or freight dispatches. 5S of the office areas.
  • Manage the in and out of finished goods per schedule, establishing priorities per schedule (fleet or third-party carriers).

Qualifications
  • Education: Diploma or equivalent in Business/Commerce/Manufacturing/Engineering.
  • Experience: 3 years in various Logistics/Import/Export environments.
  • Competencies: good oral and written communication skills. Ability to meet deadlines. Analytical and problem-solving skills. High attention to detail.
  • Computer skills in Microsoft office, WMS (Warehouse Management System) and SAP systems.

title: Controller-Real estate
description:
Our client is presently looking to hire a Controller in real estate.


JOB DESCRIPTION:


  • Experience in managing family office or real estate portfolio. Monthly bank reconciliations
  • Year-end files to be assembled and sent to CPA firm for final review and tax filing
  • Sales tax filings performed every month for various companies
  • Daily monitoring of bank accounts positions
  • Monitoring of intercompany loans and advances
  • Bookkeeping related to issuance of cheques or maintenance/corrections
  • Weekly payroll runs on Ceridian
  • Regular maintenance of corporate minute books
  • Financial reporting pertaining to corporate fiscal planning
  • Financial performance measuring of various enterprises mainly in construction, real estate and finance
  • Multi-Residential financial planning and construction
  • Dealing with Notary’s and Lawyers for PSA
  • Strategic business Planning
  • Opening new corporations
  • Dealing with Banks for opening of new accounts, refinancing of properties
  • Dealing with QS on Construction financing
  • Creating Loan Agreements, company resolutions.
  • Oversight of accounting relating to LP’s and Joint Ventures
  • Oversight of accounting with affiliated offices
  • Aid with decision making and business planning


REQUIREMENTS:


  • Experience in managing family office or real estate portfolio.
  • Strong accounting background
  • Experience in real estate transactions and planning
  • Ability to develop control tools on Excel
  • SAGE 50
  • Office Suite (Excel, Word)
  • Office 365 (one drive included)
  • Solid organizational skills
  • Ability to change course or task quickly
  • Self starter but also a team player

title: Divisional Controller
description:
Our client is searching for an outgoing Senior Accountant or Divisional Controller who is interested in a Finance position that mixes technical corporate accounting with operational acumen, all in a strong, fun corporate culture! The successful candidate should be familiar with full cycle accounting and have a desire to collaborate and assist other members of the organization, and not be afraid to make & impact change. If you are looking for a company with a great company culture, this may be the role for you!


Your success will be defined by your ability to:


o Perform the month-end close process including reconciliation of accounts, review of operations, investigation of discrepancies and preparation of financial statements

o Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual budgets

o Prepare year-end working papers and corporate tax returns for external accountants

o Assist with or provide reports to Senior Management and/or Board of Directors

o Lead and provide oversight to the financial services team

o Ensure compliance with provincial and federal government reporting requirements, filings and related payments

o Review and streamline processes, identify areas for improvement, and implement action plans

o Provide recommendations for changes and enhancements to business practices to senior management based on thorough analysis of financial performance data

o Manage a team of several individuals to achieve required results within tight timelines


Your strengths include:


o Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance

o Minimum five (5) years of progressive accounting and financial experience

o CPA designation is considered an asset

o Ability to communicate to all audiences within the organization

o Excellent interpersonal skills with a collaborative team-orientated attitude

o Leadership experience with direct and indirect reporting relationships

o Works well in a fast-paced growth environment

o Superior analytical and problem-solving capabilities

o Experience with Microsoft NAV (preferred) and/or aptitude with other ERP/Financial Systems

o Strong Microsoft Office skills; including Excel, Word, and Powerpoint


If you are interested please reach out to me directly and/or reach out to me via email at snober.bains@rpinc.ca

title: Controller - Client Opportunity - Garden Grove Landscaping
description:
With a winning mindset, Garden Grove improves commercial property value in the summer and mitigates risk in the winter with guaranteed service. Operating in commercial grounds maintenance, landscape and snow management/removal services, Garden Grove has proven next level results over the past 30 years! By putting people first, Garden Grove has built a reliable, talented team that provides high-quality customer service.


The role

This is an exciting opportunity to bring Financial Leadership to an organization alongside its President, Vice President and General Manager. As a Financial Controller, you will perform a pivotal role regarding monthly reporting and analysis, ad hoc reporting, budgeting, forecasting and projections. This position involves interaction with all divisions at Garden Grove.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities; Account & Financial Statements:

  • Support all divisions with financial statement analysis. Provide recommendations for improvement in quoting and managing projects based on analysis
  • Manage all accounting operations including cash management functions (13-week cashflow), overseeing invoicing, A/R, A/P, General Ledger, Cash disbursements, payroll, and bank reconciliation functions
  • Prepare weekly statements for analysis of Performance Metrics, Sales Gross Margins, and the Incentive Reports for all divisions
  • Manage, coordinate, and perform the preparation and review of budget, financial forecasts, and variances
  • Perform bi-monthly analysis of Balance Sheet accounts
  • Make recommendations to Senior Management and Office Administrator regarding Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable to ensure minimum cash requirements are being met
  • Review monthly financial statements with Senior management to ensure accuracy of statements for all revenue and expense accounts
  • Work with Senior Management to ensure budgets are accurately depicted for the goals of each department
  • Prepare budget vs. actual analysis of financial statements for the Senior Management
  • Team
  • Assist in tracking and maintaining Fixed Asset sub ledgers. Prepare journal entries for new assets as well as depreciation, sale of FA’s and write off of FA’s
  • Provide leadership, accuracy, and clerical support with the Office Administration team
  • Review standard quoting and pricing strategies to ensure consistency with plan
  • Perform review analysis for all customer contract renewal agreements ensuring gross margins, providing recommendations for price increases where needed along with cost recovery strategies for CPI, labour, and material price increases
  • Develop and document business processes and counting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls
  • Post customer payments by recording cheques and EFT transactions
  • Posts revenues by verifying and entering transactions from local deposits
  • Update and maintain Accounts Receivable reporting and strategies and management of collecting outstanding Accounts Receivables
  • Prepare payroll from all employee time logs and any other related employee documentation


Monthly and Year End Analysis and Support:

  • Prepare working papers for company auditors
  • Liaise with company auditors to answer any questions posed by the audit team
  • Prepare internal statements for the Senior Management team to evaluate the year versus budget and the strategic plan
  • Accurate preparation of monthly returns (HST, EHT, WSIB, Payroll Deductions)  Accurate preparation of yearly reporting (T4’s, T4 summaries, ROE’s)


Qualifications and Requirements:

  • 10+ years of overall combined accounting and finance experience as a Financial Controller/Accounting Manager
  • 3 – 5 years experience in Financial Analysis
  • Expert proficiency in QuickBooks and Microsoft Excel
  • CPA, CA designation
  • Excellent leadership skills with a proven track record of leading financial teams and direct reports
  • Thorough business acumen in relation to accounting principles and supporting several departments in an organization
  • Proven experience with general ledger functions, month-end/year-end close process and working with external auditors
  • Strong team player and strong communication skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Technology savvy and strong software abilities
  • Experience in service industry
  • Experience in implementation of new ERP systems

title: Corporate Controller
description:
About the Role:

We are looking for a Corporate Controller to expand our growing Finance Team! Reporting to the VP Finance, you will be responsible for overseeing the Finance and Accounting functions of the organization while working closely with our other departments, as well as analyzing and reporting on the financial performance of an expanding global organization.


Success in the role requires someone with strong month and year end process experience, solid leadership skills to lead and mentor a growing team, and a capable communicator that can help make complex financial information understandable to non-financial stakeholders.


About Nettwerk

Nettwerk Music Group is a full-service artist development and music intellectual property brand builder with a history spanning over 35 years. Nettwerk operates a global organization with offices in major cities around the world and an infrastructure to match. At Nettwerk we pride ourselves on our ability to anticipate shifts in consumer behavior and to effectively leverage technology in order to place great music in the hands of fans. We’re looking for inspired, skilled and energetic people to help us deliver on that promise.


We work with over 180 clients across a variety of genres, with an overarching philosophy to help inspiring artists grow their careers and realize their creative vision.


Role Responsibilities:

  • Lead, support, and assist the finance team on a day-to-day basis, including mentoring more junior staff and growing the team to meet the growing needs of the business;
  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business results on a monthly and annual basis;
  • Planning, directing, and coordinating all accounting operational functions;
  • Coordinate and prepare internal and external financial statements;
  • Managing the year end audit process including communications with auditors and delegating to the Finance team;
  • Prepare and review information needed for Canadian and US annual tax compliance;
  • Assist in evaluating tax planning opportunities and transfer pricing policies;
  • Assess current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement, and implementing new processes;
  • Assist in establishing and maintaining best in class accounting internal control systems;
  • Manage the annual budgeting process by working across the organization; monitor performance to budget to ensure corporate fiscal responsibility;
  • Develop, implement & manage financial and cash strategies, monitor, and forecast cash balances;
  • Ensure that the company complies with all legal and regulatory requirements;
  • Assist with the preparation of applications to government and private sector corporate funding programs (cultural properties development grants);
  • Coordinate insurance needs
  • Assist the VP Finance with scaling the department, including:
  • Manage the transition of function currency for the parent company;
  • Research, and implement automation of certain manual transactional procedures – including leveraging the capabilities of NetSuite


What you Bring:

  • Strong leadership skills and abilities to encourage and provide mentorship to the team;
  • Excellent communication skills and experience working with multi-department leads;
  • Experience building financial budgets (internal/external stakeholders) and an attention to detail that ensures assumptions are supported.
  • Communicate openly and actively with the management team to evaluate business needs, eliminate obstacles, provide resources, and reset direction;
  • A commitment to learn, apply, champion, and enrich Nettwerk's Values, Business and People Leadership principles;
  • An ability to set best practices standards for processes, and controls to achieve efficiencies where possible;
  • The ability to set clear objectives, add value to the company as a whole, and inspire the team to reach their highest potential;
  • A proactive and entrepreneurial sense of urgency and ability to prioritize important work.


Proven and best-in-class skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:

  • Chartered Professional Accountant - CPA designation
  • Knowledge of US generally accepted accounting principles (US GAAP)
  • Expert Excel skills and knowledge of MS office products
  • Strong knowledge of NetSuite and its FP&A tools
  • Proven, recent experience in a similar controllership type of role
  • A deep understanding for the music industry considered an asset
  • Strong business and strategic acumen, technical and communication skills


Please send a cover letter and resume to jobs @ nettwerk.com, with the subject line: Controller Role. We thank all applicants; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Nettwerk is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Role Overview:


Reporting to the Director, Finance, in the Vancouver office, the Corporate Controller will be responsible the financial reporting, budgeting, and internal controls of for the Company. This position will play a key role in the development and execution of the Company’s financial reporting requirements under IFRS under the TSX, NYSE, and ASX, and be based in the Vancouver office.



Position Responsibilities (including but not limited to):


  • Provide accurate, timely financial and project reporting under IFRS as required under the public Company requirements per the TSX, NYSE, and ASX.
  • Co-ordinate the timely preparation and filing of the consolidated financial statements, note disclosures, MD&A, and legal entity financial statements.
  • Be responsible for Corporate and Project budget to actual analysis and preparation of the monthly reporting package.
  • Ensure strong financial governance through the adherence and compliance of internal controls, and maintain a strong internal control environment under SOX.
  • Assist with the annual Budget process and work with departments to ensure alignment.
  • Define and lead fit for purpose process improvements and coordinating the implementation of any changes identified.
  • Manage cashflow and treasury function of the Company.
  • Manage tax planning and liaise with tax advisors on strategy and opportunities for improvement.
  • Assist and coach team members on accounting, transactions, reorganizations, and the preparation of financial reports as required.



Education & Experience:


  • CPA Accounting Designation, or equivalent, and post-secondary degree in relevant field.
  • 6+ years of progressive finance and accounting experience.
  • Strong accounting expertise in IFRS and experience working in a SOX compliant environment.
  • Proven team leadership, able to work with team members at all levels to meet deliverable deadlines.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel), Quickbooks, and SAP BusinessByDesign an asset.
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to adapt quickly in a fast paced environment and flexible to take on a multitude of tasks.
  • Mining industry or large capital project experience is required

title: Controller
company: Thermo King of British Columbia Inc.
description:
COMPANY

A leader in servicing the transportation industry, Thermo King of British Columbia Inc. (“TKBC”) supplies, installs as well as repairs air conditioner and heater units used on truck trailers, ocean-going containers as well as rail cars. Thermo King dealers, including TKBC, are the exclusive distributors of Thermo King products manufactured by Thermo King Corporation headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

ROLE TITLE:          Controller

REPORTS TO:          President

LOCATION:           Coquitlam, BC

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage and oversee full-cycle accounting and administration departmental affairs.
  • Lead finance and administration team, ensuring financial processes and information are handled accurately and timely.
  • Evaluate policies, systems and procedures pertaining to financial reporting and make recommendations for change.
  • Ensure all accounting, payroll and AP/AR functions comply with existing policies and procedures.
  • Ensure compliance and reporting for GST / PST.
  • Ensure timely and accurate preparation of budgets, financial statements and management reports.
  • Lead and complete year-end review / audit, including preparation of working papers.
  • Prepare annual operating budgets, as well as any external compliance reporting requirements.
  • Work closely with senior management to ensure healthy financial performance.
  • Create new accounting and business processes as necessary.
  • Draft balance sheet reconciliations, operational variance analysis, financial statements and ad-hoc reports.
  • Manage inventory balances, internal controls and revenue recognition.
  • Manage and monitor reporting on cash management as well as working capital balances (AR, AP, and inventory).

REQUIREMENTS

·        A Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance.

·        CA / CPA designation and prior industry experience in a senior-level role (post designation) with strong financial reporting and technical accounting knowledge.

·        Solid business judgement and strong controllership focus.

·        Strong analytical, organizational, planning and time management skills.

·        Propensity to develop new ideas and create solutions.

·        Advanced Microsoft Excel and ERP skills.

·        Prior experience with new ERP implementation is an asset.

·        Strong work ethic and the ability to respond to deadlines in an organized manner.

·        Strong people management skills including mentoring and developing team members.

·        Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Personable, courteous, and a great team player.

title: Controller
description:
Our client is a private real estate investment company whose assets include equity interests in multi-family, industrial, retail, student housing and commercial properties across Canada and the US. They also engage in development and management of retail, commercial and residential properties.

Industry: Real Estate

Location: Montreal, Quebec

Schedule: Due to the nature of the role, this is a work-from-office position.

Profile: The ideal candidate will be a very hands-on, strategic individual with 3-5 years of accounting and financial experience. Candidates with an understanding of real estate will be considered a strong asset.

Tasks may include:

  • Daily management of financial controls, including cash management, cash projections, bookkeeping, bank reconciliations, Accounts Payable, and Accounts Receivable
  • Responsible for full-cycle accounting process
  • Preparing annual financial statements
  • AP/AR posting entries
  • Make sure that GST, QST, Income tax, and other legally required account remittances and reporting are maintained and accurate
  • Assist in reviewing and presented annual budgets
  • Review on quarterly or semi-annual basis, financial results, and variance to budget
  • Monthly bank reconciliation review
  • Perform regular investment analyses for a wide variety of investments, including real estate and venture capital

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of accounting experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting
  • CPA Designation a must or enrolled to study for a CPA
  • Real Estate experience a must
  • Solid organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with fluctuating priorities and deadlines
  • Computer savvy

title: Controller
description:
Phidal Publishing is a Canadian based corporation that has been in operation for over 40 years. We are publishers of children’s books and specialize in innovative, entertaining, and educational books. Our products are sold worldwide, and we carry all the major children’s licenses.


Phidal is presently seeking a dynamic team player that will hold the position controller to join our Finance team. Reporting directly to the VP of Finance, the candidate requires strong organizational skills, must possess solid technology, analytical, and accounting background. Candidate must have vast knowledge of accounting principles and a deep understanding of financial statements.


Key Roles and Responsibilities

  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data required for F/S preparation.
  • Good understanding and maintenance of multiple currencies.
  • Solid background of inventory costing.
  • Maintenance of accurate inventory records with the assistance of the inventory manager.
  • Preparation of yearly audit file for external auditors
  • Have a strong knowledge of the accounting software SAGE 300 and the ability to prepare Crystal reports.
  • Overseeing and filing regulatory sales tax in the different worldwide jurisdictions
  • Supporting and assisting the accounting staff
  • Performance of month-end procedures
  • Preparation of government reports and related remittances and manage the government relationships with respect to audits and assessments.


Qualification:

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance and CPA designation
  • 5+ years’ experience in the area
  • Have a strong knowledge of the accounting software SAGE 300 and the  ability to prepare Crystal reports.
  • Experience in month-end and year-end audit processes, as well as managing accounting personnel
  • Strong organizational skills – ability to handle multiple priorities and the capacity to meet deadlines with efficiency and accuracy.
  • Good communicator and strong interpersonal and management skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to deal with complex problems and present recommendations and findings in a clear, concise format.

title: Controller
description:
The Strongman Group owns and manages over $200 million of commercial real estate assets throughout Western Canada and Ontario and has several real estate investment companies under management. Total assets exceed 620,000 square feet with over 50 properties and over 120 tenants across Canada. The Strongman Group continues to diversify and expand its real estate holdings, including investing in other high-growth businesses.


Taylor Ryan is pleased to be partnering with The Strongman Group in their search for an Accounting professional to join the team.


As a member of the Accounting team, the Controller provides the Company with financial leadership by providing relevant information to executives and assures the timeliness and accuracy of the financial records and information for the various real estate investment companies under management. You will lead and manage a team of two Property Accountants and one Senior Accountant and report directly to the President.


Duties and Responsibilities

Accounting and financial reporting

  • Develop, implement and maintain financial and accounting policies and procedures and ensure compliance
  • Develop and maintain timely and accurate financial statements and reports
  • Review output from the Accounting team, including monthly reports, quarterly variance analysis, year-end files, financial statements and budgets to ensure accuracy and completion
  • Oversee the annual financial statement process; including the preparation of the year-end common area (“CAM”) reconciliations for all tenants, and ensuring information is accurately prepared and reviewed before all supporting information is provided to the external accountants for the timely preparation of the annual financial statements and tax filings and in accordance with the company’s reporting deadlines
  • Develop and maintain financial accounting systems and a system of internal controls by preparing and recommending policies and procedures for all accounting processes
  • Responsible for financial sections of investor updates;
  • Manage the cash position, cash flow and prepare regular cash flow forecasts;
  • Oversee and coordinate the property tax appeal and payment process assisted by the Accountant and in conjunction with the Company’s external property tax advisors;
  • Manage the accounting for the acquisition of or disposal of properties and investments


Treasury

  • Lead treasury process and electronic banking for various companies under management;
  • Actively monitor cash balances and reviews and approves banking transactions in accordance with the Company’s treasury and internal control processes;
  • Actively monitor mortgages, loans, and leases; and prepare a renewal schedule;
  • Maintain banking relationships and assist the President in the negotiation of mortgages, lines of credit and other financial services as required and appropriate


Budget and annual plan preparation

  • Oversee and lead the preparation of annual property budgets (both operations and capital budgets) working closely with the property management team. Leads the regular monitoring of budget to actual performance and communications with executives and stakeholders on progress;
  • Perform quarterly budget to actual analyses; advising management and stakeholders on company performance;


Property management and project management accounting

  • Provide the property management and leasing teams with accounting support as required;
  • Develop and lead the preparation of construction budgets for development projects. Provide accurate and timely reporting on the financial activity of individual projects;
  • Maintain financial records for each project in a manner that facilitates management reports and ensure that accurate and timely financial statements are prepared in accordance with agreements with lenders;



You will have at least six years of relevant real estate experience (property management - commercial/retail and construction development experience preferred), an accounting degree (CPA designation preferred), the ability to adapt in an entrepreneurial company environment and to take on new roles and varied responsibilities as needed. Previous experience in Sage 300 preferred. You can expect to find a fantastic work environment and the selected candidate will receive a competitive compensation package as well as excellent benefits. For more information and to be considered, please forward your resume to daniela@taylorryan.com.

title: Controller
description:
About Novagevity: 


Novagevity creates plant-based products grounded in medical nutrition by converging phytoceutical, nutraceutical, and food, ensuring we are affordable and accessible to all. We are boldly inspiring change in the foundation of our conventional health system with a sense of urgency and care. Sperri, Novagevity’s consumer-facing brand, is Canada’s first plant-based meal replacement beverage (sperri.ca).


We started Sperri because we know that proper nutrition is the first step to better health.  Our team consists of physicians, dietitians, and health specialists.  Sperri is a more natural, nutritious, and complete meal replacement beverage than others. Our offices are conveniently located in the south end of Halifax, NS, and currently serve customers throughout Atlantic Canada and across the country. We are a dynamic and dedicated team that works with passion and purpose. 


The Role:


Reporting to the CEO, we are seeking a hands-on Controller to navigate our business as we are poised for significant growth. This is a full-time position with an attractive compensation package commensurate with experience, including options for the right candidate. You will also coordinate with the rest of the management team on proactive and sound accounting management regarding procurement and production, commercialization, and reporting.  


Successful Candidates will possess the following qualifications:


  • CPA designation with strong knowledge and understanding of financial reporting requirements under ASPE
  • Superior communication skills, both written & verbal
  • Accounting experience in a CPG environment with cost accounting responsibilities
  • Proven analytical abilities, detail-oriented and practical decision-making skills
  • Proficiency in computer skills working with Google Suite and MS Office 365 suite of products as well as report writing
  • Familiarity with QuickBooks
  • Working knowledge of short- and long-term planning, budgeting and forecasting, and rolling budgets
  • Hands-on experience leading people
  • Knowledge and experience with cross border matters are desirable 
  • Proven sense of urgency in prioritizing and multitasking skills in completing tasks
  • Ability to be flexible and composed while working with tight deadlines
  • Strong organizational skills, the ability to prioritize and effectively manage assignments
  • Proven ability to research
  • Experience in system implementation


Key Responsibilities:


  • Complete month-end closing procedures, preparing monthly management reports and other periodic financial reports such as cash flow analysis.
  • Work with departments in preparing budgets and forecasts 
  • Year-end financial reporting is required for external reporting
  • Cash flow management, including regular review of all operating accounts
  • Develop policies, processes, and flow charts, and implement controls to mitigate risk regarding the accounting system, including revenues, receivables, and receipts, purchases, payables and payments, and inventory processes
  • Maintain and develop as needed accounting policies and procedures
  • Accountable for daily cash management and A/R collections, as well as approving credit limits and payment terms
  • Work with purchasing department on raw material purchases and coordinate production runs
  • Oversee dealings and compliance with Canada Revenue Agency, including payroll, HST, and corporate taxes
  • Assist with the development and implementation of an ERP system
  • Research and apply for all sources for possible funding, including grants, payroll rebates, and government programs
  • Other duties may be required from time to time


If interested, please submit your resume and cover letter to hr@novagevity.ca with the subject line: “Controller Position” by May 13, 2022. We appreciate your interest in our company; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


To learn more about our products, visit sperri.ca.


Novagevity is committed to equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

title: Controller
description:
Responsible for the maintenance and analysis of divisional financial records required for monthly financial statement preparation, coordinate audits with internal and external auditors, prepare audit packages and prepare budgets and forecasts for review.

RESULTS:

· Accurate and timely financial reporting relating to the internal operation of the division

· Organized and accurate financial records

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Management Reporting & Control Systems

· Maintain and verify MMOGL

· Maintain financial control and plant performance reporting system in accordance with company policies and procedures

· Track plant performance KPI’s and report to management team

· Maintain internal control of financial and operational processes

· Monitor capital expenditure budgets and commitments

· Perform post-expenditure reviews on significant capital projects and report to division

· Track plant working capital performance to budget and follow up issues

· Liaise with internal and external auditors and corporate officers

Accounting Processes

· Administer monthly closing of G/L

· Oversee maintenance of complete records supporting G/L including sub-ledgers and reconciliation’s

· Determine accruals and maintain cut-off procedures

· Co-ordinate physical inventory and reconcile with book amounts

· Prepare financial statements and analyze significant variances

· Prepare year-end audit file and assist external audit process

· Maintain A/P and A/R sub ledgers regarding fixed assets

Costing and Quoting Systems

· Maintain project costing systems for control of tooling, capital, and SRED projects

· Ensure SRED project costs are properly documented and are consistent with SRED guidelines

· Maintain inventory valuation and analysis

Cash Management

· Supervise processing of invoices for payment.

· Follow up on outstanding receivables, claims, and other customer issues

· Prepare cash flow forecasts for Corporate

· Maintain petty cash

Budgets and Forecasts

· Prepare monthly and yearly forecasts and budgets

· Prepare analysis of future projects and programs

· Track and maintain capital projects

QUALIFICATIONS:

· Degree or diploma in business with an accounting major or appropriate combination of education & relevant experience

· Excellent understanding of accounting concepts

· Appropriate software knowledge

· Ability to interact effectively with Management, Plant personnel, Auditors and various Finance personnel at other divisions


ONLY those candidates with high volume manufacturing will be considered with a strong foundation in manufacturing costing .

Position is located West of GTA
