title: Corporate Controller
description:
Future Electronics is a worldwide leader in the electronic components distribution industry. Headquartered in Montreal and operating in 169 locations in 44 countries around the world, Future Electronics has earned an impressive reputation for providing outstanding service and developing efficient, comprehensive global supply chain solutions.


Position Overview

Working very closely with the CFO and Executive VP, the Corporate Controller will be responsible for the implementation and execution of corporate strategies and initiatives in the day-to-day operations regarding information systems capabilities, procedures and policies for Accounting, Budgeting and Financial Analysis.


Responsibilities

  • Establish, maintain and enforce accounting policies and procedures that conform to financial accounting standards
  • Lead the worldwide audit process
  • Implement and insure the effectiveness of internal controls
  • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of all financial data and financial reports required by senior management
  • Ensure the operating efficiencies of administrative departments such as Accounting, Payroll and Accounts Payable
  • Prepare financial statements
  • Ensure the accuracy and efficiency of the various information systems used to process transactions or manage the business
  • Prepare all special analysis required by the Executive VP & CFO
  • Responsible for the annual budget and quarterly forecast process
  • Involved in tax planning and tax issues with the Executive VP & CFO and the VP – Worldwide Taxation
  • Participate in the development, implementation and application of the company’s policies including but not limited to travel expenses, car allowances, commission plans and cost control measures
  • Manage and analyze operations using the activity-based costing approach
  • Drive special projects as needed
  • Manage the financial analysis and the due diligence process relating to potential acquisition
  • Participate in the Canadian and US pension plan committees


Qualifications and Experience

  • Minimum 20 years’ experience
  • Multinational company experience
  • Chartered accountant professional designation (CPA)
  • Possess in-depth knowledge of all accounting, finance and treasury functions
  • Knowledge of MS Office


Competencies (Skills & Behaviors)

  • Detail-oriented
  • Highly analytical yet practical
  • Multi-tasker
  • Possess a sense of urgency
  • Takes initiative
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Solid communicator

title: Controller
description:
CONTROLLER

WHISTLER WHILE YOU WORK! Have you been dreaming of combining your personal passions with your professional path? This may be the opportunity you’ve been looking for! Our client is emblematic of the Whistler lifestyle- fun, adventure, appreciating the natural beauty of the mountains. SWIM is seeking a new CONTROLLER on behalf of this exciting organization. If your attention is grabbed, keeping on reading- and hum a merry tune!

Who- the Company: Our client is a well-established, ever-evolving, and entrepreneurial organization with 100+ employees. The organization is innovative and evolving, and even though revenues decreased during the pandemic, profits increased! The company has a dynamic culture that truly lives by the old cliché of “work hard/play hard”. The corporate team are all serious about their careers, but when the work is done, they are happy to get outside to explore all that Whistler has to offer.

What- the Role: On behalf of our client, SWIM is seeking a new CONTROLLER. The Controller will manage 2 individuals and will report directly into the impressive CEO. Responsibilities are varied and include: process improvements within the accounting & finance function, multi-entity and full-cycle accounting, financial reporting, overseeing payroll, budgeting and forecasting, cashflow management, financial system optimization, etc. Most importantly, the Controller will provide business decision support to the senior leadership team and contribute to the company’s strategic direction, especially during times of change.

Who- the Candidate: We are seeking candidates who will embody the organization’s culture- people who are team players, fun-loving, dynamic, and spirited. Qualified candidates will have 7+ years relevant and progressive experience in accounting & finance. Must have proven leadership abilities, ideally with 2+ direct reports on an accounting team. CPA designation is highly preferred. The ability to be both hands-on and strategic is crucial in this well-rounded Controllership role.

Where: Ideally the Controller will live in Whistler or along the Sea-to-Sky corridor (Pemberton, Squamish, Lions Bay, Porteau, etc.) That said, we’re also open to candidates who live in the lower mainland or elsewhere in BC, as long as they can easily get to Whistler for meetings once (and sometimes twice) a week. Candidates will need to have a good home office set-up.

How Much: Compensation will be in-line with qualifications and experience level. Please discuss with SWIM!

When & How to Apply: Swim Recruiting has been engaged exclusively on this search. SWIM will present shortlisted candidates directly to the hiring CEO for review. If you are keen on exploring this opportunity with an exciting Whistler-based company, please do not hesitate to apply. If you already have a Recruiter at SWIM, please reach out soon. If you do not yet have a contact at Swim Recruiting, please hit 'APPLY NOW' and send us your resume. Thanks!

title: Controller
description:
Introduction


Established in 1989, Terlin has become a leader and innovator in full-service general contracting and project management for retail, commercial, infrastructure security, and institutional clients. Distinguished by their end-to-end approach and unparalleled reputation for quality and reliability, Terlin’s state-of-the-art facility houses their custom millwork shop which provides an exclusive focus on the specialized needs of their clients. From design through construction and service, Terlin handles every aspect of construction and delivers outstanding and consistent results.


About the role


This is an exciting opportunity to leverage your technical and leadership expertise to take ownership of a finance department inside of a high-growth organization. This is a hands-on role that is truly meant for an entrepreneurial finance leader that doesn’t stray away from a challenge and takes pride in doing good work.


Reporting directly to the President and working in conjunction with the vCFO, the Controller is an integral member of the Finance team that is responsible for undertaking all aspects of financial management for the organization. As the Controller, you will be a critical leader in corporate accounting, regulatory and financial reporting, budget and forecast preparation, as well as the development of integral control policies and procedures.


You will have a clear focus on producing thorough, comprehensive and timely financial-status reports for senior management in both a routine and ad hoc manner to help improve operational efficiency and aid in continued growth. You will plan, direct and coordinate all accounting functions which include accounts receivable, accounts payable, inventory, job cost accounting, and close-out processes. You will analyze and manage Work-In-Progress reporting and perform margin analysis on projects for improved cost management and increased profitability, cash flow management and forecasting.


Is this for you?


You bring a minimum of 7 years’ experience as a senior-level accounting or finance leader with proven experience within an industry where you’ve gained an expertise in project accounting. You will bring a strong technical background in full-cycle and multi-entity accounting that is backed by a strong understanding of the nuances of finance, accounting, budgeting and forecasting, as well as cash flow management.


You believe that the finance and accounting function is not to simply keep record of financial transactions but can be a valuable partner to the business and help shape decisions in the path forward. You have an analytical mind that sees the value in systems and procedures and have proven success in both optimizing and implementing them within an organization. Your time management and administration skills are at a superior level which allow you to achieve results despite a large workload that is frequently evolving and in competition for your attention.


You have proven success in leading small teams that is complemented by a genuine passion for coaching and mentorship. You are a strong communicator that is trustworthy, honest and can make decisions with a superior and influential level of integrity.

description:

Our client, a company in the manufacturing industry, is looking to hire a Controller for their office located in the east of Montreal.

What You Need To Get The Job
  • Bachelor of Commerce in Accounting or Finance
  • More than 3 years of pertinent experience
  • Bilingualism – strong French reporting skills

You Will Have To
  • Supervise a team of 5 people

title: Controller
description:
Your role:


As the Controller you will be a strategic and key member of our team, leading annual business planning cycles with quarterly revised estimates, preparing monthly financial statements, annual budgets, and financial forecasts. You will manage the monthly reporting, accounting functions, access internal controls, monitor cash flow, provide forecasts and recommendations for improvement, and act as a key leader to the accounting team.


What you'll do:


  • Design and deliver the required operating systems for effective control and reporting of management accounts on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis
  • Oversee accounting functions including accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, capital assets, and product costing
  • Oversee the maintenance and upgrade of the information systems and processes, ensuring proper controls are in place, the systems are used correctly and effectively
  • Supervise the preparation of financial statements, variance analysis and regulatory reports and ensures they are in compliance with GAAP
  • Develop and manages financial controls in accordance with company procedures to ensure cost effective financial responsibility
  • Provide tax planning, ensuring compliance with all provincial, state, federal, payroll, and other applicable taxes by working alongside external tax advisors
  • Coordinate and direct the preparation of the revised plans as often as necessary to reflect changing strategies
  • Work closely with management team to keep them informed of all financial issues relating to company operations, present financials at company meetings as needed
  • Ensure best practices in key processes are continuously implemented throughout
  • Lead accounting team by delegating effectively, providing resources, training and guiding employees in job functions ensuring that deadlines and commitments are met, and monitoring performance


What you'll bring:


  • CPA or other recognized Professional Accounting Designation
  • Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting
  • 7+ years of finance and accounting experience with at least 2 years in finance management
  • Corporate financial planning experience with strong working knowledge in all areas of accounting, payroll and tax compliance
  • Experience in assessing and implementing effective internal controls and compliance
  • Familiarity with Canadian GAAP and preparation of audited financial statements
  • Strong organizational skills with ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
  • High attention to detail, with strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong management skills in leading an accounting team with effective mentoring and coaching skills
  • Displaying a high level of initiative with the ability to self-motivate and deliver reliably
  • Demonstrated success in establishing collaborative working relationships both internally and externally


What we offer:


This tech company offers employment with an emphasis on work-life balance for someone eager to contribute to a successful and growing business. Although most of us are currently remote, you also do have access to a fun and friendly office!

description:

The Controller will be responsible for the financial reporting, internal controls and accounting activities of the firm and will have direct, hands-on responsibility for financial activity within the accounting department. title: Controller
description:
WHISTLER WHILE YOU WORK! Have you been dreaming of combining your personal passions with your professional path? This may be the opportunity you’ve been looking for! Our client is emblematic of the Whistler lifestyle- fun, adventure, appreciating the natural beauty of the mountains. SWIM is seeking a new CONTROLLER on behalf of this exciting organization. If your attention is grabbed, keeping on reading- and hum a merry tune!

Who- the Company: Our client is a well-established, ever-evolving, and entrepreneurial organization with 100+ employees. The organization is innovative and evolving, and even though revenues decreased during the pandemic, profits increased! The company has a dynamic culture that truly lives by the old cliché of “work hard/play hard”. The corporate team are all serious about their careers, but when the work is done, they are happy to get outside to explore all that Whistler has to offer.

What- the Role: On behalf of our client, SWIM is seeking a new CONTROLLER. The Controller will manage 2 individuals and will report directly into the impressive CEO. Responsibilities are varied and include: process improvements within the accounting & finance function, multi-entity and full-cycle accounting, financial reporting, overseeing payroll, budgeting and forecasting, cashflow management, financial system optimization, etc. Most importantly, the Controller will provide business decision support to the senior leadership team and contribute to the company’s strategic direction, especially during times of change.

Who- the Candidate: We are seeking candidates who will embody the organization’s culture- people who are team players, fun-loving, dynamic, and spirited. Qualified candidates will have 7+ years relevant and progressive experience in accounting & finance. Must have proven leadership abilities, ideally with 2+ direct reports on an accounting team. CPA designation is highly preferred. The ability to be both hands-on and strategic is crucial in this well-rounded Controllership role.

Where: Ideally the Controller will live in Whistler or along the Sea-to-Sky corridor (Pemberton, Squamish, Lions Bay, Porteau, etc.) That said, we’re also open to candidates who live in the lower mainland or elsewhere in BC, as long as they can easily get to Whistler for meetings once (and sometimes twice) a week. Candidates will need to have a good home office set-up.

How Much: Compensation will be in-line with qualifications and experience level. Please discuss with SWIM!

When & How to Apply: Swim Recruiting has been engaged exclusively on this search. SWIM will present shortlisted candidates directly to the hiring CEO for review. If you are keen on exploring this opportunity with an exciting Whistler-based company, please do not hesitate to apply. If you already have a Recruiter at SWIM, please reach out soon. If you do not yet have a contact at Swim Recruiting, please hit 'APPLY NOW' to send us your resume. Thank you!

title: Gate Controller
description:
At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.

We operate or service some 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated employees to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.

You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.

So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.

Your role:
  • Maintains Gate Person Systems and the overall appearance and standards of the yard and warehouse;
  • Verifies all items leaving the yard;
  • Performs routine re-stocking and housekeeping of yard and warehouse while providing exceptional customer service;
  • Operates the gate in an efficient and friendly manner;
  • Provides an exceptional level of customer service, internally and externally;
  • Communicates in a professional manner with all yard staff;
  • Directs customers to location of material, notifies Order Builders of customers requiring additional assistance;
  • Maintains quality assurance and inspects all products prior to loading
  • Assists with the loading of customer vehicles
  • Upon customer’s exit, ensures customer’s paperwork is complete and quantities match receipt;
  • Maintains quality assurance and inspects all products prior to loading;
  • Monitors customer returns coming into yard, checking condition, ensuring payment and completing "return through warehouse" form in absence of Order Picker;
  • Maintains warehouse, ensures area is well stocked, tidy and kept free of debris.

The qualifications we are looking for :
  • Position requires good communication skills to deal effectively with customers
  • Good physical condition.
  • Ability to work in a team.
  • Ability to work outdoors, tolerance to cold and heat.

Your benefits of working for Lowe’s Canada:

By joining the Lowe’s Canada family, you’ll enjoy many benefits, such as:
  • An inclusive and safe working environment
  • Promotion of work-life balance
  • Exclusive employee discounts
  • Benefits: insurance (certain conditions apply), annual salary review, etc.
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company
  • An employer that’s involved in the community
  • Teamwork and ongoing training
  • A comprehensive training program for all new hires
  • A company discount on store merchandise
  • A student incentive program
  • And much more!

title: Controller
description:
We’re Pound & Grain, a digital creative agency located in Vancouver & Toronto. We hustle to build hardworking, results-driven creative solutions for our clients. And we infuse everything we do with heart because Pound & Grain is “where hustle meets heart”.


We’re looking for that highly motivated and capable Senior Accountant/Controller to make an immediate impact and influence the direction of Pound & Grain by providing stakeholders with key financial information for a growing business.     


We want someone who is passionate about financials and details and is happy to roll up their sleeves and take care of the day-to-day accounting while being driven to support management with real time analysis and quality decision support. The Controller will be replacing a bookkeeper as a service as agency growth and greater demand require a broader skill set, deeper knowledge, and real time support. 


Responsibilities

Full-cycle accounting:

  • Manage and execute client billing process and accounts receivable
  • Monitor bank balances and optimize cash flow by managing accounts payables and bank balances of multiple currencies 
  • Administer and process monthly payroll and health benefit plan
  • Liaise with external tax advisors with respect to corporate year-end filings and preparation of supporting working papers
  • Streamline processes and identify opportunities for efficiencies


Management reporting:

  • Work with the Head of Production to create and maintain costing spreadsheets to understand margin and profitability by client and by service line
  • Maintain and enhance monthly reporting of pipeline, forecasted and actual revenues
  • Maintain monthly and annual cash flow projections, conducting budget vs actual variance analysis, and other analyses to support management
  • Design, develop and troubleshoot excel models to provide financial reports, sales data, and other ad hoc reports


Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Ideally 3-5 years working experience as an Assistant Controller and/or Controller, with preference to those who’ve worked in marketing or digital media space
  • Bachelor's Degree with a CPA, or equivalent accounting designation.
  • Excellent Excel modelling and analytical skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and interpersonal skills.
  • Extreme attention to detail.
  • Ability to initiate corrective actions with leadership when appropriate.
  • Experience creating financial statements under ASPE and reports for management and other stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and decision making skills to evaluate alternatives and provide recommendations on business issues.
  • Ability to work in an open team environment while safeguarding confidential information.
  • Proficiency and comfort with web based technologies, Google G Suite and accounting software.
  • Experience in a fast-paced, energetic agency environment.
  • Ability to multitask effectively as required
  • Entrepreneurial spirit: self-starter and proactive.
  • Flexible and adaptable to rapidly changing business conditions and priorities.


The P&G Difference

  • We are a creative agency with heart striving to deliver the best digital-led work to our clients without all those tiresome big agency hassles. 
  • Pound & Grain strongly believes that differences make us all stronger. They make our work and ideas better. The more diverse and strong we are as a team, the better we can be.
  • To that end we’re committed to diversity and inclusion in our team, in our work, and in regular training for all of us to hold us accountable. 
  • Still in a sweats kind of mindset? No worries. We are very pro-flexible and remote working vibes and have casual office experiences in Vancouver and Toronto when you need one.
  • Competitive compensation and physical and mental health benefits, plus annual training and conference opportunities. 


Salary Range

  • Commensurate with experience


Sound like you?

If you’re the awesome Controller we need please share your details and interest with us.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Crossroads Christian Communications Inc. (CCCI) has an excellent opportunity to join our finance team in the full-time permanent position of Controller.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to oversee and lead our finance team, primarily responsible for the accounting process and controls, reporting, and financial statements, while maintaining the integrity of the financial statements for CCCI and CCCI – USA.


The chosen candidate will be passionate about leading and developing people and Crossroads organizational purpose:

Revealing the transforming story of Jesus through inspiring and innovative media to anyone, anywhere, anytime.

About RTB LLP

 

RTB is a rapidly growing financial services firm located in Calgary, Alberta. We offer fractional CFO, controller, and bookkeeping services to small and medium sized enterprises as well as not-for-profit and charitable organizations. We leverage our 40+ years of financial, strategic, operational, and regulatory experience to assist technology companies to commercialize their product and grow their business for the long term, and if desired, assist in an exit – be it an M&A, RTO or IPO.


We are currently seeking individuals who have the experience in public company reporting to provide Senior Accounting and/or Controller services to our clients.

 

About the Role

 

As a fulltime employee of RTB, you will be required to provide financial, operational, strategic, and regulatory advice to various client companies. You may be required to supervise the Finance and Admin Unit.

This position will become an integral part of the client company’s management team and will work directly with the CFO. As the client’s Controller, this position will have primary responsibility for the client’s budget management, cost benefit analysis, forecasting cash and resource needs, recommending and implementing cost cutting or growth generating initiatives and securing new funding.


 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

●     Assist in performing all tasks necessary to achieve the organization's mission and help execute staff succession and growth plans

●     Work with the CFO on the strategic vision including fostering and cultivating stakeholder relationships as well as assisting in the development and negotiation of contracts

●     Ensure adequate controls are installed and that substantiating documentation is approved and available such that all expenditures may pass independent and governmental audits

●     Provide the client company with an operating budget

●     Prepare quarterly and annual reports

●     Work with the client to ensure operational and strategic success through financial analysis support, and compliance with all contractual and ethical requirements. This includes: 1) interpreting legislative and programmatic rules and regulations to ensure compliance with all federal, provincial, and contractual guidelines, 2) ensuring that all government regulations and requirements are disseminated to appropriate personnel, and 3) monitoring compliance

●     Oversee the management and coordination of all fiscal reporting activities for the organization including financial statement preparation, investor relations communications, legal and regulatory matters, board communication relating to financial and administrative aspects of the company

●     Oversee all purchasing and payroll activity for staff

●     Develop and maintain systems of internal controls to safeguard financial assets of the client. Oversee the coordination and activities of independent auditors ensuring all audit issues are resolved, and all compliance issues are met, and the preparation of the annual financial statements is in accordance with IFRS and federal, provincial and other required supplementary schedules and information.

●     Monitor banking activities of the client

●     Ensure adequate cash flow to meet the client’s needs

●     Investigate cost-effective benefit plans and other fringe benefits which the organization may offer employees and potential employees with the goal of attracting and retaining qualified individuals

●     Oversee the production of reports including financial statements and cash flow / budget projections for use by Executive management, as well as the Audit/Finance Committee and Board of Directors

●     Oversee Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable and ensure a disaster recovery plan is in place

●     Oversee business insurance plans and health care coverage analysis.

●     Oversee the maintenance of the inventory of all fixed assets

●     Other activities and duties as required

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

●     Accounting designation

●     5 years of relevant experience

●     Public company experience desirable

●     Not-for-profit / charitable organization experience is desirable

●     A basic knowledge of current trends, developments, and theories in technology development, life cycle and adoption

●     Two years of direct service delivery experience working with technology innovators (preferred)

●     Good working knowledge of ASPE and IFRS and Internal Control processes

●     General office software, particularly the Microsoft Office Suite and QuickBooks / Simply accounting software. Navision and Jet reports experience desirable

●     Intermediate to advanced MS Excel and MS Office skills

●     Ability to foster and cultivate business relationships, opportunities and partnerships

●     Communicate effectively in both written and verbal form

title: Controller
description:
The Knight Automotive Group in BC has an exciting opportunity for an individual to join our Management Team. We are looking for a talented individual to join one of our dealerships as the Controller.


The individual that is best suited for this role shares our passion for providing superb service to both internal and external customers and excels working in a teamwork environment. As the Controller, you will have the opportunity to work as part of our Management team in a fast paced, customer focused, retail environment.


Responsibilities:


· Plan, manage and evaluate the accounting and finance department’s activities.

· Prepare monthly financial statements, annual budgets and rolling forecasts.

· Provide analysis to the management team and report performance metrics.

· Prepare and review month end working papers and other schedules to support the accuracy of the financial reporting.

· Develop and implement internal controls and policies to mitigate risk relating to finance, financial reporting, treasury, commodity tax, budgeting, inventory control and payroll.

· Ensure compliance with income tax, commodity tax, payroll and other tax legislation.

· Provide mentorship and training as necessary, supporting the finance team.

· Provide guidance to ensure compliance with Canada Labour Code and workplace policies and procedures.

· Perform adhoc reconciliations, analysis and tasks as required.

· Support the CFO on projects related to other business functions


Skills & Qualifications:


· Professional Accounting Designation (CPA) preferred or relevant experience, preferably within the automotive or marine dealership industry.

· 5 - 10 years of experience in progressively responsible senior accounting and finance roles.

· Strong computer software literacy skills with advanced skills in Excel. Preference will be to candidates with experience using automotive software (i.e: CDK, Lightspeed, PBS or Quorum).

· Excellent leadership and communication skills.

· Ability to adapt to changing demands by prioritizing tasks, meeting tight deadlines, and working well under pressure.


We offer a competitive compensation package, including a benefits plan. Candidates must possess a valid driver’s license and be willing to attend training necessary.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Do you love building and maintaining financial projections and results? Do you have amazing skills in analyzing data and building clear and relevant reporting and dashboards? We’re looking for a Senior Finance Manager to help our expanding team. You will lead our Finance department and processes and work closely with the Operations and HR teams to provide best-in-class service to Evolving Web’s employees and clients. You will be responsible for making sure that internal finance operations are running smoothly. We’re a growing company and take on many types of projects, so there will be a wide variety of tasks for you to work on. This role is perfect for someone who loves strengthening interdepartmental and client relationships, building or improving existing processes, knows that there’s a solution to every problem (you just have to find it), and gets immense satisfaction from seeing a project through to completion.

Note that regular visits to the office are mandatory; we will only consider applicants within traveling distance of the greater Montreal area.

Every day may look a little different, but expect to:
  • Own all financial reporting, including weekly and month-end financial reporting and end-of-month client and contractor billing
  • Forecasting and reconciling projected payroll and expenses, including invoiving
  • Track freelance costs and expenses; partner with operations, resource management and account to manage agency capacity and labor utilization; analyze and report profitability monthly, as well as general revenue projection
  • Monitor financial performance of accounts within P&L, identify areas of concern and/or opportunities and partner with senior account leads to address
  • Conduct balance sheet reconciliations and follow up on outstanding issues on monthly basis
  • Manage monthly close for general ledger and make journal entries as necessary
  • Review and authorize agency expenditures
  • Retain awareness of the company’s financial position and act to prevent problems
  • Oversee the Evolving Web’s finance IT systems
  • Run year-end client reporting and close books annually
  • Adhere to, administer and enforce agency processes and financial policies
  • Manage and assist the bookkeeping tasks and monthly reconciliations of the finances
  • Maintaining all budget control reports for client budgets
  • Prepare for and meet with project managers for monthly customer invoicing
  • Preparing and presenting profitability analysis and reporting to the various teams
  • Assisting project managers in contract signatures, filing and archiving of all contractual documents and invoices
  • Assisting project managers in hours reports
  • Optimizing our current and future financial tools
  • Assisting with RFP process for any financial documentation
  • Creating and maintaining financial processes and procedures. Being in charge of documentation.
  • Facilitating the Finance team with procedural and workflow compliance
Requirements
  • 5-7 years of experience in a similar role
  • Expert Google sheets and G Suite
  • Up to date with Canadian and Quebec government regulations and requirements
  • Exceptional attention to detail and time management skills
  • Obsessed with list-making and organization
  • Able to communicate and collaborate effectively and enjoy interacting on the phone and in person
  • Able to step in to make decisions and take ownership of a task or project
  • Comfortable managing multiple projects, people and deadlines
  • Excited about learning about new technologies and applying them to your role
  • Experience working with multinational and diverse teams
  • Understand that finance is more than “just numbers”
  • You are curious, passionate, sincere, and empathetic. People always come first.
Our Perfect Candidate Also Has
  • Fluency in spoken and written English and French
  • Experience working in a technical agency or startup environment
  • Experience in helping a “small business” grow to a “medium-sized business”
  • Excel formulas as a love language
  • A love of cats and dogs
Benefits

What kind of person usually gets along easily with us?
  • Someone who feels better products come from a collaborative work process
  • Not afraid to voice your opinion but open to any input
  • Organized, consistent, and able to work on several projects concurrently
  • Creative and curious, you're not afraid of learning new tools or responsibilities
  • Strong team player, problem-solving and leadership skills
What You Get
  • A hybrid working position where you are trusted to do work that matters whichever way you work best
  • Work on important projects for public sector clients, such as Tourisme Quebec, Princeton University and the Government of Canada
  • Work as part of a multi-disciplinary spread across many countries
  • A culture of promotions from within, with a start-up atmosphere allowing for varied and rapid career development
  • Work with dedicated people in a fun and friendly environment
  • Competitive salary and health insurance
Evolving Web values diversity and is committed to assembling a team with a diverse set of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more diverse we are, the better we will be. Evolving Web is an equal opportunity employer. We support and encourage flexible working, including flexible hours and work from home.

Learn more about what it's like to work at Evolving Web and join us!

title: Corporate Controller
company: Lambert Nemec Group (formerly A&F Nemec Recruitment)
description:
Corporate Controller


Position Overview


Are you an experienced Controller who has a passion for driving successful continuous improvement initiatives? Do you enjoy the complexities that a manufacturing setting and want to be actively involved in all aspects of the business? If so, Lambert Nemec Group, Manitoba’s Premier Specialized Recruitment Firm, has been engaged by our client to recruit a Corporate Controller for their organization.


The Corporate Controller is responsible to plan, implement, manage, and controlling all financial accounting, reporting, and control activities. The Corporate Controller is a trusted business partner who thrives on providing robust operational and financial analysis and reporting to improve profitability. The Corporate Controller will work with other senior leaders in a highly collaborative environment on key business, financial, operational, and special initiatives to deliver on strategic and financial objectives.


Responsibilities:


Oversee the monthly financial accounting close process.


  • Performs operational and financial analyzes and work with the rest of the leadership team to make business enhancements;
  • Direct and coordinate the financial planning and analysis for the organizations;
  • Present monthly financial statements along with supporting schedules on a monthly basis;
  • Establish and maintain standardization of financial procedures and policies while ensuring robust financial and operational controls exist;
  • Provide exceptionally mentorship, leadership, and guidance to the accounting department and the operations of the group;
  • Ensure compliance with provincial and federal reporting requirements;


Requirements:


  • The successful candidate must possess a Canadian Accounting Designation, CPA (CA, CGA, CMA) with 3+ years in a leadership role, and ideally, have 8+ years of progressive accounting and finance experience;
  • 5+ years prior relevant experience, preferably in a lean manufacturing environment;
  • Previous experience with financial statement consolidations and foreign currency translation ;
  • A collaborative and supportive leader who has a passion for business, and encouraging attitude, and is a true team player;
  • Clear communicator with the ability to speak and write persuasively;
  • Detail-oriented and enthusiastic to get actively involved to accomplish objectives;


Rewards:


  • Base salary of 90,000-110,000 DOQ
  • A dynamic, casual, and flexible work environment
  • Company matched RRSP plan & company sponsored Extended Health Plan
  • Bonus potential up to 50% of base salary
  • Excellent financial and operationally focused opportunity

title: Controller
description:
Baydo is an engineering-based land and real estate developer specializing in the design and construction of townhomes, apartment-style condominiums, and commercial developments and we are currently looking for a CPA Accountant to join our team.

 

Your responsibility will be managing multiple company's accounting functions, including establishing and maintaining internal controls, as well as the preparation of financial statements and reporting to senior management. You will also assist with the budgeting process and support the CFO with any special projects or ad hoc reporting. The position is full-time and can start immediately.

 

 

Key responsibilities:

·        Oversight of all accounting operations including the review of journal entries, payroll, accounts payable, accounts receivable and statutory reporting, providing advice and guidance on all accounting matters;

·        Establish and monitor internal controls to ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements as well as company policies and procedures;

·        Assist with the budgeting process and make enhancements where needed;

·        Prepare, analyze and present monthly, quarterly and annual operating results for each operation;

·        Prepare year-end working papers and work with the external auditors as required;

·        Provide strategic analysis as required to drive improved decision making;

Key requirements:

·        A university degree in accounting;

·        Must possess a Canadian CPA designation;

title: Controller
description:
Looking to harness your leadership and accounting skills and give back to your community?

Placemaker Group needs a driven and dynamic Controller like YOU to join our collaborative and growing team in North Vancouver!

About Placemaker Group

Partners in community wellbeing. It’s what drives us to do what we do. Placemaker is a real estate development company building rental and strata homes within the Lower Mainland. We acquire, develop, build, and market our projects while striving to do our part in improving the wellbeing of each of those communities. You will work with residential, mixed-use, and commercial projects that range from 50 – 300 homes in Metro Vancouver and have the opportunity to grow and contribute alongside our passionate and dedicated team!

About You

As a Controller with Placemaker, you will be in the driver’s seat for all-things accounting, lead with enthusiasm, and will be an integral part of our growth. You will be reporting to the CEO with all aspects of financial management, including regulatory and financial reporting, budget and financial forecasts, and report variances. You are detail-oriented, solutions-driven problem-solver that is quick on your feet and ready for an exciting new challenge!

A DAY IN THE LIFE
  • OWN all aspects of accounting operations including general ledger, AR/AP, month and year-end reconciliations and management of financial statements. You’re the expert!
  • Lead the budgeting and cashflow forecasting process to ensure within-budget and on-time results.
  • Collaborate with the project management team to draft, manage and monitor project budget costs, project cash flow, and report on/explain the “so what” behind variances.
  • Prepare budgets by establishing schedules, analyzing financial data, and providing recommendations to ensure high-quality statements.
  • Deliver customized monthly/quarterly/annual financial statements.
  • Prepare and organize intercompany accounts through reconciliations, invoicing, and reporting. 
  • Use your stellar accounting skills to prepare GST returns for all associated entities and T5018s annually.
  • Actively engage in Zoom meetings and communication channels to foster learning opportunities, resolve process issues, or establish action plans. 

What You Bring To The Table

Along with a growth mindset, you bring the following qualifications to the table:
  • 5+ years of combined accounting and financial experience in a similar role overseeing multiple projects and responsibilities.
  • Professional accounting designation (CPA). 
  • Proven proficiency in Microsoft Excel and technologically versed with software such as Accumatica, Jonas Premier, Procore, and/or Argus Developer to manage finances.
  • Demonstrated experience with cash flow projections, forecasts, budgets, costing and accounts payable.
  • A proven self-starter with sound judgement, a high attention to detail and strong decision-making skills.
  • Strong ability to take ownership and accountability within the role.
  • Located in North Vancouver or nearby, so that you can be on-site if necessary.
  • A strong work ethic and enthusiastic attitude!

BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE:
  • Experience supervising teams and overseeing multiple projects at the same time.

WHY JOIN THIS TEAM?

We know that work isn’t only about what you do, but also who you’re surrounded with and how you’re able to do your work. Led by the strength of our values of courage and community, our culture is shaped by employee ownership, building on each other’s contribution, and collaborating in order to deliver the much-needed housing Vancouver needs. We help you take charge of your career and give you growth opportunities along the way.

Some of your great benefits include:
  • Competitive salary based on skills and experience.
  • Comprehensive medical, vision and dental benefits plan.
  • 3 weeks’ vacation to relax and rejuvenate.
  • Accessible office location steps away from the SeaBus terminal in the vibrant Lower Lonsdale neighborhood.
  • Opportunities to develop your career within our growing company! 
  • Pet friendly office – bring your best friend!

Does this sound like the next step in your career journey?

Apply today by submitting your resume and cover letter!

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Reporting to the President, the Corporate Controller is responsible for leadership of the company’s accounting function across multiple legal entities and operational divisions. This will include the preparation of financial statements and reporting to senior management and stakeholders.  This role is also responsible for internal controls, budgeting, forecasting, financing, tax planning and risk management.

 

 

Key Responsibilities

 

  • Lead and mentor the accounting team including, recruitment, training, goal setting, performance review and appreciation.
  • Develop, document and implement effective internal controls to ensure the integrity of financial information
  • Review existing processes, procedures and reporting systems and implement best practices to improve on the quality of information reporting.
  • Lead and assist the team with financial reporting, tax compliance, intercompany reconciliations, AR, AP, payroll and all other accounting functions.
  • Ensure financial reports are prepared in accordance with Accounting Standards for Private Enterprises (ASPE).
  • Review and approve internally prepared monthly, quarterly and annual division and consolidated financial statements to ensure, complete and timely distribution to internal and external users.
  • Manage cash flow and short term investments.
  • Support the timely and accurate completion of annual operating forecasts, KPI’s and capital budgets.
  • Providing advice on strategic business initiatives and evaluate the accounting implications.
  • Manage relationships with external stakeholders including lenders, insurance brokers, external accountants and CRA.

Your Education, Skills and Experience

  • CPA designation
  • 6+ years of relevant experience in accounting, finance and/or public accounting.
  • Work experience in real estate development, property management and hospitality.

  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Enjoys working independently, in a team, and under pressure.
  • Easily adapts to changing circumstances and is an effective problem solver
  • Fosters a positive and rewarding environment by encourage and supporting others.

 

Compensation and benefits to working with us:

 

  • Year-round salary commensurate with experience
  • Company benefits program.
  • RRSP matching program.
  • Golf privileges at Deer Creek North, Deer Creek South, Salem Ridge, and Glen Cedars.
  • 50% off meals while working.
  • Friends and family discounts on green fees.
  • Learning, development, growth, and professional development strongly encouraged.

title: Controller
description:
The Centre for International Governance Innovation (CIGI) is an independent, non-partisan think tank whose peer-reviewed research and trusted analysis influence policy makers to innovate. Our global network of multidisciplinary researchers and strategic partnerships provide policy solutions for the digital era. 

CIGI has an opening for a Controller. Reporting to the CFO and Director of Operations, this position is responsible for a wide range of accounting and financial processes for CIGI. The Controller will work closely with the management team to provide meaningful, timely and accurate financial reporting while ensuring excellent stewardship of the organization’s assets. This position has one direct report.

The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with excellent attention to details and the ability to build relationships across the organization.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage, monitor and backup all accounting functions including payroll, accounts payable and receivable, including HST.
  • Produce accurate internal and external reporting for decision making to all levels of the organization and various external stakeholders. Assist with various financial reports for presentation to Finance Committee and full Board of Directors. Respond to ad-hoc financial requests.
  • Assist with creation of annual budget and project budgets.
  • Cash management, including monitoring of CIGI’s cash flow (Canadian and US account) along with recommendations for withdrawals from various funds ensuring that money is only taken when necessary but avoiding the use of overdraft facility. 
  • Co-ordinate and manage field work of external audit as well as ad hoc audits by granting institutions, governments, etc.
  • Monthly investment reconciliations along with recording investment revenue and fees in the general ledger. 
  • Maintain overall integrity of the general ledger.
  • Prepare complete and accurate government filings eg. HST, EHT, CPP, EI, WSIB. 
  • Establish and manage financial policies and procedures to be followed throughout the organization.
  • Active participation in the management team. Establish positive, collaborative relationships across the organization.

 

Knowledge and Skills Required:

  • University degree, CPA at least 8 years of post-qualification experience.
  • Demonstrated experience in financial management, experience working with not-for-profits.
  • Demonstrated leadership and project management skills.
  • Strong strategic focus, with a demonstrated aptitude for continuous learning and innovative thinking.
  • Strong communication skills with stakeholders at all levels, and ability to resolve complex financial and project-related issues.
  • Demonstrated analytical and organizational skills with high attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • The ability to prioritize, multi-task and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Understanding of international affairs and academic or government work environment an asset.


Interested applicants are invited to send a cover letter and resume along with salary expectations to careers@cigionline.org by May 24, 2022. We appreciate all candidates’ applications but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


CIGI is committed to providing an inclusive, equitable and accessible environment. Our goal is to attract and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. We are committed to providing accommodation to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.

title: Controller
description:
The Company

Tandem Networks Inc. has been providing leading edge construction and engineering services to the telecommunication industry since 2008. We offer a wide range of plant construction and engineering services to telecommunications service providers, including the design, engineering, construction and maintenance of hybrid fiber/coax networks. Tandem provides the intangible that customers appreciate, and our company is built upon strong working professionals who strive for success.


The Opportunity

Reporting to the President, and Director, the Controller will function as the key finance person in the organization. Your mission will be to become the right hand to the President & Director, taking on challenges large and small, while improving the quality of financial information and optimizing the accounting and tax processes. You’ll own the general ledger and take charge of the day-to-day accounting.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage the general ledger and perform month-end closing.
  • Complete bank and credit card reconciliations, WSIB and HST returns, AP/R and other day-to-day accounting tasks.
  • General and specialized payroll services (CCQ – Quebec).
  • Own the financial tracking and analysis of job costs, change orders and other budget items.
  • Administer projects contracts and subcontract documentation including current insurance, CNESST, CCQ and statutory declarations.
  • Produce detailed financial reports and analyses for internal and external stakeholders.
  • Prepare monthly and yearly financial statements.
  • Prepare monthly cash flow.
  • Responsible for monthly bank reconciliation.
  • Tax planning strategies and solutions.


Key Qualifications:

  • A degree or diploma in accounting, finance, business administration, or a closely related discipline.
  • 5+ years of progressive accounting experience.
  • In depth knowledge of the Quebec tax and payroll systems (CCQ).
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills in both English and French.
  • Working experience with Sage 50.
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite, advanced user level with MS Excel.
  • Superior interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Team-oriented, with the ability to develop good working relationships.
  • Strong continuous improvement orientation; eager and able to research and implement process optimization software and systems.
  • Organized, meticulous and detail-oriented.
  • Can-do attitude; problem-solver; trouble-shooter.


We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


Tandem Networks Inc. respects the dignity and independence of people with disabilities and provides accommodations throughout the recruitment and hiring processes.

title: Controller
description:
The ideal candidate manages the accounting department, the staff dedicated to these activities and plays an advisory role to managers. Ensures the financial management of the company. They also ensure that the rules and policies of the company are in accordance with accounting norms and regulations.


Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the complete management of the accounting cycle and accounting tasks related to the preparation of the financial statement (end of the month activities, quarterly activities, annual activities etc.).
  • Ensure compliance with ASPE norms.
  • Assist/lead in the management of Year-end audit requirements.
  • Reconcile balance sheets, taxes, and manage the hedging transaction.
  • Assist in the preparation of Budgets & Forecasts where required.
  • Review and ensure reconciliation of Balance Sheet accounts are accurate. Produce reports and identify corrective actions or inherent risks.
  • Manage payroll to ensure accuracy and efficiency.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting with a recognized accounting certification.
  • CPA or CGA accreditation is an asset.
  • At least 3 to 5 years of relevant experience
  • Be bilingual both verbally and in writing (French and English).
  • Master the Office suite. (Advanced Excel required).
  • Prior knowledge of SAP is an asset.

title: Accounting Manager
company: The Mason Group - Strategic Search Partners
description:
Our client is looking for a high energy Accounting Manger to join their accounting team. Team members work closely together to service the administrative and financial needs of the firm. The setting is highly‐confidential, professional, and collegial. The Accounting Managers responsibilities include establishing financial status by developing and implementing systems for collecting, analyzing, verifying and reporting information.

Key responsibilities of the Accounting Manager includes:

  • Plan, implement and oversee overall accounting strategy
  • Oversee accounting daily operations
  • Take responsibility for accounts payable/receivable, cash receipts, general ledger, and, budgeting, cash forecasting, revenue and expenditure variance analysis, capital assets reconciliations, general and trust account statement reconciliations, cheque runs
  • Monitor and analyze accounting data
  • Regularly produce financial reports or statements for management
  • Adhere to proper accounting methods, policies and principles
  • Encourage other employees to adhere to standards
  • Train new employees
  • Manage outbound and incoming wires, money orders, bank drafts, currency conversions
  • Liaise with bank manager
  • Assist accountants with year end
  • File quarterly transaction levy reports
  • Prepare monthly BMO Margin Report
  • Handle all complex accounting issues
  • Verify cheques for the bank upon request
  • Verify cheques if cheques are cashed or not requested by files handlers/ clients


Requirements


  • 5+ years proven accounting experience in the professional services industry
  • University Degree in Finance, Accounting, Analytics, Mathematics, or business-related discipline
  • Achieved or working towards CPA
  • Well-organized with ability to prioritize multiple projects
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with ability to influence different points of view
  • Experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI), Excel Power Pivot databases and NetSuite


If you are already registered with The Mason Group, please contact your Recruiting Consultant directly with reference to job #16079.

title: Accounting Onboarding & Implementation Manager
description:
At airCFO, we believe that startups are building the future each and every day. airCFO helps these startups shape the future by building their finance, tax & accounting functions to scale with efficient processes and tools that gives insight into their financial performance. Our vision is to become the nation’s most respected financial partner for startups -- serving organizations from Silicon Valley to NYC.


Our approach has always been simple: hire great people, then enable those people to do impactful work sustainably. In 2022, our ambition is to achieve best-in-class NPS scores from both our employees and our clients.


Our challenge today

In order to support our rapid growth, we are hiring for an Accounting Onboarding & Implementation Specialist! If you have a passion for working with fast-growing tech startups and you want to enhance your knowledge and skills working with clients across a variety of verticals, come and join our team of accounting and financial professionals.

Hiring an Onboarding & Implementation Specialist is a top priority for us, as we’ve onboarded an average of ~8 clients per month so far in 2022 and we want to ensure that we’re giving them a phenomenal client experience from the first day of their engagement with us.

Startups aren't known for stability — they are known for being a wild west of opportunity. We don't believe you should have to choose between stability and opportunity. Our strengths today are in the consistent progression opportunities we offer high performers via our career maps, human support from managers and values embedded in our strategy, benefits and behaviors.


What You’ll Own:


🧠 Onboarding Lead

-Make a great first impression and demonstrate excellent customer service skills as you interact with new clients as their main point of contact from onboarding kickoff through completion.

-Collaborate with Sales & Accounting/Finance/Tax teams to facilitate smooth handoffs from sales → onboarding → implementation → recurring client work.

-Act as a key player in strategically analyzing our current onboarding processes in order to implement a more scalable and automated process in the future.


♻️ Implementation Specialist

-Act as point-person for implementation projects, such as systems setup and historicals cleanup, that level-up a clients’ back offices & put our client-facing teams in a position to do their jobs successfully.


💚 Ad-hoc Project Delivery

-Serve as airCFO’s systems subject matter expert, and help with various projects related to improving clients’ back offices (as time allows based on onboarding workload)-


The ideal candidate will dive in head-first on execution and gradually increase their imprint on the strategic direction of the business.


This role might be for you if:


... you've had the following experiences in your career:

-You’ve worked in accounting for a tech company or professional services firm that works with technology companies.

-You’ve had extensive experience working with cloud-based tools e.g. Quickbooks Online, Gusto, Bill.com, Brex, Ramp, etc.

-You’ve worked in a fast-growing, fully-distributed startup.


... the following statements describe you:

-You’re not interested in working in a cubicle and you have a strong passion for working with startups.

-You’re an independent, initiative problem solver, and critical thinker with an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for tech startups.

-You won’t rest until our clients are 100% satisfied.

-You’re willing to roll up your sleeves and wear different hats when needed.

-You’re a sponge for learning new things. You'll be exposed to many business models, concepts, and leadership styles; learning that will serve you well no matter where your career takes you.


Still not sure if this is for you? Have a look at our website to learn about our services, our clients, our team culture and more.


Note: Applicants will be subject to a background check and employment reference check at the expense to airCFO. airCFO is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of airCFO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination.

title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
DIRECTOR OF FINANCE

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club

The Club

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club is a private members' club in the heart of Rosedale, Toronto, and is conveniently located on the Yonge Street subway line. The Club has a long history, since 1876, of providing excellent tennis courts, coaching and programming for players of all ages and has built its reputation as the premier tennis club in Canada

In addition to 18 tennis courts (four indoors) the Club has four squash courts, a Fitness Centre, a seasonal pool, a Wellness Centre, and food and beverage outlets. The Club has 3,000 members, including family members of all ages; annual revenues are approximately $14 million. From high-caliber tennis, to all-around athletics and exceptional social scene, membership is about belonging to a uniquely warm community located right in the heart of Rosedale.

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club is a historic facility that has been witness to the best tennis since the 19th century. Legends like Borg, Navratilova, Connors and Evert have all graced the club’s Har-Tru courts.


The Position

We are recruiting an accomplished full time Director of Finance to take charge of the Club's accounting and finance functions. Reporting to the General Manager/Chief Operating Officer (GM/COO), the Director of Finance is an integral member of the Senior Management Team and will lead an accounting team of three people.  The Director of Finance is a contributing team manager to the overall Club operation, and manages the financial operations of the Club, supervises the accounting functions, and provides analytical support to the GM/COO, Finance Committee, Board of Directors and others for planning, budgets, and solutions to business problems. This includes recommendations on the implementation and maintenance of the Club's financial plans and policies, its accounting practices, fiscal records, and the preparation of financial reports. The Director of Finance is a strong Club business partner, and makes decisions in accordance with Club policy on administrative or operational matters, ensuring the effective achievement of objectives.

The Director of Finance will be responsible for the following:

  • Recommend and implement policies to control and coordinate accounting, auditing, budgets, taxes and related activities and records; develop, establish, and administer procedures and systems pertaining to financial matters. Responsible for the Club’s internal controls and compliance to same.
  • Prepare financial statements, forecasts, and analysis for all administrative and managerial functions. Maintain all accounting records; develop, analyze, and interpret statistical and accounting information.
  • Manage the annual audit.
  • Evaluates and recommends insurance coverage for protection against property losses and potential liabilities.
  • Coordinates and directs the preparation of the annual operating and capital budgets, business plan, and financial forecasts; institutes and maintains other planning and control procedures; and analyzes and reports variances. The Club performs in a fiscal year beginning January 1 of each year.
  • Development, analysis, and interpretation of statistical and accounting information in order to appraise operating results in terms of profitability, performance against budget, and other matters bearing on the fiscal soundness and operating effectiveness of the organization.
  • Responsible for evaluating the performance of several personnel in the Administration department. This individual recommends training requirements, has the duty to keep the staff at the highest level of skill necessary to meet Club needs and objectives.
  • Responsible for the development, implementation, and operation of all accounting and information systems support; for the administration, management, and maintenance of the equipment systems employed in the collection of information and for the training and supervision of staff related, but not limited, to the Administration department.
  • Establishes major economic objectives and policies for the Club and prepares reports that outline the Club's financial position in the areas of receivables, payables, payroll, purchasing, fixed asset accounting, cash flow management and banking arrangements.
  • Furnishes internal reports, revises, and updates reports to be more useful and efficient, and furnishes external reports, including for tax and other government reporting, as necessary.


Candidate Profile:

  • ﻿ Professional Accounting designation (CPA);
  • Ten years of professional accounting experience with at least two years as Controller;
  • Experience working with Not-for-profit Organizations, the private club industry, and volunteer committees;
  • Excellent management, leadership, analytical and interpersonal skills
  • Strong communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations.
  • Knowledge of pertinent Ontario and federal employment laws and practices.


Compensation:

The Club will offer an attractive compensation package, commensurate with experience, which will include a competitive base salary, bonus, and benefits.


Note:

The position is currently vacant.

 

Inquiries:

 

IMPORTANT: Interested candidates should submit resumes along with a detailed cover letter which addresses the qualifications and describes your alignment/experience with the prescribed position by Friday, May 13th at 5:00pm EDT. If you require any accommodations to be considered for this position please include that information in your submission. Those documents must be saved and emailed in Word or PDF format (save as “Last Name, First Name, Toronto Lawn Finance Cover Letter” and “Last Name, First Name, Toronto Lawn Finance Resume”) respectively to: execsearch@globalgolfadvisors.com  

 

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact those selected for an interview. Please email resume with references.

 

 

Lead Search Consultants:

 

 

Michael Gregory

Partner

GGA Partners™

michael.gregory@ggapartners.com

 

Liz McDowell, CPA, CA, CCM

Director                                  

GGA Partners™

Liz.mcdowell@ggapartners.com

title: Manager of Accounting
description:
The Manager of Accounting is part of the administration team and is responsible for the oversight of the accounting and reporting functions of Shalom Manor Long Term Care Home, Shalom Manor Non-Profit Seniors Assisted Living Apartments and Mount Nemo Christian Nursing Home. The manager will oversee the work of 3 staff and provide guidance on duties and manage workload responsibilities as they assist the manager with the accounting functions. The position will be required to liaise with resident families in support of billing, accommodation fees and trust transactions. The manager will be led by the Director of Finance & Administration whom will provide guidance, mentorship and growth opportunities. The manager will be expected to work in accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values of Shalom, applicable legislation and regulations, corporate policies and procedures and collective agreements. The position is seen as an integral part of the growth of Shalom Manor Long Term Care Home as we look to expand our services to Hamilton with the planned new campus build at Upper Wellington Street. 


Duties will include:

  • Preparation of monthly financial reporting including recurring journal entries
  • Oversight and preparation of government reporting to various ministries including the Canada Revenue Agency, Ministry of Long Term Care, Minister of Finance, etc.
  • Supervision of accounts payable, accounts receivable and bank reconciliation processes.
  • Oversight of payroll systems in accordance with the payroll administrator.
  • Management of promissory note renewals, payouts and interest payments.
  • Monthly billing support to third parties and resident accounts


Tools/equipment:

  • Sage 300
  • Nation Builder
  • Point Click Care
  • Staff Schedule Care
  • Sage APA
  • Online banking portals
  • Canada Revenue Agency My Account


Qualifications Required:

  • Professional accounting designation
  • University degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or other similar discipline
  • At least 3 years of supervisory experience, preferably in a health care setting
  • Demonstrated proficiency in operation and use of a computer, related technologies and software required for the role
  • Ability to work both independently (self-directed and motivated) and as part of a team
  • Demonstrated problem-solving skills and ability to address conflict positively


Interested applicants are asked to submit their covering letters and resumes to hr@shalommanor.ca

title: Contrôleur financier- Entreprise en croissance - Ville de Québec
description:
Tu es actuellement à l'emploi d'un cabinet comptable et tu es enfin prêt à faire le saut en entreprise? Tu es plutot en entreprise et tu vises un poste de Contrôleur financier dans une grande entreprise?

Tu souhaites retrouver une conciliation travail-vie (adieu les heures supplémentaires!) ?

Tu es autonome et tu aimes apprendre?

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un nouveau Contrôleur financier pour une entreprise d'envergure (à l'échelle national).

Si tu souhaites te joindre à une belle équipe de CPA chevronnée, c'est un poste tout simplement parfait pout toi!

Avantages

Le Contrôleur financier- Entreprise en croissance - Ville de Québec aura accès à plusieurs avantages tel que :
  • Poste permanent, à temps plein sans heures supplémentaires ;
  • Horaire de travail flexible;
  • Télétravail 2 à 3 jours semaines;
  • Salaire concurrentiel, établi selon expérience;
  • Vacances établies selon expérience;
  • Programme d’assurances collectives et cotisation REER de l'employeur;
  • Facile d’accès en transport en commun;
  • Entreprise en croissance et opportunités d’avancements à moyen terme;
  • Gym à proximité.

Responsabilités

Vos principales responsabilités en tant que Contrôleur financier- Entreprise en croissance - Ville de Québec seront:
  • Préparer les états financiers des différentes divisions;
  • Participer à la consolidation des états financiers;
  • Être la personne ressource au niveau de l'équipe de comptabilité;
  • Être la personne ressource au niveau de divers dossiers fiscaux;
  • Participer à la préparation du dossier de vérification;
  • Préparer divers rapports pour la direction;
  • Participer à des mandats spéciaux.

Qualifications

Les qualifications recherchées sont:
  • BAA en comptabilité;
  • Titre CPA ou en voie d'obtention;
  • 2 -4 ans d'expérience pertinente.

Sommaire

Intéressé par le rôle de Contrôleur financier- Entreprise en croissance - Ville de Québec?

Vous pouvez me rejoindre au 418.955.4199 pour en discuter de vive voix ou faites-moi parvenir votre CV à amy.young@randstad.ca

Vous n'êtes pas prêt à postuler, ou avez-vous d'abord des questions? Appelez-moi pour discuter en toute confiance.

Vous êtes ouvert à de nouvelles opportunités? Contactez-moi! Il me fera plaisir de discuter de vos aspirations professionnelles et de discuter du marché avec vous.

Rejoignez mon réseau LinkedIn : linkedin.com/in/amy-young-cpa-40057584/

Pour consulter la liste complète des postes actuels : www.randstad.ca

Au plaisir de vous connaître!

Amy Young, CPA

Partenaire en capital humain

L'humain en tête

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à accessibilite@randstad.ca pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Russell Hendrix is looking for an experienced Accounting Manager join our Corporate Accounting team. You’ll be an integral part of the team’s operations, managing the AP department, and reporting directly to the Corporate Controller. This position requires a high attention to detail, the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize, and experience in successfully leading teams.


What You’ll Do:

  • Manage AP department – ensure that invoices are entered on a timely basis, with proper approvals, and correctly coded; ensure that Russell Hendrix KPI’s are met as pertains to accuracy and processing time.
  • Manage COA’s for Traverse ERP platform.
  • Prepare weekly listing of outstanding Accounts Payable for CFO review.
  • Organize and prioritize weekly payment runs and assist in preparation of weekly and other periodic cash forecasts.
  • Analyze expenses and prepare accruals on a monthly basis.
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of all intercompany transactions and resolve any discrepancies.
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of balance sheet accounts for review by Corporate Controller.
  • Prepare monthly bank reconciliations for review by Corporate Controller.
  • Approve disbursements within the Russell Hendrix banking portals, ensuring compliance with Russell Hendrix internal control matrix; complete bank transfers on a weekly basis.
  • Handle all sales tax remittances and assist in streamlining current tax reporting structure.
  • Review and approve monthly commission and rebate journal entries; review and approve monthly and quarterly commission and rebate payments.
  • Work with AP team to document and automate tasks.
  • Assist with preparation of contractual reporting to lenders.
  • Administer all corporate credit cards; manage and review employee expense report submissions to ensure compliance with Russell Hendrix guidelines.
  • Support annual audit and bank audits as needed.
  • Ad hoc duties as required.


Required Skills/Experience:

  • You have at least 10 years of progressive, hands-on experience in a similar role.
  • You have at least 5 years experience supervising or managing transactional teams.
  • Successful completion of university or college degree with a focus on accounting.
  • You have distribution/manufacturing/logistics experience within a sales-driven organization.
  • You have intermediate Excel skills, comfortable with pivots, lookups, etc.
  • You have experience with banking portals.
  • You have experience with high volume of transactions.
  • You have experience with complex manual reconciliations.
  • You have experience with process improvements within a highly manual multi-entity environment with non-integrated ERP functionality.
  • You are a detail oriented and responsible individual with a proven track record of demonstrating initiative and proposing/implementing solutions to address issues.
  • You have demonstratable organizational and time management skills in dealing with changing priorities in a fast-paced environment while meeting reporting deadlines.
  • You have a proven ability to work with all levels of the organization to ensure that goals are met.
  • You are comfortable giving and receiving feedback.


What’s In It for You:

  • Extended health benefits
  • $400/year gym subsidy
  • Dynamic work environment
  • Excellent employee discount
  • Opportunity for growth


Get To Know Russell Hendrix!


With locations across Canada and over 70 years of experience, Russell Hendrix is the Leader in the commercial Food equipment industry. We are service focused Foodies who value integrity, teamwork, resourcefulness, and fairness. Check us out on Instagram: rhfoodequip or visit our website: www.russellhendrix.com.

Russell Hendrix is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Russell Hendrix is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.
