title: Accounting Manager
description:
Company Description

For more than 30 years, Lorex has been a leader in the marketplace when it comes to innovative security technology for both home and commercial use. We achieve this by continuing to produce innovative monitoring solutions, all backed by cutting-edge technology and a dedicated team of forward thinkers. Using the latest technology and innovations, Lorex strives to produce solutions to both enhance security and fit your lifestyle.

Job Summary

The Accounting Manager is responsible for all areas relating to financial reporting. This position will be responsible for developing and maintaining accounting principles, practices and procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting and statements. This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including general ledger preparation, reporting (financial, compliance, regulatory, tax), year-end audit preparation, and the support of budget and forecast activities.


Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure.
  • Ensure an accurate and timely monthly, quarterly and year end close.
  • Ensure the timely reporting of all monthly financial, compliance, regulatory and tax information.
  • Ensure all key financial reconciliation are performed in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Supports budget and forecasting activities.
  • Collaborates with the other finance department members to support overall department goals and objectives.
  • Valuating, developing, and improving department controls, ERP systems, and procedures increase accuracy and efficiency.
  • Work closely with Accounting Group in overseas HQ to streamline the financial reporting and GAAP conversion process.
  • Advises staff regarding the handling of non-routine reporting transactions.
  • Work with the team to ensure a clean and timely year end audit.
  • Assist in development and implementation of new procedures and features to enhance the workflow of the department.
  • Provide training to new and existing staff as needed.
  • Support CFO with special projects and workflow process improvements.


Requirements:

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs)

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Accounting, Business, Finance or equivalent
  • Good knowledge of US / Canadian GAAP and IFRS
  • Knowledge or prior working experience with US tax including Federal, State & Sales tax is preferred
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills


Competency Profile

  • Self-motivated and ability to work to deadlines with good prioritization and time management skills
  • Ability to deliver high quality documentation paying attention to detail.


Background Experiences

  • 6+ years of progressive accounting experience with 3+ years being in a supervisory role
  • Prior working experience in public accounting firm or multinational companies is preferred
  • Qualified accountant (CPA / CA / CMA or equivalent) is preferred
  • Experience with SAP strongly preferred


Key Competencies:

Connects:

· Builds trust and establishes rapport with diverse colleagues and customers by listening, understanding their needs, and following through on commitments.

· Works effectively with people who have different perspectives, backgrounds and abilities while encouraging constructive dialogue and being sensitive and receptive to diverse views and opinions.

· Builds mutually beneficial working relationships to foster a positive and inclusive culture and engages with internal and external customers and stakeholders representing a variety of interests.


Teamwork:

· Works with others to share expertise and achieve outcomes that benefit the organization.

· Demonstrates strong communication skills to others on the team through active listening, summarizing, facilitating and "bridge building".


Inspires:

· Creates a shared vision by soliciting and valuing diverse input obtained from each team member on the vision of their work and the team.

· Uses a broad range of communication strategies and methods to communicate vision with enthusiasm and clarity, and to inspire confidence and generate commitment.

· Helps the team to embrace different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds by modeling positive leadership behavior and encouraging full participation.


Self-Awareness:

· Proactively seeks and obtains ongoing feedback to help understand ones' own strengths and development areas to work more effectively with team/department managers/clients.

· Understands and is aware of one’s emotions and the impact these emotions may have on others.

· Reflects on feedback and lessons learned and uses acquired knowledge in working with team members to achieve personal and professional growth.


Delivers:

· Ensures the timely delivery of programs, projects, and services, effectively adapting to tight deadlines and sudden changes in priorities to accomplish objectives.

· Plans for possibilities and contingencies, identifying opportunities and problems to ensure that best results are achieved.

· Recognizes and makes best use of the diverse skills, abilities, experiences of team members to achieve best outcomes.


Transforms:

· Takes initiative and sustained action to ensure the successful implementation of change by shifting strategic focus and embracing new ideas and building on past knowledge and success.

· Fosters a team environment where all are encouraged to think creatively and new and diverse ideas and approaches are heard, valued and considered for implementation.

· Seeks performance feedback and opportunities to invest time and effort to learn and expand knowledge to improve performance.


Accountability:

· Takes responsibility for clarifying the expectations of others

· Acknowledges how personal decisions, actions and standards of performance influence work accomplishments

· Accepts responsibility for work accomplishments

· Recognizes changes required to achieve better results going forward.


Creativity/Innovation:

· Identifies and evaluates unique ways to improve the organization (cost reductions, use of resources, policies/procedures, products), generating useful new ideas, approaches or techniques.


Integrity:

· Adheres to ethical standards and integrates Lorex values, principles and standards into practices and business transactions.

· Creates honest, trusting and successful working relationships with others inside and outside the organization and conducts all affairs with personal and professional integrity.

· Promptly addresses issues about discrimination, harassment, and unfair treatment and does not allow personal assumptions, biases and/or complaints to impact any work-related decisions in the team.

title: SOX Manager, Business Process & Accounting
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

 Job Category Finance and Operations Job Details

Job Description

Salesforce is looking for a dedicated and multifaceted Manager to join the management-led SOX 360 Program Office team to support our team’s strategy, growth, process excellence and innovation. We are currently seeking a highly effective individual with passion and a proven track record for success in understanding Record to Report, Hire to Retire, Acquire to Retire business processes as well as identifying risks and potential gaps in relevant controls. Reporting to the Director of End-to-End Business Process, this role requires strong discernment, emotional intelligence, and the ability to transform business knowledge into useful solutions. This person will also be responsible for applying business knowledge into the systems, process or reporting solutions that are proposed and delivered for an effective control environment.

The ideal candidate is expected to inspire change , think independently, clearly communicate and support a point-of-view and recommendations, perform SOX risk assessments and scoping, participate in readiness and process/control improvement initiatives, and exercise influence to drive action in a cross-functional environment. Additionally, the candidate for this role will have a deep understanding of auditing requirements including Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) requirements, US GAAP, and standard methodologies and emerging trends relevant for establishing an outstanding SOX program.

Your Impact
  • Work cross-functionally to support a changing SOX landscape and drive process improvement - we are strategic advisors to the company!
  • Provide end-to-end business knowledge and expertise to assist in SOX readiness activities and SOX program maturation activities
  • Take ownership for all assigned process areas, which includes acquiring a comprehensive grasp of Record to Report, Acquire to Retire, and Hire to Retire business process activities and controls as well as related company policies and external accounting and reporting guidelines and act as asubject matter authorityfor each ofthese assigned areas
  • Assist in the development of the annual SOXprioritizationassessment and plan
  • Work with current functional teams within the organization to review current processes and identify risk areas and areas for improvement and design controls around these to reduce risk and exposure to avoid operational surprises as well as evaluate and assess deficiencies
  • Bring your knowledge and experience designing, implementing and testing internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR) per the Sarbanes-Oxley Act to respond to identified risks
  • Partner with the business to ensure SOX documentation, including flowcharts, narratives, and controls are up to date,accurate and properly handled

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Valsoft Corporation is looking for an experienced and dynamic Accounting Manager reporting to the Head of Finance of one of the business units.


This individual will coordinate and manage period-end close and ensure accurate financial reporting and analysis for a portfolio of acquired companies, as well as lead projects impacting their accounting and handle the more complex accounting issues.


Here is a little window into our company: Valsoft’s focus is to acquire and grow vertical software businesses that provide mission-critical solutions in their respective niche or market. Since 2015, we have acquired over 50 businesses; today, Valsoft has over 2000 employees across 20+ countries. This business model creates a rapid growth environment allowing the acquisition of new companies based on profitable vertical performance. Our motto is Be Humble Stay Hungry!


What your day will look like:


  • Supervise and review the work of local and offshored accounting analysts – 3+ resources (journal entries, reconciliations, reports – including for AR, AP, billings and accounting transactions)
  • Supervise and implement appropriate application of GAAP accounting standards including more complex accounting situations such as percentage of completion
  • Coordinate the preparation of month-end financials for all the companies within the business unit (12+ subsidiaries in portfolio)
  • Supervise and lead the year-end closing for the business unit, as well as contribute in the audit process in support to the corporate accounting team
  • Prepare monthly financial analysis on key P&L items to better understand financial performance and variances between actual, forecast and budget, and support the reporting team during the month-end close
  • Review reporting needs and produce ad-hoc reports for the business, in collaboration with the FP&A team;
  • Build and review workflows, implement processes to optimize efficiency of reporting and put in place internal controls
  • Train, coach and provide support to the team
  • Collaborate with the integration team during the acquisition of a company to ensure the adequate setup of the accounting books
  • Contribute to the standardization of accounting processes with other business units and assist in the implementation of best practices
  • Strive for continuous improvement activities as part of day-to-day efforts
  • Support the Head of Finance of the business unit with special projects


About you:


  • 5+ years of experience in a similar role, including at least 2 in team management
  • CPA designation required
  • Fast-learner and adaptable – time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of French considered an asset
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Excel
  • Superior analytical skills, detail oriented
  • Excellent organizational skills and time management
  • Ability to manage risks by ensuring that effective and efficient internal controls are in place without compromising operational efficiency and flexibility
  • Working knowledge of Sage Intacct ERP (or similar) considered an asset
  • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • Team player


Perks working at Valsoft include:


  • Attractive compensation package including potential bonus
  • Training /Tuition Reimbursement Program
  • Free catered daily lunches, unlimited fruit and snacks, coffee, tea, hot chocolate
  • Work-life balance with a flexible working schedule
  • Free parking for all employees
  • Ping Pong and Foosball
  • Room to grow based on performance
  • Unlimited vacation after 3 years
  • Annual gym discount
  • Monthly on-site barber
  • Lounging areas


At Valsoft there is room for career growth, and we want you to feel like part of the Valsoft family! Valsoft Is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of; disability, race, ancestry, place of origin, color, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status or family status. We thank all applicants for their interest however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:


The Director of Finance is responsible for the management of the accounting, finance, and payroll department and will provide key support to the business for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting. This includes the annual budget, forecasting future financial trends, performing variance analysis, and working with the Navacord team on financial projections and key initiatives. The individual will be a trusted advisor and influencer within the leadership team and will spend significant time establishing the financial performance strategy. The individual will be part of the Executive Team and participate in the strategic direction of the business.


RESPONSIBILITIES:


Strategy

·Fully engage and become an integral part of the leadership team to create and support the Company’s strategic vision

·Advise on the role finance can proactively play in planning for success – being more competitive and remaining at the forefront of the industry

·Translate the corporate strategy and executive mandate into formalized financial systems and processes to achieve strategic priorities and outcomes

·Partner with leaders from other departments and identify revenue and cost drivers

·Lead the organization’s budget development and oversight processes


Leadership

·Oversee the finance department including all transactions related to receivables, payables, trust accounts, Account Executive expenses, compensation schedules, payroll and financial reporting

·Provide support, guidance, coaching and direction to the various levels throughout the finance department

·Be present and engaged; be a role model of professional conduct pursuing excellence in execution, seeking opportunities for continuous improvement and producing creative and/or unique solutions

·Demonstrate an ability to anticipate outcomes and to adjust approaches and internal services accordingly

·Foster a high performance culture within the Finance team


REQUIREMENTS:

·Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field

·Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) strongly preferred

·A minimum of 10 years of experience working in a complex fast-paced environment

·Insurance Industry and Applied Epic knowledge considered an asset

·Proficient in using accounting information systems

·Experience in supervising and mentoring others

·Strong interpersonal skills are essential

·Exemplary work ethic and organizational skills

·Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook


COMPETENCIES & ATTRIBUTES:

·Strategic, forward thinker who can forecast potential service and operation vulnerability in the business and drive mitigating actions

·Collaborative and team focused leader with the ability to coach and mentor staff and build an empowered and accountable team

·Leadership skills that will incite enthusiasm, provide vision, motivate, create positive morale and role model standards of professionalism

·Demonstrated initiative and motivation to continuous improvement of self and company processes

·Strong personal belief in high standards of service; and an effective, accountable leader; a contributing member of the team and a champion for the organization.


Paisley is actively committed to support diversity, equity, and inclusion. We serve and recognize and respect human differences and similarities. We value the diversity of people and actively encourage women, indigenous peoples, members of visible minorities, people with disabilities, and lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ2+) persons to apply.

description:

Our client is Canada's leading specialty footwear expert with over 27 national retail locations.


  • Employees: 250+

  • Team: 11


Who you are:

The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of progressive accounting/finance experience and have a passion for working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.


The impact you will have:

Due to continued growth and long-term vision, the company is looking to bring in an accounting professional to become a part of the finance leadership team. This individual will lead the accounting activities within the organization while working closely with the CFO and other senior leadership team members to execute strategic growth plans. The Accounting Manager is responsible for the day-to-day management of an Accounting Team consisting of 11 people, 4 of whom the Accounting Manager will be managing. In addition, the Accounting Manager will be responsible for various financial reporting, establishing controls, and month-end and year-end related activities.


What are we looking for?

  1. 5-7 years of progressive accounting/finance experience in a similar role.
  2. Ability to provide superior customer service and be able to successfully communicate ideas to the internal leadership and finance team.
  3. Excellent ability to organize and time management in order to tackle multiple tasks simultaneously.
  4. CPA Designation or equivalent education.
  5. Leadership Experience: Has demonstrated their ability to coach, develop and motivate a team to continuously improve



Egility is committed to creating and fostering culturally diverse, equitable, and inclusive organizations. We recognize the value in a wide range of ideas, perspectives, experiences, and skillsets in our client’s workplaces. Our client is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with the Accessible Canada Act, 2019 and all applicable provincial accessibility standards, upon request, accommodation will be provided by both Egility and our client throughout the recruitment, selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.


Due to high volume, we will only be contacting applicants who meet all of the minimum requirements listed in the job description. Only those applicants who align most closely with our minimum and preferred qualifications will be contacted for an interview. The Recruiting team at Egility will retain your application materials and may contact you regarding future opportunities.

description:

Assurance

Industry/Sector

Job Description & Summary

The best opportunities to let your knowledge, talent and skills flourish.

The Capital Markets Accounting Advisory Services team (“CMAAS”) at PwC is a team committed to supporting clients through moments of exceptional change by providing accounting advisory services. These services include accounting support through acquisitions and divestitures, accounting change projects, ESG reporting, restructuring and restatements and capital transactions such as IPOs.

A career within CMAAS will provide you with the opportunity to be responsible for complex financial reporting issues around transactions and other transformational events. You’ll tackle client’s needs with a solution-oriented approach that creatively addresses complex financial reporting problems for high profile transactions and you’ll have significant interaction with senior company management, teams, bankers, lawyers and other advisers.

To stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be an authentic and inclusive leader, at all grades/levels and in all lines of service. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across all our lines of service, geographies and career paths; and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and to progress in our careers, now and in the future.

Important point(s) to consider

COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: Putting the safety of our people and clients first as we look to a hybrid future: The health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, clients, and communities is our number one priority. Vaccinations have proven to reduce the risk of COVID-19. Effective Friday, October 1, 2021, PwC Canada requires all partners, staff, contractors and visitors to be fully-vaccinated when entering a PwC location, subject to applicable legal exemptions. At PwC, the future ways of work will be a hybrid of in-person and virtual, allowing choice and flexibility to explore new ways of working and collaborating. Read this press release for further details.

What you’ll create and do:

The Manager role requires the individual to be a part of the leadership team within the CMAAS practice, contributing to strategy and business development activities, working effectively with the national team of partners and managers to deliver high-quality solutions to both our private and public clients. You’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues, from strategy to execution. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Lead our clients through capital market transactions including IPO readiness, and other market transactions (i.e. BAR Reports, pro forma financial statements)
  • Lead our clients through various accounting change projects including GAAP change in contemplation of a transaction and ESG reporting
  • Lead our clients through implementation of accounting policy changes and new accounting standards
  • Work with the team and our clients to prepare complex accounting calculations, quarterly/annual financial statements and management reporting to drive insights
  • Assist and advise clients through corporate restructurings
  • Assist clients through financial statement restatements, including support on comment letters from regulatory boards
  • Research technical accounting matters as required
  • Manage engagement economics
  • Coach others and encourage them to take ownership of their development
  • Focus on building trusted relationships
  • Analyze complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations
  • Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties
  • Develop a perspective on key global trends, including globalization and how they impact the firm and our client; and
  • Uphold the firm’s code of ethics and business conduct

What you’ll bring to this role:

  • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work;
  • A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences, developing and coaching diverse teams, and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard;
  • CPA designation, or equivalent designation, required;
  • Excellent knowledge of IFRS, US GAAP and ASPE;
  • Emerging technical knowledge of ESG reporting frameworks, including TCFD, SASB, and GRI is beneficial;
  • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work. Proven ability working with data analytic tools (Tableau, Alteryx, Power BI) considered an asset;
  • Excellent project management skills and ability to manage relationships at all levels within PwC and within the client’s organization;
  • Strong Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.) and an aptitude for technology and innovation are an asset;
  • The ability to build relationships and to integrate with client teams working under tight deadlines;
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills and an ability to work through complex and challenging client projects;
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a multi-tasked, fast-paced and changing project-based environment with the flexibility to work overtime where client deadlines are tight;
  • Previous experience in coaching and leading engagement teams;
  • Exceptional commitment to providing excellent client service, by building and maintaining productive relationships with both internal and external clients;
  • Prior experience within a consulting or advisory role is an asset; and
  • A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences, developing and coaching diverse teams, and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard.

Why you’ll love working for PwC

At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc

title: Senior Accounting Manager
description:
The Senior Accounting Manager will oversee the month-end close process, ensure accuracy in the reported numbers, ensure compliance with CSI accounting policies, and that deadlines are met without exception.


Responsibilities :

  • Review and ensure accounting systems and processes are working properly
  • Complete monthly results certification for corporate on WD4 and WD6 for business units including new acquisitions.
  • Send out the monthly variance file to the FAs/GMs. Review variance commentary by FAs and provide commentary.
  • Highlight any material (>$25k) accounting surprises before the distribution of the BU reporting package (i.e. before WD5)
  • Review monthly balance sheet reconciliation and ensure any issues are resolved in a timely manner.
  • Drive accountability of balance sheet reconciliation amongst the BU finance team and ensure standardization of balance sheet reconciliations across the division.
  • Work with the BU finance teams to put in-process controls for recurring accounting issues
  • Recording of centralized accounting processes & providing guidance for journal entries, close process, coding expenses, and leading execution of PER Corporate Accounting policies.
  • Provide IFRS-16 Lease Accounting & IFRS-15 guidance to BU accounting teams
  • Quarterly impairment testing for CSI corporate. Take the lead with reviewing and assessing impairment models when an impairment is triggered
  • Work with FAs on a $1M new contract checklist for CSI corporate (Due quarterly) for PER Corporate.
  • Prepare Quarterly variance analysis and Quarterly division FS Checklist for PER Corporate
  • Oversee the internal/external audits for the BUs & drive resolution accountability to mitigate risks
  • Ensure optimized use of contour amongst the BUs.
  • Assist the teams with the hiring and onboarding of new accounting resources.
  • Assist BU finance teams with new acquisition hiring, task assignment, and contour utilization.
  • Ad-hoc corporate projects as defined by management


Technical and Educational Qualifications

  • Completion of a professional accounting designation program (CPA, CMA, CGA) is a plus.
  • Experience of 5-7 years in accounting & finance is essential.
  • Excellent analytical, research, and problem-solving skills;
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Excel;
  • Strong communication and people skills;
  • Ability to meet deadlines in a rapidly changing business environment;
  • Ability to work independently and balance competing demands;
  • A strong understanding of accounting guidelines, particularly IFRS-15 revenue recognition guidelines is strongly preferred, and acquisition accounting is a plus.
  • Ability to manage and prioritize competing deliverables in a fast-paced environment.
  • Knowledge of Great Plains, Jedox & Concur is an asset.



WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT US

  • Doing work that has a direct impact on customers and an industry
  • Working with a team of confident, self-starting, and persistent people with visible passion
  • Opportunity to work outside of one’s comfort zone and within the thrill of a fast-paced environment
  • Corporate bonus program
  • Great health and dental insurance benefits

title: Accounting Manager
description:
A BIT ABOUT US.


Outhire is a new kind of agency that puts candidates first! Our innovative recruitment process is rooted in a digital first approach that aims to save candidates’ time, tailor the right fit, and give real-time updates throughout the process. Most importantly, our process guarantees that hiring managers see a complete picture of you and not just another name on a paper. When you work with Outhire, we make it a point to be a partner in your job search.


ACCOUNTING MANAGER – LOW-RISE DEVELOPER


Average Salary:

$100,000


Location:

Mississauga, ON


Office:

In-office 1st 3 months, Hybrid after


The Role:

Accounting Manager – this will be the first hire for the accounting and finance function with short-term plans to build a team around this role and transition some of the responsibilities. In the interim, the right candidate should expect to be doing everything from processing invoices to preparing annual reports.

  • 40% Full Cycle Accounting
  • 30% Management Reporting
  • 20% Ad-hoc & Process Setup
  • 10% Corporate Accounting


The Tasks:

Full Cycle Accounting

· May include but not be limited to the following tasks: day-to-day accounting operations, payroll, filing of tax returns, balance sheet and bank reconciliation, fixed asset accounting, AP, and monthly adjusting entries.


Management Reporting

· May include but not be limited to the following tasks: forecasts and budgeting on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis; collaboration with business units for active construction projects; support for tracking and reporting of key performance indicators (KPI); support for M&A analysis including the calculation of IRR, NPV, and EBITDA.


Corporate Accounting

· May include but not be limited to the following tasks: personal and holding level CRA filings on behalf of the owners, expense reporting, receipt and distribution of funds.


The Opportunity:

An excellent opportunity for someone looking to get in at ground level with a fast-paced, high-growth real estate development company. This role will be pivotal to the company. The Accounting Manager will be a strategic partner in securing the company’s financial resources with proper processes and controls while also enhancing project profitability and minimizing financial risks.


By Month 1

· Learned the business and taken the hand-off of the full cycle accounting deliverables from the incumbent consultant.


By Month 3

  • Achieved full proficiency with the full cycle accounting deliverables.
  • Gained partial proficiency with any cost accounting responsibilities, most notably the timely reporting to the cost consultants.
  • Developed a baseline relationship with key internal and external stakeholders.

By Month 12

  • Developed a robust understanding of the business and the management reporting deliverables.
  • Identified and proposed process improvement changes to the accounting and management reporting processes.
  • Became the trusted gatekeeper for any accounting-related issues and financial advisor to the partners.

The Company:

A privately-owned real estate developer operating in the Ontario region with five projects to date in the residential townhomes space.


The Team:

  • Under 10-person company.
  • Reporting directly to the Managing Partner.


The Perks:

  • Discretionary annual bonus.
  • Three weeks of paid vacation with an additional week during December.
  • Standard Benefits.[LS1]
  • CPA dues.
  • Flexible hours after six months.
  • Professional development support.


The Skill Set:

  • Minimum five years of accounting experience.
  • Designated CPA or equivalent.
  • Preference for someone with accounting experience in the construction, engineering, or manufacturing industries.


NOT QUITE THE ROLE FOR YOU?

Only qualified candidates will be contacted. Not the right role for you? Sign up at outhire.ca/registration to get earlier notices on job matches, full compensation details, real-time updates on applications, and more.

title: Gestionnaire de la comptabilité (Hybride)
description:
Valsoft Corporation invite un ou une gestionnaire de la comptabilité alliant expérience et dynamisme à joindre son équipe!

Notre entreprise en quelques lignes: Valsoft est spécialisée dans l'acquisition et le développement de firmes logicielles verticalement intégrées proposant des solutions essentielles dans leur créneau ou leur marché respectif. Depuis 2015, nous avons acquis plus de 50 entreprises. Aujourd'hui, Valsoft compte plus de 2000 employés répartis dans une vingtaine de pays. Ce modèle d'affaires jette les bases d'un environnement favorisant la croissance rapide et permettant l'acquisition de nouvelles entreprises selon une stratégie verticale axée sur le rendement et la rentabilité. Notre devise : Soyez humble, mais voyez grand!

Relevant du chef des finances de l'une des unités commerciales, la personne titulaire du poste coordonnera et gérera les procédures de clôture de fin d'exercice et veillera à l'exactitude des analyses et rapports financiers pour un portefeuille de firmes acquises. Elle dirigera également différents projets touchant à la comptabilité et traitera des questions comptables plus complexes.

Votre rôle au quotidien:
  • Superviser et examiner le travail des analystes de la comptabilité sur place et à l'étranger – équipe de trois personnes ou plus (écritures de journal, rapprochements, rapports – y compris pour les comptes clients et fournisseurs, la facturation et les opérations comptables);
  • Superviser et mettre en œuvre l'application adéquate des PCGR, y compris dans des situations comptables plus complexes telles que la comptabilisation proportionnelle du profit;
  • Coordonner la préparation des états financiers de fin de mois pour toutes les entreprises de l'unité commerciale (le portefeuille comprend 12 filiales);
  • Superviser et diriger la clôture de l'exercice pour l'unité commerciale, et venir en aide à l'équipe de la comptabilité dans le cadre du processus d'audit;
  • Préparer les analyses financières mensuelles concernant les principaux postes de pertes et profits afin de mieux comprendre les performances financières et les écarts entre les chiffres réels, les prévisions et le budget; épauler l'équipe chargée de la production des rapports lors de la clôture de fin de mois;
  • Examiner les besoins en matière de rapports et produire des états ponctuels pour l'entreprise, de concert avec l'équipe d'analyse et de planification financières;
  • Créer et examiner les flux de travail; implanter des procédures permettant d'optimiser l'efficacité de la production de rapports; instaurer des contrôles internes;
  • Former, encadrer et soutenir l'équipe;
  • Collaborer avec l'équipe chargée de l'intégration des entreprises lors du processus d'acquisition afin d'assurer la mise en place adéquate des livres comptables;
  • Contribuer à la normalisation des processus comptables avec les autres unités commerciales et à la mise en œuvre des pratiques exemplaires;
  • Tâcher de mettre en place quotidiennement des techniques d'amélioration continue;
  • Soutenir le chef des finances de l'unité commerciale dans le cadre des projets spéciaux

Votre profil:
  • 5 années d'expérience ou plus à un poste comparable, dont au moins 2 à la tête d'une équipe;
  • Titre de CPA (incontournable);
  • Facilité d'apprentissage et capacité d'adaptation – bonne gestion du temps et respect des échéances;
  • Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication verbale et écrite;
  • Connaissance du français (atout);
  • Connaissance approfondie de MS Excel;
  • Excellentes aptitudes analytiques et grande minutie;
  • Solide sens de l'organisation et excellente gestion du temps;
  • Capacité à gérer les risques, en veillant à ce que des contrôles internes efficaces soient en place sans compromettre l'efficacité et la souplesse opérationnelles;
  • Connaissance pratique du logiciel ERP de Sage Intacct (ou d'un logiciel comparable) – un atout;
  • Esprit d'équipe;
  • Citoyenneté canadienne ou résidence permanente (essentiel).

Quelques-uns de vos avantages à travailler chez Valsoft:
  • Dîner gratuit préparé quotidiennement par un traiteur, fruits et collations à volonté, café, thé, chocolat chaud, etc.;
  • Rémunération attrayante avec possibilité de prime;
  • Équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée, et souplesse de l'horaire de travail;
  • Programme de formation et de remboursement des droits de scolarité;
  • Possibilités d'avancement professionnel en fonction des résultats obtenus;
  • Vacances illimitées après 3 ans;
  • Stationnement gratuit pour l'ensemble du personnel;
  • Services de coiffure sur place tous les mois;
  • Remise annuelle sur les inscriptions en salle de sport;
  • Tennis et soccer de table;
  • Espaces de repos.

Ici, l'avancement professionnel est une réalité. Nous voulons vous donner le sentiment de faire partie de l'équipe!

En tant qu'employeur, nous souscrivons au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination fondée sur le handicap, la race, l'ascendance, le lieu d'origine, la couleur de peau, l'origine ethnique, la citoyenneté, les croyances, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité de genre, l'expression de genre, l'âge, le casier judiciaire, l'état matrimonial ou la situation familiale.

Nous vous remercions de votre intérêt pour ce poste. Notez que seules les personnes retenues pour une entrevue seront contactées.

title: Accounting Manager
company: The Mason Group - Strategic Search Partners
description:
Our client, a family office in the real estate industry is looking for an Accountant Manager for their fun, young and growing small office, located in central Toronto.

As an Accounting Manager for a small company, you are an organized self-starter, who enjoys working in a small team, including front office client services. Experience at a small company is helpful. Property accounting and/ or family office experience are assets.

The Accounting Manager will be responsible for accounting under ASPE. A system savvy mind who likes to find and implement process improvements will thrive in this environment. Full-cycle accounting oversight, transaction-level support across multiple investments, and overall accounting system experience are just a few of the day-to-day duties.

This Accounting Manager opportunity provides great balance and stability as a 9am–5pm job. With a nice work environment, while reporting directly to the Owners. This is a five day a week in the office job.


Requirements


  • Accounting / Finance/ BComm. or related degree,
  • CPA designation is an asset,
  • Strong knowledge of ASPE,
  • Lead effective month-end accounting close and assist with an efficient year-end process,
  • Excellent skills working with accounting, reporting, KPIs and data analytics software,
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required to manipulate large datasets and present information in a clean, organized way for decision making,
  • Strong systems knowledge,
  • Previous experience within property accounting, real estate, and/ or a family office environment, as well as well-honed project management skills,
  • Exemplary communication, presentation skills with a positive can-do client service attitude,
  • Confident, articulate, and reliable with great emotional maturity,
  • Ability to quickly problem-solve, with an inherent critical thinking mindset.


If you are already registered with The Mason Group, please contact your Recruiting Consultant directly with reference to job #15966.

title: Team Manager - Accounting
description:
Let’s impact lives for the better!

Alberta Blue Cross® is Alberta based, not-for-profit and dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting the wellness of all Albertans. We believe in what we do—and place trust in our employees to deliver our vision.

Working at Alberta Blue Cross® means having a career where you’ll be recognized for your contributions. We value diversity, encourage our employees to maintain a healthy work-life balance and provide opportunities for training and career growth.

OVERVIEW:

Working in a flexible work style, Alberta Blue Cross® has an immediate opening for an enthusiastic, team-oriented and results-driven Team Manager to join our Accounting team. Reporting to the Manager of Accounting and the Team Manager will be a a natural collaborator with a great attitude, work ethic and ability to see things from a customer’s perspective and experience. As the successful candidate, you will bring a CPA designation and previous managerial experience to coach and mentor your staff and drive results.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:
  • Supervision of accounting staff, including mentorship and contributing to annual reviews.
  • Reviewing general ledger reconciliations and journal entries.
  • Preparing complex reconciliations between sub-ledgers and general ledger, including resolving or recommending action on reconciling items.
  • Contributes to coordinating the distribution of monthly, quarterly and annual financial reporting.
  • Significant contributor to the coordination and execution of the year end process.
  • Oversee continuous improvement projects in Accounting.
  • Contribute to Corporate level projects as a subject matter expert.
  • Responsible for supporting and working within the internal control framework.
  • Communicating with all levels of management on accounting issues, results, and business initiatives.
  • Contributes to the research and recommendations regarding the treatment of accounting issues that comply with IFRS.
  • Support department vision and strategic planning.

WHAT YOU WILL HAVE:
  • CPA designation is required.
  • Five or more years’ experience in full cycle accounting operations and/or public practice with preference given to those with prior managerial experience.
  • Must have the ability to develop staff through coaching, mentorship and personal career development.
  • Must have the ability to develop and grow meaningful and strong relationships with all stakeholders including senior management.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Experience with reconciliations and posting journal entries.
  • Experience with external & internal audit.
  • Treasury Management experience is an asset.
  • Strong business acumen and ability to understand business requirements.
  • Ability to identify opportunities for change and improvement, research issues and formulate recommendations.
  • Project support including defining requirements and testing.
  • Good understanding of IFRS.

Alberta Blue Cross® is an inclusive employer committed to a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We empower and are advocates for our employees by welcoming, respecting and valuing their unique perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in an innovative, high-energy team-focused environment. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, apply online at careers.ab.bluecross.ca

COVID-19 Vaccination Notice: Alberta Blue Cross has a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that applies to all of its employees. As a condition of employment, successful job applicants will be asked to confirm their COVID-19 vaccination status and may be required to provide proof of a valid negative COVID-19 test or a valid exemption pursuant to applicable human rights law if not fully vaccinated.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Our Client, one of the world’s leading manufacturers and marketers of vehicle lighting and safety systems, is looking for an accounting manager to add to their accounting staff. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, organized and have a minimum of three years’ experience in accounting at a senior level. The experience should be in a manufacturing environment. Experience with E1 (JDE) system an asset. The ideal candidate will be looking to advance their career in the accounting field. This position will report directly to the Controller.


Duties and Responsibilities

• Using the highest standards and practices to ensure financial documents comply with the law

• Collecting and verifying financial information

• Maintaining a general ledger by inputting daily financial transactions

• Overseeing payroll for the company

• Preparing financial statements, producing accounting reports, and checking them for accuracy

• Maintaining the standard costing of all products per corporate standards

• Monitor, observe and audit the warehouse cycle counts

• Assist with the supervision of the accounting staff

• Assist with the annual and quarterly budget process

• Assist with financial audits


Skills and Qualifications

• Strong understanding of mathematics

• Excellent time management and ability to meet constant deadlines

• Knowledgeable in financial computer software

• Good delegation skills

• Leadership skills

• Detail orientation

• Proficiency in Excel

• University degree in accounting or economics

Compensation and Benefits

• Competitive wages

• RRSP/DPSP program

• Competitive benefits package

title: Gestionnaire de projet, Systèmes de comptabilité de détail
description:
REJOIGNEZ NOTRE ÉQUIPE

Notre mission est simple : facilité la vie de nos clients un peu plus chaque jour. Nous voulons leur remonter le moral en leur offrant de petites attentions en cours de route. Où que votre voyage vous mène, nous pouvons vous aider à y parvenir.


Gestionnaire de projet, Systèmes de comptabilité de détail

Département : Système de comptabilité de détail

Lieu : Laval, QC

Type d’emploi : Permanent, Temps plein


Le département des systèmes de comptabilité de détail offre une opportunité passionnante pour une personne analytique, soucieuse du détail et dotée d'un sens aigu de la réflexion globale. Le titulaire de ce poste coordonnera et collaborera avec les départements de l'organisation afin de créer les meilleures solutions du secteur pour plusieurs systèmes comptables.


Il s'agit d'une excellente occasion de diriger une équipe vers le prochain niveau dans l'espace d'innovation et les nouvelles technologies au fur et à mesure qu'elles sont développées pour notre environnement Circle K/Couche-Tard. Ce rôle joue un rôle essentiel pour s'assurer que tous les produits déployés dans nos magasins répondent à notre vision d'entreprise qui consiste à faciliter la vie de nos clients au quotidien.


CE QUE VOUS FEREZ

Voici quelques moyens qui vous permettront de faire une différence :

  • Analyser des programmes complexes, coordonner et collaborer avec plusieurs départements pour développer des solutions de systèmes comptables basées sur les besoins de l'entreprise.
  • Diriger une équipe de personnes talentueuses, fixer des objectifs détaillés et assurer le suivi des produits livrables.
  • Soutenir les mises en œuvre en utilisant des techniques de test de gestion de projet et la documentation connexe conforme à la loi SOX. S'assurer que les solutions élaborées sont mises en œuvre dans le logiciel du système comptable, selon les besoins.
  • Travailler avec des ressources internes et externes, dépanner et faire des recommandations en fonction des exigences opérationnelles et comptables.
  • Travailler avec les chefs de projet et les responsables de processus mondiaux pour mettre en œuvre des solutions cohérentes dans l'ensemble du réseau.
  • Certifier les changements de projet approuvés dans l'environnement de production avant le déploiement.
  • Assurer la formation croisée du département pour garantir que tous les processus sont couverts en cas d'absence de l'équipe.


CE DONT VOUS AUREZ BESOIN

Nous voulons que vous rejoigniez notre équipe ! Voici ce que nous recherchons :

EXIGENCES

  • Baccalauréat en comptabilité ou en informatique requis
  • Capacité à communiquer dans plusieurs disciplines (comptabilité, systèmes de vente au détail, gestion de projet et informatique) et à adapter le langage en fonction de l'auditoire.
  • 5 à 8 ans d'expérience pertinente dans un rôle de gestion de projet.

COMPÉTENCES REQUISES :

  • Capacité à être autonome et à demander un minimum d'encadrement.
  • Organisé et doté d'excellentes capacités de résolution de problèmes.
  • Capacité à gérer des calendriers complexes, à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois et à respecter les délais en fournissant un travail de haute qualité.
  • Capacité à communiquer efficacement à l'écrit et à l'oral.
  • Capacité à reconnaître les forces de l'équipe et à construire des chemins de croissance.
  • Excellente connaissance d'Excel et des applications Microsoft.
  • Connaissance des logiciels PDI Enterprise, Bulloch et Radiant Point of Sale systems et ReconNet (un atout).
  • Bilingue (français/anglais)


POURQUOI TRAVAILLER AVEC NOUS

Nos offres d'emploi dans les magasins et les bureaux vous permettent d'évoluer rapidement au sein d'une entreprise internationale, tout en bénéficiant d'un environnement de travail dynamique qui place les personnes au premier plan. Où que vous soyez dans votre parcours, nous avons une place pour vous. Voici quelques-uns des avantages attrayants que nous vous offrons :

  • Une gamme complète d'avantages sociaux (soins médicaux et dentaires) ;
  • Possibilité d'adhérer à un régime de retraite avec cotisations de l'employeur ou à un plan d'achat d'actions ;
  • Rabais pour les employés en magasins et chez plusieurs de nos partenaires ;
  • Congés payés incluant des vacances, des jours de congé maladie et personnel ;
  • Travail au sein d'une équipe collaborative, dynamique et performante ;
  • Opportunités d'apprentissage pour développer de nouvelles compétences et évoluer professionnellement dans une entreprise en pleine croissance ;
  • Travail en mode hybride.


INTÉRESSÉ(E) ?

Faites-nous parvenir votre curriculum vitæ par courriel à candidatfinances@couche-tard.com en indiquant le numéro de poste suivant dans l'objet R227235.


Couche-Tard accorde une grande importance à la diversité en milieu de travail et souscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi en encourageant les candidatures venant des groupes désignés, c'est à dire : les femmes, les personnes autochtones, les personnes handicapées ainsi que les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles.


Nous remercions tous les candidats de l’intérêt qu’ils portent à ce poste; seules les personnes sélectionnées seront contactées.

title: Controller - Real Estate Development
description: Do you want to be a Controller with a reputable Real Estate & Property Development company? Contact Robert Half if you have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, and making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and clerical department. If you are good at planning and directing all accounting operational functions, handling the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluating accounting and internal control systems, and leading departmental staff, this role might be right for you. You might be a good fit for this position if you can lead with integrity and reliability and have the ability to manage self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability when providing client services. We're looking for creative team players with a talent for challenging the status quo, coming up with unique ideas, negotiating and influencing. If it's time to advance your career, find out more about this opportunity and take the next steps toward a very competitive and generous compensation and benefits package. The Controller will be a permanent employment opportunity and will be located in the Edmonton, Alberta region.

title: Gate Controller
description:
At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.

We operate or service some 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated employees to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.

You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.

So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.

Your Role
  • Maintains Gate Person Systems and the overall appearance and standards of the yard and warehouse;
  • Verifies all items leaving the yard;
  • Performs routine re-stocking and housekeeping of yard and warehouse while providing exceptional customer service;
  • Operates the gate in an efficient and friendly manner;
  • Provides an exceptional level of customer service, internally and externally;
  • Communicates in a professional manner with all yard staff;
  • Directs customers to location of material, notifies Order Builders of customers requiring additional assistance;
  • Maintains quality assurance and inspects all products prior to loading
  • Assists with the loading of customer vehicles
  • Upon customer’s exit, ensures customer’s paperwork is complete and quantities match receipt;
  • Maintains quality assurance and inspects all products prior to loading;
  • Monitors customer returns coming into yard, checking condition, ensuring payment and completing "return through warehouse" form in absence of Order Picker;
  • Maintains warehouse, ensures area is well stocked, tidy and kept free of debris.


The Qualifications We Are Looking For
  • Position requires good communication skills to deal effectively with customers
  • Good physical condition.
  • Ability to work in a team.
  • Ability to work outdoors, tolerance to cold and heat.


Your Benefits Of Working For Lowe’s Canada

By joining the Lowe’s Canada family, you’ll enjoy many benefits, such as:
  • An inclusive and safe working environment
  • Promotion of work-life balance
  • Exclusive employee discounts
  • Benefits: insurance (certain conditions apply), annual salary review, etc.
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company
  • An employer that’s involved in the community
  • Teamwork and ongoing training
  • A comprehensive training program for all new hires
  • A company discount on store merchandise
  • A student incentive program
  • And much more!

title: Controller
location: City of Langley, British Columbia, Canada
description:
Our Client

Our client is a leading-edge commercial Construction Management group that champions the philosophy that construction project work has a deeper purpose than just creating spaces, and that through strong partnerships, they can bring transformation to the industry, their customers, and the communities they serve. They’re passionate in their belief that the future of construction will be one where everyone is aligned with the mission, working shoulder to shoulder, solving problems, and understanding issues and challenges from each other's perspectives. Their consistent drive in this direction continues to propel their successful growth in the markets they serve.

Our clients’ current services range from commercial site assessment to pre-con and construction management all of which are approached and completed with the highest degree of mutual respect, value, and fairness. The end goal is that aside from creating beautiful and functional spaces with purpose, they aim to build solid professional relationships based on positive and successful project experiences.

The Opportunity

Exclusive Opportunity! Peeple Inc. is excited to assist our client in their search for a strong Controller to help grow their business in 2022 & beyond! You will roll up your sleeves and be responsible for everything GL, financial reporting, and payroll-related. You will be managing and mentoring a small team that supports you on the day-to-day accounting work. This is an amazing opportunity to partner with the business and helps them understand the numbers through your expertise with analytics, financial reporting, budgets, and forecasts. Project and/or construction accounting experience is a must and will help get you up to speed quickly as you learn about all the exciting projects being worked on! This is your chance to roll up your sleeves and take this challenge head-on with enthusiasm and accountability!

Key Responsibilities
  • Oversee and lead all finance operations
  • Mentor and manage a small accounting team
  • Direct all financial reporting & analysis, month-end close, and reconciliations
  • Partner with the Project Managers & their teams to streamline financial tracking and process of ongoing projects
  • Manage and oversee project accounting and AP
  • Supervise full-cycle payroll systems
Education/Experience
  • 3+ years of accounting experience at the Controller level
  • CPA designation
  • MUST have project accounting/construction experience
  • Strong leader with excellent management & mentorship skills
  • Experienced in financial reporting, full-cycle accounting, payroll, and process improvement
  • Solid ERP experience, Sage 300/Timberline an asset
Who You Are
  • Exceptional ability to communicate with all levels of the organization + external stakeholders
  • Bring a positive attitude and outlook
  • Independent and practice a hands-on approach to your role
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to handle multiple & changing priorities
  • Ability to communicate financials to operational and non-financial teams
About Peeple Inc.

Peeple Inc is a Vancouver-based People Development firm specializing in Management Search and Executive Coaching and development. We’re focused on helping companies build and develop world-class teams and assisting jobseekers to find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continuing care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible.

Peeple Inc and the clients we represent are committed to an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace, as well as complete compliance with the B.C. Human Rights Code, Canadian Human Rights Act, and the Employment Equity Act.

Application and Timeline

We encourage interested applicants to apply as soon as possible as our client is keen to welcome their newest team member. Interviews will take place as resumes are submitted through the Peeple Inc website.

title: Controller
description:
Are you a CPA-designated, hands-on Controller who has experience in a start-up environment with IFRS experience, and open to new opportunities in Toronto? Do you have experience implementing internal controls, strong technical accounting knowledge, and comfort overseeing the month-end process?


Do you have proven experience leading and motivating a team, diverse experience in a smaller-company environment, being involved with HR, payroll, and other departments?


If this role describes you and your experience well, this may be a great Controller ole for you to consider!


Reporting to the CFO, your duties and responsibilities will include;


• Establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures as well as internal controls

• Oversee all accounts, ledgers, and reporting systems ensuring compliance with appropriate IFRS standards and regulatory requirements

• Monitor and confirm financial condition by conducting audits; providing information to external auditors

• Consistently analyze financial data and present financial reports in an accurate and timely manner

• Monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statement preparation

• Assist leadership in the annual budgeting and planning process; administer and review all financial plans and compare to actual results with a view to identify, explain, and correct variances as appropriate

• Prepare and manage organizational cash flow on a daily basis

• Prepare budgets by establishing schedules; collecting, analyzing, and consolidating financial data; recommending plans

• Prepare and submit Executive payroll, remittances, etc. for Canada and U.S.

• Complete operational requirements for planning, monitoring, and appraising job results assigned to staff; coaching, counseling, and disciplining staff


ADVANTAGES


- Excellent base salary offering

- The opportunity to work for a fast-growing start-up

- On-site parking

- Hybrid model


QUALIFICATIONS


• CPA designated

• Big 4 audit experience is highly desired

• Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills

• Strength with MS Excel and financial modeling

• M&A experience is an asset


If this seems like a great Controller opportunity for you to consider, please apply directly and email kristina@davidson@randstad.ca & bryan.hewitt@randstad.ca with your resume!

title: Section Controller
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.

You will work under the guidance of the Finance Manager and Ops Manager to maintain finance transactions, data, systems and reporting. You will also collect data and perform detailed checks/controls.

How You Will Contribute

You will:
  • Execute aspects of finance planning and performance management process and related financial decisions potentially including Annual Contract planning/forecasting, target development, financial performance reporting/analysis, financial modeling and decision support for a focused scope within a region, business unit, country, Supply Chain, Mondelēz International Business Services or Corporate Finance team. You will also execute data collection and prepare data integrity checks
  • Contribute to a strong controls and compliance environment in your area of scope and ensure full compliance with our policies
  • Execute ad hoc analyses and projects as requested by the Finance Manager or Senior Analyst
  • Support projects to improve efficiencies and improvements to ways of working and embrace a mindset of continuous improvement
  • Contribute to a high-performing Finance team. You will also invest in personal development and the development of your Finance peers

What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:
  • TECHNICAL EXPERTISE in financial analysis and data collection/structuring
  • BUSINESS ACUMEN and relevant experience in a local or regional business
  • LEADERSHIP SKILLS including collaboration and communication skills within a Finance team. Team player with can do mentality to deliver results
  • GROWTH/DIGITAL MINDSET and the ability to execute opportunities and leverage technology to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness
  • INTEGRITY and in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values and policies and external regulations

More About This Role

What you need to know about this position:

Responsibilities include:

Build strong governance on manufacturing KPI and cost deliverables, creating transparency, awareness, driving resolution of the gaps. Drive analytical insights with plant personnel in order to prepare the variable conversion cost and specific fixed cost budget and forecasts. Ensure regular tracking of it, adherence to budget figures and reporting of deviations. Track actual performance against relevant KPI’s, production standard of the conversion process including material, Direct Variable Labour (DVL), Direct Variable Exp. (DVE) consumption. Support timely and accurate new product development and costing. Help to identify cost drivers at the site for further productivity potential savings, business partnering with R&D and BD. teams. Support productivity project savings with plant personnel and Engineering to build savings funnel to meet plant financial goals. Lead Plant Loss analysis and Gross Productivity Planning cycle. Guarantee strict compliance with relevant financial policies and procedures related to internal controls, bin counts, cycle counts, and MRO counts. Ensure all bin counts completed quarterly.

What extra ingredients you will bring:

Education / Certifications:

Undergraduate Degree In Finance, CPA Preferred.

Minimum 3 Years of Experience in Finance and Manufacturing.

Job specific requirements:

SAP Experience Preferred With Knowledge Of SAP MTI

Travel requirements:

Work schedule:

 Business Unit Summary We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

title: Controller/Contrôleur
description:
Company Overview

Founded in 2002, Longbow Advantage is a leading Supply Chain Technology Company built to provide best-in-class WMS, EWM, WM, LMS, and TMS implementation and integration services. Our team of supply chain professionals have experience and expertise that is unmatched throughout the industry. We have a 20-year track record of delivering successful logistics execution solutions and delivering on the commitments we make to customers. All of this has resulted in customer satisfaction scores that are world class.

The ideal candidate for this role will primarily be responsible for overseeing the full accounting cycle and financial reporting, ensuring the financial control environment, maintaining our ERP system, and handling regular tax filings. We are looking for someone who is passionate about technology and numbers, with the ability to prioritize tasks, to be result driven and be an outstanding team player.

This is a fulltime position based in Montreal.

What’s in it for you?
  • Be part of a growing organization that values initiative
  • Room to grow, and expand your knowledge
  • Competitive compensation based on experience
  • 4 weeks of vacation + personal and sick days
  • Healthcare Benefits (health, drugs, vision, dental)
  • Opportunity to share your knowledge and learn from the team
  • Hybrid work environment – we have brand new office in MTL!
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Diverse, inclusive and environmentally friendly work environment

As a Controller at Longbow, some of your main responsibilities will include
  • Leading the production of monthly financial statements and other reports
  • Overseeing all month end and year end closing processes
  • Acting as the main point of contact for our annual audit
  • Managing cash flow and ensuring that bank accounts are adequately funded to meet disbursement requirements
  • Working with the team to optimize our internal processes and our various tools
  • Ensuring compliance with all government, legal, tax regulatory requirements
  • Producing annual budgets, quarterly forecasts, estimates, and other reports requested
  • Assisting management with other financial and operation projects as needed

The Skills And Experience You Bring
  • Minimum 3 years of experience (open to accounting firm candidate)
  • CPA designation or late stages of the CPA program
  • Solid knowledge of the accounting standards for private enterprises (ASPE)
  • Experience with Netsuite and highly proficient in Excel
  • Experience in multi-companies, multi-currencies & multi-countries organization
  • Experience in a fast-paced environment like start-ups
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in French and English
  • Outstanding at prioritizing and results driven
  • You love technology, innovation & you are a team player
  • Ability to handle data with a high-level of confidentiality
  • Open-minded - open to thoughts and ideas which are different from your own
  • Go-getter - no task is beneath you if it means achieving the desired result.

Controleur

Survol de la compagnie

Fondée en 2002, Longbow Advantage est une société spécialisée en technologie de chaîne d'approvisionnement qui fournis des services de premiers plans de mise en œuvre et d'intégration de WMS, EWM, WM, LMS et TMS. Notre équipe de professionnels de la chaîne d'approvisionnement possède une expérience et une expertise inégalées dans l'industrie. En plus d'avoir notre propre logiciel propriétaire, Rebus©, nous avons plus 20 ans d'expérience dans l’exécution de solutions logistique et dans le respect des engagements que nous prenons envers nos clients. Tout cela a permis à Longbow Advantage d’obtenir des scores de satisfaction de sa clientèle qui lui permet de se classer parmi les meilleurs de l’industrie.

Le candidat idéal pour ce poste sera principalement chargé de superviser le cycle comptable complet de l’entreprise et la production de rapports financiers, d'assurer le maintien d’un l'environnement de contrôle optimal, de maintenir notre système ERP et de gérer nos obligations fiscales.   • Aucun travail n'est trop anodin pour vous lorsqu’il s'il s'agit d'obtenir le résultat souhaité.

title: Controller
description:
Job Description:

Modpools, North America’s only patented container pool company, is looking for a highly motivated and career-oriented Controller to join our team!


This is a permanent position based out of Abbotsford BC and you would be responsible for the Abbotsford and Texas facilities.


As our new Controller and reporting directly to the President and General Manager, you are an impact player: people-focused and detail-oriented. You enjoy problem solving and thinking outside the box, but you understand the importance of good processes and you enjoy helping build and refine them. You are committed, tenacious, curious, and conscientious but most of all, you love to win as part of a team. You have a CPA designation in good standing and a minimum of 5 years of progressive accounting experience. You have strong knowledge of accounting principles and concepts, and experience with accounting systems and internal controls.


Requirements:

· CPA designation is a must

· Experience within the Manufacturing industry is a considerable asset

· Minimum 3 years of experience in a Controller role

· Proven experience building out accounting controls/processes

· Progressive mindset with respect to using technology to manage finance

· Solid technical accounting skills, advanced in Excel knowledge

· Attention to detail and commitment to follow-up

· Experience with US taxes and requirements

· Experience in a high-growth company is a considerable asset


Role Duties:

· Full cycle accounting, ensuring all accounting deadlines are met for all entities.

· Reconciling bank accounts on a weekly basis.

· Completing monthly Balance Sheet Reconciliations including related journal entries for each legal entity.

· Building and customizing management reports.

· Inter-company accounts reconciliation and maintenance.

· Preparing monthly financial statements for the group of companies

· Assisting with A/P, invoicing and A/R

· Prepare, input GST/PST/HST and overall compliance for the group of companies.

· Cash Flow Forecast (weekly basis)

· Fixed Asset / Inventory maintenance

· Gross Margin review for business segments

· Manage the overall data migration, rules and policies set up, development and implementation of the standard processes for all user groups.

· Lead the annual budgeting process, carry out spending against budget analysis, and update monthly and rest of the year forecast.


Why you should join us:

· Coaching and professional development opportunities

· Growth and the opportunity to help build an ever-evolving brand

· Competitive Wage



Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $120,000.00-$160,000.00 per year

title: Controller
description:
Crown Private Credit Partners Inc.

Toronto, ON


Job Posting: Controller


About Crown Private Credit Partners Inc.


Crown Private Credit Partners Inc. (“CPCP”) is a leading private credit manager focused on private debt opportunities across the credit spectrum. CPCP was formed following the recent carve-out of the private credit business from Crown Capital Partners Inc. (“Crown Capital”). CPCP’s management team led Crown Capital’s private credit business since it was established by Crown Life Insurance Company in 2000. Crown’s management team has a 20-year track record in the private debt industry and has achieved a gross IRR of 14+% over this period.


Position Summary


We are seeking a qualified individual to lead the accounting and finance function within our growing private credit management business. Reporting to the Managing Director, the individual will lead all accounting and financial reporting functions spanning the investment funds and all related entities within the group structure.


As a Controller, your main responsibilities will involve:

  • All accounting functions for investment funds and corporate entities within the group
  • Prepare monthly/quarterly/annual financial statements and note disclosures for all investment funds and corporate entities within the group
  • Preparation of quarterly Form 31-103F1 (working capital form)
  • Detailed oversight of the investment accounting and operating activities prepared and performed by our external fund administrator, where applicable
  • Involvement in preparing and distributing monthly fund NAVs and supplemental information provided to LP’s
  • Involvement in capital calls and distributions
  • Calculation of the funds’ management fees and performance fees
  • Manage the timely completion of all external audits
  • Preparation and filing of all relevant tax returns, T5013 partnership returns and GST filings
  • Involvement in the tax slip cycle, ensuring all clients’ slips are free from misstatement and are distributed in a timely manner
  • Prepare quarterly investor account statements and assist in preparation of the quarterly managers reports
  • Preparation, review and circulation of responses to regulatory filings, surveys and other correspondence
  • Involvement in all fund and corporate cash management activities
  • Assist on new fund launches
  • Build up a strong understanding of the unique characteristics of our funds and become a subject matter expert within the company on technical fund-related matters
  • Build and maintain excellent working relationships with external service providers, including our fund administrator, custodian, auditor, tax advisor, external legal counsel etc.
  • Identification and documentation of key internal controls and policy


Success Factors:

  • Professional attitude and demeanour to appropriately represent the team
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate and function in a team environment
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative
  • Flexibility to adapt to a wide range of roles and responsibilities
  • Attitude of continuous learning and development to improve skills and knowledge


Your experience and qualifications will include:


  • CPA designation
  • A minimum of 7 years of industry related work experience with fund accounting and administration and/or audit experience with funds from public practice within financial services group
  • Exposure to various fund structures, specifically Mutual Fund Trusts and Limited Partnerships
