title: Controller
description:
Pro Cut Lumber Corporation is currently seeking a controller to join their team. Headquartered in Lake Cowichan, BC, Pro Cut Lumber operates primarily on the British Columbia coast. For over thirty years Pro Cut Lumber has provided full-service Forest Management Consulting and has demonstrated they have the knowledge, skill, resilience, and resourcefulness to be successful in this highly competitive industry.


This newly created position will report directly to the Chief Financial Officer and the Executive team. The Controller will play a key role within the organization, providing operational controls, administrative and reporting procedures, as well as maintaining and creating systems to effectively grow the organization and ensure its financial strength. The Controller will also be responsible for the development and implementation of financial planning processes and efficiency models, as required. The ideal candidate will be organized, adaptable and efficient, experienced with cost accounting, and possess an understanding of the logging industry. You enjoy problem solving and thinking outside the box, while at the same time understanding the importance of good processes and systems. This is an outstanding opportunity and as the new Controller you are an impact player: people focused and detail oriented.


Responsibilities:

  • Leads the day-to-day accounting function
  • Evaluates operational performance
  • Ensures sufficient and appropriate financing
  • Plans, implements, and manages all financial related processes
  • Prepares budgets and forecasts, calculates variances, and develops action plans
  • Provides timely, accurate and complete reports on the operating condition of the organization
  • Reports proactively on budget, performance variances, developing trends and makes recommendations
  • Minimizes financial risk and stewards’ assets with operational requirements
  • Analyses and advises on revenue, expenses, balance sheet and investments
  • Enhances and documents business processes and accounting policies
  • Educates and assists others in a non-finance role
  • Fosters a client driven and can-do environment
  • Motivates, inspires, and instills confidence
  • Supervises an accounting team of three


Skills & Qualifications:

  • Post-secondary education with a professional accounting designation (CPA)
  • Three years’ experience in a finance, business management or operations management role
  • A background in forestry, mills, logging, construction or similar environment is an asset
  • A results oriented, self-motivated, disciplined, and proactive individual who gets things done
  • Ability to balance strategy with a hands-on approach to deliver key initiatives
  • Desire to work collaboratively with all levels of employees
  • Excellent follow up and tracking skills
  • Demonstrated success in developing relationships both internal and external
  • Above average communication and people skills
  • Possesses a sense of humor, with the ability to create an environment of trust and inclusion


This career opportunity will appeal to an individual who is tenacious, curious and conscientious, but most of all, you love to win as part of a team. If you are searching for an entrepreneurial environment where you can contribute, be part of the growth and share in the rewards, you will want to check out this opportunity.

title: Controller
description:
Pinnacle is an industrial wood pellet manufacturer and distributor and the third largest producer in the world with close to $500 million in revenue and over 500 employees. The Company produces sustainable fuel for renewable electricity generation in the form of industrial wood pellets. This fuel is used by large-scale thermal power generators as a greener alternative to produce reliable baseload renewable power. Pinnacle is a trusted supplier to its customers, who require reliable, high-quality fuel supply to maximize utilization of their facilities. Pinnacle takes pride in its industry-leading safety practices.


Pinnacle was acquired by British energy company Drax Group plc in April 2021. This was a major acquisition for Drax and expands their North American presence, providing a foundation for further growth. The acquisition makes Drax the world’s leading sustainable bioenergy generation and supply business.


To support the company’s forecasted growth and lead the financial integration into the Drax organization the company has launched a search to recruit a Controller who, reporting to the Director, Finance, will oversee a team responsible for financial accounting, financial statement preparation, cash management, and payroll. With a focus on change management, the Controller will be given the mandate to drive process, system and policy improvement. Automating and streamlining processes that drive efficiency, accuracy and timely reporting will be a key focus. Building an engaged finance team that interfaces with the business and is considered best in class is the strategic objective.


The ideal candidate is a CPA whose career encompasses time in a ‘big four’ accounting firm combined with a track record of success as an Assistant Controller, Accounting Manager or Controller responsible for monthly and annual financial reporting, cash management, payroll, internal controls and process and systems improvement in a complex operating business. They have a reputation for being a change agent who delivers sustainable process improvement. They are a strong communicator, engaged leader and team player who is willing to support their team and roll up their sleeves to get things done.


To explore this opportunity further, please click Apply.


We thank all applicants for their interest in this position. Please note that we will only be in contact with those individuals moving forward with our client.

title: Controller - Contrôleur
description:
English Below...


PIP Canada, qui fait partie d'une organisation mondiale dont le siège social canadien est situé à Laval (Québec), est un important fournisseur de protection des mains et d'équipement de protection individuelle (EPI) pour les marchés industriels et de la construction. PIP® est l'acronyme de Protective Industrial Products, ce qui signifie que nous sommes engagés à aider à protéger les travailleurs essentiels chaque jour. Aujourd'hui, en tant qu'entreprise mondiale d'EPI dont le chiffre d'affaires s'élève à un milliard de dollars, nous sommes dans une position unique qui nous permet d'offrir à nos employés de nombreuses possibilités de mener une carrière diversifiée et enrichissante, tout en sachant que nos produits d'EPI contribuent à protéger les travailleurs contre les blessures.

 

C'est dans cette optique et cette vision que nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un contrôleur qui travaillera à partir de notre siège social canadien à Laval, au Québec. Le contrôleur tient à jour et contrôle le grand livre et est responsable de l'enregistrement exact des transactions conformément aux politiques locales et à celles de l'entreprise. Ce rôle comprendra un travail d’analyse et une revue approfondie des données financières.

 

Sous la direction du vice-président Finances pour le Canada, ce poste clé du service de comptabilité supervise les activités du service en mettant l'accent sur la production des états financiers et de rapports dans les temps voulus. Le contrôleur supervise et fait la revue des activités des membres de l'équipe qui sont responsables de l'enregistrement des transactions quotidiennes.

 

Responsabilités:

−     Diriger les opérations comptables quotidiennes de PIP Canada Ltée sous la direction du VP Finances de PIP Canada Ltée;

−     Gérer tous les aspects du processus de fin de mois dans le respect des délais de l'entreprise, incluant la production d'états financiers, divers calendriers de rapports et l'analyse d'informations provenant de plusieurs sources de données;

−     S'assurer que les résultats communiqués soient conformes aux NCECF et aux politiques de l'entreprise;

−     Préparer certaines écritures de journal et passer en revue les écritures de journal des membres de l'équipe;

−     Passer en revue et tenir à jour les rapprochements des comptes de bilan;

−     Vérifier l'exactitude des transactions du grand livre, des comptes créditeurs et de la paie;

−     S'assurer que les transactions soient comptabilisées, documentées, revues et appuyées conformément aux politiques comptables de l'entreprise;

−     S'assurer que des contrôles financiers internes adéquats soient implémentés et suivis;

−     Tenir à jour les comptes du grand livre, y compris l'analyse des principaux comptes de régularisation, de prépaiements (et l'amortissement adéquat) et autres comptes importants;

−     Gérer le plan comptable dans le logiciel local de planification des ressources de l'entreprise (ERP) et assurer la coordination avec le service de planification et analyse financières (FP&A), le cas échéant;

−     Contribuer aux prévisions et à la préparation du budget annuel.

−     Responsable de l'audit annuel et de la préparation du rapport financier annuel: travailler avec les auditeurs externes lors des audits de fin d'année;

−     Fournir des analyses des résultats réels par rapport au budget et travailler en étroite collaboration avec les chefs de service pour répondre aux questions et connaître les dépenses de leur service;

−     Élaborer et implémenter des systèmes efficaces de collecte, d'analyse, de vérification et de communication des données financières de façon plus efficiente;

−     Observer les procédures et les processus comptables et fournir des recommandations au vice-président Finances concernant les améliorations et les efficiences opérationnelles;

−     Implémenter des procédures comptables, des politiques financières et des processus d'amélioration continue;

−     Diriger l'attribution des tâches et des responsabilités quotidiennes et aider le vice-président Finances sur d'autres aspects liés à l'équipe;

−     Gérer et encadrer les membres plus débutants de l'équipe pour assurer une croissance adéquate;

−     Gérer des projets ad hoc au besoin.

 

Expérience et exigences:

−     Baccalauréat en comptabilité ou en finance;

−     Minimum de 7 ans d'expérience progressive en comptabilité, dont une partie importante dans un rôle de supervision. Une expérience dans une organisation internationale serait un atout;

−     Le bilinguisme est essentiel;

−     Excellentes habiletés de communication verbale et écrite et capacité à travailler à tous les niveaux d'une organisation;

−     Solides habiletés de leadership et détermination à diriger et à obtenir des résultats;

−     Valoriser et maintenir la confidentialité;

−     Flexibilité et capacité à s'adapter à l'évolution des besoins de l'entreprise dans un environnement où les délais sont serrés;

−     Habiletés approfondies en Microsoft Excel. Expérience avec d'autres systèmes financiers.


//ENG//


PIP Canada, part of a global organization with its Canadian head office located in Laval, QC is a leading provider of hand protection and personal protective equipment (PPE) to Industrial and Construction markets. PIP® stands for Protective Industrial Products meaning we are committed to helping protect essential workers every day. Today, as a $1 billion global PPE company, we are in a unique position to offer employees ample opportunities for a diverse and rewarding career while knowing that our PPE products help keep workers safe from injury.

 

It is with this view and vision that we are currently seeking a Controller, working out of our Canadian Headquarters in Laval, QC. The Controller maintains and controls the General Ledger and is responsible for the accurate recording of business transactions in accordance with both local and corporate policies. This role will include analytical work and a thorough review of financial records.

 

Taking direction from the VP Finance for Canada, this key position in the Accounting Department oversees the department’s functions with a focus on ensuring the timely and accurate delivery of financial statements and reporting. The hands-on Controller oversees / reviews activities of team members who are responsible for recording of day-to-day transactions.

 

Responsibilities:

−     Lead the day-to-day accounting operations of PIP Canada Ltd. and report up to the PIP Canada Ltd. VP Finance.

−     Manage all aspects of the month-end close process in adherence with corporate timelines, including production of financial statements, various reporting schedules, and analyzing information from several data sources.

−     Ensure that reported results comply with ASPE and corporate policies.

−     Prepare certain journal entries, as well as review team member journal entries.

−     Review and maintain balance sheet account reconciliations.

−     Review general ledger, accounts payable, and payroll transactions for accuracy.

−     Ensure transactions are recorded, documented, reviewed, and supported in accordance with corporate accounting policies.

−     Ensure that proper internal financial controls are implemented and followed.

−     Maintain general ledger accounts, including analysis of key accruals, prepaids (and appropriate amortization), other significant accounts.

−     Manage chart of accounts in local ERP and coordinate with FP&A, as applicable.

−     Assist with forecasting and preparation of the annual budget.

−     Responsible for annual audit and with preparing annual financial report; work with external auditors during year-end audits.

−     Provide actual to budget analysis and work closely with department heads to answer questions and be knowledgeable about their department spend.

−     Develop and implement effective systems for collecting, analyzing, verifying, and reporting financial information more efficiently.

−     Observe accounting processes and procedures, and provide recommendations to VP Finance regarding operational improvements and efficiencies.

−     Implement accounting procedures, financial policies, and continuous improvement.

−     Lead assignment of day-to-day tasks and responsibilities and assist VP Finance with other team related matters.

−     Manage and mentor more junior team members to ensure appropriate growth.

−     Handle ad-hoc projects as needed.

 

Experience and requirements:

−     Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance.

−     7+ years of progressive accounting experience with a significant portion of it being in a supervisory role. Experience in a global organization a plus.

−     Bilingual is a must.

−     Excellent verbal and written communication with ability to work across all levels of an organization.

−     Strong leadership skills with a dedication to driving and achieving results.

−     Values and maintains confidentiality.

−     Flexible and able to adjust to evolving business-needs in a deadline-driven environment.

−     Advanced Microsoft Excel skills. Experience with other financial systems.

title: Section controller
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.

You will perform detailed finance work, transactions and data structuring under the guidance of the Finance Manager. You will collect data, be responsible for maintaining information integrity, monitor reconciliations and conduct basic checks and controls.

How You Will Contribute

You will:
  • Execute aspects of finance planning and performance management process and related financial decisions potentially including Annual Contract planning/forecasting, target development, financial performance reporting/analysis, financial modeling and decision support for a focused scope within a region, business unit, country, Supply Chain, Mondelēz International Business Services or Corporate Finance team. You will also execute data collection and data integrity checks
  • Contribute to a strong controls and compliance environment in area of scope and ensure full compliance with our policies
  • Execute ad hoc analyses and projects as requested by the Senior Finance Manager (or Director)
  • Support projects to improve efficiencies and improvements to ways of working and embrace a mindset of continuous improvement
  • Contribute to a high-performing Finance team. You will also invest in personal development and the development of your Finance peers

What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:
  • TECHNICAL EXPERTISE in financial analysis and data collection/structuring
  • BUSINESS ACUMEN and a basic understanding of our business, consumer packaged goods industry, and local snacking market. Relevant experience in a regional (or sizeable local) business
  • LEADERSHIP SKILLS including collaboration and communication skills within a larger Finance team. Team player with can do mentality to deliver results
  • GROWTH/DIGITAL MINDSET and the ability to execute opportunities and leverage technology to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness
  • INTEGRITY and sound judgement in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values and policies and external regulations

More About This Role

ducation / Certifications:

Undergraduate Degree In Finance, CPA Preferred.

Minimum 3 Years of Experience in Finance and Manufacturing.

Job specific requirements:

SAP Experience Preferred With Knowledge Of SAP MTI

Work schedule: Monday to Friday

No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

title: Controller
description:
Employment Opportunity: Controller

Status: Full-time

Do you want to work in an innovative and fast paced environment?

Do you aspire and have the initiative to grow with a company and achieve career success?

Are you a self-motivated individual with a can-do attitude?

If you answered YES to all the above, we want YOU!

Preciseley Microtechnology Corporation is immediately hiring a full-time Controller to join our growing team in Burnaby, BC.

What We Offer

  • Competitive compensation with annual bonuses
  • Company matched RRSP contributions
  • Stock options plans
  • Relocation assistance within Canada
  • Comprehensive extended health benefits
  • Flexible work environment
  • Work with an inclusive supportive team environment
  • Training and development opportunities in a growing company
  • Reporting directly to the VP Finance, the successful induvial will be responsible for all day to day accounting including payroll. This will include building processes, policy and systems.

Responsibilities

  • Perform and manage day to day accounting including payroll, accounts payable and accounts receivable. This position will be hands on with regular accounting activity
  • General cash management
  • Month end process and creating financial reports for management and board
  • Develop, improve, implement and document accounting policies and processes
  • Year end audit preparation and management.
  • Research and implement technology to improve and automate processes.
  • Assist with management of IT systems. Be the point person with the Managed Services Partner
  • Be responsible for tracking, monitoring, analyzing, and reporting on key performance indicators.
  • Maintain any procurement, contract, and other records.
  • Be responsible for managing and maintaining all sales data using the Hubspot.
  • Prepare business review presentations, reports and KPIs on a monthly and quarterly basis.
  • Develop, update and maintain sales policies and procedures.

Qualifications

  • CPA designation or relevant experience.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite programs including advanced Excel skills.
  • A strong understanding of ERP and apps used to optimize processes.
  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to work fast and accurately.
  • Strong technical accounting knowledge.
  • A strong sense of problem-solving proven experience in developing efficient solutions.
  • A result and success-oriented mentality, conveying a sense of urgency and driving issues to closure.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to develop lasting relationships with people.
  • An ability to utilize resources to improve upon inefficiencies.
  • Comfortable with handling multiple demands, shifting priorities, adjusting to adhoc requests, working with ambiguous situations, and adapting to rapid change.

About Us

Founded in 2006, Preciseley Microtechnology Corporation is a rapidly growing leader in providing optical MEMS solutions globally through designing and supplying a range of products, including mirror devices used for laser beam steering, switching, and manipulation, with diverse applications across optical systems, telecommunications, sensors, and other fields.

COVID-19

Our company is committed to taking every reasonable precaution to protect the health and safety of our people, volunteers, communities, and clients from the spread of adverse health consequences of COVID-19. With this commitment in mind, we comply with all public health mandates (locally, provincially and/or federally, as applicable) and have implemented various safety measures in accordance.

Preciseley Microtechnology Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified and aspired individuals. We thank you for your interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Controller
description:
Job Description

Who We Are:

Founded in 2003, Multivista , part of Hexagon AB, is a leading information technology company that has been contracted on over 2 billion square feet of construction projects worldwide. We are trusted by the industry’s leading companies to leverage ground breaking documentation technology in order to mitigate risk, create efficiencies, and deliver a higher level of project insight throughout a building’s lifecycle.

Multivista offers a full suite of visual construction documentation services on an intuitive cloud-based website platform with local boots-on-the-ground support in 67 international markets through its franchisees. Along with UAV, streaming webcams, professional facility management videos, and virtual walkthroughs, we deliver interactive as-builts by linking inspection-grade photos to architectural plans to capture every project with exceptional clarity.

Summary

Reporting to VP of Finance, the Financial Controller will play an essential role in leading the core accounting functions to provide the business with timely, accurate and relevant information. We are looking for a dynamic individual who will motivate and support the team. This is a full-time position in our energetic and vibrant accounting team.

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Oversees all finance functions including AR, AP, Payroll, Financial Reporting and Analysis
  • Lead and mentor a team of 6
  • Lead month end close process and complete financial report timely and accurately
  • Compliant with parent company reporting requirements
  • Manage cashflow and FX trading
  • Coordinate & review all Federal, Provincial and State tax filings
  • Improve and implement the financial policies, systems and processes
  • Lead and complete year end audit
  • Assist with ad-hoc inquiries
What We Provide
  • Competitive remuneration based on experience
  • Group benefits including Health & Dental
  • Generous Personal Time Off policy
  • Positive work-life balance environment
Desired Skills

Qualifications
  • CPA, (CA/CMA/CGA) or equivalent
  • A minimum of 3+ years in a Controller/Finance manager role in medium size company
  • Proven experience in high growth multi-entity multi-currency environment
  • Solid leadership in leading and mentoring a team and helping them to succeed in their career
  • Knowledge and experience in IFRS and US GAAP
  • Self-motivated, accountable and people oriented
Job Family

Finance and Controlling

City

Vancouver, BC

title: Controller
description:
At Think Shift, we believe in building jobs around people. Our talented team of multi-disciplined creators and strategists have one thing in common: the desire to realize their potential and to help other team members grow as well. We help our clients do the same.

As one of the largest ag-focused agencies in North America, we help agriculture and agri-food organizations imagine their future — then re-invent themselves accordingly. Our people have a head for logic and a heart for magic, and our clients engage us to help them think strategically and craft the stories that will propel them forward. Through our progressive approach to leadership development, strategic planning, corporate culture, brand development and marketing, we help ag leaders see their true potential and leverage change to bring their traditional brands into the new world.

We’re looking for creative and strategic minds who share our desire to find and realize potential — for ourselves and for our clients. Let’s get in touch.

Summary

The Controller is a senior member of the shared services team who works very closely with senior leadership and our accounts team ensuring the company’s finance function is organized, effective, and efficient. They organize, produce, and communicate a detailed record of the company’s operations. The Controller oversees and organizes the system that produces timely and accurate financial reporting and forecasting.

Reports To: CEO

Direct Reports: Accounting Coordinators & Financial Specialist

We are Looking for:
  • A person looking to grow into a C-suite role.
  • Post-Secondary Degree and Accounting Designation
  • 7 + years' experience in a workplace setting, with preference for experience in a job cost setting.
  • Experience in multi entity and multi-currency accounting.
  • Thorough understanding of financial statement preparation and analysis.
  • Thorough understanding accounting processes and procedures
  • Advanced MS Excel skills
  • Developing ability in presentations including use of associated applications including business reporting and data management, and presentation software
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Well-developed communication skills
  • Highly organized with strong attention to detail
  • Ability and desire to manage and grow a team
  • Understanding of and ability to manage and oversee data in a multi-application ERP environment.

You get to:
  • Oversee organizational accounting and reporting
  • Communicate and collaborate regularly with the senior leadership team.
  • Create quarterly Board reports and lead financial presentations to the board.
  • Lead relationships with banks, auditors, tax advisors and authorities
  • Be a critical part of a highly functioning team charged with building a growing and successful marketing agency.

Benefits

Think Shift provides an attractive, market-researched comprehensive compensation plan, which includes base salary and company bonus. Employees enjoy a range of benefits, some of which include:
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits coverage
  • Semi-annual bonuses (based on Company performance)
  • Flexible work arrangements (work from anywhere)
  • Year-round opportunities for internal and external training and development programs

Think Shift is transitioning to a remote-only work environment on August 1, 2022.

Please note accepted applicants must provide satisfactory proof of vaccination at the time of offer. Lack of documentation will result in the withdrawal of the application.

title: Accounting Manager/Supervisor
description:
Description

An exciting opportunity exists to join a dynamic small public practice firm with a staff complement of ten amazing people. The company offers either an in-office setting from one of two Lower Mainland office locations, a Hybrid work model, or Work from home. Work / Life balance is advocated by this exciting emerging group. The team does not audit and focuses entirely on personal and small to medium-sized clients with a keen interest in emerging new companies.

The Company Offers The Following
  • A wide range of clients – engaging industries and complexities
  • Ability to work at either of our two locations – Ladner & South Vancouver (Marpole)
  • Flexible and relaxed work environment
  • Competitive salary, benefits, sick days, flex days, paid professional development
  • Team building activities & events
  • Growth – this is a position that will grow and evolve over time
Requirements

The position of Manager requires the following:
  • Manage and review notice to reader financial statements and tax engagements.
  • Deliver completed product to the Partner on a timely basis.
  • Plan and complete routine and complex Notice to Reader financial statements – including related corporate tax returns, working papers, and communication with clients.
  • Plan and complete routine and complex Review engagements – including preparation of related corporate tax returns, working papers, communication with clients, and supervising junior staff.
  • Preparation of personal, trust and GST returns, year-end tax forms (T4 & T5) and resolve accounting and tax issues in client documents and working papers.
  • Supervise and mentor junior staff.
The Ideal Candidate Requires The Following
  • CPA designation.
  • Minimum 5 years in public accounting.
  • Demonstrate a focus on detail, thoroughness, and accuracy.
  • Demonstrate the ability to prepare their own files while assisting with the review of junior staff files.
  • Ability to see the big picture, develop efficiencies in files while supervising and training junior staff.
  • Proficiency in MS Office, Caseware, Sage 50, Quickbooks, and TaxPrep.
  • Excellent communication, both verbal and written with common sense and solid judgment when dealing with coworkers, clients, and government offices.
If this opportunity holds any appeal, be sure to apply to our posting for immediate contact and further discussion!

title: Accounting Manager - Bramalea City Centre
description:
Job Description

PURPOSE

The Manager, Accounting is accountable to the Controller for overseeing performance of a variety of accounting functions for an assigned portfolio ensuring the integrity of all financial information is recorded in strict compliance with corporate policies and procedures and existing internal controls.

Duties And Responsibilities
  • General Accounting Responsible for and is personally involved in the day-to-day accounting activities, including analyzing records, preparing financial statements and liaising with various departments, peers, service providers and executives, to ensure the integrity of all information recorded and accurate reflection of the financial state of a given portfolio .
  • Reconciliations Oversees the preparation and approves monthly/quarterly accounting, compliance and vendor/tenant reconciliations and ensures closure of any steps required to resolve. As assigned, prepares and/or reviews calculations for recovery of operating costs from tenants, including interpreting the financial aspects of lease clauses relating to recovery of costs .
  • Continuous Improvement Reviews, contributes to the development and implementation of company-wide policies and procedures within the accounting team and across functional lines , in order to improve efficiency as well as recommend any necessary changes to reflect changing business process or external accounting practices and regulations environment .
  • Stakeholder Relationships Effectively communicates and develops relationships with various internal/external functions to ensure timely submission of information in accordance with various business processes and to provide responsive and high- quality service, advice and assistance to internal client groups, while providing support when complex accounting issues arise .
  • Budgeting and Reforecasting Communicates and oversees the annual budgeting/quarterly forecasting plan and year-end timelines to the accounting team , while coordinating and planning schedules to ensure a timely close and proper review/sign off of statements .
  • Accounting Reporting Processes Oversees the accounting reporting process and provides insight into discrepancies and variances to ensure the integrity of reports, while also working with the Information Technology group to enhance current report formats or create new reports in order to better meet the needs of end user groups .

title: Manager, Assurance and Accounting
description:
This bilingual opportunity is also available on MNP’s Postes avec expérience job board in French. Please submit one application only to be considered for this opportunity. Thank you.

Inspirational, innovative and entrepreneurial - this is how we describe our empowered teams. Combine your passion with purpose and join a culture that is thriving in the face of change.

Make an impact with our Assurance & Accounting team as a Manager. This diverse team of professionals are dedicated to exceeding clients’ unique needs within a rapidly evolving business and financial reporting landscape. As a trusted advisor, you’ll provide comprehensive, tailored financial information that enables clients to make informed decisions with confidence.

MNP is proudly Canadian. Providing business strategies and solutions, we are a leading national accounting, tax and business advisory firm in Canada. Entrepreneurial to our core, our talented team members transcend obstacles into opportunities and are successfully transforming mid-market business practices.

Responsibilities
  • Manage a portfolio of compilation engagements and deliver high-quality financial statements and corporate tax returns. Ensure clients’ needs are met and that relationships and accounts grow and develop
  • Manage a list of (T3) Trust returns and T4/T5 season for the team
  • Review of personal tax returns during tax season
  • Accountable for engagement planning and scheduling
  • Maintain quality control and apply specialized knowledge to anticipate, identify and address issues relevant to the client’s business, financial entries and reports
  • Contribute to strategic and operational planning related to client and practice management, as well as the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes
  • Mentor, motivate and coach team members towards professional and personal development by setting clear expectations, providing feedback and conducting performance reviews

Skills And Experience
  • CPA designation
  • 4 to 6 years of relevant public accounting experience
  • Strong understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles
  • Proven people management, relationship building and leadership skills

MyRewards@MNP

More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Reports to:

Director, Property Accounting



Summary:

The Accounting Manager will maintain departmental controls and accounting policies and procedures. The Accounting Manager will be directly responsible for the mentorship of the reporting Project Accountants. Leadership, accountability and responsibility are three critical assets to the position.



Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team with approximately 2 direct reports
  • Review the preparation and reporting of financial results including cash flow reporting and distribution before they are submitted to clients
  • Implement departmental policy and procedure regarding all direct reporting project accounting staff
  • Review and maintain internal controls
  • Involved in review process of EFT transmissions
  • Knowledge of GST regulations and requirements to provide support in reporting and audit coordination
  • Coordinate and maintain operating cost reconciliation process and schedule in coordination with Budget Manager
  • Liaise with clients and client representatives
  • Encourage positive working relationship with Real Estate and Administration departments
  • Coordinate external audits as required by tenants for recovery purposes, clients for property books



Qualifications and Competencies:

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting/commerce or related field required;
  • Accounting designation or working towards a designation an asset;
  • 3+ years of experience in property accounting;
  • Supervisory experience is considered an asset
  • Relationship Skills - Ability to communicate effectively, both oral and written in English and French (an asset); ability to develop and sustain cooperative working relationships; team player;
  • Organizational/Multi-Task Skills - Ability to allocate time effectively, work under pressure and manage tight deadlines; ability to handle multiple demands, competing priorities, ability to work at a detailed level; willingness to learn in a dynamic environment that includes new ideas and change;
  • Computer Skills – intermediate to advanced skills in Excel, Word, and other Microsoft Office programs; knowledge of MRI or Yardi an asset.



Canderel is an equal opportunity employer. We believe a diverse and inclusive workforce drives innovation and makes our company stronger. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants to join our team as we continue to grow and build a strong and varied workforce reflective of today’s diverse world. title: Manager, Audit - Quality Control and Accounting Standards
description:
Manager, Audit ( Quality Control and Accounting Standards )

Richter is one of Canada's largest independent accounting, business advisory and consulting firms. Innovation is the key to our approach, combined with the ability to generate results quickly. Richter offers a full range of advisory and consulting services, supported by in-depth industry knowledge and national and international experience.

Dedicated to the success of our clients, our people, and our community, we foster a strong sense of family that has been a part of our DNA for more than 90 years. We value our team, work together, and challenge the status quo; we work with people who aspire to create a better world.

It’s Your Talent, Make it Count!

Professional Practice Group (PPG)

The team that forms the Professional Practice Group (PPG) is made of professional accountants who have strong technical skills and several years of practical experience. The objective of the Professional Practice is to ensure the quality of the services rendered in assurance by the firm in terms of ethics, independence, training, methodology and financial reporting. To do this, PPG has developed a unique approach to provide our professionals with high-level training and support in the application of our audit methodology. PPG is also involved in all matters relating to ethics and independence.

Furthermore, PPG through its Financial Reporting Advisory Services group, directly assists clients and professionals dealing with complex accounting issues (e.g. business combinations, hedge relationships, variable interest entities) and with audit questions relating to clients in particular, the conversion from GAAP to IFRS or the financial reporting obligations of public companies.

The Professional Practice group also manages all aspects of professional staff training and is responsible for developing the firm's audit methodology, as well as training, implementation, and monitoring.

A day in the life of a Manager, Audit (PPG)
  • Participate in internal consulting services (organize them, direct them and carry out research) to determine the appropriate accounting treatment for certain transactions, in accordance with various GAAP, including ASPE, IFRS and US GAAP;
  • Assist in the provision of financial reporting advisory services to assist non-assurance clients in accounting for particular complex transactions (for example, convertible debentures, business combinations, depreciation etc.);
  • Monitor the activities of all accounting standard-setting bodies (ie. FASB, SEC, AICPA, EITF, IASB, CPA Canada etc.) and evaluate the impacts of any change in the firm's clientele;
  • Participate in the development, implementation and support of the audit strategy;
  • Perform the quality control review of financial statements;
  • Assist in the preparation and facilitation of various training and courses on GAAP updates to professionals and partners of the firm;
  • Provide support in the resolution of complex accounting problems;
  • Participate in the development of sectoral guidelines on accounting and auditing.

What we are looking for:
  • CPA auditor designation;
  • Minimum of four years of relevant work experience as an auditor (including at least two years in professional practice and/or quality control);
  • Great facility for written and verbal communications in French and English
  • Strong technical knowledge of ASPE and IFRS (US GAAP, an asset);
  • In-depth knowledge of auditing and accounting;
  • Ability to train various professionals and partners (ability to verbalize the information and facilitate workshops);
  • Excellent analytical skills;
  • Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize and complete tasks in a timely manner;
  • Team spirit;
  • Willingness to offer high quality services to internal and external clients;
  • Ability to adapt to various work environments.

What Richter offers you?

Our Montreal office is conveniently located on McGill College. We have regular volunteer opportunities and a variety of team social events. Learning is encouraged, and courses are reimbursed for our team members.

A competitive compensation package, insurance benefits, a retirement savings plan, an employee and family assistance program, a health and well-being program, as well as professional development are also offered. To accommodate your personal and family obligations, a variety of work arrangements are available which may include a flexible schedule and working remotely.

title: Accounting Manager, Canada
description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?

At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

Our Finance and Accounting teams build the financial infrastructure to scale our growing company. We combine analytical and strategic thinking to develop a sound financial future for our global brand. We work closely with teams across the company, international subsidiaries, as well as with external partners to ensure a world-class finance organization. Our team contains experts from fields like tax, treasury, purchasing, FP&A, and more.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a senior finance professional to join our growing International Controllership team as Accounting Manager for Canada. This role is to be based in Montreal and will support Epic’s significant growth aspirations within both Canada and Internationally.

You will work alongside existing members of the International Finance team and partner with them and others within Epic to integrate Epic’s Canadian subsidiaries, acquisitions and investments into Epic. This will include defining and building robust financial reporting processes to enable the complete and accurate financial reporting for the US Group and EMEA sub-groups.

This role will enable Epic to continue to grow its finance and accounting presence within a key International market. The role will report into Epic’s International finance team (based in Switzerland and the UK) but will work closely with senior leadership within the wider Epic Group, such as Corporate Tax, FP&A, HR and Legal.

The role will take responsibility for building best in class reporting and control structures to ensure that Epic’s financial and operational performance is optimized, scalable and clearly communicated on a timely and accurate basis.

In This Role You Will
  • Be responsible for the management of the financial accounting and reporting for all of Epic’s Canadian subsidiaries and equity investments, including building the foundations for future finance team growth in Canada.
  • Ensuring the swift and accurate reporting of month end reporting, oversea subsidiary month-end closing processes and ensuring policy compliance.
  • Assist with ad-hoc requests from management, auditors and other external bodies (as required).
  • Provide input into and local ownership of complex accounting topics, as they arise (such as Leases).
  • Design, implement and operate key business process controls to ensure that the company has an effective and scalable internal controls framework.
  • Have a continuous focus on process and control improvements that are required, and the ability to communicate these to Management.
  • Build cross-functional working relationships within the company and externally, and provide technical guidance, training, and support to the Finance, Legal and Business Development teams.
  • Own the relationship with the external auditors to ensure that both group and statutory filing obligations are met.
  • Partner with the existing Canadian leadership teams, operations and out-sourced accounting staff to ensure that there is a strong holistic view of accounting and finances, and that finances are managed, controlled and presented in a way that is representative of business operations.
  • Partner with operational leaders to understand the various capital projects that are ongoing within Canada, including status, accounting considerations, budgetary oversight and tracking, and implementation of capital project controls and processes.
  • Partner with cross functional teams to implement a new ERP (Workday) with regional customization and support change management to associated front end processes.
  • Analyze financial information and summarize financial status in order to have an overall, holistic view of the businesses finances.
  • Regularly report and present to both International and US management about the overall finances of the Canadian subsidiaries and equity investments.
  • Represent Epic’s controllership function in the implementation of a flexible and suitable scaled internal control environment that is robust and stands up to external audit.
  • Direct internal and external audits to ensure compliance, including risk assessments and reviews of risk areas
  • Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls and ensure alignment with Epic group policies.
  • Ensuring Canadian territory specific regulatory compliance from a finance perspective.

What We're Looking For
  • Fluent in both French and English.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Accounting, or related field.
  • Chartered Accountancy qualification or equivalent (preferred but not required).
  • Already residing in Canada or a right to work in Canada.
  • 5+ years financial accounting experience, preferably within both an International and Canadian business and accounting environment.
  • Ability and willingness to “roll up their sleeves” to achieve Controllership activities, whilst having team management experience.
  • Knowledge of international transfer pricing principles and “cost plus” recharging.
  • Good knowledge of both US GAAP and Canadian GAAP, including a deep knowledge and understanding of Canadian tax and legal financial reporting obligations.
  • Experience of dealing with External Auditor requests.
  • Strong communications, presentation, and interpersonal skills, including the ability to summarize key accounting and operational issues to management.
  • Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel (complex formula, VBA, macros and pivot tables) and proficient with other Microsoft Office applications.
  • Experience of working in different ERP systems and system migrations.
  • Knowledge of international digital sales taxes and transfer pricing requirements..
  • Complex analytic problem solving and project management skills.
  • Independent and self-starter with a “can-do” attitude.
  • Someone who is user-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative.

About Us

Epic Games spans across 12 countries with 32 studios and 3,000+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

title: Complex Accounting Manager
description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?

At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

Our Finance and Accounting teams build the financial infrastructure to scale our growing company. We combine analytical and strategic thinking to develop a sound financial future for our global brand. We work closely with teams across the company, international subsidiaries, as well as with external partners to ensure a world-class finance organization. Our team contains experts from fields like tax, treasury, purchasing, FP&A, and more.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a senior finance professional to join our growing International Controllership team as Accounting Manager for Canada. This role is to be based in Montreal and will support Epic’s significant growth aspirations within both Canada and Internationally.

You will work alongside existing members of the International Finance team and partner with them and others within Epic to integrate Epic’s Canadian subsidiaries, acquisitions and investments into Epic. This will include defining and building robust financial reporting processes to enable the complete and accurate financial reporting for the US Group and EMEA sub-groups.

This role will enable Epic to continue to grow its finance and accounting presence within a key International market. The role will report into Epic’s International finance team (based in Switzerland and the UK) but will work closely with senior leadership within the wider Epic Group, such as Corporate Tax, FP&A, HR and Legal.

The role will take responsibility for building best in class reporting and control structures to ensure that Epic’s financial and operational performance is optimized, scalable and clearly communicated on a timely and accurate basis.

In This Role You Will
  • Be responsible for the management of the financial accounting and reporting for all of Epic’s Canadian subsidiaries and equity investments, including building the foundations for future finance team growth in Canada.
  • Ensuring the swift and accurate reporting of month end reporting, oversea subsidiary month-end closing processes and ensuring policy compliance.
  • Assist with ad-hoc requests from management, auditors and other external bodies (as required).
  • Provide input into and local ownership of complex accounting topics, as they arise (such as Leases).
  • Design, implement and operate key business process controls to ensure that the company has an effective and scalable internal controls framework.
  • Have a continuous focus on process and control improvements that are required, and the ability to communicate these to Management.
  • Build cross-functional working relationships within the company and externally, and provide technical guidance, training, and support to the Finance, Legal and Business Development teams.
  • Own the relationship with the external auditors to ensure that both group and statutory filing obligations are met.
  • Partner with the existing Canadian leadership teams, operations and out-sourced accounting staff to ensure that there is a strong holistic view of accounting and finances, and that finances are managed, controlled and presented in a way that is representative of business operations.
  • Partner with operational leaders to understand the various capital projects that are ongoing within Canada, including status, accounting considerations, budgetary oversight and tracking, and implementation of capital project controls and processes.
  • Partner with cross functional teams to implement a new ERP (Workday) with regional customization and support change management to associated front end processes.
  • Analyze financial information and summarize financial status in order to have an overall, holistic view of the businesses finances.
  • Regularly report and present to both International and US management about the overall finances of the Canadian subsidiaries and equity investments.
  • Represent Epic’s controllership function in the implementation of a flexible and suitable scaled internal control environment that is robust and stands up to external audit.
  • Direct internal and external audits to ensure compliance, including risk assessments and reviews of risk areas
  • Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls and ensure alignment with Epic group policies.
  • Ensuring Canadian territory specific regulatory compliance from a finance perspective.

What We're Looking For
  • Fluent in both French and English.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Accounting, or related field.
  • Chartered Accountancy qualification or equivalent (preferred but not required).
  • Already residing in Canada or a right to work in Canada.
  • 5+ years financial accounting experience, preferably within both an International and Canadian business and accounting environment.
  • Ability and willingness to “roll up their sleeves” to achieve Controllership activities, whilst having team management experience.
  • Knowledge of international transfer pricing principles and “cost plus” recharging.
  • Good knowledge of both US GAAP and Canadian GAAP, including a deep knowledge and understanding of Canadian tax and legal financial reporting obligations.
  • Experience of dealing with External Auditor requests.
  • Strong communications, presentation, and interpersonal skills, including the ability to summarize key accounting and operational issues to management.
  • Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel (complex formula, VBA, macros and pivot tables) and proficient with other Microsoft Office applications.
  • Experience of working in different ERP systems and system migrations.
  • Knowledge of international digital sales taxes and transfer pricing requirements..
  • Complex analytic problem solving and project management skills.
  • Independent and self-starter with a “can-do” attitude.
  • Someone who is user-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative.

About Us

Epic Games spans across 12 countries with 32 studios and 3,000+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!

Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

title: Accounting Manager - Manufacturing (FT)
description:
Our North York-based client, an established precision machined products manufacturer is in need of an Accounting Manager to be responsible for the general full-cycle accounting duties, material purchasing/inventory and scheduling. The successful candidate should demonstrate maturity, cross-functionality and a willingness to learn.

The role is a one person operation, there is no finance team.

Salary to 80k, vacation and benefits.

Responsibilities
  • Monthly account reconciliations and closing journal entries.
  • Prepare financial reports, statements, analysis and maintain financial schedules and statistical data.
  • Collection of accounts receivable and payable, including entry of receipts, bank deposits and solving discrepancies on accounts and invoices.
  • Entry of all financial transactions, posting, journal entries, adjustment, Trial Balances and monthly financials.
  • Manage ongoing expenses, cash flows and budgets by reconciling expenses, reviewing and analyzing of financial results.
  • HST filings, tax returns, filing remittances, HST, EI, WSIB.
  • Purchasing including sourcing supplier pricing, issuing purchase orders, matching purchase orders to receipts
  • Perform and report on internal quality auditing and communicate with 3rd party auditors.
Qualifications
  • Minimum 10+ years’ experience in accounting in a manufacturing setting.
  • University/College degree required, CGA designated.
  • Strong computer proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) and ACCPAC.
  • Experience with purchasing/procurement an asset.
  • Excellent written and spoken English communication skills.
  • Able to adapt to new processes and systems, eager to learn.
  • Must own vehicle with valid G driver’s license.

title: Manager, Assurance and Accounting - Audit
description:
Inspirational, innovative and entrepreneurial - this is how we describe our empowered teams. Combine your passion with purpose and join a culture that is thriving in the face of change.

Make an impact with our Audit team as a Manager. This diverse team of professionals are dedicated to exceeding clients’ unique needs within a rapidly evolving business and financial reporting landscape. As a trusted advisor, you’ll provide comprehensive, tailored financial information that enables clients to make informed decisions with confidence.

MNP is proudly Canadian. Providing business strategies and solutions, we are a leading national accounting, tax and business advisory firm in Canada. Entrepreneurial to our core, our talented team members transcend obstacles into opportunities and are successfully transforming mid-market business practices.

Responsibilities
  • Lead client facing engagement teams to complete audit and assurance engagements, reviews, budgeting and financial/accounting transactions
  • Deliver industry and technical expertise in audit and assurance through client interactions, reports, technical work, management presentations and high-quality deliverables
  • Manage a portfolio of clients while understanding their business, key risks and ways to deliver added value; ensure clients’ needs are met and that relationships and accounts grow and develop
  • Accountable for engagement planning and scheduling as well as project financials (i.e., budgets, WIPS, timely billing, collection, variance recognition)
  • Maintain quality control and apply specialized knowledge to anticipate, identify and address issues relevant to the client’s business, financial entries and reports
  • Network in the local business community, consider business development opportunities and contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs
  • Mentor, motivate and coach team members towards professional and personal development by setting clear expectations, providing feedback and conducting performance reviews
  • Maintain flexibility to travel, as necessary

Skills And Experience
  • CPA designation
  • 4 to 6 years of relevant public accounting experience, working with public company or large private enterprise engagements
  • Extensive knowledge of and experience working with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS)
  • Strong understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles
  • Proven people management, relationship building and leadership skills

MyRewards@MNP

More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.

Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment and more!

title: Accounting Manager
description:
BE authentic. BE influential. BE the expert. Be all that and more at Colliers.

At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.

Who You Are

Reporting to the Controller, you will lead property accounting activities for your team, including the budgeting and reporting process, within a specific portfolio of assigned commercial properties. During busy times you’re not afraid to roll-up your sleeves and jump in to work side by side with your team. You’ll have the opportunity to mentor and share your expertise with your team and to continuously work with and develop high-performing property accountants. You’re always looking at the bigger picture yet overseeing detailed work and producing high-quality reporting for our clients.

What You Bring
  • 3 years of progressive leadership responsibilities and accounting experience within the commercial real estate industry
  • Experience in leading and developing high-performing teams
Bonus skills and experience

  • Advanced education in accounting; CPA designation is an asset
  • Experience with audits, strong understanding of accounting standards (ASPE / IFRS)
  • Reporting at a portfolio level, including MD&A style lease and operations reporting
What Success Looks Like
  • Ensure accurate and timely performance and reporting of real estate accounting activities for a national, diversified portfolio of Retail, Office, and Industrial properties.
  • You continuously evaluate the effectiveness of internal processes to seek opportunities for process improvements.
  • You develop and sustain a highly engaged team through strong leadership, open communication, and ongoing coaching and mentoring.
BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.

Please be aware that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Colliers professionals in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated to attend any Colliers workplace. As a condition of commencing any role, you will be required to self-report your vaccination status and provide verifying documentation. Should you require medical or religious accommodation related to vaccination please discuss with your Talent Acquisition Advisor.

description:

title: Manager Sage Intacct (Hybrid work/office anywhere in Canada)
description:
What do you think of when you hear the name MNP? Most likely tax and accounting, but as one of Canada’s largest consulting organizations, we’re so much more! We’re also serious about technology.

Make an impact with our Digital team as a Manager Sage Intacct. This diverse team of tech-savvy problem solvers has expertise and delivery depth across customer platforms, applied data & analytics, applications & cloud and business platforms solutions. Regardless of the underpinning technology, our team members understand clients’ unique needs and embrace the possibilities that technology brings to an evolving business landscape. Customer preferences are evolving at a rapid pace. As a trusted advisor you will design to meet those needs, engage customers in expected as well as new ways, gather, secure and organize meaningful insights, translating them into meaningful action, an incredible client experience, improved sustainability and optimized performance while reducing costs and enhancing growth.

At MNP Digital, we’re a team of highly skilled and creative thinkers that continuously support and learn from each other. We pride ourselves on translating our clients’ challenges into real results by leveraging technology - and that all starts with having the right people to deliver. We’ve created an environment where you’ll continuously grow, always have a voice and collaborate on work that’s meaningful and fulfilling. If you’re ready to take your career into your own hands, you’ve come to the right place.

MNP Digital offers candidates the option of a hybrid home/office work environment which provides flexibility to be based anywhere in Canada.

Responsibilities
  • Provide and lead strategic IT consulting services to a wide range or MNP's clients in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors including IT Strategy and Planning, Business Alignment and Enablement, Process Redesign, Solution Design, System Selection, Project Management and IT Systems Optimization
  • Design and configure technology stack - Intacct and third party software’s such as Bill.com, Expensify, etc
  • Act as System Architect to develop business defined solutions
  • Design & Flowchart workflows of system, including project/grant management, invoicing, revenue recognition, accounts payable/accounts receivable, financial reports, etc
  • Clean-up historical financials and load into Intacct.
  • Responsible for the delivery of consulting services such as strategic and operational planning, business and IT transformation, business process improvement, performance optimization, organization effectiveness and risk assessment
  • Manage complex projects and undertake the leadership of teams to ensure projects are delivered on time, on budget and within the client specifications to ensure project profitability and client satisfaction
  • Work collaboratively with clients to identify business opportunities including defining root cause of issues and developing innovation solutions that achieve client outcomes
  • Prepare correspondence, technical reports, client summaries and presentations outlining findings, facts and highlights resulting from the client engagement
  • Think strategically about client needs by quickly gaining an understanding of their business, their organization, operating environment and key risks
  • Maintain high quality control by reviewing work done by other team members for accuracy and completeness; provide feedback to team members
  • Leverage team appropriately to ensure proper documentation is prepared for the client and procedures relating to the file are followed accordingly
  • Promote MNP consulting services through the delivery of presentations, writing articles, facilitating workshops or participating in community activities
  • Provide leadership and subject matter experience in proposal development and solution design
  • Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches in order to improve work processes

Skills And Experience
  • Completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in business, technology, engineering or other related field
  • 5 to 8 years of IT experience in a consulting environment is preferred
  • Sage Intacct experience required preferably in a System/Solution Architect role
  • Client Accounting experience preferred
  • Accounting, project management, and reporting skills
  • Fundamental knowledge of GAAP
  • Detail oriented, master of time management and organization
  • Completion of additional certifications (e.g. PMP, Prince2, CBAP, Agile, CISSP, TOGAF, ITIL) are considered an asset
  • Strong financial and analytical capability
  • Passion for innovation and application of technology to solve complex business problems
  • Experience in project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, decision making, documentation, managing client expectations, project profitability and team leadership
  • Professional experience in IT Strategy and Planning, Business Alignment and Enablement, Business and IT Transformation, Process Redesign, Solution Design, System Selection, Project Management, Implementation Reviews and IT Systems Optimization
  • Experience in proposal development
  • A developed network within the business and IT community is considered a strong asset
  • Some travel may be required

MyRewards@MNP

More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.

Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment and more!

title: Accounting Manager
description:
About the Opportunity


Are you ready for the next step in your career? Do you have what it takes to manage 6 direct reports and provide coaching and mentorship? Our client, a fast-growing, Vancouver-based accounting firm is hiring an Accounting Manager for a newly created role. Reporting directly to Partners, the Accounting Manager will have responsibility for the delivery of accounting, tax and advisory services to a portfolio of small to mid-sized clients. This role includes supervision of the junior staff, financial statement preparation, complete T1s, review Caseware and T2s, and perform day-to-day accounting. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated individual with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. If you're a CPA, with 3+ years experience and want to join a culture that prizes collaboration and open communication, apply today!


Core Responsibilities

  • Delegate tasks to juniors, interns and senior accountants and providing support, coaching and mentorship
  • Support the promotion of regular attendance, a balanced lifestyle and a high standard of team wellness
  • Maintain high-quality control by reviewing work done by other team members for accuracy and completeness, providing feedback to team members
  • Work with the team to ensure proper documentation is prepared for the client and that related procedures are followed accordingly
  • Communicate feedback to business partners about the annual performance review
  • Review, investigate and correct discrepancies and irregularities in financial entries and reports
  • Complete complex T1 personal income tax returns during tax season
  • Review corporate files (Caseware & T2 corporate tax returns) throughout the year, including compilations and review engagements
  • Proactively research more complex accounting and tax matters on behalf of the partners
  • Potential to participate in partner client pitches, including presentations


Key Requirements

  • CPA/CA designated with 3+ years experience
  • Proven experience with accounting & client management
  • Experience with financial statement preparation, year-end process, & T2 preparation and review
  • Experience complete and reviewing complex T1 returns
  • Effective and confident leadership skills with ability to delegate tasks, providing clear direction and guidance to seniors and juniors supporting you
  • Excellent communication skills, setting clear and concise expectations when delegating tasks and using them as teaching opportunities
  • Ability to assist the partners with client presentations and pitches


Benefits

  • Comprehensive drug and dental coverage
  • Extended health services
  • CPA dues paid

title: Manager Accounting NA
description:
About Staffbase

At Staffbase we believe that Internal Communication moves people, and people move companies. Our mission is to empower leaders and communicators to drive transformation through internal comms solutions, strategies, and insights. Our most recent Series E funding led by General Atlantic, officially launched us to 🦄 UNICORN 🦄 status!

We're headquartered in Chemnitz, Germany, with offices in many locations throughout the world, including Vancouver, Kelowna, New York, Amsterdam, London, and several locations in Germany! Our international team counts roughly 600 employees from 45+ nationalities and we have a growing base of 1000+ enterprise customers that want to transform their employee experience. We are rapidly scaling, post-Series E ($115 million funding), have strong-growing revenue, and our customers love us.

We would like to expand the Accounting & Controlling team within our Finance organization and we are looking for someone to lead the North American Accounting & Controlling team (currently 3 people) with passion and willingness to take on responsibility for all things accounting for the North American market.

As a digital first company, we offer greater flexibility in working locations. You would be able to work in a hybrid model from one of our locations, ideally Vancouver. Fully remote option available as well!

The role requires that you can build strong relationships in- and outside the company, move quickly, not be constrained by how things "used to be" and most importantly that you are ambitious, curious, and passionate leading a team on the one hand but also about doing accounting in general on the other hand.

Your tasks include but are not limited to:
  • Heading the NA accounting team
  • Ownership for timely and accurate financials of our NA entities (SB Inc. US, SB CA Systems Inc. and more to follow)
  • Oversee all full-cycle accounting processes from procure-to-pay, order-to-cash, and record-to-report within NA
  • Coordination of local statutory (tax) reporting and corporate income tax returns with internal and external stakeholders for US and Canada
  • Setting up and monitoring our sales and use tax strategy including all processes & tools around evaluating US nexus positions and the collection, remittance, and reporting of local taxes
  • Pro-actively contribute within the global accounting team which is leading the company-wide IFRS conversion, group consolidation procedures and the general up-leveling of our accounting practices
  • Support the year-end close audit procedures with our Big4 auditors
  • Bring in your experience, ideas, and support regarding the development, optimization and documentation of internal processes and policies
  • Support and proactively participate in special projects such as post-merger integrations

Your profile:
  • CPA (or equivalent) with 5+ years of related experience (could be a team lead, and previously in accounting role progressing into a management role)
  • You would describe yourself as communicative, persistent and eager to improve things
  • Ideally experience working in Big4 (audit or tax) or field accounting in a SaaS environment
  • You enjoy leading a team of currently 3 accounting professionals (and growing!)
  • Previous exposure to IFRS standards
  • You have group consolidation knowledge and are willed to work yourself into the topic, group consolidation experience is a plus
  • You've been part of professional audit processes
  • Workday ERP experience is not a must, but also a big plus

Office : Vancouver, Kelowna or remote North America

Our Global Benefits

Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP)

Staffbase offers you a benefit plan which entitles you to an ownership interest in stock options in the company. We're in business to create value for our shareholders and we want our employees to benefit from that shared success as well.

Ongoing Learning

We thrive on personal and professional growth. Every employee gets €1,800/$2,200/£1,650 per year to spend on personal and professional development.

Feel Good Fridays

Summertime means extended vacation time at Staffbase! During August we run the 4-days workweek which means that during this month Fridays are off for all employees.

Flexibility

When it comes to your personal life, it's not our place to dictate your schedule. We offer flexible schedule including work-from-home options.

Parental Leave

We recognize that one of the most special events in an individual's life is the birth or adoption of a child. We offer paid parental leave options for all employees.

Read More About Our Benefits Here.

We Love Diversity - Equal Employment Opportunity

Our platforms are for everyone, and so is our workplace. We are passionate about equity, inclusion, and diversity at Staffbase. Read more about our policies here.
