title: Director of Finance and Accounting
description:
Our Client is recruiting for a seasoned finance professional who will bring strong accounting, reporting, analytical and communication skills to a Director, Finance & Accounting role. In addition, the successful candidate will be highly insightful, respectful of deadlines, detail‐oriented, with a continuous improvement mindset and a demonstrated ability to effectively prioritize multiple workflows and deadlines. The successful candidate will work well in a team, will be keen to learn, and thrives in an entrepreneurial, fast paced environment.

Advantages

Opportunity to lead, develop, and motivate a team of accounting professionals to deliver value to the broader organization. Mentor and grow a high-performance accounting team through a deep understanding of ‘what good looks like’.

Responsibilities
  • Oversee the accounting team’s completion of month end and quarterly deliverables, including preparation / review of internal reports, third party reporting and completion of requisite variance analyses versus budgets
  • Develop internal management reporting to assist senior management make informed decisions as part of companies transition to an

asset manager
  • Oversee the centralized cash management, treasury and accounts payable/receivable function services Corporate and Forum’s platforms, that include familiarity with setting up and maintaining a cash management structure across several legal entities, along with cash positioning and banking administration
  • Review and sign-off on monthly and quarterly financial statements and related schedules and financial reports
  • Coordinate and manage interim and year-end audits for all entities

Qualifications
  • Accounting and a Professional Accounting Designation (CPA, CGA, CMA)
  • 8-10 years of relevant experience in a complex environment, with a minimum 4 years of post- designation and 2 years of management/supervisory role.
  • Proficiency with ERP systems
  • Strong analytical, attention to detail and technical accounting (IFRS and ASPE)

Summary

Our Client is seeking a seasoned finance professional who will bring strong accounting, reporting, analytical and communication skills to a Director, Finance & Accounting role.

In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. title: Accounting Manager - Consolidation
description:
• Description:* This Consolidations Manager is part of the corporate reporting team that consolidates and analyzes the results of 50+ reporting sites and prepares reports for internal and external purposes.

This position requires an accountant with consolidation experience in Longview and month end close experience in SAP, is able to troubleshoot and resolve issues, and IT savvy.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Maintain books for several accounts in SAP, including preparing/reviewing journal entries, account reconciliations (using Blackline) and preparing statutory financial statements
  • Working with treasury/tax to ensure intercompany transactions and reorganizations are properly accounted for and communicated to sites
  • Accounting for foreign currency translation /hedging in SAP as part of the month end close, processing of invoices, etc
  • Perform monthly consolidation in Khalix/Longview including journal entries and intercompany eliminations. Troubleshoot and resolve reporting issues. Analyze results and prepare/review reports for management/parent company
  • As co-systems administrator, maintain databases and hierarchies in Longview, perform system testing. Conduct year end rollover, and maintain site reporting packages
  • Participate in preparing consolidated/statutory FS including cash flow statements, note disclosures, work papers for auditors, SOX testing, external filings, and statistics surveys
  • Provide guidance to sites on accounting/reporting issues. Develop and roll out new templates or reporting packages to gather data for new or changes to IFRS standards, including training of others
  • Continuous improvement focus, including enhancing quality of account reconciliations and standardizing/automating processes and calculations globally, resolve internal audit findings and various ad hoc projects,
  • Help to manage the workload of others
  • CGA/CPA with minimum 3-4 years of consolidations experience
  • Strong knowledge of accounting close process in SAP, experience with maintaining multi-currency general ledgers
  • Strong IT and computer skills, advanced Excel including macros
  • Knowledge of FX translation, dealing with various inter-company transactions and profit eliminations, etc.
  • Extensive experience with consolidations using Khalix or Hyperion, including system admin role
  • Experience with preparing cash flow statements, balance sheet reconciliations, statutory FS and note disclosures
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to effectively interact with other departments/sites around the world
  • Quick learner, effective time management skills, organized, proactively takes initiatives
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage work to meet tight deadlines while maintaining attention to details and accuracy. Ability to work with little supervision. Team player, and manager workload of others
  • Excellent communications skills (clear and concise) and written skills. Experience preparing and presenting training materials
  • Troubleshoot issues in Khalix/consolidations. Ability to evaluate and identify issues, analyze and resolve quickly
  • Ability to consolidate and analyze large quantities of data including interpreting and reporting the results
  • Demonstrates high aptitude for using systems applications to analyze and improve efficiencies and controls over data
  • Proven driver of change and process improvements
  • Skills:* Reporting, Longview, Sap, General ledger, Accounting, System implementation, journal entry, reconciliation, month end
  • Additional Skills & Qualifications:* MUST HAVES: 1: 3-4 years of experience o Closing the books in SAP o Journal entries, Reconciliations, Accruals o Consolidation in Longview, or Khalix. Rolling over month end, lock system, prepare reporting packages out to all 50 sitres o Multi Currency Experience* o Intercompany reconciliations o System testing, adding new customers, new accounts, new lines of business 2: Longview and SAP systems experience 3: CGA/CPA
  • Experience Level:* Intermediate Level

À propos d'Aston Carter:

Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire.

About Aston Carter:

Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aston Carter has an unrivaled commitment to delivering first class service to clients and business professionals across a variety of disciplines, including Accounting and Finance as well as Governance, Risk and Compliance. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. Aston Carter is a division of Aerotek. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, a global talent solutions provider. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description:
Join a diverse and talented team

For years now, we’ve been designing lingerie and swimwear for everyday living. Why do we do what we do? Because we want women around the world to look and feel their best! Join our dynamic team to start a stimulating professional career in a committed and constantly evolving environment.

We’re a proudly local company with more than 3,500 employees and more than 275 stores across Canada and in 17 countries around the globe (100 stores).

Purpose of the role

The jobholder will be primarily responsible for properly recording financial transactions and producing various financial information while ensuring the integrity and rigor of the accounting practices used. They will also be responsible for monitoring these accounting policies and procedures.

Job Description
  • Plan, direct and coordinate all operational functions relating to accounting;
  • Execute the complete accounting cycle;
  • Ensure the production of monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements, as well as government reports and analyze them;
  • Ensure the accuracy of reconciliations;
  • Maintain the integrity and control of the chart of accounts;
  • Prepare internal reports and analyze for management;
  • Prepare year-end files and participate in external audits;
  • Perform inventory management at the accounting level;
  • Evaluate current accounting procedures, make recommendations to improve them and implement new processes;
  • Ensure the application and compliance with accounting policies and procedures;
  • Lead and coach a team of three technicians.
Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree in accounting (or equivalent) is essential;
  • Accounting title is an asset;
  • Relevant experience of three to five years required in supervision;
  • Great ability to concentrate and be meticulous;
  • Autonomous and priority management;
  • Respect of deadlines;
  • Knowledge in Microsoft Office suite and Great Plains;
  • French/English bilingualism.
Exclusive job perks
  • 50% discount on all products;
  • Flexible hours;
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company;
  • Being part of a family-owned business committed to the community;
  • Performance bonuses (in-store sales or management position);
  • Recognition program for years of service;
  • Innovation program to encourage idea sharing;
  • Referral bonus ;
  • Dayforce Wallet (pay on demand: you’ll be able to access a portion of your pay as soon as your shift ends).
For Full-time Employees
  • Group insurance plan;
  • Three (3) to five (5) paid personal days (depending on the position);
  • Minimum of 2% employer contribution to your RRSP.
The information on this site is for information purposes only and is not intended to have legal consequences. La Vie en Rose is committed to employment equity. La Vie en Rose has put in place an adaptation process that provides accommodation for selected candidates for an interview.

Apply Now

title: Gestionnaire Comptabilité générale et Information financière
description:
Position Description

Vous recherchez un nouveau défi ayant une portée sociale, économique et environnementale ? Vous souhaitez donner un élan à votre carrière et faire la différence? Participez à l’électrification des transports en vous joignant à notre équipe à titre de Gestionnaire, Comptabilité générale et Information financière!

 CE QUI VOUS ATTEND :

Dans ce rôle stimulant, vous serez responsable de la supervision du personnel et des activités de comptabilité générale et financier pour les filiales canadienne et américaine de l’entreprise.

VOS RESPONSABILITÉS:
  • Gérer et maintenir une équipe motivée et engagée de professionnels en comptabilité;
  • Maintenir l’efficacité et s’assurer de la qualité du travail de son équipe;
  • Évaluer la performance des membres de son équipe et s’assurer de leur développement professionnel;
  • Favoriser l’esprit d’équipe, la communication et la mobilisation des employés;
  • Planifier et organiser les activités de son secteur selon les exigences du plan directeur;
  • Établir les méthodes et les procédures de travail de son équipe et s’assurer de leur maintien;
  • Développer des indicateurs de performance pour son secteur;
  • Participer activement aux efforts d’amélioration des processus;
  • Assurer le respect des activités prévues au cycle comptable de l’organisation;
  • Respecter les délais de fermeture de mois/années selon la politique en vigueur;
  • Assurer la création, le respect et le suivi des processus de contrôle interne;
  • Assurer la production des états financiers mensuels non-consolidés et trimestriels consolidés selon les délais prescrits;
  • Préparer les rapports requis par la direction;
  • Assurer la gestion des activités entourant les audits externes et ceux avec les différents paliers gouvernementaux en collaboration avec le gestionnaire en fiscalité;
  • Assurer le lien entre le secteur et les autres services pour s’assurer de fournir un service optimal;


VOS AVANTAGES :
  • Occasion exceptionnelle de prendre part à des projets d’envergure;
  • Salaire et avantages sociaux concurrentiels;
  • Assurances et REER collectif, généreuse politique de vacances;
  • Télétravail 5 jours/semaine (Covid-19) puis éventuellement en mode hybride 2 jours au bureau et 3 jours par semaine en télétravail.


CE QU’IL VOUS FAUT :
  • Baccalauréat en comptabilité;
  • Titre comptable professionnel : CPA;
  • 10 années d’expérience pertinente dans une entreprise manufacturière;
  • 5 années d’expérience en gestion d’équipe;
  • Expérience dans la grande entreprise et dans un environnement multi-sites;
  • Bilinguisme (anglais/français), parlé et écrit.
  • Aimer travailler avec les gens, savoir reconnaître leur apport aux succès de l'entreprise et leur donner le soutien nécessaire pour améliorer leur performance;
  • Excellent communicateur;
  • Rigueur et leadership stimulant;
  • Dynamisme, autonomie, vision globale et esprit analytique;
  • Avoir une bonne tolérance au stress et au changement;
  • Excellente capacité d’analyse et sens de la prise de décision;
  • Enthousiaste et travailleur d’équipe;
  • Orienté résultats;
  • Autonomie, débrouillardise;
  • Maîtrise du logiciel Excel (niveau avancé), Word et Outlook;
  • Connaissance de SAP Master Finance (un atout)
  • Discipline et rigueur.
  • Être orienté vers le client;
  • Avoir le sens des affaires;
  • Faire preuve de créativité;
  • Savoir constituer des équipes performantes;
  • Respecter l’éthique et les valeurs;
  • Faire preuve de courage managérial;
  • Savoir planifier.

Nova Bus : donnez vie à votre ville

Performance | Confiance | Succès des clients | Changement | Passion

About Us

Avec des changements technologiques majeurs à venir qui bouleverseront notre façon de vivre, il est plus passionnant que jamais de travailler dans l'industrie du transport. Depuis 1927, le groupe Volvo propose des solutions de transport et d'infrastructure durables et efficaces essentielles à la prospérité de toute société. Chaque jour, nos camions, autobus, moteurs, engins de chantier et services financiers facilitent notre quotidien. Nous offrons une multitude d’opportunités de carrière au sein de nos différentes entités et marques commerciales, leaders sur leurs marchés. Toutes partagent une même culture fondée sur des valeurs de confiance, passion, performance, changement et réussite client.

www.volvogroup.com/career.

Nova Bus, membre du Groupe Volvo, est l’un des plus importants fournisseurs en Amérique du Nord de solutions durables de transport en commun.

Notre équipe de plus de 1 500 employés dans trois usines (Saint-Eustache et Saint-François-du-Lac au Québec et Plattsburgh dans l’État de New York) travaille en partenariat avec certaines des plus grandes sociétés de transport collectif au Canada et aux États-Unis.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Our travel industry client, recognized as one of the best places to work year after year has a newly created Accounting Management role to support their growth! Reporting directly to the Finance Director, the Accounting Manager will be responsible to oversee the daily & month end accounting operations. In this role, you will provide strong leadership & development of 4 direct reports and ensure a high level of integrity for business data, accounting processes, reporting and compliance.

Advantages
  • Flexible Hybrid Work Arrangement
  • Annual Wellness Allowance
  • Extensive Learning and Development Programs + Tuition Reimbursement
  • Group RRSPs & Company match
  • Paid time-off for volunteering

Responsibilities
  • Lead a team of four accounting specialists, providing guidance, coaching, mentoring and development.
  • Ensure accurate accounting and proper internal controls
  • Drive process improvement cross through identifying and solving issues while leveraging cross functional collaboration
  • Looking for someone analytical / accounting strong
  • Represent Finance on initiatives and have a presence at the table, confidently providing input and being active in decision making

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Related Program
  • CPA Preferred
  • Strong knowledge of accounting concepts, financials, and internal controls
  • Minimum of 3 years supervisory experience
  • Minimum of 7 years of direct F&A work experience in Travel industry
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills

Summary

If you've led a team in a Finance & Accounting capacity for a Travel company and you're looking to join a growing company that values great teams, positive collaboration, career advancement and mentorship, then please apply! If successful, you'd be working for a company consistently voted one of the best places to work.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Audit Manager – CPA
description:
Are you a leader and learner? Would you like to see the impact of your work? Do you see yourself in a collaborative, challenging, and result-oriented environment? Are you a peoples person? Then, Apply Now!

Working with one of our top financial clients, this role calls for an Audit Manager – CPA, who will be responsible for providing subject matter expertise in executing audits for assigned business functions and projects ranging in complexity in addition to leading moderately complex audits. The ideal candidate can work multi-functionally, provide guidance to other team members and ensure good relations across teams and functions to work on projects that may require integration of cross-functional processes. The ideal candidate possesses strong communication skills, strong people skills, and can adapt to a fast-changing environment

Responsibilities
  • Plan and lead audit activities that require an understanding of AML/ATF and Audit methodology
  • Act as a subject matter expert on the audit process including planning, risk assessment, and execution of audits, reporting, and issues validation
  • Provide expertise in planning and executing end to end audits based on the established audit plans in alignment with applicable policies and regulatory guidelines in a timely fashion
  • Lead the planning process for assigned audits while ensuring the completion of appropriate programs and risk assessment to mitigate risks and improve effectiveness across the business
  • Support the audit opinion as per internal controls and professional audit standards to present the findings and recommendations to client and audit management
  • Manage follow-ups on the new findings raised from regulatory and internal divisional audits to ensure all data is up-to-date and properly documented
  • Review and identify failures in internal processes and recommend improvements to enhance operational efficiencies
  • Stay knowledgeable about emerging trends and developments related to business, analytical tools, and techniques
  • Act with the highest levels of integrity while always observing regulatory guidelines, fulfilling due diligence, and handling confidential information with discretion
  • Build a fair and positive work environment where the team can openly report challenges and exchange ideas, knowledge, and skills, and maintain good working relationships
Desired Skill Set
  • Undergraduate degree or relevant professional certifications, accounting designations, or equivalent education
  • 5 years of Audit experience
  • Experience working with MS Office and internet applications
Nice To Have
  • CPA/CA/CIA Certification
  • MBA Degree
  • Experience working with AML
BeachHead is an equal opportunity agency and employer. We advocate for you and welcome anyone regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, physical or mental disability, or age.

Privacy Policy

title: Manager, Assurance and Accounting
description:
Inspirational, innovative and entrepreneurial - this is how we describe our empowered teams. Combine your passion with purpose and join a culture that is thriving in the face of change.

Make an impact with our Assurance & Accounting team as a Manager. This diverse team of professionals are dedicated to exceeding clients’ unique needs within a rapidly evolving business and financial reporting landscape. As a trusted advisor, you’ll provide comprehensive, tailored financial information that enables clients to make informed decisions with confidence.

MNP is proudly Canadian. Providing business strategies and solutions, we are a leading national accounting, tax and business advisory firm in Canada. Entrepreneurial to our core, our talented team members transcend obstacles into opportunities and are successfully transforming mid-market business practices.

Responsibilities
  • Lead client facing engagement teams to complete audits, compliance tax engagements, budgeting, internal controls and financial/accounting transactions
  • Deliver industry and technical expertise in audit and assurance through client interactions, reports, technical work, management presentations and high-quality deliverables
  • Manage a portfolio of clients while understanding their business, key risks and ways to deliver added value; ensure clients’ needs are met and that relationships and accounts grow and develop
  • Accountable for engagement planning and scheduling as well as project financials (i.e., budgets, WIPS, timely billing, collection, variance recognition)
  • Maintain quality control and apply specialized knowledge to anticipate, identify and address issues relevant to the client’s business, financial entries and reports
  • Network in the local business community, consider business development opportunities and contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs
  • Mentor, motivate and coach team members towards professional and personal development by setting clear expectations, providing feedback and conducting performance reviews
  • Maintain flexibility to travel, as necessary

Skills And Experience
  • CPA designation
  • 4 to 6 years of relevant public accounting experience
  • Strong understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles
  • Proven people management, relationship building and leadership skills

MyRewards@MNP

More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.

Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment and more!

title: Accounting Manager - Consolidation
description:
*Description:*

This Consolidations Manager is part of the corporate reporting team that consolidates and analyzes the results of 50+ reporting sites and prepares reports for internal and external purposes.

This position requires an accountant with consolidation experience in Longview and month end close experience in SAP, is able to troubleshoot and resolve issues, and IT savvy.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Maintain books for several Celestica companies in SAP, including preparing/reviewing journal entries, account reconciliations (using Blackline) and preparing statutory financial statements
  • Working with treasury/tax to ensure intercompany transactions and reorganizations are properly accounted for and communicated to sites
  • Accounting for foreign currency translation /hedging in SAP as part of the month end close, processing of invoices, etc
  • Perform monthly consolidation in Khalix/Longview including journal entries and intercompany eliminations. Troubleshoot and resolve reporting issues. Analyze results and prepare/review reports for management/parent company
  • As co-systems administrator, maintain databases and hierarchies in Longview, perform system testing. Conduct year end rollover, and maintain site reporting packages
  • Participate in preparing consolidated/statutory FS including cash flow statements, note disclosures, work papers for auditors, SOX testing, external filings, and statistics surveys
  • Provide guidance to sites on accounting/reporting issues. Develop and roll out new templates or reporting packages to gather data for new or changes to IFRS standards, including training of others
  • Continuous improvement focus, including enhancing quality of account reconciliations and standardizing/automating processes and calculations globally, resolve internal audit findings and various ad hoc projects,
  • Help to manage the workload of others
  • CGA/CPA with minimum 3-4 years of consolidations experience
  • Strong knowledge of accounting close process in SAP, experience with maintaining multi-currency general ledgers
  • Strong IT and computer skills, advanced Excel including macros
  • Knowledge of FX translation, dealing with various inter-company transactions and profit eliminations, etc.
  • Extensive experience with consolidations using Khalix or Hyperion, including system admin role
  • Experience with preparing cash flow statements, balance sheet reconciliations, statutory FS and note disclosures
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to effectively interact with other departments/sites around the world
  • Quick learner, effective time management skills, organized, proactively takes initiatives
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage work to meet tight deadlines while maintaining attention to details and accuracy. Ability to work with little supervision. Team player, and manager workload of others
  • Excellent communications skills (clear and concise) and written skills. Experience preparing and presenting training materials
  • Troubleshoot issues in Khalix/consolidations. Ability to evaluate and identify issues, analyze and resolve quickly
  • Ability to consolidate and analyze large quantities of data including interpreting and reporting the results
  • Demonstrates high aptitude for using systems applications to analyze and improve efficiencies and controls over data
  • Proven driver of change and process improvements
  • Skills:*

Longview, Sap, cga, general accounting, general ledger, reconciliation, month end, financial statement, audit, reporting, journal entry, consolidations, financial reporting, hyperion, Khalix, accounting
  • Top Skills Details:*

Longview,Sap,cga
  • Additional Skills & Qualifications:*

MUST HAVES: 1: 3-4 years of experience o Closing the books in SAP o Journal entries, Reconciliations, Accruals o Consolidation in Longview, or Khalix. Rolling over month end, lock system, prepare reporting packages out to all 50 sitres o Multi Currency Experience* o Intercompany reconciliations o System testing, adding new customers, new accounts, new lines of business 2: Longview and SAP systems experience 3: CGA/CPA NICE TO HAVES:
  • Advanced Excel
  • SAP 4 hana
  • Big 4 experience.
  • Experience Level:*

Intermediate Level

À propos d'Aston Carter:

Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire.

Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. title: Accounting Manager
description:
For a friendlier future to emerge, we need a new approach that unlocks the human potential for transformation living inside each and every one of us. Are you ready to join Coeuraj to enable this change as our new Accounting Manager?

About Coeuraj:

Coeuraj is a transformation practice that exists to build a more inclusive, collaborative, and sustainable world.

We help people address change by finding the solutions they hold within themselves using tools that leverage the richness and complexity of human interaction, including collaborative design, data science, and strategic foresight.

And now, we're looking for an Accounting Manager to join our growing team in Canada and support people, organizations, and groups to collaboratively solve their challenges—and tackle the complex, global problems humanity faces today. The Coeuraj Canada team combines world-class designers, facilitators, researchers, and data scientists with a suite of advisors who know the ins-and-outs of the complex systems we operate in and the diverse communities we work with.

To learn more about us, check out a selection of our past projects and ideas.

Your Role

The Accounting Manager is responsible for managing and performing all aspects of the accounting cycle, including budgeting, cash flow forecasting, internal financial reporting, accounts payable and receivable, audit preparation and external financial reporting. Supporting the work of the CFO and support to our organizational initiatives round out the position.

Your Day To Day Responsibilities
  • Manage/execute accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll processing and general ledger and cash transactions both in QuickBooks and with payroll providers
  • Maintain the payroll management system, ensuring that employees are paid in a timely and accurate manner, processing and submitting statutory and benefits remittances on a timely basis.
  • Run a timely and accurate monthly close process with appropriate internal controls
  • Produce consolidated financial statements and a complete financial package every month, quarter and year-end
  • Prepare monthly, quarterly, annual and ad-hoc financial reports including forecasts and cash flow projections.
  • Lead the preparation of the annual budget along with the Director of Corporate Services
  • Monitor progress on financial objectives and key performance indicators, review the timing of schedule expenditure, analyze variables, and suggest corrective actions when required. Interaction with the business domains (departments) will be critical.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of current accounting practices and relevant legislation.

Your Resume
  • 12+ experience in accounting in a mid-sized organization. Experience in a professional services organization is nice to have. Of the 12+ years, at least 5+ years running a finance department complete with a month-end close, year-end close and audit and associated reporting
  • Chartered Accountant or CPA is desirable
  • Proficient in the use of QuickBooks, ideally Intacct Sage (or equivalent), Excel, ADP (or equivalent), Concur, tableau, Power BI or equivalent
  • Skilled in the use of data analysis and reporting tools including advanced report design.
  • Proficient in the technology required to work in a virtual environment.

What You Offer

Communications and relationship management skills: You connect with people around you by listening to their needs and engaging them so that they see those needs met.

Cultural Agility: You have a demonstrated ability to quickly, comfortably, and successfully work in cross-cultural and international environments.

Excellent Team Skills: You are a team player. You work with others to create an effective working environment and contribute positively to the organization's culture. You contribute to knowledge sharing and capture within the team.

Resilience: You will work in a very dynamic environment. The people we work with are facing the most challenging problems that the world offers. It's emotional work and will require you to be highly self-aware and self-regulating. Success in this environment will come with the ability to cope effectively with the stress and challenges present when working with other people who may be learning to cope with what's in front of them.

What We Offer In Return
  • The chance to be an early joiner in a young company that's rapidly growing into a unique position where we can enable real progressive change in the world.
  • A work environment where you can be your whole and honest self. We don't believe in hiring for culture "fit." We're more interested in how you will add to our existing culture and help shape our future.
  • We encourage and incentivize all employees to seek professional development opportunities that support their learning and growth.
  • A generous annual allowance is provided to all employees in order to create and maintain a safe and comfortable workspace.
  • We believe all systems require rest, including our organization. Therefore, we go offline for two weeks in December/January of each year, during which employees continue to receive their salary. Each employee also earns three weeks of paid time off per year and paid personal days to use as they see fit.
  • We offer all employees extended health benefits, including an EAP and a Wellness Spending Account.

Location & Other Details:

Start Date: ASAP. This is a remote position based out of Canada within PST/MCT zones.

If you are interested in exploring this opportunity, please apply with your resume and a letter telling us a little bit more about you to get the conversation started. We believe in creating an accessible and inclusive interview experience. Please let us know if there are any adjustments we can make to assist you during the interview process.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Toronto - Ontario - Canada

Job Summary

Assists in the direction of daily sector’s accounting functions. Responsible for training and managing AP/AR accountant.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
  • Responsible for tax reconciliations and filing.
  • Provide guidance on federal and provincial taxes.
  • Prepares, reviews and approves journal entries.
  • Prepares, reviews and approves accounts reconciliations.
  • Reviews and approves Projects and Contracts in PeopleSoft.
  • Responsible for supervision of general and sub ledger maintenance.
  • Provides technical advice and training on accounting systems to staff.
  • Assists with training and monitoring performance issues.
  • Interprets current policies and practices and plans and implements new operating procedures to improve efficiency.
  • Participate system conversions / enhancement providing testing and feedback, and training others.
  • Performs and assists with profitability analysis, financial decision-making, and operating statistics for a functional area.
  • Reviews staff projects to ensure work accuracy and departmental deadlines are achieved.
  • Leads special projects and companywide initiatives
  • Ad Hoc projects
Supervisory Responsibilities

Provides formal supervision to AP/AR accountant.

Technical Skills

Must be detail oriented with strong problem-solving skills. Ability to solve advanced problems and deal with a variety of options in complex situations

Ability to handle changing priorities and schedules.

Quick to learn and self-motivated.

Advanced skills in Microsoft suite applications and real estate or other financial accounting software - PeopleSoft preferred

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form.

EDUCATION And EXPERIENCE

Bachelors Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field; CPA required. 3+ years experience in public and/or private accounting.

Communication Skills

Highly developed written, oral, and presentation skills. Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret the most complex business documents. Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive issues. Proven ability to effectively interact with senior management, employees, internal and external auditors.

Ability to make effective presentations on general topics to an internal department, large group of employees, and/or management.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires in-depth knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to analyze the most complex business/financial data and develop innovative solutions. Advanced understanding of accounting and bookkeeping concepts. Develops and administers accounting practices to ensure optimum client satisfaction while guaranteeing CBRE financial interests are protected.

  • Contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs
  • Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry through experiential learning with clients
  • Collaborate with client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality and deadlines
  • Think strategically about client needs by understanding their business and key risks
  • Identify ways to maximize the relationship with clients and deliver added value
  • Maintain high quality control by reviewing work done from other team members for accuracy and completeness; provide feedback to team members

  • Knowledge of Public Sector Accounting Standards (PSAS), and Accounting Standards for Not-For Profit Organizations (ASNPO) would be considered an asset

  • Solid understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles

  • Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Some travel may be required

title: Manager, Assurance and Accounting - Public Companies
description:
Inspirational, innovative and entrepreneurial - this is how we describe our empowered teams. Combine your passion with purpose and join a culture that is thriving in the face of change.

Make an impact with our Assurance & Accounting team as a Manager. This diverse team of professionals are dedicated to exceeding clients’ unique needs within a rapidly evolving business and financial reporting landscape. As a trusted advisor, you’ll provide comprehensive, tailored financial information that enables clients to make informed decisions with confidence.

MNP is proudly Canadian. Providing business strategies and solutions, we are a leading national accounting, tax and business advisory firm in Canada. Entrepreneurial to our core, our talented team members transcend obstacles into opportunities and are successfully transforming mid-market business practices.

Responsibilities
  • Lead client facing engagement teams to complete audits, compliance tax engagements, budgeting, internal controls and financial/accounting transactions
  • Deliver industry and technical expertise in audit and assurance through client interactions, reports, technical work, management presentations and high-quality deliverables
  • Manage a portfolio of clients while understanding their business, key risks and ways to deliver added value; ensure clients’ needs are met and that relationships and accounts grow and develop
  • Accountable for engagement planning and scheduling as well as project financials (i.e., budgets, WIPS, timely billing, collection, variance recognition)
  • Maintain quality control and apply specialized knowledge to anticipate, identify and address issues relevant to the client’s business, financial entries and reports
  • Network in the local business community, consider business development opportunities and contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs
  • Mentor, motivate and coach team members towards professional and personal development by setting clear expectations, providing feedback and conducting performance reviews
  • Maintain flexibility to travel, as necessary

Skills And Experience
  • CPA designation
  • 4 to 6 years of relevant public accounting experience
  • Strong understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles
  • Proven people management, relationship building and leadership skills

MyRewards@MNP

More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.

Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment and more!

title: Manager of Accounting
description:
Our client, a leading investment dealer advising institutional investors and a wide variety of growth oriented companies based in Toronto is looking for an Manager of Accounting to join their team. The Manager will be reporting to the CFO. The Manager of Accounting is a pivotal member of the Finance team.

Responsibilities

Cash Management
  • Review and approve wires/EFT’s/cheques
  • Daily monitor of bank accounts
  • Notify necessary departments of receipts and or payment
  • Journal entry for receipts and or payments as required
  • Bank reconciliation for operation related bank accounts
Accounting
  • Prepare and post month end journal entries for intercompany, inventory, brokerage related accounts, foreign currency translation, fixed asset depreciation, various revenue accounts
  • Monthly inventory revaluation process
  • Monthly reconciliation of brokerage related accounts
  • Monthly reconciliation of commission revenue accounts
  • Maintenance of miscellaneous receivable and payable accounts
  • Create required reports in accounting software
  • Create codes as required in accounting software
  • Preparation of month end financials
  • Run year end accounting software close procedures
Audit
  • Liaise with external auditors for annual financial statement audits where required, preparation of necessary documents as requested by auditors review information provided to auditors to ensure it is correct and complete.
  • Liaise with regulatory auditors for regulatory audits where required, preparation of documents required by auditors
Qualifications
  • Completion of post secondary degree in business/accounting.
  • CPA,CMA/CGA or equivalent
  • 10+ years of work experience in an accounting position performing a variety of accounting duties, including preparation of trial balance, adjusting entries and financial statements. Experience in the financial services industry is preferred.
  • Solid working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Word and Excel

title: Controller
description:
NOW HIRING: Controller 

LOCATION: Centennial Auto Group, Summerside & Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island

HOURS: Full time, permanent, 40 hours per week.

WAGES:  Salary + benefits (negotiable and commensurate with experience and qualifications)


THE PERFECT FIT

Centennial Auto Group is looking for someone who is passionate, a team player, has a strong work ethic and is ready to take the lead with a successful accounting team. We are looking for a strong communicator and skilled financial analyst who will work daily with our 5 dealership teams in both Summerside and Charlottetown reporting directly to store management and the Chief Financial Officer. The successful candidate is looking for a challenging and rewarding career with one of the fastest growing companies in the areas we serve. 


APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Post-secondary education in Accounting or Finance or related discipline; candidates with a professional accounting designation given priority
  • Minimum of 3 to 5 years of accounting experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (primarily Excel) and in Google Workspace 
  • Strategic financial management and strong analytical skills
  • Excellent leadership and communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills and attention-to-detail
  • Automotive dealership experience considered an asset 
  • Experience in PBS dealer management software an asset
  • Motivated – we are looking for an employee who takes pride in their work and encourages this in their team.  


JOB TASKS:

  • Prepare monthly financial and operational reports 
  • Develop and maintain internal control policies and procedures
  • Monitor day-to-day accounting and inventory processes
  • Ensure all month-end and periodic reports are completed on a timely and accurate basis
  • Full cycle accounting including month-end and year-end close processes, journal entries, invoicing, bank reconciliations, and general ledger reconciliations
  • Prepare monthly auto manufacturer financial statements
  • Work closely with store management to manage balance sheets, inventory, and expense analysis
  • Monitor cash balances, receivables, and floor plan financing
  • Ensure all standard accounting policies, procedures and controls are consistently and accurately applied.
  • Perform additional accounting responsibilities as required including assistance with the year-end processes


WHY WORK WITH CENTENNIAL? 


  • Customer centered, team orientated staff
  • Professional training and development
  • Competitive wages
  • Health/ Dental/ Insurance
  • RRSP contributions 
  • Employee/ other partner discounts


Centennial Auto Group consists of 5 new car dealerships, 2 powersport recreation stores and 6 collision centres. We are committed to consistently meeting and exceeding our customers’ expectations. We strive to achieve maximum customer loyalty while providing a clean, safe and friendly work environment for our fellow employees. If you feel you have what it takes to be a valuable team player, please apply online.


Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Horizon Recruitment is currently seeking an experienced Corporate Controller for an 18 month contract with one of our rapidly growing clients. Our client is on the leading edge of their industry and is seeking a dynamic and driven individual to lead the accounting team through a period of growth and substantial change.

Initially an 18month contract term to cover a maternity leave, the successful candidate has a strong possibility of being retained permanently in a leadership role within the finance team.

Job Description

Reporting to the CFO, the Corporate Controller will be responsible for the monthly, quarterly and annual financial reporting packages. This role will work closely with various operational departments to drive change within the organization and optimize the accounting function. The ideal candidate will have experience dealing with Tax and IFRS issues and liaising with external auditors.

Requirements
  • A professional accounting designation (CA, CMA, CGA)
  • 7+ years' experience in a similar role managing a high performance team of designated accountants
  • A driven, "can do" attitude with the willingness to push back
  • Substantial public company reporting experience with a detailed knowledge of IFRS
  • Experience guiding and mentoring accounting staff to ensure high performance form all team members
  • Drive to continually improve systems and processes with the ability to function in a changing environment
  • Experience leading the finance team in a high growth environment
Horizon Recruitment Inc. is a specialized recruitment and search firm with three complimentary practice areas: Finance, Supply Chain and Engineering.

To APPLY and view similar postings please visit “Your Career” at www.horizonrecruit.com.

title: Controller
description:
Le contrôleur aura la responsabilité de superviser le département de finance et comptabilité incluant la production de rapports financiers mensuels, trimestriels et annuels et d'assurer le maintien de contrôles internes rigoureux au sein du groupe d'entreprise.

Informations sur l'entreprise

Notre client est un acteur en forte croissance sur son marché

Missions

Superviser le cycle comptables des entités du groupe
Produire les états financiers consolidés mensuels, trimestriel et annuel pour le CA et les investisseurs externes
Analyser les États financier et participer activement au reporting
Évaluer les systèmes, processus et outils comptables, ainsi que les systèmes de contrôle interne de l'entreprise, et recommander des améliorations, au besoin
Assurer la préparation et la coordination des budgets, des prévisions et des projections de trésorerie
Superviser les opérations quotidiennes du service de comptabilité y compris les comptes à recevables et payables, ainsi que la paie
Gestion de la trésorerie
Assurer la préparation des documents relatifs aux rondes de financement et autres rapports spéciaux
Préparer les dossiers d'audit et assister les auditeurs externes dans l'exécution de leur mandat

Profil du candidat

Une expérience de 3 à 5 ans comme contrôleur ou poste similaire
Idéalement titulaire du CPA
excellente maîtrise des outils Microsoft
Un très bon esprit d'analyse et de synthèse
Capacité à gérer les priorités et travailler dans un environnement agile
Bilingue (Français & Anglais)
Vous êtes reconnu pour votre sens de l'initiative et vos compétences interpersonnelles

Conditions et Avantages

Rémunération et package attractif

Assurances & REER au dessus du marché

Autres avantages



MPI ne fait pas de discrimination fondée sur la race, la religion, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité ou l'expression du genre, l'âge, le handicap, l'état civil, ou sur le statut d'un individu dans un groupe ou une classe quelconque autrement protégé par la législation applicable en matière de droits de l'homme. MPI encourage les candidatures des minorités, des femmes, des personnes handicapées et de tous les autres candidats qualifiés.



MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class otherwise protected under applicable human rights legislation. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled and all other qualified applicants

title: Controller
description:
A dynamic team in a very exciting start-up environment is seeking a Controller to join them! The ideal candidate is a highly capable individual with a positive attitude and a strong accounting skillset. This position will be suited to a high energy person who is able to wear multiple hats and who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment where there is constant challenge and lots of opportunities for you to use your initiative. As the only accounting employee and reporting to the founders, the main responsibilities include:


  • Oversee all accounting duties, from full cycle data entry, AP, AR and bank reconciliations to analysis and preparation of consolidated financial statements
  • Manage cashflow, bank accounts, credit cards and loans
  • Process payroll
  • Ensure regulatory compliance, coordinate year end audit papers, remit HST and apply for government subsidies
  • Produce ad hoc modelling, marketing analysis and oversee lease management
  • Take ownership of IT


This role is well suited to an individual who enjoys being part of a growing organization where you have to switch gears at a moments’ notice. The owners of this company have high expectations and require someone extremely competent, professional and deadline oriented. If you can rise to the occasion, please apply today!


Qualifications


Mandatory:


The main qualifications for this role include:


  • Post-Secondary education in accounting
  • 3 + years’ experience with full cycle accounting
  • Excellent interpersonal skills


If you have previous experience in a start-up environment, you will know that this type of company is ever-changing and evolving and requires someone flexible and able to adapt quickly.


What’s the Bottom Line:


  • $70,000 – $80,000 annual salary
  • Group insurance benefits
  • 3 weeks’ vacation


Location: Ottawa – Remote


Internal Job ID#: 4119

title: Controller
description:
Venor is proud to partner with our client, who is seeking a Controller to be responsible for all activities within accounting & finance, including all aspects of financial management, corporate accounting, payroll, regulatory and financial reporting, budget and forecast preparation, as well as development of internal control policies and procedures.


Controller responsibilities include:


  • Manage staff accountants and all accounting operations including billing, A/R, A/P, cost accounting, inventory accounting and revenue recognition.
  • Prepare the budget and financial forecasts and report variances.
  • Prepare and publish timely financial statements.
  • Support payroll processes.
  • Support month-end and year-end close processes.
  • Ensure quality control over financial transactions and financial reporting.
  • Manage and comply with local, provincial and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings.
  • Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls.
  • Additional controller duties as necessary.


The successful candidate will have an accounting degree and a CPA or CMA designation. They will have a minimum of five years of accounting and finance experience and proven history as a Controller and manager. The ideal candidate possesses excellent accounting software knowledge and administration skills and is confident with accounting principles and procedures, general ledger functions, month-end and year-end close processes and creating financial statements.


If you are interested in hearing more about this position, please contact Ian Sullivan via ian@venor.ca.

  • Manage and comply with local, provincial and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings.
  • Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls.
  • Additional controller duties as necessary.


The successful candidate will have an accounting degree and a CPA or CMA designation. They will have a minimum of five years of accounting and finance experience and proven history as a Controller and manager. The ideal candidate possesses excellent accounting software knowledge and administration skills and is confident with accounting principles and procedures, general ledger functions, month-end and year-end close processes and creating financial statements.


If you are interested in hearing more about this position, please contact Ian Sullivan via ian@venor.ca.

title: CONTROLLER
description:
Job description:

GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible and accountable to lead, manage, support and provide direction to all staff within the department through effective goals/objectives setting, performance monitoring and reviews, communication, and the execution of on-the-job training and development plans.
  • Ensures a robust department structure by maintaining effective staffing levels and creating succession plans and related employee development plans to support current and future needs. 
  • Develops and executes an annual strategic plan for the department supporting company performance objectives and industry/field related benchmarking and trends.
  • Collects, measures and monitors data related to the overall effectiveness of the department; benchmarking and analyzing these trends to establish action plans for continuous improvement (QOS process).
  • Develops and implements new processes and procedures, as needed to support changing business demands.
  • Facilitates effective two-way communication through department meetings (minimum monthly) and an Open-Door philosophy
  • Accountable for department budget preparation, approval and attainment.
  • Ensure all departmental requirements are met on a timely basis, specifically buy not limited to the following:
  •    Monthly reporting requirements (internal and corporate)
  •    Year-end reporting and audit requirements
  •    Annual budget requirements
  •    Capital acquisition process requirements
  •    Bi-weekly payroll requirements
  •    Other management reporting requirements
  •    Regular forecasting
  •    Hedging Analysis
  •   Ensures compliance with GAAP, and Sarbanes-Oxley policies and requirements.
  •    Ensures confidentiality of all proprietary and human resources related information.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  •     Leads by Example
  •     Makes Decisions
  •     Excellent ability to persuade, influence and motivate others
  •     Communicates Effectively
  •     Negotiates
  •     Strong time management and organization skills
  •     Strong computer skills, especially MS Excel
  •     Decisive
  •     Ability to work overtime to complete projects by the required deadline

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or related field of study
  • Accounting Designation (CPA) required
  • Post-secondary Degree in a related field preferred (business)

WORK EXPERIENCE:

  • 7 or more years of work-related experience
  • Minimum 5 years related experience
  • Minimum 3 years supervisory experience preferred
  • Experience in the automotive industry preferred

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

PERFORMANCE MEASURES:

•   Budget Attainment

•   Budgeting/forecasting accuracy

•   Departmental Strategic Plan Execution

•   Departmental Succession Plan and Employee development plans.

•   Detailed forecasting methodology

•   EOS Metrics

•   On-time month-end reporting

•   On-time quote capitals

•   QOS Measurables

•   Year-end audit binder submission for external auditor's - timely completion and management of audit staff

 

Physical Demands – Normal amount of sitting and standing; Ability to move around an office environment and on the production floor;  Ability to work at a computer workstation; Ability to bend, twist, lift, reach.  Required to carry out job duties and responsibilities in a work environment that may include, but is not limited to, varying levels of noise and/or temperature. Ability to lift max. 50lbs periodically.



We offer:

Competive wages and benefits.  Diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: Controller
description:
Headquartered in Montreal, Reflector is a new breed of studio working with top talents to create high-quality, compelling content for global audiences. By employing a true transmedia approach, where content is built outwards from fully fleshed “Storyworlds”, the company is able to tell richer, deeper stories that connect with fans everywhere.

Summary

Under the supervision of the CFO and with the support of the Accounting Clerk and Payroll and Benefit Specialist, the Controller is responsible for the complete accounting cycle of the company.

Responsabilities
  • Ensure the maintenance and optimization of all accounting and payroll processes;
  • Prepare or validate end-of-period entries and ensure month-end closings within a limited time frame;
  • Ensure the accuracy of various financial reports;
  • Analyze and present complete financial statements,
  • Support the CFO on ad hoc projects;
  • Collaborate with the members of the head office in Europe;
  • Manage annual internal and external audit processes;
  • Serve as the main point of contact with government authorities and the bank;
  • Ensure compliance with corporate tax obligations;
  • Contribute to compliance with the continuous improvement of accounting policies;
  • Participate in the development of the finance function within a growing company.

Qualifications
  • University degree in accounting;
  • CPA designation;
  • Minimum of seven (7) years of relevant experience;
  • Thoroughness and attention to detail;
  • Ability to lead several projects simultaneously while managing time and priorities;
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines;
  • High level of autonomie and organizational capacity;
  • Excellent mastery of Excel, PowerPoint and other office suite tools;
  • Strong communication skills in French and English, both oral and written.

title: Controller
description:
The Organization

Our client is a mid-sized Insurance Brokerage with several offices located in the York Region. We’re seeking an experienced accountant to join the Management Team and oversee this growing team in the role of Controller. The ideal candidate will have proven industry experience as an accountant, preferably in a senior role. As a strong communicator and skilled financial analyst, you will make it your mission to finish the EPIC implementation and then streamline the budgeting, payroll, and financial reporting processes. You will produce thorough financial-status reports for senior management to help improve operational efficiency and aid in their continued growth.



Key Accountabilities

The position will include the following responsibilities:

  • Participate in the development of and support of the company’s strategic plans
  • Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions
  • Provide comprehensive financial updates to senior management by evaluating, analyzing, and reporting appropriate data points
  • Help develop and support short and long-term operational strategies
  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of business results
  • Maintain internal control safeguards for the receipt of revenue, costs and both team and organizational budgets and actual expenditures
  • Overseeing regulatory reporting, frequently including tax planning and compliance
  • Maximize payroll efficiency through innovative process development
  • Providing management with information vital to the decision-making process
  • Implementing EPIC and the new accounting processes that will increase efficiency and utilization of the new system
  • Establish financial and operating benchmarks, budgets, program monitoring, and reporting standards on a bi-weekly, monthly, and annual basis
  • Process all monthly operating expenses disbursements
  • Hiring, training and retaining skilled accounting staff
  • Coordinating activities of external auditors


Candidate Profile

The successful candidate will have the following:


Education:

  • An accounting designation (CMA, CGA or CA) or equivalent combination of related experience in a senior accounting role and education


Experience:

  • 5- 10 years of experience as a senior-level accounting or finance manager.
  • Previous experience within the Insurance industry would be a definite asset.
  • Experience using EPIC and ideally has participated in the transition from a legacy system to EPIC
  • Working knowledge of finance law and regulatory standards


Competencies and Attributes:

  • Comprehensive knowledge of Applied Systems, Payroll and Excel software
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Great analytical, organizational skills and excellent attention to detail
  • Proven payroll experience, with a focus on streamlining accounting processes
  • A dynamic leader who supports the accounting team and creates an environment of trust and productivity

title: Controller - (Langley)
location: City of Langley, British Columbia, Canada
description:
Otter Co-op is now accepting applications for a Controller at our Administration Office located in Langley, BC.

Who we are:

Otter Co-op is a $350 million dollar retail co-operative with a diverse portfolio of commodities which includes liquor, petroleum, food, feed, pharmacy, hardware, family fashions and hospitality. Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our brand to life, visit us at www.otterco-op.crs.

What you’ll do:
  • Coordinate an effective, efficient, and timely period-end close process, including ownership of the general ledger and preparation of financial statements.
  • Contribute to the annual budget process, including any necessary maintenance and re-forecasts during the fiscal year.
  • Identifies potential financial risks and recommends corrective actions.
  • Regulatory compliance and understanding of Federal and Provincial tax applications in a retail & petroleum environment.
  • The role will assist in the management of the treasury function, as it relates to bank accounts, monitoring and adjusting foreign exchange rates.
  • Directs the training and mentorship of a team of 11 in their job responsibilities.
  • Fixed asset/depreciation/disposal calculations and reporting.
  • Review and approve monthly reconciliations (banks, prepaid, receivables, etc.).
  • Improve and implement financial policies, systems, and processes.
  • Directs the development and administration of accounting policies and operational procedures to ensure effective accounting and internal controls.
  • The Controller supports any accounting software projects.
  • Must work within strict confidential guidelines and with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to deal with a diverse and fast-paced work schedule and to work with a sense of urgency in a changing environment.
  • Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, with a positive attitude and the ability to work as part of a Team.
  • Contribute to the Team in living the Corporate Values of Integrity, Community and Excellence
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Why it matters:

Our team provides a range of products and services to support our member-owners. Through the work that we do, we help to build, fuel, feed and grow Western Canadian communities together.

Who you are:

You are looking for a career in Finance and:
  • Minimum 10 years of accounting experience and 3 years of Controller experience
  • Post-secondary undergraduate or technical degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance; CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is required
  • Proficient in a variety of computer applications including MS Office Suite and advanced knowledge of excel (VLookup, Sumif, left-mid-right, formatting, creating charts, pivot tables)
  • Must have a pragmatic and diplomatic approach to managing people through change management and projects
  • Excellent organizational, planning and time management skills
  • Experience with credit management
  • Superior attention to detail
  • Must be committed to a SAFE working environment

What’s in in for you:
  • Competitive wage
  • Qualify for wage increase based on the number of hours worked & meeting expectations in the position
  • Team discount on Liquor, Food, Gas, Fashion, Hardware, Feed & Restaurant purchases
  • Co-op Membership with an annual dividend payment on qualified purchases
  • Annual bonus program for all team members
  • For eligible positions: comprehensive benefits package and an employer matched pension plan
  • Learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation
  • Team Events, community volunteering opportunities

Otter Co-op is committed to a diverse and supportive working environment based on our Core Company Values of Integrity, Community and Excellence. We are committed to giving back to our communities through our Corporate Social Responsibility Program.

At Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

All successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.

We would like to thank everyone for their application, however only candidates that will be moving forward in the interview process will be contacted.

title: Controller
description:
The Opportunity

The Controller is responsible for the overall management of the accounting and finance function including month-end / year-end reporting and financial audits. The Controller is responsible for the implementation and management of the internal control environment and will continuously seek out areas for improvement. The Controller is the owner of the local treasury function, generating a meaningful cash flow forecast to assist Corporate Treasury in making key decisions. The Controller is also responsible for managing transfer price changes in line with NNCI transfer pricing strategy.

Overview

Key Areas of Responsibility:
  • Financial Process, Financial Reporting and Audits (30%)
  • Internal Controls / Compliance (20%)
  • Treasury (15%)
  • Transfer Pricing (10%)
  • Contract & Insurance Review (10%)
  • Digitalization and Other Projects (15%)
Financial Process, Financial Reporting and Audits: 30%
  • Manage month-end / year-end financial closing process and provide guidance and direction to the line of business and other finance personnel.
  • Knowledge of the operation of the general ledger system ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of financial results and reporting requirements.
  • Review monthly reconciliations to ensure accurate and in accordance with IFRS and Global requirements.
  • Approve line of business accruals on a monthly basis ensuring liabilities are in accordance with IFRS and sufficient supporting documentation is attached.
  • Manage and establish KPIs for the Global Business Services team as it relates to financial reporting ensuring consistent and regular communications are established and guidance is provided. Ensure adherence to KPIs.
  • Lead responsibility in preparing financial reporting for local and global requirements, and ensuring financial records are maintained in compliance with accepted policies and practices.
  • Jointly responsible for review and validation of Product Listing Agreement (PLA) accruals with Revenue & Trade Manager.
  • Management of internal and external audits, and collaborating cross-functionally to ensure all audit requirements are being fulfilled.
  • Cost center owner for NNCI head office cost budget, including preparation, reconciliation to actuals and providing commentary to FP&A team.
  • Proactively identifies, assesses and recommends improvements in financial processes including operations with shared services looking for further efficiencies and streamlining processes.
  • Cultivate a thorough understanding of key functions of North American businesses to identify best practices for standardization.
Internal Controls / Compliance: 20%
  • Responsible for finance internal control environment in line with internal control reporting framework.
  • Responsible for the design, implementation and compliance of NNCI SARBOX scope.
  • Responsible for ensuring existence and completeness of controls, and providing sufficient supporting documentation for SARBOX testing by internal and external auditors.
  • Partners with line of business to develop, implement and maintain an adequate system of internal controls throughout the Company, continuously identifying opportunities to strengthen internal financial controls while maintaining efficiencies in processes.
  • Monitors internal controls system for NNCI identifying immediate actions to mitigate internal control weaknesses / noncompliance, reporting any areas of concern or noncompliance to the Director, Financial Operations.
  • Ensures documentation is at reperformance standard and in line with retention requirements.
Treasury: 15%
  • Responsible for the monthly cash flow forecast preparation, analysis and submission to Corporate Treasury.
  • Management of the internal and external banking relationships to ensure NNCI receives appropriate level of required service.
  • Manage the execution of annual dividend plans to ensure repatriation to NNAS within Corporate Treasury requirements or other treasury transactions as required.
  • Analysis of long-term treasury implications to provide input on NNCI’s cash management strategies
Transfer Pricing: 10%
  • Owner of the preparation and presentation of therapy profit and loss “P&L” statements ensuring required annual return on sales are achieved.
  • Preparation of transfer pricing adjustment calculations.
