title: Controller
description:
Position Overview

NCSG Crane & Heavy Haul Services Ltd. is looking for a dynamic individual to step into the role of Controller. This position is ideal for someone who is driven by high expectations. Reporting to the CFO you will be a good fit for this position if you can plan and direct all accounting operational functions, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluate accounting and internal control systems, and lead five departmental staff. You will succeed in this position if you can effectively manage self and others within strict time constraints, lead while also being a team player, generate innovative ideas, and challenge the status quo. You're a good fit for this position if you want a challenging, yet stable role.

The Successful Candidate Will Possess The Following Qualities
  • Comprehensive understanding of accounting standards, specifically Canadian ASPE.
  • Established management and leadership skills, including the ability to lead, mentor and develop operational and corporate staff.
  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and motivated self-starter.
  • Well-organized with excellent time management skills including the ability to meet deadlines, which may require the flexibility to work the hours required to get the job done during peak times.
  • Strong analytical skills and knowledge combined with the ability to effectively communicate the knowledge across the organization.
  • Identifying short and long-term goals and objectives, contributing to the overall strategic plan of the department and the company.
  • Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • University degree with a professional accounting designation.
  • Five plus years of experience in a challenging finance function, including at least two years of supervisory experience in a similar role.
  • Position Description and Responsibilities:
    Finance Focused
    • Overseeing daily operations of the accounting department (Billing, Accounts Payable, Payroll, and Divisional Controller).
    • Responsible for all accounting procedures and functions, internal controls and accounting records (excluding credit, treasury, and financial reporting).
    • Financial reporting and analysis - monitoring and analyzing monthly operating results against budget and prior year and working with operations to understand and analyze these results to drive improvements.
    • Directing and managing financial audits for the operating entities the role oversees.
    • Review and ensure the accuracy and timeliness of all operational reporting and tax requirements
    • Foster new accounting procedures to streamline processes where possible.
    • Oversight of direct and indirect reports, including regular meetings and formal annual performance evaluations.
    • Staying current with financial related practices, trends, political/regulatory activities, and competitive economic changes.
    • Perform related tasks and duties as requested by the CFO such as assisting with acquisitions, major capital expenditures and internal controls.
    Operations Focused
    • Improve the operational systems, processes, and policies in support of organizations mission -- specifically, support better management reporting, information flow and management, business process and organizational planning.
    • Integrate Support Services (HR, IT and Finance), through improvements to each function as well as coordination and communication between support and business functions.
    • Working with department managers and staff to develop business plans, goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures. Includes the production of, and monthly monitoring of, the annual budget and forecasts by branch.
    • Recommending and implementing benchmarks for measuring the financial and operating performance of divisions and departments.
    With approximately 350 employees in nine branch locations throughout the energy corridor of Canada, NCSG provides crane and heavy haul services to various industries such as refining, upgrading, upstream oil & gas, utilities, forestry, mining, and wind energy. NCSG is headquartered in Acheson, Alberta and is proud to be one of the top fully operated and maintained crane companies in North America. We can provide local content to the project, as we have a large labor force based in western Canada from which to draw. NCSG is a privately-owned company. For further information please see our website:

    www.ncsg.com

title: Controller
description:
We are looking for a Controller to build our accounting team as Mercury grows rapidly. In this role you will help us transition our accounting functions in-house and build a world-class team that’ll scale with the company. You will be responsible for leading all aspects of the accounting function including monthly close, audits, reporting, finance operations, and tax compliance. This is your chance to build a team and processes in the way you’ve always wanted to.

What You’ll Do:
  • Build, manage, and develop our accounting team. You’ll plan how to do in-house accounting and strategically execute step by step.
  • Lead the monthly close process and ensure timely and accurate financial reporting. This will directly impact Mercury’s ability to make sound financial decisions.
  • Ensure proper GAAP accounting as we launch and scale new products.
  • Drive our annual audit process and proactively identify and address areas of audit risk.
  • Evaluate material risk areas in the company’s control environment and implement controls to mitigate appropriately for the company’s stage and scale.
  • Own financial audit, banking, tax, 409A, and other finance related advisory relationships
  • Evaluate Mercury’s ERP stack and implement other systems and tools to uplevel the accounting function.
  • Longer term, set the roadmap for public company accounting readiness.

You Should:
  • Have 10+ years of progressive accounting experience with a mix in public accounting and industry. Having both startup and public company experience is a huge plus, even better if in fintech.
  • Have big 4 public accounting experience with a detailed understanding of GAAP
  • Have a BA/BS or equivalent in accounting or related field; Certified Public Accountant (CPA) required
  • Have a history of scaling and process improvement for finance and accounting operations
  • Be good with numbers but more importantly with people and can lead others and work cross-functionally effectively.
  • Have a high bar of excellence. You strive to continuously improve processes and results but also know how to prioritize. You own your work completely and with pride.
  • Have the utmost integrity and zero compromise in values.
  • Be a self-starter and first principles thinker. You grasp problems and how to handle them quickly with little direction required. You enjoy tackling new problems and don’t need a prior mental model to think through them.

  • Lead and manage human resources initiatives and activities for direct reports including coaching, recruitment, onboarding, performance management, employee development, employee recognition and general support

Qualifications

  • Excellent communication skills with strong, written, verbal and presentation skills
  • Well-developed listening, coaching, delegating, training and mentoring skills; advocates a team approach
  • Ability to work independently under pressure

  • Excellent decision-making and time-management skills
  • Strong attention to detail to maintain organizational systems
  • Valid CPA designation preferred with demonstrated technical accounting knowledge and experience
  • 3 - 8 years of experience in financial management including a strong background in finance, accounting, budgeting and cost control principles including GAAP
  • Knowledge of financial and accounting computer software; experience with construction software as an asset
  • Experience in the construction and/or residential/commercial rental and leasing industries

JOB ID: 9A24295345

title: Controller (RH2022-001)
description:
Description

Controller (RH2022-001)

Location: Laval, CanadaNumber of positions available: 1

Since 1996, the CIRION group, a contract research laboratory with a global reach, is experiencing a rapid and constant growth thanks to its specialized scientific research team. Located in Laval, in state-of-the-art laboratories, our employee talent, expertise, know-how, and innovation contribute to our success. Our laboratories have more than 80 researchers, life science graduates and employees whose main objectives are to contribute by their expertise to the advancement of life sciences.

We are currently looking to fill the permanent full-time position of Controller. The Controller will act as Financial Director and will lead a team in a multi-company and multi-currency environment.

If you are passionate about your profession and looking for new challenges, we are looking for an experienced person who can help us to reach new heights in a motivating and pleasant atmosphere.

We are convinced that our researchers and employees are the reason of our success and we dedicated to offering an environment allowing our employees to grow professionally.

Responsabilities

Under the authority of the Vice-President and COO, the Controller will be in charge of the planning, the organization and the administration of the company’s accounting systems in accordance with general accounting principles and company policies. In addition to ensuring accurate accounting and financial information, the person must maintain appropriate internal controls. The Controller will act as a resource person for the Vice-President and Chief Operating Officer in all aspects of budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting.
  • Coordinate and control all accounting activities including the management and development of a team;
  • Coordinate monthly financial statements and prepare gap analysis and other relevant analyzes;
  • Supervise and carry out all the accounting operations of the group companies in a multi-currency and project accounting environment;
  • Develop and improve reports tracking budget variances, key performance indicators and develop effective reporting tools;
  • Conduct the year-end process and coordinate the activities of the external audit
  • Train and develop the administrative staff to ensure the best practices;
  • Develop, update and deliver company's integrated accounting management system's functionalities;
  • Manage and participate in special projects and prepare analyzes at the request of the Management including the recommendation of new policies or management tools;
  • Participate in treasury management of the treasury in collaboration with the immediate superior.
Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in accounting combined with a CPA certification (member of the Ordre des comptables professionnels agrées du Québec);
  • Advanced knowledge and advanced working skills of Microsoft Office Suite, specifically MS Excel (pivot tables);
  • Proficiency in French and English (oral and written).
> Experience
  • Minimum of 15 years of relevant accounting experience including 3 to 5 years in a controller role;
  • Experience in management or supervision of a team;
  • Strong experience in implementation/optimization of integrated management systems;
  • Relevant work experience in biopharmaceutical and/or service industry is an asset.
> Key skills
  • Very good skills in budget and financial planning (budget management, forecasts, and financial analysis);
  • Good knowledge of an enterprise resource planning system (ERP) is essential and of ACOMBA integrated management system (an asset);
  • Knowledge of tax measures related to the SR&ED tax credit program;
  • Excellent coaching, leadership, and training skills;
  • Ability to show rigor, integrity, autonomy, and discretion;
  • Ability to analyze, synthesize, problem-solving skills and detail-oriented;
  • Ability to deliver high-quality solutions on time;
  • Focused on performance, action, and ability to work under pressure.
Interested candidates should submit their resume and a letter of introduction to the following address: Competitive compensation is offered to the candidate who meets the selection criteria.

title: Real Estate Controller - IPP
description:
Description

Our large downtown Real Estate client is looking to hire a Controller for their Income Producing Properties (Property Management) Group. The IPP Controller will be responsible for communicating with Property Management senior leadership, as well as the planning timing and accurate completion of all annual, quarterly, and monthly activities and cycles, including property month ends, annual property budgets, annual tenant operating cost adjustments, and property reporting. Preparation and maintenance of all procedural documentation relating to property accounting. Additional duties include managing staff workloads to ensure fairness, and responsiveness to internal and external clients, providing guidance and direction to the property accounting team; and being responsible for the team’s continuous improvement of departmental processes/procedures.

Identifying and analyzing issues; taking decisive action when required and taking on special projects as delegated including process improvements and senior management requests are all part and parcel of the IPP Controller's duties.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Description

The Company

Our Niagara area client has been in business for almost 100 years. They are a publicly traded corporation headquartered in the US with operations across the globe. They boast customers in over 100 countries across various industries.

The Role

The Corporate Controller reports to the CFO in the Canadian head office. The Corporate Controller has 9 direct reports and is responsible for all accounting, financial reporting, treasury, tax, payroll and cash management. You will have responsibility for the organization’s operations across the country including several distribution centres in Western, Central and Eastern Canada.

About You

You are a designated CPA CA with a minimum of 7-10 years’ experience in publicly traded companies with 7+ years in progressively senior management roles. Your background is predominately in global public distribution companies where you had responsibility for 200,000+ SKU’s. In this role, since you will interface with colleagues at all levels including the Canadian leadership team and executives in the US head office, exceptional written and verbal communication skills are mandatory.

Your Skills & Experience
  • CPA CA designation
  • Large public company experience
  • Previous experience managing a busy Finance team and overall oversight for the month-end close and financial reporting process
  • Past responsibility for accounting, reporting, tax, treasury, cash management and payroll
  • Past distribution experience, preferably in a multi-location environment with thousands of different product SKU's
  • Large ERP experience and advanced Excel skills
  • Knowledge of US GAAP
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
What’s in it for You?
  • Generous base salary
  • Annual bonus
  • Long term incentive plan
  • Full health and dental benefits
  • Healthcare spending account
  • Defined contribution pension plan
  • Company-paid CPA dues and tuition reimbursement plan
  • Team-oriented collaborative culture where hard work and excellence is always rewarded
  • Opportunity to be an integral member of the Canadian leadership team for a global multi-billion dollar publicly traded organization
  • Exciting opportunity with an established, financially stable, and profitable company with decades of market leadership in their industry
Requirements
  • Overall management, coaching and development of Finance team including 9 direct reports
  • Responsible for monitoring, and documenting all accounting policies and procedures
  • Oversee the accounting cycle of month-end, quarter-end and year-end financial reports and accurate close processes
  • Manages recording of fixed assets and depreciation in accordance with Company policy
  • Ensure all balance sheet accounts are reconciled on a monthly basis
  • Responsible for research, interpretation, and recommendations on complex/escalated accounting issues in collaboration with the CFO
  • Responsible for internal management reporting of all cost centers, branches, zones, and the Company overall
  • Responsible of all government and statutory reporting
  • Responsible for maintaining all banking relationships and treasury responsibilities including cash flow analysis and hedging requirements
  • Primary liaison with the Company’s internal audit department and independent auditors as required
  • Process improvements to improve profits and increase efficiencies
  • Regular collaboration with different departments across the organization
  • Primarily responsible for the establishment and monitoring of adequate internal controls to safeguard Company assets in compliance with corporate policy and adherence to Sarbanes Oxley requirements.
  • Provides leadership and oversight for day-to-day management of payroll, including employee benefits, wage and salary administration, policies and procedures, records maintenance, employee benefits, workers’ compensation, and employment law
  • Develops, interprets, and maintains all payroll policies and procedures, and ensures that all payroll practices are fully compliant

  • Production of financial statements
  • Financial analysis, reporting, ad hoc analysis as needed
  • Costing and inventory analysis, cash flow management
  • Submission of tax remittances
  • Assisting in the coordination and preparation of budget and financial forecasts, institute and maintain planning and control procedures and analyze report variances
  • Preparing Month and Year End close
  • Liaising with external auditors
  • Communicating with Senior Management on financial variances and strategies
About You

The successful candidate will have the following:
  • Strong oral, written, and communication skills (English mandatory)
  • 5+ years of experience in Accounting & Finance
  • Experience in the construction industry
  • Designation (CPA) is an asset
  • 3+ years of leadership of an accounting team
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Highly organized, strong attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, self-starter, collaborative
How To Apply

Please apply by clicking the “Apply Now” button below and follow the instructions to submit your résumé. If you are already registered with us, please contact your Senior Recruiter. Please quote job 14920.

Thank you for your interest in this role. One of our Recruiters will be in touch with you if your profile meets the requirements for the role and the expectations of our clients. Please note that all candidates must be permitted to work in Canada to be considered for this opportunity.

title: Controller
description:
What is the role?

Specifically, You Will

Working closely with the Finance Business Partner, the Controller will lead the financial accounting team of BMT Canada Ltd., ensuring financial and tax compliance requirements for the legal entity.
  • Lead and manage the financial accounting team of the legal entity, ensuring the smooth operation of team functions: Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable & Payroll, and Project Accounting
  • Responsible for leading the periodical (monthly, annually) financial accounting and control process for the legal entity, ensuring compliance with Canadian and BMT’s GAAP standards, including preparation of external financial reports. Providing financial accounting input to the FBP for internal reporting purposes.
  • Provide financial accounting advice to internal stakeholders
  • Ensure compliance with local taxation requirements including Payroll Tax, GST, SRED and yearly consolidated tax return for the legal entity
  • Provide ad-hoc taxation compliance advice
  • Work closely with the Finance Business Partner(s) to understand the businesses they support, provide financial & tax compliance support across the operating unit(s) and business units
  • Maintain all local workers compensation insurance requirements
  • Continuous improvement of financial accounting processes and systems; implementation of new software
  • Manage and develop policies and procedures to ensure efficient and effective controls exist to safeguard the assets of the company, compliant with BMT’s internal controls
  • Active participant in harmonising regional finance matters, sharing knowledge and facilitating collaboration.
  • Develops standards and guidelines for use within business units in close cooperation with the Finance Business Partner(s)
What are we looking for?
  • CPA designation
  • Minimum of 5 years business experience working in a similar role
  • Demonstrated experience working with ERP and accounting software systems, experience with Deltek Vision and IFS would be considered an asset
  • Advanced skills in MS Office, in particular Microsoft Excel and PowerBI
  • Experience leading a team
  • Experience with leading annual closing processes and coordination of external audits
  • Ability to work independently and autonomously
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to demonstrate initiative
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills, including written and verbal
  • Ability to use discretion and maintain confidentiality
  • Current Canadian security clearance, or ability to obtain clearance
What can we offer you?

At BMT we believe in hiring the best talent, from diverse backgrounds, as this introduces new ideas to the team and our customers. We believe in a cooperative and collaborative work environment and support and encourage career growth.

The Successful Candidate Will Receive a Competitive Salary Commensurate With Skill, Ability And Experience, As Well As a Comprehensive Benefit Package Including

  • Medical, dental and vision plan (including a Health Care Spending Account)
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • RRSP matching program
  • Flexible work hours and remote work options
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Employee recognition
  • Employee referral program
What do we do?

BMT provides independent consultancy services, specializing in engineering, science and management services in the energy, defence, and transport sectors.

We recruit talented individuals from Canada and around the world from the new graduate to the seasoned pro. Not only do we offer challenging and rewarding projects, but we also understand that flexibility is important in today’s business world.

Apply Online

Does this sound like you? If so, please submit your application via our company Careers page. We look forward to learning more about you.

BMT is committed to employment equity, to eliminating discrimination and encouraging diversity amongst its workforce. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Controller
description:
Randstad Staffing is currently looking for an experienced Controller to join a fast-growing family-run organization in the North-West of Winnipeg.

The successful candidate will directly report to the Director of Finance and will be a key player in the financial growth and success of the organization.

Do you have your CPA designation? Do you have previous Controller experience in the manufacturing industry (experience in Retail, Construction, and Maintenance would be considered an asset as well)? Are you passionate about people and numbers? Do you embrace change and feel comfortable with an ever-evolving work environment?

Are you a problem solver, who can think outside the box? Do you thrive in a fast-paced work environment and want to join a fantastic family-run organization?

Do you enjoy financial reporting and have an analytical mind? Are you tech-savvy and very comfortable with Excel and Sage 300?

If this sounds like you, reach out to us today!

All applications are fully confidential and you can think of us as your sports agent - we would love to connect with you and help you grow your career!

Advantages
  • Competitive compensation - depending on experience
  • Monday - Friday daytime hours with flexibility
  • Great casual company culture with a family-feel
  • Advancement potential due to incredible company growth
  • Great benefit packages are available
  • Free parking on site

Responsibilities
  • Producing monthly financial statements
  • Financial analysis and recommendations
  • Inventory management
  • Assist with the preparation of budgets and annual audits
  • Monitor cash flows, debt levels and operating metrics
  • Training and mentoring of other members of the finance group
  • Ensuring day-to-day operations run smoothly
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
  • CPA designation is required with a Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Business
  • Previous industry experience as a controller (preferably in retail, construction or manufacturing)
  • Outstanding communication, interpersonal and leadership skills
  • Superior understanding of general accounting principles
  • Great computer skills (MS Office, Excel and Sage 300)
  • High attention to detail and ability to work in a deadline-driven environment
  • Ability to travel (within Canada)

Summary
  • Apply directly on this site
  • Go to our website at www.randstad.ca, create a profile and apply directly
  • Email your resume to lena.vincent@randstad.ca and include the title of the position in the subject line.

At this time we are no longer accepting walk-in candidates to our office as it is closed due to COVID-19. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to hearing from you soon!

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position and only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Contrôleur / Controller
description:
Contrôleur

Le contrôleur est responsable de toutes les activités de comptabilité, de paie et de fiscalité de lentreprise. Il veille à ce que les registres financiers soient bien tenus, à lexactitude de la paie, au respect de la législation fiscale et en assurant en permanence des contrôles internes solides.Le rôle de contrôleur relève directement du Vice-Président Finances et travaille en collaboration avec le Directeur de FP&A.

Ce Que Tu Feras
  • Gérer le processus de fin de mois ainsi que la production des états financiers
  • S’assurer que toutes les conciliations sont effectuées de façon régulière
  • Fournir des informations financières à valeur ajoutée (Opex, Capex, détails de fournisseurs) aux gestionnaires des départements et les assister dans l’optimisation de la performance budgétaire
  • Gérer le «Vendor Master» ainsi que le cycle des comptes payables
  • Superviser le processus de paie, soccuper de générer les reçus fiscaux annuels ainsi que toute documentation requise par les employés
  • Effectuer les déclarations et remises mensuelles des taxes à la consommation et effectuer les calculs d’impôts corporatifs
  • Diriger la prise d’information afin d’effectuer les calculs liés aux crédits d’impôts
  • Effectuer des analyses financières et jouer un rôle clé dans lamélioration des processus
  • Gérer le processus d’audit annuel ainsi que toute autre vérification requise
  • Superviser l’équipe des comptes payables
Ce Que Tu As Besoin D’avoir
  • 6 à 8 years dexpérience en comptabilité financière ou en audit
  • Fortes connaissances des systèmes comptables connaissance de NetSuite et des outils danalytique comme Alteryx
  • la préparation des états financiers avec un minimum de retard et de retouches
  • Fortes connaissances dans le «reporting by channel» ou par segment incluant la façon de structurer l’information pour atteindre ce but
  • Expérience requise avec les achats, les inventaires, l’établissement des coûts (costing), les provisions et ses déclinaisons
  • Bonnes connaissances des lois et règlements en lien avec la taxation en Amérique du Nord - taxes de ventes, impôt des sociétés et crédits d’impôts
Ce Que Tu y Gagneras
  • Gros rabais sur des marques de plein air et de mode pour vous et votre famille
  • Ensemble complet davantages médicaux et dentaires
  • Accès complet aux services de télémédecine via lapplication Dialogue
  • Budget dapprentissage et de développement
  • Options de travail flexibles
  • Un espace de travail moderne au cœur de la Petite Italie à Montréal
  • Possibilité de faire partie d’équipes sportives, de participer à des sorties de groupe et des concours, grâce à notre incroyable comité social.
Altitude Sports est le leader de la vente en ligne au Canada, et se spécialise dans la rencontre de la mode avec le plein air. Fondée en 1984, l’entreprise offre des conseils de premier plan en matière d’équipement et de vêtements techniques haut de gamme, en plus d’un programme d’avantages destinés à ses membres et d’une multitude de produits soigneusement sélectionnés pour les aventures urbaines et en plein air.

___________________________________________________________

Controller

The Controller is responsible for all accounting, payroll and tax activities of the company ensuring that financial records are well maintained, payroll accuracy, compliance with tax legislation and ensuring strong internal controls. The Controller role reports directly to the Vice President Finance and works in conjunction with the Director of FP&A.

What You Will Do
  • Manage the month-end process and production of the financial statements
  • Ensure all account reconciliations are performed routinely
  • Provide value-added financial information (Opex, Capex, Vendor details) to department leaders and budget owners to assist them in optimizing performance
  • Manage the Vendor Master and Accounts Payables cycles for the company
  • Manage the processing of Payroll along with the generation of annual tax receipts and other required employee payroll documentation
  • Ensure compliance with sales tax filings and perform corporate tax calculations
  • Lead the accumulation of input information and estimates for tax credits
  • Conduct financial analysis and be a key assets in processes improvements
  • Supervise the Accounts Payable department
  • Manage the annual financial audit and any other audit request
What You Need To Have
  • 6 to 8 years of experience in financial accounting or audit
  • Strong knowledge in Financial applications such as NetSuite and analytics tools such as Alteryx
  • Experience establishing clear month-end procedures, structuring chart of accounts and generating financial statements with minimal delays and rework
  • Strong understanding of channel or segmented financial reporting including how to structure input information to achieve this goal
  • Experience with purchasing, inventory flows, costing, provisions and component break-downs
  • Good knowledge of taxation rules within North America - sales, corporate and tax credits
What’s In It For You
  • Discounts on outdoor and fashion brands for you and your family
  • Comprehensive health and dental benefits package
  • Full access to Telemedicine services through the Dialogue app
  • Learning and Development Budget
  • Flexible working options
  • A modern workspace in the heart of Montreal’s Little Italy
  • Opportunity to participate in sport teams, group outings and contests
Altitude Sports is Canadas ecommerce leader, working and playing at the intersection of fashion and the outdoors. Founded in 1984, the company offers best-in-class advice on premium gear and technical apparel, a members-only benefits program and a curated selection of products for outdoor adventures and urban pursuits.

title: Controller
description:
Description

This is an exciting role for someone who enjoys managing all aspects of Accounting, in a fast paced, high energy environment.

Our client in Toronto is seeking a highly capable, hands-on Controller (3-6 month contract). Potential for permanent, full-time employment.

The Controller reports directly to the President/Owner. They will manage a team of 4 direct reports.

Key Responsibilities
  • Plan, supervise, and assist the Accounting Team in performing daily, weekly, and monthly accounting processes to properly record, classify and control financial transactions
  • Perform tasks associated with month-end and year-end close of financial statements, account reconciliations & G/L analysis
  • Prepare periodic reports for management by collecting, analyzing, and consolidating financial data and trends
  • Prepare budgets and recommend plans
  • Prepare and maintain cash flow forecasts and projections to effectively manage cash balances
  • Lead the annual audit process with external auditors
  • Perform tax planning functions
  • Credit adjudication and administration (including credit limit management, new customer appraisal, existing account limit changes
  • Establish and maintain strong accounting controls sufficient to ensure compliance with all applicable laws, regulations and mandates of all governing bodies, and advise management on needed actions
  • Develop, implement and maintain policies, procedures, and internal controls
  • Maintain Accounting Team job results by coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results
  • Other responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time
Requirements

Qualifications and Experience:
  • Bachelors and/or Master’s Degree (preferred) in Accounting or Finance; CA or CPA designation is preferred
  • Seven or more years of overall financial and managerial accounting experience with two or more years in a supervisory capacity
  • Strong knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles and Canadian tax legislation
  • Must be self-motivated and work well under pressure
  • Excellent communication, management and interpersonal skills, with the ability to identify issues and solutions, and ensure timely project completion with minimal supervision
  • Strong command of MS Excel. Experience with Xero software is an asset
  • Ability to speak both English and Chinese (Cantonese/Mandarin) is preferred
If you have the right qualifications and experience, please apply to this position today.

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.3198. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Controller
description:
Description

This is an exciting role for someone who enjoys managing all aspects of Accounting, in a fast paced, high energy environment.

Our client in Toronto is seeking a highly capable, hands-on Controller (3-6 month contract). Potential for permanent, full-time employment.

The Controller reports directly to the President/Owner. They will manage a team of 4 direct reports.

Key Responsibilities
  • Plan, supervise, and assist the Accounting Team in performing daily, weekly, and monthly accounting processes to properly record, classify and control financial transactions
  • Perform tasks associated with month-end and year-end close of financial statements, account reconciliations & G/L analysis
  • Prepare periodic reports for management by collecting, analyzing, and consolidating financial data and trends
  • Prepare budgets and recommend plans
  • Prepare and maintain cash flow forecasts and projections to effectively manage cash balances
  • Lead the annual audit process with external auditors
  • Perform tax planning functions
  • Credit adjudication and administration (including credit limit management, new customer appraisal, existing account limit changes
  • Establish and maintain strong accounting controls sufficient to ensure compliance with all applicable laws, regulations and mandates of all governing bodies, and advise management on needed actions
  • Develop, implement and maintain policies, procedures, and internal controls
  • Maintain Accounting Team job results by coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results
  • Other responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time
Requirements

Qualifications and Experience:
  • Bachelors and/or Master’s Degree (preferred) in Accounting or Finance; CA or CPA designation is preferred
  • Seven or more years of overall financial and managerial accounting experience with two or more years in a supervisory capacity
  • Strong knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles and Canadian tax legislation
  • Must be self-motivated and work well under pressure
  • Excellent communication, management and interpersonal skills, with the ability to identify issues and solutions, and ensure timely project completion with minimal supervision
  • Strong command of MS Excel. Experience with Xero software is an asset
  • Ability to speak both English and Chinese (Cantonese/Mandarin) is preferred
If you have the right qualifications and experience, please apply to this position today.

title: Controller
description:
Who We Are

We are a dynamic, growth-oriented, and safety-focused company. Our organization has been deemed to be an “essential service” by providing collection and processing for Waste and Recycling that keep our communities clean and safe. With customer service and safety as our focus, we are looking for an energetic and driven employee to support our growing company and play a crucial role in waste diversion. Emterra is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers, a certified diverse supplier of the Canadian Aboriginal and Minority Supplier Council (CAMSC), the Canadian Women Business Enterprise National Council (WBE) and WEConnect International.

As a key member of the BC Management Team, the Controller position is a hands-on role responsible for ensuring that the Accounting and Finance team provides the services necessary to support the operational and financial success of the organization. Reporting directly to the CEO, the successful candidate will be an articulated and motivated seasoned professional, filled with passion and commitment to help us grow and succeed for the future. The Controller is an expert at building relationships with stakeholders at all levels – both internally and externally and your career demonstrates entrepreneurial achievements.

What You Will Achieve In This Role
  • Oversee the preparation of monthly consolidated financial statements for Emterra Group and coordinate external year-end review;
  • Manage multi-location financial reporting, including standardization of reporting and review processes;
  • Manage Accounting Services (payroll, AP, AR and general accounting) and organize department assignment;
  • Analyze and interpret accounting and operational data to forecast profitability and performance against budget;
  • Coach, train and evaluate performance of direct reports;
  • Identify new opportunities that drive financial success;
  • Ensure the timely preparation of month-end financial statements;
  • Lead month-end close for all divisions and maintain various schedules such as fixed assets, amortization schedules, month-end adjusting entries;
  • Assist in reconciliations as required for audited financial statements;
  • Provide commentary on monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements and insight on individual operations across the region;
  • Initiate and implement process improvement and accounting control measures;
  • Assume responsibility for the coordination and submission of annual budget preparation; and
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
What You Bring To The Table
  • Completion of relevant post-secondary education (minimum Bachelor’s degree in related field);
  • Professional designation (CA, CGA or CMA);
  • Minimum of 5 years experience in a Controller role within a large private organization;
  • Experience in the waste/recycling, manufacturing, and/or transportation industry considered an asset;
  • Demonstrated business acumen, strategic thinking and an ability to execute against formulated strategy;
  • Strong leadership skills, able to effect positive change through structured training, coaching and engagement initiatives;
  • Prior experience managing a team of both direct and indirect reports in a multi-site operating environment;
  • Process-oriented thinking with strong analytical skills and a detail-oriented commitment to excellence;
  • Exceptional customer service skills with both internal and external stakeholders;
  • Excellent command of the English language and strong presentation skills;
  • Proficient with MS Office Suite along with experience in or the willingness/capacity to learn industry-specific programs; and
  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamic – Business Central considered an asset.
Reasons To Apply, Stay And Grow With Emterra Group
  • Competitive Wages
  • Comprehensive health benefits (drug, dental, vision, LTD, life insurance)
  • Tuition reimbursement program and professional development support
  • Employee discount programs

title: Controller
description:
Haldimand Motors Ltd.

Cayuga, On

If you are interested or know someone who is, reach out to careers@autocan.ca now!

Who We Want

We are looking for a Controller who will manage the accounting and reporting functions as well as the accounting processes and procedures at Haldimand Motors Ltd. You will report directly and work in partnership with the Dealer Principal, John Edelman.

This pivotal role is an integral member of Haldimand Motors’ senior management team and will participate actively in the both the financial and operational functions of the dealership.

It is our goal to be the destination for top talent and we are committed to providing our team members with meaningful and challenging work, an engaging and collaborative environment, recognition for performance, and opportunities for growth and advancement by cultivating a culture of excellence and aspiring to be best-in-class in the industry.

Why This is the Perfect Opportunity For You

AutoCanada is a CADA Laureate Winner in Business Innovation and a TXS30 Winner , with no small part due to our cutting-edge operational analytics. Join this enthusiastic and highly effective team that has no end to challenging and interesting work. We are growing, and our mindset is expansionary, with so much potential for the right person!

Culture at AutoCanada is everything! Our greatest accomplishment is having a productive culture.

Our Culture Is Based On
  • Drive for Performance
  • Trust & Transparency
  • People Development
  • Promoting from Within
  • Accountability to Ourselves & to Each Other
PROFIT IS THE RESULT – NOT THE VISION. That’s why we are looking for a Controller who is passionate about automotive and who is genuinely motivated by leading and coaching a team to success!

What We Offer
  • Industry-leading Pay Plan
  • Paid vacation
  • Health and Dental Benefits (of course)
  • A team full of GRIT – passion & perseverance
  • An opportunity to be part of an exciting, GROWING BUSINESS
The Role
  • Provide support and supervision to the Finance Department composed of three people.
  • Meet all monthly, quarterly, and annual deadlines as required by Home Office and the Dealer Principal including monthly reconciliations, monthly and quarterly reporting, covenant calculations, financial analysis, year-end reporting, budget preparation, etc.
  • Coordinate all activities within the Finance Department including accounts payable, accounts receivable, general accounting, payroll, special projects accounting, financial planning and reporting.
  • Participate in scheduled departmental Managers' meetings.
  • Perform all duties and responsibilities in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.
  • Working with IT department to assist in integration of company’s data and program development.
  • Supervise and assist with recording all business transactions, process accruals and adjustments, reconcile accounts and payroll activities and prepare monthly accounting statements
  • Advise management in financial planning activities, revenue generation and cost control opportunities, efficiency improvements.
  • Coordinate the development of the operating and capital budgets.
  • Ensure the maintenance of the fixed asset inventory control system.
  • Keep abreast of federal, provincial and municipal developments, laws and policies that may affect the financial operations of the organization.
  • Review and maintain all dealership contracts
  • Coach, mentor, lead, and train accounting team members at the dealership
What You Bring to the Table but we’re totally flexible for the right person
  • Completion of post-secondary education in accounting or a related field
  • A minimum of 5 years or more of relevant work experience
  • Experience working in a dealership would be considered an asset
  • Prior experience in an accounting oversight role is required
  • A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including negotiation and conflict resolution skills
  • Excellent verbal/written communication combined with the ability to interact and gain the support of senior leadership and other decision-makers
  • Ability to manage priorities, perform a variety of tasks and meet required deadlines and targets
  • Excellent skills in Word and Excel.
  • Knowledge of Sage and Payworks systems would be considered an asset
  • Experience managing large corporate sales accounts would be considered an asset
If for some reason you don’t know Who We Are…

AutoCanada is a publicly traded multi-location automotive dealership group operating in both Canada and the United States with a home base in Edmonton, AB. Founded in 2006, AutoCanada has expanded significantly and continues to grow.  For more information about AutoCanada, check out https://www.autocan.ca/ , Instagram , Facebook .

title: Controller
description:
Qui Vous Êtes

Vous êtes un(e) contrôleur(e) unique en son genre qui entretient de bonnes relations avec toutes les parties prenantes, à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur de l'organisation. Vous apportez à la table les meilleures pratiques en matière de comptabilité technique et opérationnelle et vous êtes fier de veiller à ce que les états financiers et les rapports soient conformes aux normes et règlements comptables. Bien que vous soyez l'expert technique, vous connaissez également le fonctionnement des entreprises et êtes au fait des politiques et des pratiques actuelles et futures possibles. Vous voyez les tendances et les informations qui ont une incidence sur l'entreprise et l'organisation. Vous pouvez voir au-delà des chiffres et donner un aperçu de la façon dont les chiffres influent sur les activités quotidiennes de l'entreprise. Grâce à vos années d'expérience, vous savez comment les stratégies et les tactiques fonctionnent sur le marché.

Votre mission chez Inter-Power Group, une compagnie de Flow Control Group (FCG) Canada, est de mettre à profit votre expérience diversifiée pour aider notre équipe non seulement dans les activités comptables quotidiennes mais aussi dans les priorités stratégiques à plus long terme.

Vous superviserez ainsi les activités de la compagnie Inter-power Group et par la suite, vous superviserez également les activités comptables d'une autre compagnie de FCG. L'objectif est de mettre en place une structure de services partagés entre les sociétés.

Principales Responsabilités
  • Superviser les fonctions comptables des services partagés de FCG Canada;
  • Fournir un soutien technique en matière de comptabilité aux subordonnés directs;
  • Gérer et encadrer une équipe diversifiée de comptables, de techniciens comptables et d'employés des comptes créditeurs et débiteurs;
  • Réaliser des gains d'efficacité en élargissant le rôle des services partagés de comptabilité au Canada;
  • Trouver des gains d'efficacité en réalignant les rôles/postes et en optimisant un ERP moderne;
  • Proposer et diriger la mise en œuvre d'améliorations des processus et/ou de nouvelles technologies;
  • Élaborer, mettre en œuvre, examiner et documenter les processus afin de s'assurer qu'ils sont conformes aux normes et aux exigences réglementaires;
  • S'assurer que les contrôles internes sont mis en œuvre et suivis;
  • Jouer un rôle clé dans le processus d'examen et d'approbation des grands livres généraux, des grands livres auxiliaires et des calendriers d'appui;
  • Planifier et préparer l'examen/audit annuel;
  • Coordonner les provisions et les déclarations fiscales avec les conseillers fiscaux;
  • Coordonner et superviser le processus de clôture de fin de mois;
  • Préparer les rapports financiers mensuels;
  • Soutenir le budget annuel et le processus de prévision mensuel;
  • Préparer des rapports ad hoc pour aider la direction à prendre des décisions;
  • Toutes les autres tâches qui peuvent être confiées de temps à autre.
Exigences
  • Baccalauréat en comptabilité avec titre CPA ou un titre international de nature similaire;
  • Au moins 3 ans d'expérience dans un poste similaire;
  • Bilingue (anglais/français);
  • Expérience de travail dans des organisations de tailles diverses;
  • Une expérience en cabinet public dans une entreprise de taille moyenne est un atout;
  • Bonne maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office, notamment d’Excel;
  • La connaissance de Prophet 21 est un atout.
Capacités Et Aptitudes
  • Excellent souci du détail (minutie)
  • Fortes capacités d’analyse et d’interprétation stratégique des résultats
  • Esprit et leadership d’équipe
  • Aptitude à respecter les échéances imposées dans un environnement dynamique;
  • Capacité à gérer plusieurs dossiers simultanément;
  • Faire preuve d'initiative et possède un bon jugement;
  • Autonomie et polyvalence.
  • Vision stratégique
  • Bon sens de l’organisation
Avantages Du Poste
  • Faire partie d'une équipe dynamique et en croissance
  • Un programme de bonification pour tous les employés
  • 3 semaines de vacances dès la première année
  • Des assurances collectives payées à 60% par l'employeur
  • Un programme de REER collectif avec participation de l'employeur
* Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et a pour seul objectif d'alléger le texte.*

Veuillez noter que seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées. Nous tenons à remercier tous les candidats pour votre intérêt envers Inter-Power Group, une companie de Flow Control Group.

Who You Are

You are one of a kind Controller who relates well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization. You bring to the table best practices in technical and operational accounting and take pride in ensuring financial statements and reporting are in accordance with accounting standards and regulations. While you are the technical expert, you also know how businesses work and are knowledgeable in current and possible future policies and practices. You see trends, and information affecting the business and organization. You can see beyond the numbers and provide insight into how the numbers effect day-to-day business operations. Through your years of experience, you are aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace.

Your mission at Inter-Power Group, a Flow Control Group (FCG) Canada Company, is to use your diverse experience to assist our team in not only day-to-day accounting activities but also longer-term strategic priorities.

You will supervise the activities of the company Inter-power Group and later, you will also supervise the accounting activities of another company of FCG. The goal is to set up a shared services structure between the companies.

About The Role
  • Oversee the accounting functions for FCG Canada Shared Services
  • Provide technical accounting support to direct reports
  • Manage and coach a diverse team of accountants, accounting technicians and A/P & A/R positions
  • Drive towards efficiencies by expanding the accounting shared service role within Canada
  • Find efficiencies by realigning roles/positions and optimizing a modern ERP
  • Propose and lead the implementation of processes improvements and/or new technologies
  • Develop, implement, review and document processes to ensure they comply with standards and regulatory requirements
  • Ensure internal controls are implemented and followed
  • Play a key role in the review and approval process of general ledgers, sub-ledgers and supporting schedules
  • Plan and prepare for the annual review / audit
  • Coordinate tax provision and returns with tax consultants
  • Coordinate and supervise the month end close process
  • Prepare monthly financial reports
  • Support the annual budget and monthly forecast process
  • Prepare ad-hoc reports to support management decision-making
  • All other items as may be assigned from time to time
Required Experience
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting with CPA designation or an international designation of a similar nature
  • At least 3 years’ experience in a similar position
  • Experience working in organizations of various size
  • Experience in public practice with a mid-sized firm is an asset
  • Bilingual (English/French)
  • Good knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel
  • Knowledge of Prophet 21 is an asset
Competencies
  • Excellent attention to detail (thoroughness)
  • Strong analytical skills and strategic interpretation of results
  • Team spirit and leadership
  • Ability to meet deadlines in a dynamic environment
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously;
  • Demonstrate initiative and good judgment;
  • Autonomy and versatility.
  • Strategic vision
  • Good organizational skills
Position Benefits
  • Being part of a dynamic and growing team
  • A bonus program for all employees
  • 3 weeks of vacation as of the first year
  • Group insurance paid at 60% by the employer
  • A group RRSP program with employer participation
Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted. We would like to thank all applicants for your interest in Inter-Power Group, a Flow Control Group company.

title: Responsable de la comptabilité / Accounting Manager
description:
Responsable de la comptabilité

Division : Finances

Département : Finances

Se rapporte à : Assistant(e) directeur(rice) des finances
  • En raison des lois locales, nous considérerons prioritairement les candidats ayant l’autorisation de travailler au Canada, et s’exprimant parfaitement en français et en anglais, à l’oral et à l’écrit.
Le Four Seasons Hôtel Montréal est à la recherche d’une personne qui partage notre passion pour l’excellence et cherche à créer une expérience mémorable pour nos employés et nos clients. Nous recherchons une personne qui a une solide éthique de travail, un haut niveau d’intégrité, un souci de qualité, une sensibilité culturelle et un sens du service client.

Résumé du poste

Le Responsable de la comptabilité vient en aide à l’Assistant(e) directeur(rice) des finances pour veiller au bon déroulement des opérations financières de l'hôtel et superviser les tâches comptables quotidiennes tout en s'assurant de se conformer aux lois corporatives et locales. De surcroît, cette personne est responsable de la supervision des autres divisions du département des finances, se rapportant à l’Assistant(e) directeur(rice) des finances soient : la paie, les comptes payables et les encaissements généraux, le tout conformément aux politiques et procédures locales et corporatives.

Fonctions humaines
  • Maintenir des relations harmonieuses et professionnelles avec tous les départements et le siège social ;
  • Respecter et appliquer les règles de travail et les normes de conduite de la catégorie Une et de la catégorie Deux de Four Seasons énoncées dans EmPact (Livret d’Accueil et Règlement Intérieur) ;
  • Planifier, organiser, diriger et contrôler différents projets et activités au sein de l'équipe financière ;
  • Identifier les occasions de faire du coaching et s'assurer que ces moments deviennent des opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement pour l'équipe des finances ;
  • Établir un lien entre l'équipe des finances et les autres divisions de l'hôtel ;
  • Avoir une perspective de travail globale et d'excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale ;
  • Avoir la capacité de superviser, d'encadrer et de motiver l'équipe financière et leur assurer un soutien et une aide appropriés lorsque cela est nécessaire ;
  • S’entretenir régulièrement avec l’Assistant(e) directeur(rice) des finances pour communiquer toutes les activités comptables ou autres qui affecterait les résultats de l’entreprise ou l’équipe ;
  • Préparer les évaluations annuelles et les plans de développement et prendre les mesures appropriées avec l'équipe (embaucher, féliciter, discipliner, évaluer, etc.) selon les besoins ;
  • Se comporter de manière professionnelle en tout temps.
Fonctions techniques
  • Comprendre et posséder une connaissance approfondie du manuel de comptabilité et de la finance ;
  • Excellente compréhension des processus de clôtures mensuelles, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter à, la préparation des états financiers, des écritures de journaux et courus, réconciliations pour tous les comptes de bilan dans les formats d'entreprises établis et conformément aux principes comptables généralement reconnus ;
  • Une grande attention aux détails ainsi qu'une innovation continue du travail quotidien de l'équipe des finances sous la direction du directeur des finances ;
  • Coordonner, observer et préparer tous les équipements d'exploitation et fournir des inventaires conformément aux politiques de l'entreprise et selon les directives du Directeur des Finances ;
  • Assurer que la situation de trésorerie soit suffisante aux besoins des opérations et alerter le Directeur financier dans le cas contraire ;
  • Aider à la préparation de tous les budgets et prévisions ;
  • Excellente compréhension de l'édition actuelle de l'USALI ;
  • Préparer avec minutie l'ensemble des rapports mensuels, des déclarations des revenus locales, étatiques et fédérales et d'autres rapports (y compris les rapports de la règle 80-20) ;
  • S'assurer que les taux de change exacts dans les rapports financiers sont appliqués dans la monnaie locale (le cas échéant) et évalués dans la monnaie stipulée dans le contrat de gestion ;
  • Préparer et participer à toutes les écritures de journal avec les pièces justificatives (le cas échéant) et s'assurer que toutes les écritures non standard et non récurrentes sont contresignées par le directeur des finances ;
  • S'assurer que le système est configuré de manière à empêcher la clôture du mois sans que toutes les écritures de journal soient enregistrées, mises à jour ou saisies dans le grand livre général ;
  • Participer aux rapprochements mensuels pour tous les comptes du bilan et tous les rapprochements bancaires sont contresignés par le directeur des finances sur une base mensuelle et trimestrielle ; le directeur des finances approuve tous les rapprochements en accordant une attention particulière aux éléments de rapprochement.
  • Coordonner et faciliter les audits externe et interne ;
  • Selon les besoins, avoir une connaissance pratique des procédures comptables de l'établissement (ou d'une autre entité) et de leur incidence sur les finances de l'hôtel ;
  • S'efforcer continuellement d'améliorer les processus et l'efficacité ;
Fonctions stratégiques
  • Surveiller et contrôler les dépenses de l'hôtel et traiter les problèmes qui ont non seulement un effet sur la rentabilité de l’entreprise, mais également sur l’expérience des clients ;
  • S'assurer que les comptes des fonds de caisse sont à jour et limiter tout type d'exposition qui pourrait affecter la rentabilité ;
  • Aider le Directeur adjoint des finances à établir les prévisions et les budgets ;
  • Pour les établissements qui maintiennent des bilans complets incluant les immobilisations, s'assurer que les comptes de dépréciation accumulée sont exacts et correctement enregistrés ;
Qualifications Et Compétences Souhaitées
  • Deux (2) à cinq (5) ans d'expérience dans un département financier, de préférence dans un hôtel ;
  • Pouvoir communiquer parfaitement en anglais et en français, à l’oral et à l’écrit ;
  • Connaissance technique fonctionnelle des principes comptables généralement reconnus. La connaissance pratique est généralement apprise au travail ou à travers une série de certifications professionnelles ;
  • Sens stratégique, analytique aigue et solide sens des affaires ;
  • Compétences de leadership éprouvées dans un environnement Hôtelier ;
  • Le plus haut niveau d'intégrité et de transparence ;
  • Être force de proposition ;
  • Solides compétences interpersonnelles et relationnelles pour travailler avec des équipes multifonctionnelles ;
  • Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale pour préparer et diffuser des rapports, des présentations efficaces et pour faciliter les réunions ;
  • Promouvoir un environnement d'apprentissage continu qui crée une atmosphère pour les opportunités de développement professionnel ;
  • Travailler de manière sûre, prudente et organisée ;
  • Connaissance et capacité d'opérer du matériel informatique et du logiciel Excel. La connaissance de SUN et du système Opera serait idéale et très appréciée.
Avantages pour vous    
  • Couverture maladie complémentaire (soins dentaires, vision, assurance-vie, médicaments sur ordonnance, etc.) 
  • Réductions au restaurant MARCUS et à notre spa 5 étoiles   
  • Journées et événements pour les employés tels qu'Employé du mois, célébrations des années de service, événements d'anniversaire, et plus encore!    
  • Repas gratuit par quart de travail dans la salle à manger de nos employés (Café 1440)   
  • Plan de retraite avec contribution de l'employeur   
  • Congés payés: jours de maladie, jours de vacances et 2 jours fériés flottants supplémentaires par an   
  • Opportunités de formation, de développement et de mobilité 
  • Programme de voyage des employés, y compris les séjours gratuits au Four Seasons dans le monde (selon la durée du service et sous réserve de disponibilité)   
  • Et plus !  
La liste des tâches précisées ci-dessus n’est pas exhaustive, votre fonction supposera une adaptation constante à des situations variées en fonction de l’activité de l’hôtel.

Notre organisation est un employeur sensibilisé envers l’équité professionnelle et qui s'engage à recruter une main-d'œuvre diversifiée et à maintenir une culture inclusive. L’usage du masculin n’est utilisé qu’aux fins d’alléger le texte. Nous ne discriminons pas en fonction du genre, de l'appartenance ethnique, de la religion, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'âge, du handicap ou de toute autre base protégée par les lois provinciales ou fédérales

Accounting Manager

Division: Finance

Department: Finance

Reports to: Assistant Director of Finance
  • Due to local laws, we prioritize applicants who have permission to work in Canada, and are fluent in both English and French, both orally and in writing.
The Four Seasons Hotel Montreal is looking for someone who shares our passion for excellence and seeks to create a memorable experience for our employees and guests. We are looking for a person who has a strong work ethic, a high level of integrity, a concern for quality, a cultural sensitivity and a sense of customer service.

Job Summary

The Accounting Manager is responsible for assisting the Assistant Director of Finance in the administration of all financial aspects of the Hotel’s operations and supervising the day-to-day operation of the accounting office while ensuring that all local and corporate policies and procedures are observed. Additionally, the Accounting Manager may be responsible for supervising other areas within the Finance Department under the direction of the Assistant Director of Finance, including payroll, accounts payable, and general cashiering.

People Functions
  • Maintain harmonious and professional relationship with all departments and Corporate Office ;
  • Comply with and enforce Four Seasons’ Category One and Category Two Work Rules and Standards of Conduct as set forth in EmPact ;
  • Plan, organize, lead and control different projects and activities within the finance team ;
  • Identify coaching moments and ensure that those moments become opportunities of learning and development for the Finance team ;
  • Establish a rapport with the Finance team and other divisions within the hotel.
  • Have a global working perspective and excellent communication skills – written and verbal ;
  • Great understanding of Self-Esteem and Self-Actualization of Team and ensure proper support and help is provided whenever needed ;
  • Have the ability to supervise the day-to-day duties of the Finance team and assist as necessary ;
  • Supervise, train and motivate department staff to thoroughly understand all of their duties and responsibilities ;
  • Meet with the Assistant Director of Finance on a regular basis to communicate all accounting activities and results of the Accounting office meeting or any other related issues ;
  • Prepare reviews and development plans and take appropriate personnel-related action (i.e. hire, commend, discipline, evaluate, etc.) with Accounting staff as required ;
  • Conduct self in a professional manner at all times.
Product Functions
  • Thoroughly understand and possess a working knowledge of the Accounting & Finance Manual ;
  • Thorough understanding of Month-End Process including, but not limited to, preparation of financial statements, accruals and journal entries, maintain reconciliations for all balance sheet accounts in established corporate formats and in accordance with generally accepted accounting principals ;
  • Great attention to detail along with a continuous innovation of daily working of the Finance team under the direction of the Director of Finance ;
  • Coordinate, observe and prepare all operating equipment and supply inventories in accordance with corporate policies and as directed by the Director of Finance ;
  • Prepare Daily Cash Position report and maintain the highest level of investment of excess funds in accordance with corporate guidelines as prescribed in the Accounting & Finance Manual ;
  • Assist in the preparation of all budgets and forecasts ;
  • Excellent understanding of the current Edition of USALI ;
  • Prepare all local, state and federal tax returns and other reporting (including 80-20 rule reporting) on a timely basis ;
  • Ensure accurate exchange rates in Financial Reporting are applied to the local currency (where applicable) and valued in the currency stipulated in the Management Agreement ;
  • Prepare and assist in all journal entries with supporting documentation (as appropriate) and ensure all non-standard, non-recurring entries are countersigned by Director of Finance ;
  • Ensure the system is set up to prevent month end closing without all journal entries being posted, updated or otherwise entered into the General Ledger ;
  • Assist in monthly reconciliations for all balance sheet accounts are prepared and all bank reconciliations are countersigned by Director of Finance on a monthly and on a quarterly basis; Director of Finance approves all reconciliations paying special attention to reconciling items ;
  • Facilitate external and internal audits ;
  • As required, have a working knowledge of residential (or other entity) accounting procedures and how it affects the hotel’s financials ;
  • Continuously strive for improvement of processes and efficiency.
Profit Functions
  • Monitor and control expenses of the hotel paying special attention to the daily reporting done by the auditor of the hotel and addressing issues that not only have material effect, but also effect the guest experience ;
  • Ensure that House Funds and Floats Counts are up to date and limit any kind of exposure that would affect the profitability ;
  • Assist the Assistant Director of Finance in Forecasting/Budgeting ;
  • For locations that maintain full balance sheets including fixed assets, ensure accumulated depreciation accounts are accurate and properly recorded.
Desired Qualifications And Skills
  • Two (2) to five (5) years' experience with a Finance Department, preferably within a hotel
  • Ability to communicate fluently in English and French, both orally and in writing;
  • Highest level of integrity and transparency;
  • Strategic, analytical and solid business acumen knowledge;
  • Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills to work with cross-functional teams;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills to prepare and deliver reports, effective presentations and to facilitate meetings;
  • Promote a continuous learning environment that creates an atmosphere for professional development opportunities;
  • Apply an ethical approach to influence the outcome of situations;
  • Serve as a role model for others by demonstrating appropriate business conduct and ethical principles;
  • Continuously seek to improve/develop the performance of others and continuously strive to improve own performance; Work in a safe, prudent and organized manner;
  • Clear understanding of the purpose and reasons for internal controls;
  • Understand and be familiar with hotel quality standards and service standards;
  • Strong commitment to service;
  • Require a working technical knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles. Working knowledge is generally learned on-the-job or through a series of professional certifications;
  • Require knowledge of and the ability to operate computer equipment and Microsoft Office Suite software. Sun and Opera Systems knowledge would be ideal and greatly valued;
What’s in it for you?    
  • Extended Health Coverage (dental, vision, life insurance, RMT, prescription drugs, etc.)
  • Discounts at our MARCUS Restaurant and our 5 Star Spa
  • Employee themed recognition days and events such as Employee of the month, Service milestone celebrations, birthday events, and more! 
  • Complimentary meal per shift in our employee dining room (Café 1440)
  • Retirement plan with employer contribution
  • Paid time off including sick days, vacation days and 2 additional floating holidays per year
  • Excellent training, development, and mobility opportunities
  • Employee Travel Program, including complimentary stays at Four Seasons globally (by length of service and subject to availability)
  • And so much more!
The list of tasks specified above is not exhaustive, the function will require a constant adaptation to situations of high activity and specific management of customer relations.
  • Our organization is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability or any other basis protected under provincial or federal laws.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Robert Half has an exciting opportunity for an ambitious Controller to join a well-respected professional services firm. In this leadership role, you will manage an accounting and clerical department. The Controller plans and directs all accounting operational functions, handles the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluates accounting and internal control systems, and leads departmental staff. Working with this company, you will receive competitive and comprehensive compensation and benefits package, as well as strong career growth. We want to hear from you if you can motivate others with your positive professional attitude; are honest, reliable and a leader; and can provide outstanding client services by managing self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability. As a leader, you will encourage innovative ideas that are sound and progressive, challenge the status quo, and support creativity in your area of responsibility. The permanent Controller position is situated in the North York, Ontario area.

Major responsibilities
  • Analyze, apply and improve policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
  • Oversee the activities of the accounting department, such as accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Ensure timely cash collection by driving the timing for monthly billing and other cash management techniques
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to facilitate efficient and effective firm-wide operation
  • Perform tasks associated with month-end and year-end close of income statement and balance sheet, account reconciliations & G/L analysis
  • Ensure deliverables of self and team meet client expectations
  • Support Finance Department initiatives, such as software and systems implementation and other departmental or firm-wide improvements, with research, planning, and implementation, as required
  • Flexible in completing tasks beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Manage the creation of and monthly monitoring of the annual budget and forecasts
  • Produce cash-flow reports, calculating cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals, and manage daily cash
  • Each month, present executive committee and partners with financial reports
Requirements
  • CPA designation
  • Solid understanding of small and medium sized Business SMB, coupled with experience working in a Professional Services Firm highly desired.
  • Notable analytical, quantitative and social skills
  • Self-starter with efficient time management and organizational skills
  • Progressive accounting experience, including as a Controller preferred
  • Skilled in the construction and delivery of effective presentations to audiences with wide-ranging backgrounds
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to prioritize deals and adapt to quick changes while remaining diligent, and to thrive in a dynamic, high pressure environment
  • Great written, verbal, and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to prioritize work and balance multiple projects and deadlines
If interested in learning more about this role and partnering with Robert Half in the search for your next full-time role, please apply online referencing Controller. Kindly note, due to volume - only those applicants who most closely match the hiring requirements of our clients will be contacted for a further conversation. We thank all applicants for their interest.

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.5461. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.
