title: Controller
description:
We have an incredible opportunity at our winery in Lake Country, BC for a Controller with hospitality experience (winery experience is an asset)

Peak Cellars is located in beautiful Lake Country, BC, surrounded by vineyards, orchards, and beautiful mountain views.

We are currently recruiting for a Controller with a minimum of five (5) years practical experience in full cycle accounting.

The candidate must be energetic, positive, self-motivated and have a strong work ethic with attention to detail and the ability to work with little supervision. The candidate must have the ability to help build the wineries and brand, while working with the larger team on building for the future. The business is very entrepreneurial and requires people that are willing to step up at times.

The ideal candidate will preferably have strong accounting knowledge and experience in the hospitality or winemaking industry. Experience in dealing with web-based sales would also be a strong asset.

Controller Functions And Responsibilities

Full cycle accounting including, but not limited to:
  • Accounts payable, accounts receivables, payroll review and coding.
  • Generating monthly reporting on business performance including income statements and job cost reports.
  • Provides leadership/mentorship to the Accounts Payable Coordinator and Finance Assistant.
  • Daily review of sales reconciliations for restaurant, winery, and accommodations.
  • Inventory tracking and management, fixed asset management, product costing and analysis, and budgeting and forecasting.
  • Monthly government and liquor board reporting and remittances.
  • Oversight of the developing online sales initiatives to support the overall growth objectives of the company.
  • Job costing and reporting for associated construction activities as the business makes significant capital investments expanding its existing operations.
  • Assesses the effectiveness of existing systems, processes and internal controls within the accounting/finance function and provides recommendations for improvements and executes improvements with a focus on efficiency.
  • Assist with estate property management.
Controller Qualifications And Experience
  • Accounting diploma from an accredited training institution.
  • Professional Accounting Designation is considered an asset.
  • Minimum of five (5) years' full cycle accounting experience.
  • Retail and Restaurant POS experience is an asset.
  • Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
  • Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) and ERP based financial systems.
Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

Location: Lake Country, BC

Peak Cellars (O'Rourke Family Vineyards Ltd) adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals and disabled persons to apply. We would like to thank all applicants for submitting their resume; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Controller
description:
Job Description

We are hiring a Controller in our Mississauga, ON or St. Thomas, ON locations!

As a Controller, you will be responsible for the day to day operations of the Finance Department and the timely & accurate reporting of all financial information including reports required by Company management, Masco Corporation and regulatory agencies.

You will provide leadership and coordination of Company reporting, compliance, internal control, and budget management functions.

In this role, you will ensure Company accounting procedures conform with both Canadian and U.S generally accepted accounting principles and consistent with Masco Accounting Policy.

What You Will Do
  • Plan, coordinate and advise the activities of General Accounting, AR, AP and Costing
  • Responsible for all monthly, quarterly and year-end closings and financial reporting
  • Ensure that all established policies, rules, regulations and agreements are followed
  • Ensure that all department processes and procedures are appropriately documented and followed
  • Maintain an adequate system of accounting records and set of controls
  • Keep abreast of current accounting trends, practices and regulations
  • Supervise and analyze monthly operating results against budget, forecast and prior year
  • Ensure compliance with local, provincial, and federal reporting requirements
  • Coordinate & supervise various transfer pricing relationships/reporting
  • Establish, implement and monitor short- and long-range departmental goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures
  • Manage and direct the performance, recruitment, retention and development of staff to effectively accomplish the department's goals and objectives
  • Recommend and monitor benchmarks for measuring financial and operating performance
  • Coordinate the various tax compliance reporting including statutory financial statements and act as Company representative for any financial and taxation audits, both internal and external
  • Assist VP Finance/CFO with administration of the various company pension plans
  • Advise VP Finance/CFO of significant matters within the financial reporting & the department
Who You Are
  • Detailed knowledge of finance, accounting, internal audit, budgeting, and cost control principles including Canadian and U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
  • Knowledge of automated financial and accounting reporting systems
  • Knowledge of federal and provincial financial and taxation regulations
  • Highly developed problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to analyze financial data and prepare financial reports, statements and projections
  • Solid understanding of short- and long-term budgeting and forecasting, rolling budgets, and product-line profitability analysis
  • Work requires professional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to empower teams to produce quality results within tight timeframes and simultaneously manage several projects
  • Ability to participate in and facilitate group meetings
  • Work requires willingness to work a flexible schedule including potentially extended hours during month end reporting and other key times during the fiscal year
  • Highly technical with a degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field accompanied with a recognized accounting designation (CPA, CA, CMA, CGA) with at least ten years experience in a senior level finance or accounting position in a mid-sized manufacturing environment.
  • Experience working for, or a subsidiary of, a public company
  • Sarbanes Oxley and a strong controls background
  • Significant costing experience
  • Management of a midsized accounting group
  • Maturity developed through diverse cultural or management environments to handle organization cultural change
  • Desire and ability to lead improvement in the level of excellence, and an appreciation for the requirements of all team members and customers
  • JD Edwards or similar ERP experience
  • Strong work ethic, hands on approach and willingness to work extended hours if required
Masco Canada (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and we want to have the best available persons in every job. The Company makes employment decisions only based on merit. title: Controller
description:
Job Description

We are hiring a Controller in our Mississauga, ON or St. Thomas, ON locations!

As a Controller, you will be responsible for the day to day operations of the Finance Department and the timely & accurate reporting of all financial information including reports required by Company management, Masco Corporation and regulatory agencies.

You will provide leadership and coordination of Company reporting, compliance, internal control, and budget management functions.

In this role, you will ensure Company accounting procedures conform with both Canadian and U.S generally accepted accounting principles and consistent with Masco Accounting Policy.

What You Will Do
  • Plan, coordinate and advise the activities of General Accounting, AR, AP and Costing
  • Responsible for all monthly, quarterly and year-end closings and financial reporting
  • Ensure that all established policies, rules, regulations and agreements are followed
  • Ensure that all department processes and procedures are appropriately documented and followed
  • Maintain an adequate system of accounting records and set of controls
  • Keep abreast of current accounting trends, practices and regulations
  • Supervise and analyze monthly operating results against budget, forecast and prior year
  • Ensure compliance with local, provincial, and federal reporting requirements
  • Coordinate & supervise various transfer pricing relationships/reporting
  • Establish, implement and monitor short- and long-range departmental goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures
  • Manage and direct the performance, recruitment, retention and development of staff to effectively accomplish the department's goals and objectives
  • Recommend and monitor benchmarks for measuring financial and operating performance
  • Coordinate the various tax compliance reporting including statutory financial statements and act as Company representative for any financial and taxation audits, both internal and external
  • Assist VP Finance/CFO with administration of the various company pension plans
  • Advise VP Finance/CFO of significant matters within the financial reporting & the department
Who You Are
  • Detailed knowledge of finance, accounting, internal audit, budgeting, and cost control principles including Canadian and U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
  • Knowledge of automated financial and accounting reporting systems
  • Knowledge of federal and provincial financial and taxation regulations
  • Highly developed problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to analyze financial data and prepare financial reports, statements and projections
  • Solid understanding of short- and long-term budgeting and forecasting, rolling budgets, and product-line profitability analysis
  • Work requires professional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to empower teams to produce quality results within tight timeframes and simultaneously manage several projects
  • Ability to participate in and facilitate group meetings
  • Work requires willingness to work a flexible schedule including potentially extended hours during month end reporting and other key times during the fiscal year
  • Highly technical with a degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field accompanied with a recognized accounting designation (CPA, CA, CMA, CGA) with at least ten years experience in a senior level finance or accounting position in a mid-sized manufacturing environment.
  • Experience working for, or a subsidiary of, a public company
  • Sarbanes Oxley and a strong controls background
  • Significant costing experience
  • Management of a midsized accounting group
  • Maturity developed through diverse cultural or management environments to handle organization cultural change
  • Desire and ability to lead improvement in the level of excellence, and an appreciation for the requirements of all team members and customers
  • JD Edwards or similar ERP experience
  • Strong work ethic, hands on approach and willingness to work extended hours if required
Masco Canada (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and we want to have the best available persons in every job. The Company makes employment decisions only based on merit. It is the Company’s policy to prohibit discrimination in any employment opportunity (including but not limited to recruitment, employment, promotion, salary increases, benefits, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment) based on race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, pregnancy, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, physical/mental disability, medical condition, marital/domestic partner status, military and veteran status, height, weight or any other such characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. The Company is committed to complying with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of the Company regardless of where the employee is located and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of the Company.

title: Controller (R&D), Abbott Point of Care (Ottawa)
description:
At Abbott, we're committed to helping you live your best possible life through the power of health. For more than 130 years, we've brought new products and technologies to the world -- in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals -- that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 113,000 of us are working to help people live not just longer, but better, in the more than 160 countries we serve.

Abbott Point of Care is a worldwide leader in providing with-patient care solutions that are intuitive, reliable, and cost-effective for our customers. By delivering lab-quality results in minutes, our i-STAT® System family of with-patient products and services fosters a collaborative, patient-centred environment while driving operational performance. We are headquartered in Princeton, New Jersey, with more than 1,500 global employees and a presence in 84 countries. Our 46,500 square metre manufacturing facility, Abbott Pointe, is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada

Status: Regular/Full Time

Position Overview

As the R&D Controller, this role provides financial counsel and support to Research and Development, Program Management, Marketing Vice Presidents and their senior staff members. Financial counsel and support are provided via the following specific activities: financial planning & analysis, financial reporting & analysis, general accounting, and internal control. The incumbent's primary function is to execute the full range of controllership responsibilities for the Research and Development and Program Management, while 1) ensuring timeliness, accuracy, and integrity of all financial information and 2) providing for compliance with Corporate and Division financial policies and procedures. Reporting directly to the Finance Director with operational responsibility to the business function Vice Presidents.

Responsibilities
  • Responsible for the full range of financial disciplines involving the entity reporting; planning; and financial consolidation impacting R&D and Program Management.
  • Entity and financial planning include general ledger accounting, tax, and ensuring compliance with applicable accounting policies/procedures.
  • Key financial partner/counsel to the Research and Development Director and other senior staff including provider of financial advice and input for program management.
  • Maintain a sustainable process to support actuals reporting, program forecasts and variance analysis.
  • Build and maintain dynamic financial forecasts to support monthly, annual and long-range plan forecasts.
  • Standardized financial models will include details supporting a complete financial build up, along with assumptions by program/spend categories by month and full program timeline.
  • Participate and own the financial portion of the Program Management process.
  • Provide financial support for division business cases for new product introduction, current product portfolio positioning and accelerated investment decisions.
  • Ensure adequate internal controls are established/maintained and compliance to established financial policies and procedures.
Required Education And Experience
  • Advanced degree (MBA, CPA and/or CMA) is desirable.
  • B.A./B.S. in Finance or Accounting.
  • 7 or more years of diverse financial experience including operations support, financial planning and analysis, general accounting, internal control/audit, project accounting support, and ad hoc analysis.
  • 4 or more years in a managerial position or role in Finance.
  • Strong organization, interpersonal, communication and management skills (persuasiveness and negotiation) are key. Highly organized individual capable of interfacing with individuals in a variety of senior management positions/levels.
  • Must have the ability to balance the needs of the organization when conflicting goals may exist. Demonstrate the ability to evaluate the tasks at hand and prioritize appropriately.
  • Forward thinking for effective strategic business planning a must.
  • Strong knowledge of accounting and finance principles with the ability to apply this knowledge to support business needs.
  • Ability to prioritize; strong organizational and planning skills; strong intellectual curiosity.
  • Must thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic company environment.
  • Strong financial modeling skills and business acumen, with the ability to drive projects from start to finish.
Abbott Canada is committed to the hiring, advancement and fair treatment of individuals without discrimination based on factors such as race, sex, colour, ethnic or national origin, religion, disability, age, citizenship, family or marital status, political beliefs, sexual preference or other factors included in human rights legislation.

Our diversity goals for recruitment, hiring, and retention are embedded in our corporate goals, and our diversity initiatives are supported by the highest level of the organization.

We strongly believe that a diverse workforce fosters more creative and innovative thinking throughout the organization. Creating an inclusive environment, where everyone is respected and valued, enables us to leverage our diversity as a business driver and strengthens our position as a global leader.

Abbott strives to promote and maintain an inclusive, high-performing culture that allows all employees to reach their full potential and contribute to Abbott’s success.

title: Controller
description:
Peak Cellars is located in beautiful Lake Country, BC, surrounded by vineyards, orchards, and beautiful mountain views.

We are currently recruiting for a Controller with a minimum of five (5) years practical experience in full cycle accounting.

The candidate must be energetic, positive, self-motivated and have a strong work ethic with attention to detail and the ability to work with little supervision. The candidate must have the ability to help build the wineries and brand, while working with the larger team on building for the future. The business is very entrepreneurial and requires people that are willing to step up at times.

The ideal candidate will preferably have strong accounting knowledge and experience in the hospitality or winemaking industry. Experience in dealing with web-based sales would also be a strong asset.

Controller Functions And Responsibilities

Full cycle accounting including, but not limited to:
  • Accounts payable, accounts receivables, payroll review and coding.
  • Generating monthly reporting on business performance including income statements and job cost reports.
  • Provides leadership/mentorship to the Accounts Payable Coordinator and Finance Assistant.
  • Daily review of sales reconciliations for restaurant, winery, and accommodations.
  • Inventory tracking and management, fixed asset management, product costing and analysis, and budgeting and forecasting.
  • Monthly government and liquor board reporting and remittances.
  • Oversight of the developing online sales initiatives to support the overall growth objectives of the company.
  • Job costing and reporting for associated construction activities as the business makes significant capital investments expanding its existing operations.
  • Assesses the effectiveness of existing systems, processes and internal controls within the accounting/finance function and provides recommendations for improvements and executes improvements with a focus on efficiency.
  • Assist with estate property management.
Controller Qualifications And Experience
  • Accounting diploma from an accredited training institution.
  • Professional Accounting Designation is considered an asset.
  • Minimum of five (5) years' full cycle accounting experience.
  • Retail and Restaurant POS experience is an asset.
  • Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
  • Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) and ERP based financial systems.
Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

Location: Lake Country, BC

Peak Cellars (O'Rourke Family Vineyards Ltd) adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals and disabled persons to apply. We would like to thank all applicants for submitting their resume; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Ad Controller (Abbotsford)
description:
Posted on April 20, 2022

Ad Controller (Abbotsford)

Black Press Media has an immediate opening for a full time Ad Controller, located in Abbotsford. This is an administration position, perfect for an organized individual with the ability to pay attention to details. This is an exciting fast-paced, team environment and the successful candidate must work well with others.

The position requires an individual that is flexible, can handle interruptions yet stay focused, works well under deadlines, and has a supportive nature. Problem-solving, decision-making, and strong communication abilities will be keys to success. Strong computer knowledge and the ability to learn new computer programs is essential.

Responsibilities include
  • Data entry of print and digital advertising campaigns
  • Processing cash, credit and debit cards, and cheque payments
  • Reconciling cash reports, bank deposits, account adjustments and coordinating with the corporate accounting department as needed.
  • This position is also responsible for laying out the newspaper, specialty publications, and features in consultation with Publishers, Advertising Managers, and Editors.
  • Reception duties including ordering supplies, sorting mail, shipping and receiving packages, and handling the main phone line are required.
This position is at the centre of the action, contributing to a team of dynamic marketing and editorial professionals. It is best suited to those who can offer our internal and external customers unparalleled gold standard service.

Black Press Media is Canada’s largest private community news media company with extensive digital and newspaper properties throughout B.C., Alberta, Washington, and Hawaii.

Black Press Media is a leading North American local news champion with operations across British Columbia, Alberta, Yukon, Northwest Territories, Nunavut, Washington State, Alaska, and Hawaii. Over 1,500 talented employees work with us to deliver unique community news and information across a full suite of traditional media channels and digital platforms. We value diverse viewpoints, new ways of thinking and a collaborative approach to delivering results.

If You Want To Be a Part Of Our Dynamic Team, Please Send Your Resume And Cover Letter By Monday April 25, 2022, To

Carly Ferguson, Group Publisher

carly.ferguson@blackpress.ca

Applications will be accepted until position is filled.

Only those selected for an interview will be contacted

title: Legal Entity Controller
description:
Company Description

Technicolor Creative Studios (TCS) is a creative technology company driven by one purpose: The realisation of ambitious and extraordinary ideas. We inspire creative companies across the world to produce their most iconic work.

Our award-winning teams of artists and technologists’ partner with the creative community across film, television, animation, gaming, brand experience and advertising to bring the universal art of storytelling to audiences everywhere.

Job Description

Reporting to the CAO - TCS, the Legal Entity Controller Canada (LE) will manage the financial control and accounting function including the production of management and financial accounts; records and associated controls; business partnering with multiple stakeholders and continuous finance transformation projects.

The primary responsibility of the role is to deliver consolidated view of the Canada legal entity’s accounting figures, in respect of compliance and accounting standards.

You will be supported by finance professionals from our Global Business Services (GBS) teams, who are responsible for the execution of our end-to-end transactional processes. In addition, you will partner with our divisional FP&A, Commercial Finance and RCC (Revenue and Cost Control) teams.

The role interacts with colleagues across European, Asian, and North American territories. Therefore, flexibility is required as the role will often require calls outside of normal working hours.

You will ensure co-ordination of all legal entity activity with key internal experts, such as tax, legal, treasury etc. and external providers.

Reporting
  • Improve and standardise management reporting processes within the legal entities/service line.
  • Legal entity controller ownership.
  • Closing sign-off, produce all management accounts actuals (P&L, Balance sheet & Cash flow) including variance commentary with support/input from GBS teams.
  • Report on balance sheet, working capital variance and provide detailed review and analysis of accruals, deferred income, and other key balance sheet accounts.
  • Ensure all IFRS 16 lease information and schedules are populated appropriately within the group lease management system.
Financial Compliance and Control
  • Support Finance transformation initiatives to deliver process standardisation/systemisation of revenue recognition, billing, reporting, and month end close processes.
  • Drive continuous improvements/simplification to processes and internal controls.
  • Ensure IFRS and Group Accounting Policies are implemented and maintained (Revenue Recognition, IFRS16, Intangible assets etc.) into each entity and line of business within your remit.
  • Constantly evaluate the period end process to ensure adherence to financial controls are achieved, and efficiencies are identified.
  • Ensure figures are reviewed with Business, Controlling and GBS.
  • Validate monthly/quarterly reconciliation of all balance sheet accounts and ensure proper documentation and follow up of all accounts based on risk-based procedure (including tax receivables/payables) in Blackline.
  • Request and approve intercompany flows (amount, assignment, …) for all non-goods flows.
  • Review and challenge most significant accounting journal entries with Commercial Finance, RCC, business and GBS and ensure proper application of local rules.
  • Provide technical accounting/policy guidance and write position papers.
  • Document and write procedures for all month end and other tasks.
Systems
  • Drive and align global trial balances to ensure all GL account/cost centre codes are used for the same nature of activities.
  • Ensure alignment of reporting in Group Reporting Systems.
  • Assume project management ownership of the TCS finance transformation initiatives and workstreams.
Tax & Treasury
  • Support the in-house tax team and external tax providers in relation to local tax compliance including transfer pricing reporting (computation and reporting).
  • Support the computation and completion of Deferred tax packages in collaboration with the tax team and GBS team.
  • Support the identification and proactively resolve issues that could result in tax misstatements and classification errors.
  • Monitor correct submission of all relevant tax declarations (CIT, VAT, other taxes, tax forms...) to local authorities by the Tax team and ensure payments are processed (GBS).
  • Report to Group Treasury requirements of FX exposures for all legal entities within your scope.
Other Controls/projects
  • Support internal/external audit management actions ensuring all reporting units in your scope comply with the requirements.
  • Prepare and coordinate external auditor review and monitor with the necessary escalation points to CAO then CFO then Corporate.
  • Support and lead 8Tics review and filing (Internal Audit controls).
  • Undertake any other reasonable task as requested.
  • Work in collaboration and support other TCS LE Controllers as and when required.
Qualifications

The ideal candidate for this role will be:
  • A qualified accountant ideally ACA/ACCA/CIMA/CPA/CA or other equivalent accounting qualification, with several years PQE.
  • An excellent communicator with the gravitas to manage both up and down.
  • Able to express complex / technical concepts to people from all backgrounds and levels.
  • Calm & organised; someone who thrives in a fast-paced world where priorities change.
Additional Information

Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to talent@thefocus.com and we'll be happy to assist.

TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Controller
description:
Are you a CPA-designated, hands-on Controller who has experience in a start-up environment with IFRS experience, and open to new opportunities in Toronto? Do you have experience implementing internal controls, strong technical accounting knowledge and comfort overseeing the month-end process?

Do you have proven experience leading and motivating a team, diverse experience in a smaller-company environment, being involved with HR, payroll, and other departments?

If this role describes you and your experience well, this may be a great Controller ole for you to consider!

Advantages
  • Excellent base salary offering
  • The opportunity to work for a fast-growing start-up
  • On-site parking
  • Hybrid model

Responsibilities

Reporting to the CFO, your duties and responsibilities will include;
  • Establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures as well as internal controls
  • Oversee all accounts, ledgers, and reporting systems ensuring compliance with appropriate IFRS standards and regulatory requirements
  • Monitor and confirm financial condition by conducting audits; providing information to external auditors
  • Consistently analyze financial data and present financial reports in an accurate and timely manner
  • Monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statement preparation
  • Assist leadership in the annual budgeting and planning process; administer and review all financial plans and compare to actual results with a view to identify, explain, and correct variances as appropriate
  • Prepare and manage organizational cash flow on a daily basis
  • Prepare budgets by establishing schedules; collecting, analyzing, and consolidating financial data; recommending plans
  • Prepare and submit Executive payroll, remittances, etc. for Canada and U.S.
  • Complete operational requirements for planning, monitoring, and appraising job results assigned to staff; coaching, counseling, and disciplining staff

Qualifications
  • CPA designated
  • Big 4 audit experience is highly desired
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills
  • Strength with MS Excel and financial modeling
  • M&A experience is an asset

Summary

If this seems like a great Controller opportunity for you to consider, please apply directly and email kristina@davidson@randstad.ca & bryan.hewitt@randstad.ca with your resume!

title: Manager Passenger Modeling and Crowd Control Plan, Toronto/Canada
description:
Deutsche Bahn International Operations and Aecon Concessions have formed a partnership to operate and maintain the Regional Express Rail (RER) network in the Greater Hamilton and Toronto Area (GHTA), Canada.

Deutsche Bahn International Operations GmbH is part of the Berlin headquartered DB group, a world-leading global railway engineering and infrastructure construction and operating business with an extensive international reputation for delivering successful rail development projects globally. Our partner Aecon is based in Canada, and they are a leading infrastructure company that connects roads and transit systems, communication networks and water infrastructure projects across North America and internationally.

The partnership will be called ONxpress Operations Inc and the combined experience and capability of the ONxpress partnership enable us to bring the international experience of designing, constructing, and operating rapid transit solutions in high-density population and urbanization locations.

About the project:

This brownfield project will significantly enhance the service delivery proposition for riders across Toronto and surrounding areas and will ensure a long-lasting sustainable economic, environmental and lifestyle contribution to its current and longer-term society needs.

Responsibilities:
  • Manage the acquisition of passenger modeling and crowd control plans for 67+ rail stations and on an annual basis provide timely submittals of 2- and 3-D passenger models and crowd control plans to the client
  • Build and oversee a team of crowd control and passenger modeling specialists
  • Oversee technical requirements for procuring a third-party specialist
  • Monitor schedules and budgets and report to the Head of Stations and the work of contracted services
  • Liaise with the client to receive ridership numbers and other data affecting passenger flow through stations
  • Test and validate the results of the passenger modeling
  • Report outcomes and findings of the passenger modeling and the crowd control plans to the Station Operations Duty Manager for any required updates to the Standard Operating Procedures
  • Coordinate with the Emergency Liaison Manager on evacuation and disrupted operations
  • Coordinate with the Fixed Asset Management department on maintenance plans as they impact passenger movements and crowd management across the facility
  • Liaise with the construction team on changes or issues of passenger flows at the station platform level, and with other operators on transferring passenger flows
  • Perform visits to Union Station and Line stations on a regular basis

Qualifications:
  • University/college degree, or equivalent combination of education and work experience in data analysis and analytics, statistical modeling and/or crowd management in a large and complex environment
  • 5+ years of experience in managing passenger models and crowd plans in a large and complex facility (examples: industry, production, airports, hospitals, construction, railways, etc.)
  • Ability to be the champion for Dynamic Passenger Modeling and Crowd Management across different stakeholders and operators
  • Sound interpersonal and influencing skills
  • Track record of achieving results to deadline in an environment in which there are multiple stakeholders
  • Sound knowledge of the standards for passenger flows, densities, and comfort levels for circulation of passengers.
  • Preferably knowledge of key technical characteristics for vertical circulation elements like escalators, elevators and stairwells
  • Preferably knowledge of procuring contracted services in this industry
  • Ability to complete projects from concept to implementation
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft software applications

Benefits: 
  • Opportunity to be part of an international organization shaping the rail transportation landscape in Canada
  • Continuous learning and development by way of transparent knowledge transfer by global railway experts
  • Gain valuable experience in a diverse and inclusive team of international industry experts
  • Make a difference and by being part of a team fostering sustainable mobility

title: Controller
description:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Perkins + Will, our Instagram, and our Blog.

We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.

Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.

Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable.

We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!

What does the Finance department look like?

We're a close-knit team of scrappy, driven folks that is committed to making sure Bench has what it needs to succeed. From accounting, treasury and legal, to strategy, financial planning and analysis, we have a broad portfolio that lets us engage with every part of the business. We enjoy solving problems together through open communication and collaboration while respecting each other's ideas.

You will be responsible for scaling up our accounting function to meet the needs of our growing company. The challenges of growth at scale are exciting, and you'll be at the forefront of our plans to solve them.

What You'll Get Up To:
  • Oversee all accounting operations teams including:
    • GL accounting
    • Accounts payable
    • US, Canada and International payroll
    • Billing, revenue and accounts receivable
    • Equity accounting and administration
  • Oversee all accounting and reporting related to the balance sheet, including:
    • Leases, subleases and lease liabilities
    • Long-term assets
    • Accounts receivable and other current assets
    • Accounts Payable and other current liabilities
  • Develop and manage financial controls in accordance with the company's procedures
  • Develop and maintain accounting policies and procedures
  • Coordinate and manage the external audit
  • Support internal audits
  • Support corporate and sales tax
  • Help scale accounting operations
  • Drive accounting-wide efficiencies and value-added improvements
  • Support executive initiatives
  • Help grow, develop, and empower a world-class team

What You'll Need:
  • A professional accounting designation (CA, CMA, CGA, CPA)
  • 5+ years of experience in financial reporting, including 2+ years in a managerial role
  • Experience managing a team of accounting professionals
  • Strong knowledge of US GAAP (ASC 606 experience preferred)
  • Ability to develop and maintain strong internal and external working relationships
  • Experience working at a multinational company
  • Strong analytical, decision making, planning, and organizational skills
  • Strong project management skills, including ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, changing environment
  • ERP experience preferred (i.e. Netsuite, Intacct, SAP, etc)
  • Public practice experience at a top 10 national firm or publicly-traded tech/SaaS company preferred.

It could be an even better fit if you:
  • Have a well-developed equity lens. You actively engage in leadership of teams and of strategic-level work with an equity lens and an eye for inclusivity. You don't just accept equitable practices, you model and advocate for them on your teams and in your work.

What You'll Get:
  • At Bench, we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is $163,920 - $204,900 with a component of these earnings made up of variable pay
  • In addition, we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, unlimited paid flex days, stock options, and full health, dental, and vision.
  • You'll get unlimited access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
  • Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
  • Bench is moving towards being a fully remote organization, and we're in the process of closing our Vancouver HQ. We are looking at alternative solutions to bring teams together for collaboration and connection.
  • We currently focus our hiring efforts in the following provinces: British Columbia, Alberta, Ontario, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia.
  • You'll have access to our Home Office Setup Fund, to ensure that you have everything you need to work comfortably from home, from day one.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

Description

The Company

Are you a Controller with strong manufacturing experience? Or are you an Audit Manager from public accounting with a roster of manufacturing clients? Our client is a growing private manufacturing company in the Stoney Creek area. They boast over 600 employees across several plants. It is a fast-paced and dynamic environment where you will have lots of opportunities to engage in continuous improvements.

The Role

In this exciting role, as the Controller, you will oversee the month-end close and be responsible for journal entries, account reconciliations and government remittances.

About You

You are a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) with 3+ years of controllership experience where you have managed a small team. As a Controller, you have extensive inventory management experience, preferably from a complex manufacturing environment. You are a strong problem-solver and self-starter who also boasts strong ERP and advanced Excel skills. Alternatively, our client will also consider Audit Managers from public accounting firms who are ready to move to industry at the Controller level if you have a client portfolio of manufacturing companies.

  • CPA designation
  • University degree in Accounting, Business or Commerce
  • Manufacturing industry experience
  • Inventory management
  • Oversee month-end close
  • Government remittances
  • Process improvements
  • 10+ years’ experience
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Strong ERP experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Audit Managers straight from public accounting with manufacturing clients

title: Opérateur(trice) de machine CNC
description:
Tu recherches une entreprise où il est plaisant de travailler, Trica, un manufacturier de meuble, est présentement à la recherche de candidats dévoués et passionnés.

En plus d’être une entreprise en pleine croissance et bien établie (depuis 1988), Trica a à cœur l’environnement. L’innovation et l’amélioration continue sont au centre de nos opérations.

Trica Offre Les Avantages
  • Horaire de travail de 7h00 à 15h30 du lundi au vendredi;
  • Fermeture d’usine complète pendant 2 semaines l’été et 2 semaines durant la période des fêtes;
  • 11 jours fériés payés par l’employeur (normes du travail en prévoit 8);
  • Assurance collective, incluant le médical, le dentaire et l’assurance voyage;
  • Participation employeur au REER collectif de l’employé;
  • Escompte sur les meubles Trica;
  • Activités sociales;
  • Entreprise en croissance et bien établie (depuis 1988);
  • Évolue dans un environnement dynamique où il pourra parfaire ses connaissances;
  • L’innovation et l’amélioration continue sont au centre des opérations;
  • La santé et la sécurité des employés est une priorité pour l’entreprise;
  • Entreprise ayant à cœur l’environnement.
Tâches Et Responsabilités
  • Effectuer le réglage (set up) des machines ;
  • Procéder à l’interprétation des dessins techniques lors de la fabrication de nouvelles pièces ;
  • Modifier et/ou ajuster les programmes à commande numérique ;
  • Opérer les machines de production
  • Transporter, manuellement ou à l’aide d’appareils de levage, les matières premières et les produits finis;
  • Nettoyer les aires de travail et l’équipement;
  • Respecter les règles de santé et de sécurité et à participer à la recherche d’amélioration en matière de prévention.
Profil Recherché
  • Détenir un diplôme d’études professionnelles (DEP) en usinage ou toutes combinaisons d'expérience jugées pertinentes;
  • Expérience pertinente avec des machines CNC (essentiel)
  • Avoir de très bonnes connaissances en interprétation de documents et dessins techniques (Atout);
  • Démontrer de l’initiative et des habiletés d’esprit d’analyse;
  • Autonomie et débrouillardise;
  • Sens de l’organisation et méthodique;
  • Bonne condition physique;
  • Intérêt pour la santé et la sécurité au travail

title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
We are looking for a passionate and driven Director of Finance to join our renewable energy powerhouse.


At Subterra, a part of the STS Group of Companies, we make green buildings simple. Our Account Managers are the experts who sell innovative EaaS (Energy as a Service) products to North America. They directly advise customers on everything from solution features and configurations, through to pricing structure and availability.


People leader - 10%

You are a leader, coach, and mentor for individuals within the finance and accounting function. You lead the professional development of this team, ensuring quality and accountability.


Financial Statements and Reporting - 30%

You are accountable for the consistent production of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements for Subterra, Turnkey, and STS consolidated. These statements in inform the monthly reporting package you are responsible for producing for management and investors. 


Cash Management - 25%

You are accountable for managing AR and AP systems to ensure sufficient cash is available to manage the business and service debt. 


Job Profitability Reporting - 15%

You oversee real-time job profitability reporting with project managers to identify budget variances and implement changes mid-project as needed.


Budgeting and Forecasting - 15%

You work with management to produce annual budgets and growth forecast models with the investment team to project operating estimates under various corporate development scenarios.


Tax Strategy and Filing - 5%

You support third-party accountants with preparation of annual taxes for Subterra, Turnkey, and STS consolidated. You advise management on tax strategy. 


Here’s our story; now tell us yours


Subterra’s (STS) vision is to create change in our communities through reducing green house gas emissions in the built environment. We partner with our clients and enable them to meet the challenges and opportunities of the future. We believe in delivering exceptional service to our clients, partners, residents and society at large so we can all contribute to building a better future!

title: Controller
description:
Reporting to the Chief Corporate Controller, the Controller will be responsible for all the accounting activities related to the manufacturing sites and distribution centers. You will play a strategic role on the finance team that will help Techo-Bloc continue to grow and you will participate on projects that will make a real impact.

A day in a life:

Your day begins with a presentation to the CEO regarding the monthly financial results, followed by a morning coffee with the IT Manager regarding the ERP implementation. You then take some time to think about how to create GL mapping for the new HRIS system. You take a break for lunch and recharge. Later in the afternoon you investigate a large inventory variance and set up a call with the director of purchasing and production. Your workday ends with a one on one with your assistant controller. Finally you log off and head out for dinner and go-karting with the finance team!

In your role, your key responsibilities will include:

  • Ensure the timely production of the monthly and annual financial statements including detailed  explanatory appendices according to deadlines;
  • Lead the analysis, configuration, testing, trouble shooting and implementation of special projects (ex. FS consolidation, new bonus programs, ERP implementation, etc);
  • Conduct complex financial analysis and produce all required financial reports;
  • Investigate variances by contacting relevant departments;
  • Be able to maintain a credible rapport with the external Canadian and American auditors.  The Controller is the resource person for the Canadian and / or American tax authorities for the manufacturing sites under his or her responsibility;
  • Ensure rigorous management of cost control activities;
  • Produce and coordinate the budget process with each department;
  • Publish different performance indicator ratios;
  • Establish, review and update internal controls;
  • Participate in the improvement of accounting processes:
  • Train and motivate your team;
  • Participate in the business case process for all new products and projects;
  • Manage fixed assets(purchases, sales, dispositions and transfers);
  • Maintain a tax and legal watch of the accounting activities of the company;

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting;
  • Accounting title;
  • Experience in manufacturing environment
  • 5 to 8 years of relevant accounting experience;
  • A minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar position;
  • Experience in cost and financial control;
  • Excellent command of integrated management systems (ERP) such as Microsoft AX or SAP;
  • Excellent command of Office Suite and a master at Excel;
  • Bilingualism orally and written is essential;

Additional Information

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Controller
description:
Description

You might be a good fit for this position if you are driven by high expectations. The ideal candidate for this position thrives in a role where integrity, reliability and leadership are valued. A successful company is seeking a Controller through Robert Half to take responsibility for its accounting and clerical department. The Controller position is a permanent opportunity in the London, Ontario region. You might be a good fit for this position if you can plan and direct all accounting operational functions, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluate accounting and internal control systems, and lead departmental staff. Candidates who know how to effectively manage self and others within strict time constraints when providing client services will do well in this role along with creative types who can lead while also being a team player, generate innovative ideas, and challenge the status quo. This position offers exceptional compensation and benefits and potential for career growth.

Your responsibilities
  • Give executive committee and partners monthly financial reports
  • Assess, execute and streamline policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
  • Manage the production of the annual budget and forecasts and monitor on a monthly basis
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to ensure efficient and successful firm-wide operation
  • Research, plan and implement Finance Department initiatives including software and systems implementation and other departmental or firm-wide improvements, as needed
  • Occasionally perform duties beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Manage daily cash and prepare cash-flow reports, projecting cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals
  • Manage finance department operations, including accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Drive the timing for monthly billing and other cash management techniques to ensure the timely cash collection
  • Responsible for month-end and year-end close of income statement and balance sheet, account reconciliations & G/L analysis
  • Ensure client satisfaction by reviewing deliverables of self and team
Requirements
  • Outstanding technology, analytics and management experience required
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Able to build and deliver effective presentations to audiences with wide-ranging backgrounds
  • BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Economics or other business related field
  • Ability to prioritize deals and adapt to quick changes while remaining diligent, and to thrive in a dynamic, high pressure environment
  • 5+ years of progressive accounting experience, including as a Controller preferred
  • Prior experience in a public accounting environment is highly valued
  • Budget forecasting experience
  • Foundational knowledge in financial statement preparation
  • Strong familiarity with Corporate Tax Return
  • Month end closings experience
  • Self-driven motivator who takes initiative on projects with a strong ability to understand and solve creative challenges
  • CPA or MBA preferred
  • Excellent analytical, quantitative and social skills
  • Strong organizational skills and a proven ability to meet deadlines
Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

title: Regulatory Reporting Controller
description:
Job Description:

Bank of America is one of the world's largest financial institutions, serving individual consumers, small and middle market businesses and large corporations with a full range of banking, investing, asset management and other financial and risk-management products and services. Following the acquisition of Merrill Lynch on January 1, 2009, Bank of America is among the world's leading wealth management companies and is a global leader in corporate and investment banking and trading across a broad range of asset classes serving corporations, governments, institutions and individuals around the world. In Canada, Bank of America has a strong market position on which to continue to build, as well as a clear commitment to the market.

Job Description

This position will be reporting to the Director, Senior Legal Entity Controller.

Responsibilities

Specific areas of responsibilities include, but not limited to:
  • Responsible for completing the monthly, quarterly and annual regulatory reports for IIROC & OSFI
  • Complete daily & weekly capital reporting
  • Perform variance analysis and prepare monthly reports for senior management
  • Responsible for maintaining an effective control framework over respective functions
  • Development of in-depth knowledge/expertise of both broker dealer and foreign bank branch regulatory rules and interpretations
  • Participate/assist with regulator queries
  • Participate in various audits – external, regulatory, corporate, compliance
  • Prepare and/or assist in month-end journal entry processing
  • Preparation of monthly reconciliation of assigned balance sheet accounts and investigate/remediate issues
  • Complete ad-hoc reporting/analysis or projects
Qualifications
  • Recognized accounting designation
  • Previous financial services industry/capital markets knowledge preferred
  • Must have a combination of strong quantitative/analytical skills, attention to detail and client focus
  • Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills
  • Assertiveness, initiative, leadership, strong work ethic, team focus
  • Ability to learn quickly and take on new responsibilities
  • Ability to work well under pressure
  • Well organized/able to meet deadlines
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word essential
What Bank Of America Offers

Bank of America embodies a culture that extends from how we think, to how we behave, and to how we measure performance. By achieving excellence - in everything we do, every time we do it - we deliver the full value of Bank of America for our clients, our shareholders and our employees.

Bank of America places a high value on talent and on maintaining a culture defined by meritocracy. For these reasons, it is deeply committed to professional development, opportunity and accountability at all levels of the organization.

Bank of America is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Bank of America encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Applicants with disabilities may notify us of any accommodations needed to support your participation in the recruitment process. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying. Please be aware that only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted for this position.

title: Controller
description:
This opening will support WFS Ltd. – A W.W. Grainger Company.


Primary Function: The Controller is responsible for overall corporate accounting, taxation, accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash processing, treasury and payroll functions for the WFS business unit of Grainger and is part of the WFS leadership team.

The location is flexible between Windsor, Ontario and the Greater Toronto Area, with limited travel.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Ensure all accounting records are accurate, timely and are prepared in accordance with US GAAP and Company policy.
  • Establish financial controls to ensure safeguarding of corporate assets
  • Develop and mentor key finance talent; create a strong results-oriented, customer focused culture within WFS Finance team.
  • Work with the Grainger Finance Teams to develop management and month-end reporting in accordance with company requirements.
  • Work with the Financial Planning and Analysis Team (FP&A) to establish monthly and annual budgets and forecasts
  • Ensure all accounting practices, controls and procedures comply with Sarbanes Oxley and other regulatory reporting requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with all income and commodity tax laws, including tax filings, remittances and audits.
  • Work with business partners in WFS and Grainger Canada on key initiatives and special projects affecting finance teams.
  • Lead process improvement efforts to increase efficiencies and effectiveness across accounting and financial processing teams.


Required Education & Experience:

  • Proven Finance and Accounting professional with strong technical accounting skills
  • At least five years' post-graduate experience including people leadership
  • Familiarity with US GAAP, consolidation accounting, Sarbanes Oxley and SEC reporting requirements, and corporate financial reporting experience is desirable
  • Management experience of major accounting cycles including accounts payable / disbursements, cash processing and payroll is desirable
  • Familiarity with Canadian taxation is required
  • A solid academic background and an appropriate financial designation are expected including public accounting and audit; CPA is required.
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities and proven change management experience.
  • Self-confident and the ability to adapt to changing circumstances.
  • A person who is proactive and a "quick study", is attracted to challenge and brings an energetic and forward-thinking approach, along with high ethical standards.
  • Well-developed communication abilities with strong written and presentation skills as well as excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Solid technical skills and interests, and a commitment to resolving accounting issues and developments.
  • Disciplined, focused, well-organized, results driven.


Grainger strives to be an employer of choice, to attract and retain top diverse talent, and to provide a safe and positive work environment for all of its team members. As part of Grainger hiring process, pre-employment background checks will be required for all external candidates. Internal candidates will be required to undergo a pre-employment background check when they move from a non-driving role to a driving role and/or a director role and above position.

In accordance with Performance Excellence guidelines, team members are encouraged to apply for positions closely matching their experience/background and that are aligned with their Individual Development Plan. Grainger is committed to the principles and practices of employment equity. We invite all qualified women and men, including persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and Aboriginal Peoples to apply for our career opportunities. Accommodations are available on request for all persons with disabilities taking part in the selection process.

description:

Our client, a mining company with international presence, is looking to hire a Controller on a permanent basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day accounting operations of the company, which include the production of periodic consolidated financial reports, maintenance of accounting records, and a comprehensive set of controls and budgets. The Controller will be reporting to the CFO of the organization and his/her duties will include, but will not be limited to:

  • Ensure month-end process is accurate and completed within timeframe.

  • 5+ years of progressive experience in technical accounting
  • Consolidated financial reporting under IFRS

title: Controller
description:
Description

Robert Half Management Resources est le leader mondial des services de conseil et de dotation spécialisés pour les professionnels de la comptabilité, des finances et des systèmes d’affaires de haut niveau.

Notre client basé dans la région de Ouatouais est actuellement à la recherche d’un Contrôleur Financier parfaitement bilingue pour un contrat de 3 mois avec une forte possibilité de permanence. La personne idéale sera responsable de la préparation des rapports financiers, de l’assurance de l’intégrité des données et des systèmes financiers, de l’élaboration et de la surveillance des budgets et des prévisions, ainsi que d’autres tâches financières qui sont conformes et conformes aux principes comptables généralement reconnus.

Les Fonctions Du Contrôleur Financier Comprendront
  • Examen régulier des contrôles et des systèmes financiers
  • Examiner et exécuter l’opération comptable, la fin du mois et la fin de l’exercice
  • Exécution des budgets, des prévisions et du dépôt de la loi
  • Superviser l’équipe du personnel subaltern
  • Compréhension stratégique et analyse de la stratégie de l’organisation
  • Autres tâches requises
Requirements

Le Contrôleur idéal aura les compétences et l’expérience suivantes:
  • Une désignation comptable reconnue (CGA, CMA ou CA) avec un minimum de cinq ans d’expérience en comptabilité
  • Expérience dans les entreprises gérées par le propriétaire (actif)
  • Expérience avec les systèmes ERP et/ou comptables
  • Compétences supérieures en communication orale et écrite (le bilinguisme serait considéré comme un atout)
  • Niveau avancé Microsoft Excel
  • Solides compétences analytiques pour la résolution de problèmes, le leadership et les compétences organisationnelles
Robert Half est la première et la plus grande firme de solutions de gestion des talents spécialisées au monde, qui met en relation des chercheurs d'emploi hautement qualifiés avec des opportunités au sein de grandes entreprises. Nous offrons des solutions de placement contractuel, temporaire et permanent dans les domaines de la finance et de la comptabilité, des technologies, du marketing et de la création, et du soutien administratif et à la clientèle.

title: CNC & Sheet Metal Pricing Estimator (Remote - CA)
description:
Xometry is the source for on-demand manufacturing, offering massive capacity, instant online quotes, fast lead times, and affordable pricing. Our global network of over 5,000 manufacturing facilities enables us to maintain consistently fast lead times while offering a broad array of capabilities includes CNC machining, injection molding, sheet metal fabrication, urethane casting, and a industry-leading 3D printing service. We have a diverse customer base, ranging from startups to Fortune 100 companies and can make anything from a single prototype to millions of parts.

Xometry is looking to hire an experienced CNC and Sheet Metal Pricing Estimator to join our world class Manual Quoting and Estimating team.

Role & Responsibilities
  • Analyze engineering models and drawings to define the sequence of machining operations to ensure that the design intent and component quality can be achieved.
  • Make proper cost estimations, taking into consideration such factors as materials, speeds, type of cutters, feeds and control system limitations.
  • Work closely with machinists, quality personnel, design engineers, and management to develop successful commercial proposals.
  • Must have experience with simple turning to complex 5 axis machining methods and fixture design; experience with turning and milling programming.
  • Experience with sourcing materials and finishes

Required Skills and Experience
  • Familiarity with a range of different machining processes including 5-axis milling, live-tooling lathes, grinding, and EDM
  • Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerance (GD&T).
  • Exotic alloys and their material properties, cutting tools and machine tool capabilities to develop a part machining plan.
  • Protocols, standards, technologies, and machining applications.
  • Reviewing customer RFQs for both deliverable and quality requirements
  • Communicating with customers to accurately define requirements and expectations.
  • Supply chain management and sourcing methodologies
  • Consolidating all outside costs and internal costs associated with process time in engineering, machining, finishing and QC.
  • Creating detailed quote packages for final review.
  • Managing quote logs and tracking conversion, margin, and on-time delivery KPIs.
  • Experience with a modern CAD package such as Solidworks, Inventor, Onshape, Fusion360, Siemens NX, etc.
  • Familiarity with modern ERP/MRP systems

Ability to
  • Parse key manufacturing and specification requirements from 2D drawings and CAD models.
  • Manipulate and modify 3D CAD models
  • Provide technical support to production manufacturing teams and DFM feedback to customers
  • Monitor and respond to performance feedback related to project pricing, lead times, and order conversion rates.
  • Communicate effectively, both verbally, and in writing.
  • Operate effectively in a team environment.

If this job isn’t for you but you have a friend who may be a perfect fit - share this job with them!

Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Xometry participates in E-Verify and after a job offer is accepted, will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

title: Controller
description:
Company Overview

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Controller at our 591 Arvin Ave. facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure

Reports directly to the Director of Finance.

Responsibilities

ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING & ANALYSIS
  • Responsible for the accuracy and maintenance of the General Ledger and accounting systems, including providing oversight of all day-to-day accounting transactions.
  • Preparation of timely and accurate monthly, quarterly and annual year-end financial statements plus other reporting and analysis for internal management and external financial stakeholders.
  • Provides a detailed review and analysis of monthly consolidated financial statements including analysis on sales, gross margins/program profitability, expenses and inventories.
  • Leadership in co-ordinating and managing all internal and external audits.
  • Plans and co-ordinates all aspects of the year-end audit to ensure a smooth audit process and clean audit results. Activities include: preparation of the audit package and schedules, review of tax and other provisions, preparation of the financial statements and notes to the financial statements, and interface with external auditors.
  • Prepares reports for regulatory agencies.
  • Responsible for preparing all schedules and information to support the completion of Corporate Income Tax Returns and Tax Planning.
  • Provides support to the Director of Taxes.
BANKING, CASH MANAGEMENT AND TREASURY
  • Prepares and submits reports to the bank and other external entities.
  • Responsible for cash flow management, processing and reporting of cash.
  • Responsible for the corporate accounts receivable and accounts payable operations and accounting processes.
  • Manages reporting to support insurance coverage, including reporting of Insurable Values to insurance providers on an annual basis.
INTERNAL CONTROLS AND SYSTEMS
  • Ensures compliance with accounting policies and procedures and generally accepted accounting principles.
  • Monitors, evaluates, enhances and maintains the internal controls to support the business.
  • Establishes and recommends to senior management objectives, policies and procedures for the safeguarding of corporate assets.
  • Responsible for the integrity and accuracy of the Fixed Asset Sub-ledger.
  • Senior leader in the deployment of upgrades to the ERP system and implementation of other new systems and software.
BUSINESS LEADERSHIP AND OPERATION SUPPORT
  • Leadership in managing direct reports, executing on people management best practices and fostering a culture of teamwork and operational excellence.
  • Key member of the Senior Finance Leadership team responsible for business simplification and process re-engineering of accounting and financial processes.
  • Participates as part of the company leadership team in supporting business activities and the achievement of corporate objectives.
  • Provide business advice, analysis and guidance to support Operations, Engineering, Quality, Sales, IT, Purchasing, HR and Legal.
  • Provides data, analysis and advice to ownership & senior management in assessing and evaluating business opportunities and strategic plans.
  • Supports and enforces the company priority of Safe Operations, assisting and managing others to perform work in a safe manner so that no work site accident or illness results from any operational activity.
Qualifications
  • Accounting designation, CPA/CA Preferred
  • University degree (Business Administration or Accounting/Finance)
  • At least 5 years' experience in Public Accounting (Audit) and/or related experience
  • Management experience leading teams
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Manufacturing experience is an asset
  • Experience in business process re-engineering and process simplification
  • Strong systems & computer skills (Knowledgeable in ERP/MRP, QAD experience is an asset: Microsoft Office, Excel, other accounting packages)

title: Controller
description:
A high-tech company based in the Eindhoven area is looking for a Controller to be a key player in supporting their growth, adding value to the company with experience in the finance domain and an entrepreneurial mindset. If you get energised by being a financial advisor, getting in touch with international stakeholders, and you are passionate about process improvement, keep reading!

Working in an open and dynamic environment, as a Controller you will be reporting to the Group Controller and you can contribute to the development of the department and its team members.

What are you responsible for?
  • Critical Business Partner of the Project Management and Business Office teams, providing financial guidance & advisement;
  • Preparation of month-end closing and KPI reports;
  • Drives financial forecasting and budgeting in collaboration with the Group Business Controller;
  • Perform financial analysis and reports;
  • Develop and implement process improvements and report’s automation;
  • Advise on opportunities to accelerate financial performance;
  • Supervise the operational management of the control department & financial administration within Adimec;
  • Ensures that all Adimec entities comply with tax laws and regulations.
What are we looking for?

In Addition, You Have

A Controller with a fresh perspective, who is able to act as a sparring partner for internal and external stakeholders and support our goals as a company. You are persuasive, decisive, and a conceptual thinker.
  • A master’s degree in Finance/Accounting/Business Administration;
  • At least 3 years of working experience in a similar role as Controller, preferably in a B2B production environment;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Affinity with data analytics and IT;
  • Good command of the Dutch and English language.
Are you ready for a new challenge and do you recognise yourself as our Controller? Then apply now!

title: Controller
description:
Description

You could become a Controller with a reputable healthcare provider if you have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, experience in making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and finance department. You might be a good fit for this position if you can plan and direct all accounting operational functions, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluate accounting and internal control systems, and lead departmental staff. You might be a good fit for this position if you can lead with integrity and reliability and have the ability to manage self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability when providing client services. This is a great opportunity for a creative team player with a talent for challenging the status quo, coming up with unique ideas, negotiating and influencing. Is it time to advance your career? Find out more about this opportunity and take the next steps toward a very competitive compensation and benefits package. The permanent Controller position is situated in the Edmonton, Alberta area.

What you get to do every single day
  • Oversee the activities of the finance department, such as accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Analyze deliverables of self and team to confirm they meet organizational expectations
  • Flexible in completing tasks beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Manage the production of and monthly monitoring of financial reporting, budgeting and forecasts
  • Analyze, apply and improve policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to ensure that organization-wide operation is efficient and effective
  • Advance initiatives, such as software and systems implementation and other departmental or organization-wide improvements, as needed, with research, planning and implementation
  • Produce cash-flow reports, calculating cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals, and manage daily cash
  • Present executive team with monthly financial reports
Requirements
  • 7+ years of progressive accounting experience, including as a Controller is required
  • Remarkable analytical, quantitative and social skills
  • Vow to meet business deadlines
  • Strong communication and social skills
  • Self-driven motivator who takes initiative on projects with a strong ability to understand and solve creative challenges
  • CPA designation is required
  • Proven knowledge of Audited Financial Statements
  • General familiarity with Corporate Financial Planning
  • Deep understanding of Ad Hoc Financial Analysis
  • Detailed and have the ability work independently
  • Ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment
