title: Responsable Comptabilité / Accounting Manager
description:
Directement rattaché(e) à la Directrice administrative et financière, vous serez en charge de superviser et coordonner toutes les tâches relatives à la comptabilité et la paie. Vous aurez sous votre responsabilité 2 personnes qui vous reporteront directement. Vous serez également en étroite collaboration avec le responsable du contrôle de gestion.


MISSIONS :


Missions comptables :

  • S’assurer de la bonne tenue comptable des entités de la Division en contribuant plus particulièrement aux activités suivantes :
  • Superviser l’enregistrement des opérations comptables ;
  • Planifier et contrôler les règlement fournisseurs ;
  • Coordonner l’émission des factures clients et assurer un suivi des encaissements ;
  • Planifier les tâches associées et la production des états financiers.
  • Suivre les réalisations de trésorerie, préparer le reporting mensuel siège et établir les prévisions.
  • Préparer et traiter les déclarations de TPS et TVQ.
  • Préparer les états financiers internes trimestriels et en diffuser la diffusion au siège en France :
  • Vérifier la cohérence des postes de bilan et des comptes courants ;
  • Valider la bonne comptabilisation des écarts de change ;
  • Saisir dans le logiciel VISION les liasses fiscales.
  • Coordonner les activités avec les vérificateurs externes.
  • Préparer les informations et documents nécessaires à la préparation des déclarations fiscales.
  • Fournir à la Direction de l’information essentielle à la prise de décision.
  • Analyser les activités de comptabilité actuelles, offrir des recommandations afin de les améliorer et mettre en place de nouveaux processus.
  • Suivre les obligations réglementaires.


Missions paie :

  • Superviser les activités reliées au traitement de la paie pour tous les collaborateurs locaux et expatriés de nos filiales au Canada selon le calendrier de paie :
  • Actualisation et suivi des différentes banques (vacances, maladie, temps cumulé, etc.) et assurer leur intégrité dans le système de paie ;
  • Vérifier les déductions de paie et avantages sociaux ;
  • Valider les terminaisons d’employés tout en assurant leur conformité avec les législations fédérales et provinciales applicables ;
  • Les opérations relatives à la fermeture des dossiers du collaborateur en matière de rémunération (relevés d'emplois, versements de vacances et vérifications des derniers paiements).
  • Assurer la clôture mensuelle et annuelle du cycle comptable concernant la paie.
  • Agir à titre de personne-ressource pour toute question relative à la paie.
  • Produire des T4 et relevés 1 des collaborateurs.
  • Produire divers rapports requis (loi sur la formation au Québec, CCQ, REER, etc.).



FORMATION ET EXPERIENCE PROFESSIONNELLE :

  • Titulaire d’un baccalauréat (BAC) en comptabilité (comptabilité, contrôle), vous maitrisez parfaitement les principes comptables et de la paie Canadienne ;
  • Vous disposez d’au moins 10 ans d’expérience en comptabilité et au moins 7 ans d’expérience en paie ;
  • Expérience dans un rôle similaire avec gestion d’une équipe ;
  • Expérience dans le milieu de la construction/ingénierie, un fort atout ;
  • Expérience dans la gestion de plusieurs entités légales, des opérations inter-compagnies et multidevises.


COMPETENCES :

Compétences requises :

  • Sens de la rigueur et de l’analyse ;
  • Sens de l'organisation et de la gestion des priorités dans le respect des plannings qui vous sont imposés ;
  • Vous aimez travailler en équipe et communiquer ;
  • Vous aimez le contact avec l'opérationnel et faîtes preuve de dynamisme ;
  • Bonne maîtrise de la Suite Office (Word. PowerPoint et Excel) ;
  • Intérêt pour les systèmes d’Information.

Compétences recommandées :

  • Français courant et Anglais professionnel ;
  • Certification de l’Association canadienne de la paie, un fort atout ;
  • Connaissance de ADP, un fort atout.

title: Operations Accounting Manager
description:
Position: Operations Accounting Manager

Location: Winchester


Given the current environment our priority is to protect the health of our people, suppliers and partners and, as a result, head office employees are adhering to our Work From Home Policy.


General Accountability:

The Operations Accounting Manager is responsible for overseeing the Operations Accounting function at plant level for a complex and/or large plant and provides analytical support to the Operations group and Head Office Finance.


Critical Success Factors:

· Lead and manage the plant Finance team to achieve high performance, commitment, cross- functional cooperation and a results orientation.

· Coordinate, review and/or prepare reports on monthly results in conjunction with Operations Accountants, Plant Manager(s) and other staff.

· Coordinate, review, and prepare annual budgets and ongoing forecasts.

· Develop and review standard (dock) costs for use in evaluating plant and division performance and valuation of inventory in conjunction with Finance staff, Operations, Sales, and Supply Chain.

· Manage staff by hiring, reviewing performance and providing feedback, determining training and development needs, and providing work direction. Establish key objectives for the department and the employees therein.

· Develop and implement appropriate reporting of yields and other operating results for internal plant and division/company KPI purposes.

· Review and update policies, processes and procedures in order to ensure continuous improvement.


Key Attributes of the Ideal Candidate:

· Post secondary education in Accounting, or a related discipline, plus a recognized professional accounting designation (CMA, CGA, CA)

· Minimum of five (5) years experience in costing and general operations accounting including three (3) years experience in a supervisory role or coordinating major projects

· Strong team facilitation/leadership skills with a demonstrated commitment to employee development.

· Strong problem solving and decision making skills.

· Ability to multi-task, quickly absorb and utilize new concepts, processes and technologies and to function in a fast-paced changing environment.

· Strong communication skills.

· Strong computer skills.

· Bilingualism (French/English) is an asset

· Experience working in an SAP environment is an asset

· Ability to provide leadership to staff


Lactalis is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to the principles of diversity and employment equity. Lactalis strives to ensure that our workforce reflects the diverse nature of Canadian society.


Lactalis is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the member of the Talent Acquisition team in a timely fashion of any disabilities that requires accommodation measures in order to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.

Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially

title: Controller
description:
Description

Are you driven by high expectations? This position is ideal for someone who thrives in a role where integrity, reliability and leadership are valued. Robert Half's new Controller opening will give you the opportunity to take responsibility for an accounting and clerical department at a successful company. The permanent Controller position is situated in the New Hamburg, Ontario area. If you can plan and direct all accounting operational functions, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluate accounting and internal control systems, and lead departmental staff, you might be right for this position. Company Description

Are you a Resourcer?

As an essential services provider, Veolia helps its customers to improve their energy efficiency, better manage their buildings, their water and wastewater and transform their waste into resources. These make us THE global reference in the environment.

Controller

  • Month End Closing, Budgeting,
  • Forecasting, Standard Costing

  • Fixed Asset Accounting
  • Business Analytics

  • Internal Controls
Qualifications

  • Preferred CPA, CA, MBA not required but helps
  • At least 2 years experience
  • Fluent French & English Written and Oral
  • Ability to work in a team setting and self starter
  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills.
  • High levels of energy
Additional Information

Why join our Resourcers team?
  • A company in constant growth that creates the world of tomorrow;
  • A multitude of large-scale projects where you can use your talent;
  • Challenges to your measure and the lack of routine;
  • A permanent position - Full-time
  • The opportunity to develop your career to meet your professional objectives;
  • Training and support programs, both internal and external;
  • Very competitive compensation, pension and benefits;
  • Multidisciplinary work teams and an OHS-oriented work environment.
Would you like to come resource the world with us?

www.veolianorthamerica.com

description:
Description

Our established client in Calgary is currently seeking a Controller to join their focused team for a full time role.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Description

You're a good fit for Robert Half's Corporate Controller position with a reputable business services company, if you have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, and making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and clerical department. In this role, you will be planning and directing all accounting operational functions, handling the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluating accounting and internal control systems, and leading departmental staff. Leading with integrity and reliability and having the ability to manage self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability when providing client services will be essential for this role. title: Supervisor Accounts Payables
description:
Description

Reporting to the accounting operations department s Senior Manager Accounts Payable and Revenue the accounts payable supervisor will supervise unionized employees identify issues that need addressing and oversee the review of system processes and procedures. The incumbent will prioritize operational tasks in their sector and solve complex unusual problems. They will provide support to the senior manager and analysts in this sector as well as to users in other departments. They will produce reports and dashboards and monitor and measure the results of improvements. They will ensure action plans are executed to prioritize activities to support the organization s objectives. They also manage their employees performance by ensuring quality control and providing appropriate training as needed.

Responsibilities

Management of human resources and operational tasks

Supervises employees and operational tasks in the unit

Sets priorities and ensures the timely completion of tasks. Measures results and performs follow ups

Provides support to the senior manager accounting operations and the development analyst (development-related activities)

Is responsible for implementing and integrating various improvement initiatives within the team

Is responsible for coordinating auditors internal and external audit work

Is responsible for communicating with vendors and internal colleagues to settle disputes

Acts as a resource person by offering support to users in their department.

Quality assurance and communication

Performs quality control develops and validates the report used and follows up with the senior manager accounts payable

Produces and analyzes the unit s management and statistical reports

Acts as a resource person for the systems in their sector.

Various reports and dashboards

Performs analyses based on reports and dashboards

Develops action plans for necessary changes.

DEC (college diploma) and 10 years of experience or bachelor s degree and 7 years of experience in accounting or business administration

7 years of experience in personnel and task management prioritization and process review for accounting operations processes within an accounts payable department

5 years of experience in a role that supports employee development and/or resources. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also be considered

Solid knowledge of general accounting and year end accounting processes

Knowledge of the Canada Labour Code a valuable asset

Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word/Excel/PowerPoint) and aptitude for systems related to accounting operations. Knowledge of Oracle an asset.

Competencies

Strong interpersonal skills highly developed analytical sense and ability to play a key role in change management

Ability to work in a changing environment. Flexibility and strong proven skills in process improvement

Excellent oral and written communication skills in both official languages

Ability to work under pressure with strict deadlines

Development support skills in a unionized environment demonstrated coaching skills

Strong sense of organization and demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize operational tasks.

A fast-paced environment at a company undergoing major transformation

A modern work life balance

An innovative remote work policy

A generous and comprehensive compensation package

Bonuses based on individual and corporate performance

title: Controller
description:
Description

Robert Half is looking for a Controller on Vancouver Island, BC! If you are an experienced Sr Finance professional with hands-on experience in manufacturing/ construction or project-based environments and are looking to live in a beautiful part of BC’s West Coast while working for an exceptional & global organization, this could be an excellent position for you!

You will be part of a large accounting team and will specialize in areas including but not limited to financial reporting, consolidations, costing and inventory management, financial planning and analysis, operational reporting, budgeting/ forecasting, and system implementation. This position will play a key role in managing the financial cycle of the Canadian subsidiary, reporting to the international head office, identifying areas of opportunity, resolving any issues / errors, fostering positive & long-term working relationships with the operations staff, and providing strategic advice to the Director of Finance.

Your Day-to-day Job Responsibilities Will Include
  • Provide consolidated financial reports to the head office and Director of Finance for review
  • Assist with the budgeting & forecasting process for the Canadian subsidiary
  • Manage the month-end and year end period closing tasks
  • Oversee and manage the inventory and perform reconciliations, as required
  • Provide timely financial reporting to the finance & operations teams
  • Manage the financial planning and analysis process and make suggestions for improvement
  • Manage and improve the costing process for the group of companies
  • Liaise with the financial auditors and provide required documentation at year-end
  • Create financial models and provide project-based reports
  • Perform adhoc financial reporting functions
  • Manage/ oversee the finance department and provide necessary guidance
  • Assist the staff with performance measurement and management by setting KPI’s and goals

What you will bring to the position:
  • Experience working in manufacturing, production, forestry, construction/other project-based environment is required
  • Strong hands-on experience with costing & inventory management is required
  • 3+ years of experience working in a Sr Finance role at a similar level, leading the finance functions for mid/large organization
  • Advanced Excel Skills are required and experience with ERP system and /or system implementations will be given preference

title: CGP/Export Controls Mgr - Canada, Global Export Compliance
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Do you see compliance as a business enabler? Do you have a passion for cutting edge technologies and complex problem solving? Do you enjoy building innovative compliance solutions? Are you passionate about creating the future of controlled goods and export controls compliance?

Amazon continues to expand its global presence and customer facing services and we are looking for a highly motivated CGP and Export Controls Manager to lead CGP & Export controls program initiatives and export licensing in Canada.

The candidate must possess strong analytical skills and be comfortable working autonomously in a highly demanding and often ambiguous environment. The position requires an individual with strong attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills. This candidate must be highly organized and be able to prioritize effectively.

The successful candidate is an innovative compliance professional experienced in building cutting edge compliance programs, have strong written and verbal communication skills, and have the ability to dive deep into complex problem solving. The role will help drive and scale the export controls and licensing program through innovative process development, engaging cross-functional teams that span a broad range of stakeholders, including development teams and senior leadership. The candidate will have strong program/project management skills, must have a passion for new challenges, be creative, self-directed, and a great team player. In this role, you will drive continuous process improvement, and collaborate effectively to solve problems and develop requirements for new compliance solutions.

You will need to be the kind of leader who can build, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. You will need to be able to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment, and help create simple solutions to meet your program goals.

Primary Responsibilities

Canada CGP Designated Officer

Provide strategic expertise on Canada Controlled Goods Program and Export Control regulations and advise business customers on compliance program initiatives

Develop and implement strategic compliance processes and solutions to manage and maintain Canada CGP and export regulatory compliance and drive continuous improvements

Partner with Public Policy to engage controlled goods and export control regulators

Monitor regulatory changes

Create metrics for management reporting

Drive process improvement and compliance implementation projects

Own leadership communications to stakeholder teams and executive leadership

Innovate control mechanisms to best meet business goals and compliance requirements


Basic Qualifications

Relevant experience in Canada Controlled Good Program and acting in a Designated Officer capacity

Relevent experience in Export Controls Compliance management in a global corporate environment

Extensive knowledge of Canada Controlled Goods Program requirements and US export control regulations including EAR & ITAR

Experience implementing and managing CGP and Export Controls compliance oversight programs and licenses

Demonstrated leadership and management of compliance projects and programs; prioritization, planning and task delegation


Preferred Qualifications

12+ years’ experience in export compliance in a global corporate environment

Experience working with cloud applicable CGP requirements and export controls

Experience in classification for hardware, software, technology, and control plan implementation

Experience with non-CA export regulations (US, EU)

Track record of taking ownership and driving results

Attention to detail, and the ability to self-start and self-motivate

Experience in working with technology and automation to develop innovative solutions

Ability to mine and analyze data for reporting

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

title: Responsable comptabilité
description:
Description

Notre client est une entreprise dont la mission consiste à offrir aux propriétaires et gestionnaires de chemins de fer, des services complets d’évaluation, d’inspection et de réparation d'infrastructures de réseaux ferroviaires. L'entreprise est réputée pour ses ouvrages d'art et l'excavation générale. Située en Estrie, les activités sont réparties à travers le Québec, l'Ontario et le Nouveau Brunswick. Afin de supporter la croissance grandissante, l'organisation nécessite les services d'une personne qui aime les tâches variées pour contrôler les activités administratives, les opérations du bureau, la gestion financière et contractuelle.

.

Sommaire du poste

Ce rôle est imputable à la bonne gestion des activités financières, du suivi des aspects légaux et budgétaires des contrats afin d'orienter adéquatement les activités du Président et du vice-président. Vous serez responsable de conseiller le président et vice-président et d'assure le bon fonctionnement des fonctions administratives telles que:


  • Faire les recommandations
  • Collaborer avec la présidence pour la planification, la gestion de la trésorerie, l’affectation des fonds et l'analyse de risque.
  • Faire le suivi administratif des contrats et des ententes.
  • Superviser un employés de soutien administratif.
  • Gérer et effectuer les opérations comptables, coordonner la paie et les tâches de bureau.
  • Élaborer des processus, des tableaux de bord de gestion et structurer les activités administratives.
  • Encadrer, suivre et superviser les différents processus de gestion.
  • Assurer les suivis divers avec les parties prenantes (CNESST, gouvernement, Commission de la construction du Québec, fournisseurs, clients, assureurs.)
  • Coordonner la préparation des états financiers.
  • Veiller à la bonne gestion des dossiers d'employés.
  • Négocier les contrats qui concerne les services administratifs.


Profil recherché

La personne idéale possède les qualités requises et le leadership nécessaire avec les exécutifs. Elle détient les connaissances requises et les habiletés pour convaincre en matière de bonnes pratiques de gestion comptable. Elle doit être polyvalente et possèder les connaissances requises pour la gestion des ressources financières, matérielles et humaines. De plus, sont profil répond aux critères suivants:

Baccalauréat en administration, comptabilité ou toute autre combinaison de formation et d'expérience pertinente

5 à 10 ans d'expérience en comptabilité et administration

Expérience dans une entreprise qui touche le génie civil (atout)

Connaissances des aspects de gestion avec la CCQ (un atout)

Excellentes habiletés pour les tâches administratives

Connaissances du suivi des aspects légaux des appels d'offre et des contrats

Bon sens de la communication

Sens accru de l'organisation

Polyvalence et flexibilité pour les tâches en soutien administratif

Habiletés avec les logiciels de la suite Office dont la maitrise d'Excel

Connaissance du système Avantage (un atout)

Maitrise du français et de l'anglais à l'oral et à l'écrit

Avoir accès à un véhicule pour les déplacements entre les bureaux

Appartenance à un ordre professionnel pertinent (atout)

Conditions

Emploi permanent à temps complet

Horaire de jour flexible

Remboursement des frais de cotisation professionnelle pertinente au poste

RVER

Salaire compétitif selon votre expérience

Mesures COVID-19:

Toutes les mesures de sécurité requises par la CNESST sont en place.

Les personnes intéressées par ce poste doivent transmettre leur candidature par courriel à: cv@bocv.com

title: CNC Machinst
description:
About Us

Gerdau Long Steel North America is a leader in mini-mill steel production and steel recycling in North America, with an annual manufacturing capacity of approximately 10 million metric tons of mill finished steel products. Through a vertically integrated network of mini-mills, scrap recycling facilities and downstream operations, the company serves customers throughout the U.S. and Canada, offering a diverse and balanced product mix of merchant steel, rebar, structural shapes, fabricated steel, flat rolled steel and wire rod. Gerdau is the largest recycler in the world. Each year, we transform millions of tons of scrap into steel that is used to build the future.

Why You’ll Love it Here

At Gerdau it’s all about the people. Gerdau’s growth is based on our purpose and a vision focused on excellence. The measures of performance are customer satisfaction, the personal and professional growth of each employee, our communities, and the world. Our culture thrives by embracing diversity, encouraging innovation, and creating products that serve humanity.

Reporting to the Roll Shop Supervisor, this position’s main focus will be to set up and operate a numerically controlled lathe to machine all types of new and used rolls to finished size and contour for all sections rolled in the mill.

What You Will Do
  • Carry out the machining of worn and new steel mill rolls in various materials including cast iron, toolsteel, and carbide, using two CNC roll turning lathes
  • Use profile templates to visually confirm results and identify non-conformities in the machined profiles. Skillful and methodical manipulation of the CNC and programming resources to overcome tool deflection and tool wear, to attain proper template fit.
  • Operate overhead crane to load and unload mill rolls from lathes.
  • Follow established routine procedures for the completion of all machining tasks.
Education/Experience
  • High School Diploma or equivalent general education.
  • General machinist license.
  • Minimum five years’ experience in a conventional & CNC machining environment.
  • Must be able to read and understand CNC programs
  • Crane experience is desirable
  • Experience in manufacturing industry
  • Ability to work a rotating schedule (continental style schedule); 12-hour shifts
  • Use a wide variety of tools and possess an eagerness to learn
  • Possesses strong communication skills, strong math ability and a good work ethic
What Gerdau Offers You
  • Rate: $36.60/hour
  • Health and dental benefits
  • Basic Life/Accidental Life Insurance
  • Pension/RSP Plan
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program
  • Tool Allowance
  • All uniforms and PPE provided
Additional Information
  • All successful candidates must pass a post-medical and ergonomic assessment.
  • Background, education and criminal record check will be performed.
  • Must have the ability to work rotating shifts.
Gerdau believes in equal employment opportunity for all and the importance of each employee and applicant as an individual. It is the policy of Gerdau that there will be no unlawful discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, religion, creed, colour, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disabilities, or other legally protected status. All external applicants must be legally eligible to work in the country of hire without current or future sponsorship. If you need support or accommodation due to disability, please call the Impression Center at (866) 788-2798 or recruiting@gerdau.com .

title: Construction Accounting Manager
description:
Here at Axiom Builders, we pride ourselves on being a down-to-earth organization with serious commitment to building things right. As a leading general contractor of mixed-use, residential, commercial, and special projects, we have become one of British Columbia’s largest construction companies with notable ‘Canada’s 2021 Kincentric Best Employers’ award and current employees in the ’40 Under 40 in Canadian Construction’ list. With clear purpose and principles, we are an organization that is cultivating dedication and growth in our people, clients, and communities. Learn about what we do from our current and up-coming projects here.

Key Responsibilities Include

Axiom Builders is looking for a Construction Accounting Manager to lead and develop a growing project accounting team. As a Construction Accounting Manager, you will manage an accounting team on a diverse portfolio of projects and play an integral role with the growth and development of the business. As the lead liaison for the construction accounting team, you will provide guidance and communicate with leadership on status of projects. The successful candidate is an experienced project accounting expert that can mentor and lead others to achieve their goals together within the organization. As the Accounting and Finance team plans to scale alongside the Construction business, this role will be key in developing the team for long-term success.
  • Mentor and lead a construction accounting team of experienced project accountants with the support of the Controller;
  • Oversee all client invoicing requirements, progress draw preparations, and functions to correctly report on project costs, revenue, and margin;
  • Identify, address, and resolve accounting issues from project teams, trade partners, suppliers, and project management teams;
  • Manage and review accuracy of month-end and quarter-end close processes for various projects including all reconciliations, and project cashflow forecasting and reporting;
  • Evaluate financial and project reports detailing accounts payable status generated by team;
  • Establish communication with all internal and external project stakeholders to ensure the team’s workflow and project deadlines are managed efficiently.
The ideal candidate for the Construction Accountant Manager is a strong leader who is looking for a new challenge within a fast-paced organization. You are sharp and confident in your ability to mentor and manage a team to take ownership of what it takes for everyone to succeed. You empower others to be focused, energized, and driven at work to ensure accounting deadlines are met for all projects. You are extremely detailed and organized, with the ability to effectively manage teams and accounting duties for a portfolio of projects. You are self-driven, motivated, and professional - all of which are leadership traits that are extremely valuable to the organization.

Required Skills And Experience
  • Minimum six (6) years of progressive project accounting and job costing work experience (ideally within the construction industry);
  • Two (2) years in a leadership or management role within a digital and paper-free organization would be ideal;
  • CPA designation and/or currently a CPA candidate working towards a designation is required;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills - demonstrated confidence and ability in communicating effectively and professionally with all stakeholders;
  • Strong analytical, strategic, and problem-solving skills;
  • Expert proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel;
  • Experience with Acumatica ERP or Sage/Timberline systems would be considered an asset;
  • Familiarity with Procore would be considered an asset;
Your Rewards

We are not only committed to the growth of the business, but also to the success and development of our people. We recognize that people are the drivers behind our success, and we provide our teams with the tools and support they need to strive, thrive, and advance their long-term career here.

At Axiom Builder’s, we offer a competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package
  • Medical and Dental Coverage Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost;
  • RRSP Matching Program We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your salary;
  • Professional Development and Education Support We are keen on internal growth and development, which is why we are excited to fully support you in your pursuit of achieving further education;
  • Company Development Our annual development conference that is hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts;
  • Leadership Development Our proprietary Leadership Development program designed to support your continued growth, development and leadership capabilities.
What’s Next

We are always on the lookout for talented people who are passionate about what they do. If you want to love what you do, and believe that with the right tools and opportunities you can grow with us, simply add your resume through our Careers Portal or email careers@axiombuilders.ca to join our incredible team. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

Follow us on our LinkedIn to connect with our Talent Acquisition Team and Instagram to see updates on our current projects.

title: Controller-Fiancial Manager
description:
IPG Photonics (Canada) Inc. designs, develops and manufactures a unique and rapidly growing laser welding process monitoring technology with significant importance to the electric vehicle revolution. We are the national subsidiary of IPG Photonics Corporation (NASDAQ:IPGP).


IPG Photonics Canada Inc. is growing rapidly and is seeking to hire a new Controller/Financial Manager. This hands-on position is responsible for overseeing the financial operations of the subsidiary (~30-50 employees), preparing intra-company reports and basic payroll/benefits administration through existing commercial software platforms.


The ideal candidate will have over 5 years of accounting and financial management experience; a CPA designation is preferred however, candidates with a solid track record of bookkeeping and payroll/benefits administration will be considered as well.


Detailed Responsibilities:

  • Directing all aspects of accounting operations, overseeing all transactions related to general ledger, receivables, payables, payroll and financial reporting.
  • Reconcile general ledger accounts, sub ledgers and prepare reconciliation entries.
  • Administer payroll and benefits specific to the Canadian subsidiary
  • Manage day-to-day banking operations, reconcile monthly bank statements.
  • Applying corporate finance policies.
  • Oversee Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Payroll and Human Resource operations with assistance from corporate headquarters.
  • Fulfill month-end closing requirements.
  • Ensuring that records are maintained in accordance with GAAP/ASPE standards.
  • Prepare documents and forms related to regulatory requirements (GST/HST, CRA, Ministry of Finance, WSIB, StatsCan etc.) and ensure accuracy and timely submission.
  • Work with corporate staff and local accounting firms to prepare tax submissions.
  • Analyze subsidiary and product line profitability and suggest improvements to transfer pricing and related policies.
  • Customized financial reporting as required by management.
  • Administer all payroll activities and benefits administration.
  • Managing all tax planning and compliance with all required federal, provincial, local, payroll, property and other applicable taxes.
  • Calculate royalty payments from sales documentation.

Qualifications:

  • A CPA designation with 5 years of Financial management experience or 10+ years of bookkeeping and payroll administration experience
  • Preference will be given to candidates who are familiar with reporting requirements of a publicly traded company with global subsidiaries, and experience with enterprise ERP software.
  • Meticulous level of detail, highly organized, business oriented, dependable and capable of supporting the rest of the team.
  • Experience working with a rapid growth company is preferred.
  • Self-motivated and interested in streamlining processes.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Able to work with tight deadlines.
  • Strong computer skills. Ability to design/prepare reports and other appropriate documentation.

  • Direct responsibility for maintenance and improvement of accounting systems, methods, procedures and internal controls.

description:

Our client is a growing multi-disciplinary firm in Vancouver that specializes in the transportation, utility, and infrastructure sectors. Due to growth, they are looking to add an Accounting Manager to their team.

title: Responsable comptabilité et gestion
description:
Poste : Responsable comptabilité et gestion

Lieu : Saint-Augustin-de-Desmaures


Description de l’entreprise

Fondé en 2013, Groupe Tertio inc. est une jeune maison d’édition qui se spécialise dans le développement des ressources naturelles. Éditeur des périodiques de la série Ressources & Industrie, les principaux titres produits sont les magazines Ressources Mines & Industrie (RMI) et Ressources Énergies et Industrie (REI), deux périodiques spécialisés (B2B) offerts également au grand public, et Resources Mines and Industry, un périodique spécialisé de langue anglaise. Disponible en version imprimée et numérique, les magazines comptent des abonnés sur l’ensemble du territoire canadien.

L’équipe de Ressources & Industrie travaille activement afin d’accroître la diffusion et la présence de l’ensemble des périodiques de la série. Pour ce faire, de nombreux projets sont présentement en développement tant sur le Web (www.magazineRMI.ca) que dans l’imprimé. Au cours de la dernière année, nous avons poursuivi notre diversification en organisant une première conférence touchant le secteur minier.


Description du mandat

Notre maison d’édition désire consolider sa position de leader dans le développement des ressources naturelles au Québec et poursuivre sa croissance et son développement au Canada. Pour ce faire, nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’une personne autonome, polyvalente, organisée, responsable, qui possède une bonne capacité d’analyse et une grande rigueur pour assurer diverses tâches administratives liés à la gestion et la comptabilité dans une entreprise où le plaisir, le bien-être et l’accomplissement au travail sont des priorités.

Sous la supervision de l’éditeur, la personne aura à intervenir à toutes les étapes du cycle comptable et administratif de la maison d’édition et ce pour l’ensemble de nos activités :

• Tenue de livres et écritures ;

• Conciliation bancaire, balances de vérification des comptes et états financiers ;

• Saisie et classement des factures dans le logiciel comptable ;

• Envoi et suivi des factures des comptes clients et comptes fournisseurs ;

• Gestion et préparation les paies ;

• Saisi de données ;

• Préparer et faire les remises gouvernementales (DAS, rapports TPS, TVQ, et autres) ;

• Suivi comptable et analyse des coûts par projet ;

• Préparation des comptes, rapports, budgets, commentaires et états financiers ;

• Contrôle les budgets des revenus et dépenses ;

• Calcul les comptes de fin d’année ;

• Agit à titre de conseil à la direction ;

• Autres tâches connexes.

La personne retenue sera également responsable de la gestion des abonnements :

• Gestion et mise à jour de la liste des abonnées à chacun des magazines ;

• Préparation et gestion de l’envoi des magazines avec nos fournisseurs ;

• Suivi des abonnements en version papier et numérique.


Exigences

• Formation technique en comptabilité, gestion ou en administration ou BAC en administration ou combinaison d’une formation et d’expérience pertinente ;

• 3 à 5 années d'expérience dans un poste similaire ou tout autre poste jugé similaire ;

• Formation et connaissance en comptabilité ;

• Connaissance de la Suite Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) ;

• Excellente maitrise du français ;

• Maitrise de l’anglais (un atout) ;

• Connaissance du logiciel de comptabilité Sage 50 (un atout) ;

• Faire preuve d’autonomie et d’une grande capacité organisationnelle ;

• Respect de la confidentialité ;

• Respect des échéanciers.


Avantages et conditions de travail

• Poste permanent à temps plein ;

• 28 à 35 h/semaine du lundi au vendredi ;

• 4 semaines de vacances ;

• Congé pendant la période des fêtes ;

• Flexibilité dans les horaires de travail ;

• Conciliation travail-famille ;

• Rémunération concurrentielle ;

• Environnement de travail diversifié, agréable et stimulant.


Pour postuler

Veuillez transmettre votre curriculum vitae avant le jeudi 12 mai 2022 à l’adresse suivante : rh@tertio.ca. Nous communiquerons uniquement avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue en présélection.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
WHO WE ARE?

Tennis Canada is a mission driven, high profile, not-for-profit Registered Canadian Amateur Athletic Association (RCAAA) with offices in Toronto and Montreal. Tennis Canada’s mission is to lead the growth of tennis in Canada and its vision is to become a world-leading tennis nation. Tennis Canada also owns and operates the world-class National Bank Open presented by Rogers tournaments in Toronto and Montreal, two of the best-run sporting events on the planet which annually bring the globe’s best tennis players to Canada and continue to break attendance records year on year. Tennis Canada also owns and operates world class tennis facilities in Toronto and Montreal.


WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance, the Accounting Manager is an integral member of the Tennis Canada Finance Team. This is a fast-paced and very hands-on role that will be responsible for budgeting/ forecasting and also support and coordinate the the day-to-day accounting function of the organization. The Accounting Manager will assist with the full accounting cycle for multiple ledgers, ensuring application of sound accounting principles/practices. The Accounting Manager will also play a key role with some special projects, notably the successful implementation of an ERP/Accounting system within the organization. The Accounting Manager is located in the Toronto office with Finance staff in both Toronto and Montreal. Some travel to the Montreal office will be required.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead and coordinate financial planning and analysis, budgeting, and forecasting for the business. Monitor monthly processes against targets and work with business leads to ensure accountability and prepare Reviews monthly reports for budget and forecast variance analysis
  • Key role to support and coordinate Manages the accounting operations including the review of journal entries, accounts payable, accounts receivable. le, and statutory reporting
  • Conducts monthly reviews of all balance sheet reconciliations with respect to scheduling, grants, and restricted funds
  • Coordinates and prepares all financial statements for the annual audit and other special audits
  • Review and ensures accounts receivable and payable subledgers are fully reconciled
  • Reviews monthly reports for budget and forecast variance analysis
  • Prepares, distributes, and advises on the monthly reports for department managers
  • Approves month end bank reconciliations
  • Prepares and reviews all reporting documents for government reporting such as Sports Canada and other special reports
  • Prepares annual taxes and monthly HST/GST/QST filings
  • Plays a lead role with the implementation of new ERP/Accounting and Procurement systems at Tennis Canada
  • Collaborates with HR to build and review payroll processes
  • Collaborates with members of the Finance Team to develop accounting policies, procedures, and controls and ensure their compliance
  • Conducts payroll data analysis for payroll processes
  • Researches and proposes accounting treatment for complex transactions, where required
  • Provides back-up administrative functions for accounts receivable and payable
  • Assists with special projects, as assigned


WHO YOU ARE?

  • CPA Designation;
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience, of which at least two years were in an auditing firm; Ideally already have experience related to budgeting and forecasting
  • Supervision or team lead experience preferred
  • Advanced working knowledge of Excel and strong database skills;
  • Strong financial acumen and analytical agility;
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills and ability to build lasting relationships;
  • Detail-oriented, organized, and able to meet tight deadlines;
  • Self-motivated, results driven, prefers to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment;
  • Proven prioritization, time management, and project management skills;
  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamics GP is an asset;
  • Ability to converse in basic French. The candidate is not required to be Bilingual however it is considered an asset.


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Be part of a dynamic organization that makes a difference across Canada;
  • Get in the game! Join the National Bank Cup team;
  • Be part of an innovative, vibrant, and passionate team.


Tennis Canada is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to Diversity and Inclusion. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the candidate’s request.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Fantastic opportunity to join a growing and dynamic team - Controller $120k - $130k (US GAAP and Consolidations)

Contact this reputable company through Robert Half about their Controller position, if you have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, and making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and clerical department. If you are good at planning and directing all accounting operational functions, handling the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluating accounting and internal control systems, and leading departmental staff, this role might be right for you. In this role, it will be critical for you to lead with integrity and reliability and have the ability to manage self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability when providing client services. We're looking for creative team players with a talent for challenging the status quo, coming up with unique ideas, negotiating and influencing. You could advance your career through this very competitive and generous compensation and benefits package. This permanent position is for a Controller who will work in the Ottawa, Ontario region.

Your responsibilities in this role
  • Evaluate, implement and streamline policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to ensure efficient and successful firm-wide operation
  • Inspect deliverables of self and team to ensure that they meet client expectations
  • Manage the production of the annual budget and forecasts and monitor them monthly
  • Lead the operations of the finance department which includes accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Handle monthly and annual close of income statement and balance sheet, account reconciliations & G/L analysis
  • Comfortable in taking on tasks beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Handle daily cash management and produce cash-flow reports, calculating cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals
  • Drive the timing for monthly billing and other cash management techniques to ensure the timely cash collection
  • Research, plan and implement Finance Department initiatives including software and systems implementation and other departmental or firm-wide improvements, as needed
Requirements
  • Progressive accounting experience, including as a Controller preferred
  • Earlier experience in public accounting is highly valued
  • Strong communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills, both oral and written, and ability to build as well as deliver effective presentations
  • Comfortable working in a changing and dynamic environment
  • Detailed and have the ability work independently
  • Takes action on items beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Excellent analytical, quantitative and social skills
  • Strong communication and social skills and able to receive criticism well
  • Prior work in technology, analytics and management experience desired
  • Account Setup experience preferred
  • Proven knowledge of month end closings
  • Expertise in financial analysis
  • Solid understanding of US GAAP
  • Solid understanding of Consolidation Processes
  • Hands-on experience with budgeting
  • Comprehension of Annual Operating Budget
  • Well-founded grasp of Acquisition Integration
  • Earlier work involving Analyze Variance

  • Practical knowledge of Analyze Financial Statements
  • Proven knowledge of Accounts Receivable (AR)
  • General familiarity with Actual Variance Analysis
  • Skills in Annual Forecasts
  • Foundational knowledge in risk management
  • Wide ranging experience with Analyze Trends
  • Accounts Payable (AP) experience
  • Strong familiarity with consolidations
  • Experience with Monthly Statements
  • Account Records experience
  • Command of account reconciliation
  • Previous experience working with Annual Financial Reporting
  • Experience with Budget Processes
  • Quality experience with Analyze Revenues
  • Prior experience with budget forecasting\
  • Ability and willingness to meet business critical deadlines
  • CPA/MBA preferred

title: Diversion Control Investigator II, West Coast
description:
Are you looking to make a difference in a patient’s life? At AmerisourceBergen, you will find an innovative and collaborative culture that is patient focused and dedicated to making a difference. As an organization, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures. Join us and Apply today!

What you will be doing

As of August 24, 2021, AmerisourceBergen requires all U.S. team members to be fully vaccinated and show proof of completed vaccine status at time of hire. If you cannot receive the COVID-19 vaccine due to a disability/medical reason or sincerely held religious belief you will be required to follow AmerisourceBergen’s policy and process to apply for an exemption/accommodation.

This role will be supporting West Coast business hours 9:00 am to 6:00 pm, respectively.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Assists in the implementation and operation of the Diversion Control Program.
  • Conducts investigative research via the Internet and public record databases.
  • Conducts Customer Due Diligence (DD) and Suspicious Order Monitoring (SOM) Investigations.
  • Supports the Diversion Control Analyst in the generation of sales reporting as a result of information requests from state and/or federal regulatory authorities.
  • Supports the Diversion Control Analyst in updating the monthly parameter and related OMP maintenance.
  • Monitors and adjusts customer OMP parameters, according to Diversion Control Program policy, as required.
  • Acts as liaison and maintains contact with Sales and Customer Maintenance departments regarding diversion control concerns, as necessary.
  • Acts as liaison with distribution center compliance teams.
  • Generates statistical data on a monthly basis, as directed.
  • Assists with conducting analysis of customer dispensing reports.
  • Assists with conducting targeted, on-site pharmacy visits, as assigned.
  • Assists with DC pre-audit preparation and interviews with state and federal regulators
  • Conducts internal associate training on the Diversion Control Program to other ABC business units, as assigned.
  • Composes comprehensive written reports relative to investigative analysis.
  • Documents all work in a timely and organized fashion for future retrieval purposes.
  • Works independently, requiring less oversight from management and offering coaching to Investigator I level team members
  • Willingness to travel.
  • Perform related duties as assigned.

What your background should look like

Requires broad training in fields such as criminal justice, business administration, accountancy, sales, marketing,

computer sciences or similar vocations generally obtained through completion of a four (4) year bachelor’s degree

program or equivalent combination of experience and education. Normally requires five (5) + years of directly

related and progressively responsible experience.

MINIMUM SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY REQUIREMENTS:
  • Excellent organization and administrative skills.
  • Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office and preferably familiarity with SAP.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong research skills.
  • Ability to multi-task.

What AmerisourceBergen offers

We offer competitive total rewards compensation. Our commitment to our associates includes benefit programs that are comprehensive, diverse and designed to meet the various needs across our associate population.

Throughout our global footprint and various business units, we take a balanced approach to the benefits we offer. Many benefits are company-paid, while others are available through associate contributions. Specific benefit offerings may vary by location, position and/or business unit.

Schedule

Full time

Affiliated Companies

Affiliated Companies: AmerisourceBergen Services Corporation

Equal Employment Opportunity

AmerisourceBergen is committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or membership in any other class protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Gestionnaire de la comptabilité
description:
Contrat à temps partiel à durée indéterminée. Poste flexible évalué à 14 heures par semaine en fonction des besoins (1 à 3 jours par semaine).


Sous la direction de la directrice des opérations et en collaboration avec l’adjointe administrative et notre firme comptable externe, vous serez amené.e à veiller à la veille et à la planification financière et comptable de l’organisation.


MobilityData est un OBNL qui travaille avec des acteurs internationaux de la mobilité pour améliorer l’information voyageur et ainsi favoriser les options de mobilité alternatives à la voiture en solo, comme le transport en commun, ou le vélo-partage. 


Principales responsabilités

  • Monter les budgets des nouvelles unités d’affaire (premiers budgets) en collaboration avec la direction et faire le monitoring trimestriel
  • Effectuer le suivi et la planification des flux de trésoreries dans différentes devises 
  • Analyse des informations financière pour supporter la prise de décision
  • Assurer le point de contact auprès des autorités gouvernementales (Canada, États-Unis et Europe) pour les déclaration de revenus, de salaires et autres exigences légales fédérales, étatiques et locales
  • Assurer les relations avec les institutions financières 
  • Effectuer des opérations bancaires
  • Assurer l’intégrité, la conformité et l’optimisation des processus comptables
  • Contribuer à l'effort d'équipe en réalisant des activités connexes au besoin


Qui vous êtes

  • Rigoureux. Autonome. Bon sens de l’analyse.
  • Bilingue. Vous maitrisez très bien le français et l’anglais pour pouvoir communiquer efficacement avec les collaborateurs unilingues au Canada, aux États-Unis et en Europe, incluant des administrations publiques
  • Expérimenté.e. Vous avez déjà travaillé au moins 5 ans dans le domaine de la finance et comptabilité
  • Joueur.se d’équipe. Vous aimez les interactions interpersonnelles et souhaitez vous investir auprès d’une équipe internationale
  • Organisé.e. Vous êtes une personne ordonnée qui sait faire preuve d’autonomie. Prioriser les projets ? Pff, un jeu d’enfant ! 
  • Google Workspace. Bonne maitrise des logiciels de calcul et de rédaction (feuille de calcul et document Google)
  • Flexible. Vous vous adaptez rapidement aux défis de croissance de l'organisation 


Ce serait encore mieux si

  • Vous possédez un BAA option comptabilité et un titre CPA
  • Vous êtes familier avec le logiciel QuickBooks 
  • Vous avez de l’expérience en OBNL
  • Vous avez de l'expérience avec la comptabilité hors Québec
  • Vous avez un intérêt pour la mobilité partagée et le transport en commun
  • Vous savez travailler dans un environnement macOS


À quoi s’attendre ?

  • Entrée en poste dès que possible
  • Ouverture à l’embauche comme salarié ou contractuel, à discuter
  • Charge flexible de 2 à 3 jours par semaine. La mise en place sera plus intensive (Plutôt 3 jours par semaine pour les 3 à 6 premiers mois) et au fil du temps, on vise à diminuer à 1 journée par semaine en maintenance.
  • Rémunération selon l'expérience - salaire d’entrée salarié de 35 à 40 $ / heure
  • Horaire flexible selon les besoins de l’employé.e
  • Travail à distance, avec possibilité de rencontres trimestrielles à Montréal


  • Avantages offerts aux salariés: 
  • Équivalent de 4 semaines de vacances par année et 1 semaine de congés flexibles
  • Accès aux assurances collectives santé et dentaire payées majoritairement par l’employeur 
  • Abonnement à un service de télémédecine
  • Remboursement des titres de transport en commun et vélo-partage

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Drake Hotel Properties (The Drake) is an evolving lifestyle brand focused on a growing stable of hotels, and food and drink concepts. We are creating our own version of neighbourhood focused retreats where travelers, culture seekers and locals all intersect to enjoy the thoughtful contradictions of contemporary and timeless.


As we continue to broaden the reach of our brand and offerings, we are looking for an Accounting Manager to join + lead a highly engaged team and undertake daily financial oversight and champion the evolution of our accounting operations.


Reporting to the CFO, the Accounting Manager will lead a small but mighty team of 3 in the Accounting Department. You will play a key role in ensuring a staff education, financial analysis, project leadership, and other initiatives as they arise to support the growth of the organization. You require excellent communication, time management and analytical skills.


Job Description:

This position will require a combination of hands-on productivity and management level planning and oversight. Your primary responsibility is the timely and accurate completion of financial statements and management reporting for stakeholders throughout the organization. You will ensure all existing accounting policies, procedures and processes are adhered to and in accordance with best practices. You will establish financial regimen by developing and implementing systems for collecting, analyzing, verifying and reporting financial information. Other accountabilities include, but not limited to:


· Management and co-ordination of all day to day operations within The Drake accounting department

· Ensuring timely and accurate completion of month-end financial statements

· Presentation and review of month end financial results with the CFO

· Preparation of monthly, quarterly consolidated reporting for internal and external stakeholders

· Ownership of the financial and operational reporting with an emphasis on improving and expanding the department’s reporting to drive operational results

· Preparing and co-ordinating the annual budgets including file maintenance, distribution to owners and financial analysis and support

· Leading and participating in departmental projects such as process improvements, launch/integration of new technology & systems and internal audit initiatives

· Oversight and stewardship of the corporate bank accounts, preparation of weekly cashflow reporting

· Management and co-ordination of annual audit/review tasks

· Providing leadership and training to the Accounting department

· Government reporting and compliance


Qualifications:

· 4+ years of progressive accounting experience, including 1+ years of management

· Hotel/Hospitality experience is preferred

· Designated CPA (CMA, CA, CGA) in good standing

· Advanced user of mid-level accounting software (experience with Accpac is preferred)

· Highly proficient in Excel with proven financial analytical skills

· Expert knowledge of GAAP, accounting best practices

· Thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment

· Driven to achieving results, improving systems and developing people


WHAT WE OFFER:

We pride ourselves in providing strong leadership and development opportunities for passionate hospitality professionals who are looking to build rewarding, long-term careers. Drake offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, employee discounts, training + development support and many other unique perks as a part of joining the Drake team.


We sincerely appreciate your interest in this exciting role at The Drake Hotel, however only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


The Drake Hotel is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering a positive, supportive, and creative environment at Drake Hotel Properties that promotes equity, inclusiveness and diversity. We welcome job applications from candidates of all backgrounds including, but not limited to, BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, People of Colour) ;refugees, newcomers and immigrant persons; two-spirit, LGBTQ+ and gender non-binary persons, and persons with disabilities. Please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure you can access and complete the submissions process.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Accounting Manager

Toronto, Ontario – 5 days per week in the office

$80,000-$95,000 base plus bonus, excellent benefits and vacation


Our client is a growing Real Estate company in mid-town Toronto. They are looking for a Senior Accountant or Accounting Manager to join the small and growing team. Previous real estate accounting experience is definitely a nice to have. You must come with experience preparing financial statements and working papers.

The Accounting Manager will report directly to the Controller and will assist with handling the senior level accounting work in the department while supervising a few individuals. The company does five days per week in the office, located mid-town Toronto. Looking for individuals who don’t take themselves too seriously.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop, review and deliver monthly accounting reports to management, external partners and financial institutions
  • Prepare detailed year-end working papers up to draft financial statements, including costs to complete analysis and cost share reconciliations for active long-lived land development projects and for projects in pre-development and wrap-up stages
  • Act as main point of contact with CRA on behalf of the company. Maintain relationships with external auditors
  • Provide monthly financial analysis of projects and operations to the Controller with a goal to seek improvements and compliance with project/partnership goals and continuously seek financial improvement and efficiency for all project and operations
  • Prepare quarterly reports on projects with financial statements to be distributed to investors and partners and financiers
  • Direct, monitor and manage invoice payables of projects while reconciling with the contracts to ensure accurate and consistent procedure and payment
  • Manage the monthly construction draw process with the project cost consultant and construction lender
  • File monthly HST input tax credits on projects

Requirements:

  • University degree or College diploma
  • 5+ years experience in finance/accounting ideally in real estate
  • Some mentorship or supervisory experience
  • Must have financial statement and working paper preparation experience
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Working knowledge of EXCEL
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Positive and professional demeanor

If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please apply now. Unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those individuals chosen for interview will be contacted.

title: Administrateur(trice) - Control-M
description:
À titre de Spécialiste de plateforme d’ordonnancement et d’automatisation (Control-M), vous contribuez à l’efficacité informatique et participez à la mise en place de solutions innovantes et performantes.


Vous analysez, concevez, configurez, administrez, maintenez et faites évoluer les infrastructures d’ordonnancements (Control-M ) et d’automatisation au sein de notre organisation. Votre rôle de spécialiste-conseil et d’expert dans votre domaine permet d’offrir aux équipes une personne-ressource et un coach afin de les aider à produire des solutions simples, performantes, fiables, modernes et qui répondent aux besoins et exigences du marché.


Vous assumez un rôle de leader auprès des différents intervenants et des équipes de développement dans la relation d’affaires et dans le cadre de dossiers et projets portant sur du développement et des interventions stratégiques et complexes, à caractère novateur, tels que l’évolution, la prévention d’incidents, l’assurance-qualité et la maintenance des correctifs. La nature des dossiers exige des connaissances étendues et approfondies dans votre domaine.


Vous formulez des recommandations relatives au développement et à la réalisation de dossiers ou de projets à complexité opérationnelle et conceptuelle élevée. Ceux-ci nécessitent une analyse et une compréhension globale et détaillée du domaine d’affaires et de l’organisation. Les arrimages sont nombreux. Vous êtes appelé à interagir avec un grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés. La maîtrise des relations interpersonnelles, la curiosité et l’autonomie dans la recherche d’information, l’apprentissage des technologies, des tendances autodidactes et la capacité à agir comme facilitateur de changement, deviennent des compétences essentielles.


Responsabilités principales


  • Gérer des projets d’amélioration touchant l’automatisation et les bonnes pratiques de Control-M
  • Rédiger des documents de stratégie de planification

  • Baccalauréat en informatique
  • Un minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinente dans un rôle d'administrateur TI

Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées


Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire

  • Connaissance de l'anglais de niveau intermédiaire

title: Manager of Accounting
description:
Swish Maintenance Limited is a leading national distributor of cleaning products and solutions to institutional, maintenance and facility professionals. Since 1956 Swish has expanded to currently include more than 16 locations across Canada and into the United States. As a proud Canadian family-owned and operated company, we are looking for an experienced and dynamic individual to join our team as Manager of Accounting.


This is a temporary opportunity for 15 months, with the possibility of a permanent position.


Opportunity Overview


Reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer, the Manager of Accounting is responsible for the delivery of financial reporting, managing accounting processes and working closely with staff in areas of Accounts Payable, Cash Receipts, Inventory Control and Reception. This role will work closely with the Chief Financial Officer and other members of the Finance team and has opportunity for growth.


Location - Peterborough, ON


Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for month end closing including, but not limited to the following:
  • Capital Asset Tracking: track additions, disposals, and depreciations
  • Prepaid Expense Tracking: track additions, monthly expense entry, and documentation
  • Maintenance and analysis of standard entries
  • Prepaid Dispenser Tracking: additions, amortizations posting
  • Calculating and processing Sales Taxes on a monthly and quarterly basis
  • Prepare and track accrued liabilities
  • Reconciliation of intercompany accounts
  • Responsible for the analysis of the financial statements.
  • Responsible for company financial audits and preparation of year-end activities.
  • Process external and intercompany transactions and reconcile balances including EFT’s.
  • Perform general accounting responsibilities including but not limited to general ledger, banking, accounts receivable, accounts payable and payroll postings.
  • Responsible for preparation of general ledger adjustments for all branch and company operations.
  • Prepare accounting estimates, accruals, etc.
  • Collaborate with inventory control on various inventory reviews and monthly reports.
  • Daily and monthly cash flow management and reporting.
  • Responsible for ensuring timely payment of Government remittances, EHT and WSIB and other government compliance requirements.
  • Bank account management, cash application and reconciliation.
  • Prepare for and assist with all external auditors.
  • Prepare ad-hoc reporting as requested.
  • Work closely with the accounts payable department. Ensure timely processing of employee expense claims, km reimbursements, vendor payments (ensuring maximum QPDs) and resolution of all AP matters.
  • Identify, monitor and resolve issues affecting non-payment of vendor invoices.
  • Provide guidance and expertise toward improving financial systems and processes.
  • Other duties as assigned.


Experience and Skills

  • Accounting designation (C.P.A-CA, CMA, CGA) would be considered an asset, but is not required
  • 5+ years of experience with accounting, financial analysis and operations work
  • 5+ years of experience and proficiency in financial statement preparation and analysis including interpreting financial information
  • Must have experience with computerized financial systems and advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Strong prioritizing skills and can easily manage multiple projects
  • Must be self-motivated, flexible, organized and possess good time management skills
  • Proven ability to work independently in a demanding, fast paced, constantly changing

title: Accounting Manager - Automotive
description:
Currently we are seeking individuals for the following position, please take note that this position is time sensitive, and we advise you to apply immediately and express your skills and abilities that pertains to the job description.


If you are an Accounting/Finance specialist with 5+ years of finance and accounting experience in a manufacturing or automotive environment looking for a permanent position with a leading company, Bartech can help!



Location - Port Hope, Ontario


SCHEDULE

  • Hybrid role – Can work from home couple of days per week.
  • Monday to Friday


TRAVEL

  • Job is to be located at the Port Hope plant, but they will be required to travel to the Guelph and Belleville plants regularly
  • Travel will be reimbursed.


VACCINATION

  • Must have complete Proof of Covid Vaccination to be eligible.


PURPOSE OF POSITION

  • This is a hands-on role in the Finance department of a large manufacturing facility.
  • Responsible for directing and supervising the plant’s financial and cost accounting functions and supporting the annual budget and forecast activities.
  • Demonstrates expertise in a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures.
  • Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Oversees the daily operations in the accounting department including supervision of Financial and Cost Accounting activities, Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable.
  • Manages the maintenance of the standard costing system, including bills of materials, variance reporting and inventory control.
  • Support activity surrounding quoting of new business initiatives, including costing and profitability models.
  • Maintains the system of accounts and ensures accuracy and integrity of the books and records, including accurate and timely account analysis and reconciliation.
  • Oversees completion of month end close activities and ensure accurate and timely submission of all Corporate and internal reporting requirements.
  • Coordinates and directs the preparation of the annual financial budget and forecast updates as required.
  • Conducts reviews of financial performance on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis as required.
  • Reports on actual performance versus budget and provides plant operations management with analysis to support decision making.
  • Provides support for capital expenditure projects including analysis required to support the approval of the project.
  • Responsible for managing the maintenance of the fixed asset sub-ledger including reconciliation of the sub-ledger to the General Ledger, ensuring timely updates for additions and disposals, tagging of assets on the shop floor.
  • Work with Plant Management on cost improvement activities which include regular review of plant projects, validating the financial impact and forecasting and reporting savings.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • University degree (Bachelor's) required.
  • Chartered Professional Accountant (required) – License/Certification or 7 years’ accounting experience in automotive or manufacturing environment.
  • Professional designation in a recognized accounting program.
  • 5+ years of finance and accounting experience in a manufacturing environment, familiar with Lean manufacturing principles.
  • Superior knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles


COMPETENCIES

  • Accounting Principles & Standards
  • Demonstrated Leadership Abilities
  • Budgeting & Cash Flow Management
  • Cost Analysis & Reduction


BENEFITS

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Car lease program

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Hankook Tire is a global corporation that has consistently met the challenges of the future, always a step ahead of changes in the world economy. Over our 70 years of history, we have continuously grown in quality and size while strengthening our reputation. Hankook is actively embracing the global stage through constant technological development and commitment to innovation. We are taking a leap to become a leading global tire company that provides sustainable solutions to deliver ultimate driving satisfaction to all customers.


As a world leader in the tire manufacturing industry, Hankook Tire Canada is seeking an eager and enthusiastic experienced Accounting Manager to join our successful GTA team immediately.

The Accounting Manager maintains accounting practices and procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial statements. This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including general ledger preparation, financial reporting, year-end audit preparation and the support of budget and forecast activities. The Accounting Manager supervises and is responsible for managing the team to ensure that work is properly allocated and completed in a timely and accurate manner.

The position will report to the President of Hankook Tire Canada, to the Americas Regional Headquarters and to the Global Headquarters in South Korea.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for month end closings, quarterly and annual financial reporting

Monthly review of balance sheet reconciliations including intercompany accounts

Manage day-to-day accounting operations with expertise in accounts payable, payroll, government reporting/payment and general ledger reconciliations

Perform general ledgers and financial statement analysis

Ensure compliance with company policy and procedure

Prepare reporting package to the parent company

Perform internal accounting control assessment

Ensure quality control over financial transactions and financial reporting

Manage staffing of accounting team to achieve efficient process continuity.

Responsible for cash management, budgeting and forecasting

Assist in the annual and interim audit, including coordination of external auditors’ requests and completion of supporting schedules.

Research, interpret and implement new accounting regulations and tax rulings

Ensure that all regulatory and government returns and reporting (monthly GST/HST, QST, annual returns) are filed on time.

Environmental handling fees monitoring and management

Government authorities' tax audit

Payroll & Benefits Administration functions.

Provide HR support and other administrative duties as required.

Any other responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time


QUALIFICATIONS:

College/University graduate in Business/Finance/Operations

CPA, CA/CMA/CGA or working towards it is an asset

At least 5+ years of accounting experience

Bilingual (English and Korean) is a must

Team player, with strong leadership skills comfortable interacting at senior management

Strong supervisory skills

Advance Microsoft Excel skills

Excellent Organizational and Communication skills

Exceptional work ethic

Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), and planning skills


We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. To be considered, candidates must be able eligible to work in Canada.


We are committed to diversity and inclusion. Hankook Tire is an equal opportunity employer and qualified candidates will be considered regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, cultural or national background, marital status, disability status, and any other basis protected by Ontario law.


Under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), Hankook Tire provides accommodation supports throughout the recruitment process upon request. If you require accommodation at any point throughout the recruitment process, please let us know.
