title: Accounting Manager
description:
Our client, a leader in the apparel industry is looking for an Accounting Manager to join their team. The right candidate will be responsible for all aspects of Finance Functions and will play a key role supervising Accounts Payables (including developing and managing performance).

As Accounting Manager, your accountabilities are to perform:

  • month-end and year-end closing functions
  • post month-end and related journal entries
  • analyze general ledger accounts
  • maintain internal financial controls
  • participate in annual physical inventory counts
  • support and lead finance projects
  • assist with preparation of annual audit, annual business plan, planning, forecasting and ad hoc analysis, etc.
  • Takes action on items beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Manage the production of the annual budget and forecasts and monitor them monthly
  • Prepare cash-flow reports, projecting cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals, daily cash management
  • Lead the operations of the finance department which includes accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Present monthly financial reports to management
  • Evaluate, implement and streamline policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies

The Accounting Manager will have:

  • Strong end-to-end accounting experience within complex manufacturing setting.
  • Managerial experience, (strong AP management), leadership skills and hands-on approach.
  • Solid analytical and communication skills.
  • Be system savvy
  • Have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, and making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and clerical departments
  • You might be a good fit for this position if you can plan and direct all accounting operational functions, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluate accounting and internal control systems, and lead departmental staff.
  • The successful Accounting Manager will have solid technical accounting background and will come with critical thinking and strong communication skills. This exciting opportunity required working onsite.

Requirements:

- Outstanding analytical, quantitative and social skills

-Advanced Excel skills & proficiency

- CPA or pursuing a CA

- Be detailed, flexible, and organized

- Strong organizational skills and a proven ability to meet deadlines

- Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

- Prior work in apparel/manufacturing is an asset

Self-starter and strong ethical standards

title: Director, Carbon Accounting & Finance
description:
The Organization

Wolf Midstream is an Alberta-based private company backed by CPP Investments. Wolf was formed in 2015 to focus on the acquisition and construction of high-quality midstream infrastructure assets in Western Canada. Wolf has grown through a series of acquisitions resulting in 100% ownership of the Access Pipeline System and the recent greenfield construction of the Alberta Carbon Trunk Line, a CO2 capture and transportation system. It is currently constructing the NGL North project, a fully integrated natural gas liquids recovery, transportation, and separation system. Wolf, with its team of nearly 200 employees, is committed to developing innovative, sustainable midstream solutions and transforming the future of carbon reduction through the development of world-scale CO2 infrastructure in both Canada and abroad.

Wolf’s mission is to maintain operational excellence, foster strong relationships with customers and stakeholders, and enrich communities while generating returns on investment. Wolf has an uncompromising commitment and respect for health, safety, and the environment. Based on a strong set of core values, Wolf’s defining behaviors are Act Like Shareholders, Be Customer Focused, Be Courageous, Do the Right Thing and Own It!”

The Opportunity

Wolf Carbon, a division of Wolf, is focused on constructing, owning, and operating Carbon Capture, Utilization and Storage CCUS infrastructure in Canada. Wolf’s initial carbon asset is the ACTL which Wolf operates and is the world’s largest capacity CO2 pipeline focused on man-made CO2. Wolf is currently developing a permanent storage solution that will be connected to the ACTL and seeking additional growth areas in CO2 infrastructure.

This role provides senior level leadership for Wolf Carbon’s accounting and financial functions. It is an excellent opportunity for a high energy individual to be integrally involved in the business operations, business growth initiatives, and other strategic initiatives which extend Wolf Carbon’s expanding business.

Key Responsibilities

The successful candidate’s duties will involve finance, treasury, and operations accounting. In addition, you will support the Wolf Carbon new deal team with financial modeling and analysis and structuring.
  • Reports to the Wolf Carbon President and will manage, coach, and provide professional mentoring to one professional senior accountant.
  • Oversee timeliness and integrity of all accounting, accounts payable, tax, and financial reporting functions.
  • Monitor revenue, operating costs, G&A, and capital budgets.
  • Provides senior leadership for budget and forecasting processes.
  • Review day-to-day accounting vouchers, cash ledger, bank reconciliations, and GST filings.
  • Review month-end close including general ledger analysis and reconciliations.
  • Review monthly revenue and operating accruals, invoices, management reports and cash forecast.
  • Accountable for financial risk management for Wolf Carbon and act as a key liaison with external broker for insurance products.
  • Provides senior leadership to supporting staff that liaise directly with auditors for commercial audits and annual financial audits.
  • Oversee, implement jointly with others, and monitor internal controls for financial reporting.
  • Represent Wolf Carbon on strategic finance initiatives at the Wolf platform level.
  • Provide financial modeling support for new opportunity analysis working closely with the Wolf Carbon Business Development team and Wolf platform.
  • Provides guidance on modelling and forecasting for new opportunities into existing Wolf Carbon financial model.
  • Contribute to the new opportunity investment materials for Wolf leadership and the Board.

Qualifications And Experience

Skills:
  • Self-starter with the ability to contribute at both a strategic and a detailed operational level in a lean organization.
  • Strong understanding of the utility or midstream energy industry in Western Canada.
  • Solid IFRS financial reporting skills and proficient in accounting practices, procedures, and systems.
  • Robust problem solving and decision-making skills.
  • Critical thinking skills to support the development and implementation of key accounting and finance processes.
  • Proficiency in excel including financial modeling.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Attention to detail, organization, and desired accuracy.

Education:
  • Professional accounting or finance designation
  • MBA, CFA or CBV designation a bonus

Experience:
  • Minimum of 10 years related experience in senior financial roles within the energy industry.
  • A proven track record successfully meeting commitments in a deadline-driven, fast paced environment.
  • Experience in interpreting, operationalizing, and administering terms and conditions of complex contracts.

Rewards:
  • Competitive compensation and bonus program
  • Comprehensive benefits
  • Employer matched savings plan
  • Hybrid remote work model
  • Parental leave top-up
  • Flex time

Wolf Midstream is an equal opportunity employer.

Wolf acknowledges that our operations are within the traditional territories of the Indigenous peoples of the Treaty 6, Treaty 7, and Treaty 8 regions and the Métis Settlements and Métis Nation of Alberta, Regions 1, 2, 3 and 4. We respect the histories, languages, and cultures of First Nations, Metis, Inuit, and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our company and the greater community.

Interested candidates should apply at www.wolfmidstream.com by May 16, 2022. We thank all for their interest; however, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Apply Now

title: Global Manufacturing Accounting Manager
description:
About Sensei Ag

Sensei Ag is a market-changing AgTech company aiming to solve global gaps and inconsistencies in nutrition, food safety, and food security through the transformative power of data. Guided by the capabilities and insights of our founders, technology entrepreneur Larry Ellison and Dr. David Agus, we design, develop and deploy cutting-edge agricultural technologies to build a better, more stable food supply that is capable of feeding our entire world nutritionally-relevant, delicious, affordable meals.

Everything we do is evidence-led, radically transparent, always enriching. 

Learn more from our website or by following us on LinkedIn. If you'd like to see what we are doing with our consumer-facing brand Sensei Farms, please check our Instagram!

Position Description

Manufacturing Cost Accounting Director provides analysis and review of all the plants operational costs to Sensei leadership, financial planners and accounting management.

The Global Manufacturing Accounting Manager will help develop and manage the cost accounting team in completing gross margin analyses related to a company's products, inventory and its overall value. As an essential part of the accounting function, cost accountants calculate the costs of goods sold on the company's financial reports, which affects the company's bottom line. The Global Manufacturing Accounting Manager is also required to use BOM creation formulas, NetSuite software and spreadsheets to help management and business owners decide what prices to charge for products.

Responsibilities
  • Set up systems and processes for the costing function, this includes the full range of Cost Accounting activities.
  • Prepare and provide analysis of cost variance.
  • Work closely with Supply Chain to provide them with support relating to cost-related matters.
  • Forecast and budgeting for Product Managers and Sales Management.
  • Conduct Rotational Inventory Audit (physical stock count).
  • Ensure audit and internal compliance.
  • Assist each company with physical inventory counts and cycle counts.
  • Assists consolidated companies with month end close.
  • Participate in the preparation of the annual plant operating budget including standard product cost. development, budgeted variances, cost center budgeting, headcount requirements, volume analysis and raw material pricing analysis.
  • Participates in the coordination & preparation of plants' operating forecasts vs budget.

Required Skills, Abilities And Qualifications
  • Minimum of 5 years of accounting management experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Need a working understanding of the different techniques used to evaluate a product's cost such as the standard and traditional methods.
  • Need to know how to design or create data collection systems and then analyze the data for operations team and senior management.
  • Require the ability to communicate with people from multiple layers of a company – that includes people from management to laborers.
  • Along with calculating direct labor, material and production costs, responsibilities include establishing the value of inventory as it changes with market fluctuations.
  • Establish cycle counts and wall-to-wall physical inventory counts, investigating variances that arise.

Preferred Skills, Abilities And Qualifications
  • Previous personnel management.
  • Agriculture industry.
  • CPA or GAAP knowledge.

Educational Requirements
  • Bachelor's in Accounting or Finance.

Traits We Value
  • Appreciation for transforming health and the future of food
  • Smart, not arrogant
  • Humble and hardworking
  • Entrepreneurial, not risk averse
  • Kind and genuine
  • Grit and lots of it

Compensation & Benefits
  • Prescription Drug Coverage
  • Paramedical Services
  • Medical Supplies & Equipment
  • Hospitalization
  • Out of Province Emergency Medical Assistance
  • Vision Care
  • Dental Care
  • Basic Life Insurance & AD&D
  • STD
  • LTD
  • Optional Voluntary Life, AD&D, Critical Illness

For the health and safety of all employees, Sensei Ag has a strict COVID-19 policy. All employees are required to wear a mask except when actively eating or drinking. Frequent hand washing, physical distancing, and use of job assigned PPE is required.

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. This is not an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel in the job. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.

Sensei Ag is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Commission and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise People Operations if you require an accommodation.

title: Controller Accounting Manager
description:
Blanchett Neon is currently seeking a Controller / Accounting Manager to join our industry-leading team of professionals in Edmonton, AB. This position will be ideally suited for a recently graduated CPA. In order to succeed in this role, the individual will need to display competence in finance, be a great operational communicator, and be able to achieve pre-determined goals and timelines (excellent time management skills are needed to meet weekly, monthly, and annual reporting deadlines). Initially the position will be reporting directly into the Vice President, and overtime will be part of the senior leadership team and oversee the accounting department.

Full Cycle Accounting

Key Responsibilities
  • Billing and collections (Production & Service)
  • Complex Unionized Payroll (Production & Service)
  • Familiar with Union Agreements and Remittances, Commission Sales, Taxable Benefits, CRA Remittances, Employee Benefits
  • Monthly Bank Reconciliation
  • Monthly Credit Card Reconciliation
  • Monthly WIP and COGs Reconciliation
  • Weekly, monthly, annual journal entries (recurring and complex)
  • Benefits administration
  • Accounts payable
  • Inventory & WIP
Management
  • Oversee the accounting department staff
  • Project based accounting
  • Management Reporting (Monthly and Yearly Financial Statements, Financial Modelling, Dashboards, as well as Internal Reporting)
  • Work with the President on corporate matters
  • Be the key banking contact
  • Work with the purchasing department on inventory controls and month end accounting
  • Work with the production department on scheduling and reporting
  • Ad-hoc requests as assigned
Education And Experience Needed To Succeed
  • Near completion, or completion of the CPA accounting designation
  • Sage 50 Premium Accounting Certification (would be an asset)
  • Sage 50 Premium Accounting Work Experience
  • Level 1 CPA - Certified Payroll Association (would be an Asset)
  • Payroll Experience, unionized payroll is an asset
  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
  • Manufacturing experience is an asset
  • Knowledge of MISys Manufacturing an asset
Salary range is at 70K to 80K + benefits

Why Work for Us?

Edmonton-based, family-owned and operated company with over 70 years of success.

Full Benefits Package and RRSP program after the probationary period.

Opportunities for Advancement and Personal Development.

Blanchett would like to thank all applicants for their interest, but only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

Since 1947, Blanchett Neon is Western Canada’s premier supplier of quality business and custom signage products, from spectacular freestanding pylon signs to eye-catching store front channel letter displays; traditional neon signs to state-of-the-art LED Electronic Message Centres.

Whatever your signage requirements, Blanchett is the one-stop-shop. As a full-service Edmonton Sign Company, we offer innovative and creative design, quality manufacturing, COR status installations, and timely on-site service and maintenance, whether you are looking for a custom-designed one-of-a-kind display for a single location or a branding solution across provinces.

Our Edmonton Sign Company also offers additional business signage services including landlord signage criteria, tender assistance, signage legislation and permitting, and consulting to support our clients’ every needs.

title: Development Accounting Manager
description:
THE TEAM:

There are countless reasons to consider a career with Porte. For starters, you’ll be part of an encouraging, supportive team with plenty of room for growth. You’ll enjoy perks like training and team building events throughout the year. Plus, there’s our roof top patio, Friday happy hour, a weekly fitness workout and more!

 

You’ll be an integral part of a family company, building on over 50 years of success, amazingly generous charitable work and progressive leadership in the real estate industry. At all times guided by the Porte Promises of: People-Focused, Committed to Excellence, Trustworthy and Community Builders.

 

Porte manages 700 plus rental units and over a million sq. ft. of commercial space. In addition to the income portfolio Porte has a healthy development pipeline of sites across Metro Vancouver.  Please visit www.porte.ca to see our properties and projects!

 

JOB SUMMARY:

Reporting to the VP Finance and Accounting, the Development Accounting Manager performs duties for Porte Development Corporation, including full cycle accounting for development projects, cash flow preparation, receivable, accounts payable, data entry, bank deposits and month-end reporting duties. 

 

JOB DUTIES:

•  Deliver and complete accurate multi-year draw requests to support cash management objectives.

•  Complete all time-sensitive deliverables accurately, including draw processing and deposit and sales reconciliations

•  Ensure closings are accounted for to properly recognize revenues

•  Ensure regulatory filings happen on schedule

•  Complete full-cycle accounting and month-end close

•  Communicate effectively and professionally with the internal customer group (development, marketing, sales, legal, customer care, corporate accounting)

•  Assists with the preparation of finance proposals.

•  Produces cash flow proformas for the development projects

•  Working with managers and staff, prepares an annual budget and monitors the budget against actual revenues and expenditures on an ongoing basis.

•  Reports on the operating budget, and on overall project budgets, and tracks and reports on budget variances.

•  Assists the preparation of the draw (loan) requests and follows up to ensure funding, with the contractor, lender, quantity surveyor and others.

•  Monitors and follows up with return of letters of credit and deposits.

•  Liaises with development team on proforma inputs

 

TEAMWORK AND SUPERVISION:

•  Participates as a member of the Accounting team and the Development team

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Required training, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities:

•  Minimum 5 - 7 years development accounting experience.

•  Experience in both commercial and residential is preferred.

•  Strong writing and self review skills.

•  Strong technical and administrative skills.

•  Strong knowledge of Yardi Job Cost.

•  Experience working in a fast-paced environment.

•  High level of organization and attention to detail.

•  Strong communication skills and the ability to work well individually and in teams.

•  Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint 

•  Technology savvy

•  Ability to write and communicate clear ideas


If you are interested in applying, please send a cover letter and resume to careers@porte.ca. No phone calls please. Due to the anticipated volume of applications, we will only be able to respond to those selected for an interview.  Thank you for your interest in this opportunity with Porte Communities.

title: Contrôleur financier- Entreprise en croissance - Ville de Québec
description:
Tu es actuellement à l'emploi d'un cabinet comptable et tu es enfin prêt à faire le saut en entreprise? Tu es plutot en entreprise et tu vises un poste de Contrôleur financier dans une grande entreprise?

Tu souhaites retrouver une conciliation travail-vie (adieu les heures supplémentaires!) ?

Tu es autonome et tu aimes apprendre?

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un nouveau Contrôleur financier pour une entreprise d'envergure (à l'échelle national).

Si tu souhaites te joindre à une belle équipe de CPA chevronnée, c'est un poste tout simplement parfait pout toi!

Avantages

Le Contrôleur financier- Entreprise en croissance - Ville de Québec aura accès à plusieurs avantages tel que :
  • Poste permanent, à temps plein sans heures supplémentaires ;
  • Horaire de travail flexible;
  • Télétravail 2 à 3 jours semaines;
  • Salaire concurrentiel, établi selon expérience;
  • Vacances établies selon expérience;
  • Programme d’assurances collectives et cotisation REER de l'employeur;
  • Facile d’accès en transport en commun;
  • Entreprise en croissance et opportunités d’avancements à moyen terme;
  • Gym à proximité.

Responsabilités

Vos principales responsabilités en tant que Contrôleur financier- Entreprise en croissance - Ville de Québec seront:
  • Préparer les états financiers des différentes divisions;
  • Participer à la consolidation des états financiers;
  • Être la personne ressource au niveau de l'équipe de comptabilité;
  • Être la personne ressource au niveau de divers dossiers fiscaux;
  • Participer à la préparation du dossier de vérification;
  • Préparer divers rapports pour la direction;
  • Participer à des mandats spéciaux.

Qualifications

Les qualifications recherchées sont:
  • BAA en comptabilité;
  • Titre CPA ou en voie d'obtention;
  • 2 -4 ans d'expérience pertinente.

Sommaire

Intéressé par le rôle de Contrôleur financier- Entreprise en croissance - Ville de Québec?

Vous pouvez me rejoindre au 418.955.4199 pour en discuter de vive voix ou faites-moi parvenir votre CV à amy.young@randstad.ca

Vous n'êtes pas prêt à postuler, ou avez-vous d'abord des questions? Appelez-moi pour discuter en toute confiance.

Vous êtes ouvert à de nouvelles opportunités? Contactez-moi! Il me fera plaisir de discuter de vos aspirations professionnelles et de discuter du marché avec vous.

Rejoignez mon réseau LinkedIn : linkedin.com/in/amy-young-cpa-40057584/

Pour consulter la liste complète des postes actuels : www.randstad.ca

Au plaisir de vous connaître!

Amy Young, CPA

Partenaire en capital humain

L'humain en tête

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à accessibilite@randstad.ca pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Summary:

XTL Transport Inc., is looking for an Accounting Manager with a strong work ethic and a positive team attitude. The Accounting Manager is responsible for accurate and timely financial reporting, compliance, cash management and tax reporting. This position also requires occasional travel to Toronto and potentially other locations.


Qualifications:

·       Professional Accounting Designation (CPA) or working towards the CPA accounting designation is required

·       Accounting firm experience is an asset

·       Minimum of five years of progressive accounting experience, with a portion being at the supervisory level

·       Advanced Microsoft excel skills and experience/comfort in different ERP systems

·       A common knowledge of ASPE and IFRS is an asset

·       Experience with an asset heavy /Warehousing or Transport industry is an asset

·       Excellent time management, organizational and people skills

·       Basic knowledge of accounting systems, budgets, and internal control.


Responsibilities:

·       Managing period end and year-end accruals so that they accurately reflect the company’s position and trends

·       Preparing and reviewing operating statements on a period/monthly basis (3 main legal entities and growing)

·       Accurately reviewing bank reconciliations, continuity schedules, and some tax compliance returns

·       Maintaining a clean and functional general ledger system 

·       Assist in audits, assistance in preparation and review of audit work papers

·       Manage internal departmental relationships and external Audit relationships well

·       Helping coordinate a smooth budget process, and work with various budget templates

·       Training/supervising and maintaining strong relationships with the finance team

·       Review intercompany billing process on a monthly/quarterly basis.

·       Prepare detailed working papers for year-end audit in collaboration with the accounting team  

·       Help prepare quarterly & year-end financial statements including tax provision.

·       Assisting controller and CFO in ensuring compliance and implementation of strong accounting standards.

·       Participate in various process improvement and assist in implementation of internal controls

·       Participate in preparation of annual corporate tax returns

·       Perform ad hoc projects and analysis as requested/needed 


  • XTL OFFERS:

·       Fast paced team atmosphere with an inclusive environment

·       Great benefits including health, dental, and life insurance, and RRSP match program

·       Strong social and philanthropy committees to complement our community and entrepreneurial culture

·       XTL is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity in the workplace and equivalently considers applications from qualified women, men, visible minorities, aboriginal people and persons with disabilities. We welcome applications from all interested individuals; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

LOCATION:

Vaudreuil

START DATE:

title: Accounting Manager
company: The Mason Group - Strategic Search Partners
description:
Our client is looking for a high energy Accounting Manger to join their accounting team. Team members work closely together to service the administrative and financial needs of the firm. The setting is highly‐confidential, professional, and collegial. The Accounting Managers responsibilities include establishing financial status by developing and implementing systems for collecting, analyzing, verifying and reporting information.

Key responsibilities of the Accounting Manager includes:

  • Plan, implement and oversee overall accounting strategy
  • Oversee accounting daily operations
  • Take responsibility for accounts payable/receivable, cash receipts, general ledger, and, budgeting, cash forecasting, revenue and expenditure variance analysis, capital assets reconciliations, general and trust account statement reconciliations, cheque runs
  • Monitor and analyze accounting data
  • Regularly produce financial reports or statements for management
  • Adhere to proper accounting methods, policies and principles
  • Encourage other employees to adhere to standards
  • Train new employees
  • Manage outbound and incoming wires, money orders, bank drafts, currency conversions
  • Liaise with bank manager
  • Assist accountants with year end
  • File quarterly transaction levy reports
  • Prepare monthly BMO Margin Report
  • Handle all complex accounting issues
  • Verify cheques for the bank upon request
  • Verify cheques if cheques are cashed or not requested by files handlers/ clients


Requirements


  • 5+ years proven accounting experience in the professional services industry
  • University Degree in Finance, Accounting, Analytics, Mathematics, or business-related discipline
  • Achieved or working towards CPA
  • Well-organized with ability to prioritize multiple projects
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with ability to influence different points of view
  • Experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI), Excel Power Pivot databases and NetSuite


If you are already registered with The Mason Group, please contact your Recruiting Consultant directly with reference to job #16079.

title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
DIRECTOR OF FINANCE

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club

The Club

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club is a private members' club in the heart of Rosedale, Toronto, and is conveniently located on the Yonge Street subway line. The Club has a long history, since 1876, of providing excellent tennis courts, coaching and programming for players of all ages and has built its reputation as the premier tennis club in Canada

In addition to 18 tennis courts (four indoors) the Club has four squash courts, a Fitness Centre, a seasonal pool, a Wellness Centre, and food and beverage outlets. The Club has 3,000 members, including family members of all ages; annual revenues are approximately $14 million. From high-caliber tennis, to all-around athletics and exceptional social scene, membership is about belonging to a uniquely warm community located right in the heart of Rosedale.

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club is a historic facility that has been witness to the best tennis since the 19th century. Legends like Borg, Navratilova, Connors and Evert have all graced the club’s Har-Tru courts.


The Position

We are recruiting an accomplished full time Director of Finance to take charge of the Club's accounting and finance functions. Reporting to the General Manager/Chief Operating Officer (GM/COO), the Director of Finance is an integral member of the Senior Management Team and will lead an accounting team of three people.  The Director of Finance is a contributing team manager to the overall Club operation, and manages the financial operations of the Club, supervises the accounting functions, and provides analytical support to the GM/COO, Finance Committee, Board of Directors and others for planning, budgets, and solutions to business problems. This includes recommendations on the implementation and maintenance of the Club's financial plans and policies, its accounting practices, fiscal records, and the preparation of financial reports. The Director of Finance is a strong Club business partner, and makes decisions in accordance with Club policy on administrative or operational matters, ensuring the effective achievement of objectives.

The Director of Finance will be responsible for the following:

  • Recommend and implement policies to control and coordinate accounting, auditing, budgets, taxes and related activities and records; develop, establish, and administer procedures and systems pertaining to financial matters. Responsible for the Club’s internal controls and compliance to same.
  • Prepare financial statements, forecasts, and analysis for all administrative and managerial functions. Maintain all accounting records; develop, analyze, and interpret statistical and accounting information.
  • Manage the annual audit.
  • Evaluates and recommends insurance coverage for protection against property losses and potential liabilities.
  • Coordinates and directs the preparation of the annual operating and capital budgets, business plan, and financial forecasts; institutes and maintains other planning and control procedures; and analyzes and reports variances. The Club performs in a fiscal year beginning January 1 of each year.
  • Development, analysis, and interpretation of statistical and accounting information in order to appraise operating results in terms of profitability, performance against budget, and other matters bearing on the fiscal soundness and operating effectiveness of the organization.
  • Responsible for evaluating the performance of several personnel in the Administration department. This individual recommends training requirements, has the duty to keep the staff at the highest level of skill necessary to meet Club needs and objectives.
  • Responsible for the development, implementation, and operation of all accounting and information systems support; for the administration, management, and maintenance of the equipment systems employed in the collection of information and for the training and supervision of staff related, but not limited, to the Administration department.
  • Establishes major economic objectives and policies for the Club and prepares reports that outline the Club's financial position in the areas of receivables, payables, payroll, purchasing, fixed asset accounting, cash flow management and banking arrangements.
  • Furnishes internal reports, revises, and updates reports to be more useful and efficient, and furnishes external reports, including for tax and other government reporting, as necessary.


Candidate Profile:

  • ﻿ Professional Accounting designation (CPA);
  • Ten years of professional accounting experience with at least two years as Controller;
  • Experience working with Not-for-profit Organizations, the private club industry, and volunteer committees;
  • Excellent management, leadership, analytical and interpersonal skills
  • Strong communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations.
  • Knowledge of pertinent Ontario and federal employment laws and practices.


Compensation:

The Club will offer an attractive compensation package, commensurate with experience, which will include a competitive base salary, bonus, and benefits.


Note:

The position is currently vacant.

 

Inquiries:

 

IMPORTANT: Interested candidates should submit resumes along with a detailed cover letter which addresses the qualifications and describes your alignment/experience with the prescribed position by Friday, May 13th at 5:00pm EDT. If you require any accommodations to be considered for this position please include that information in your submission. Those documents must be saved and emailed in Word or PDF format (save as “Last Name, First Name, Toronto Lawn Finance Cover Letter” and “Last Name, First Name, Toronto Lawn Finance Resume”) respectively to: execsearch@globalgolfadvisors.com  

 

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact those selected for an interview. Please email resume with references.

 

 

Lead Search Consultants:

 

 

Michael Gregory

Partner

GGA Partners™

michael.gregory@ggapartners.com

 

Liz McDowell, CPA, CA, CCM

Director                                  

GGA Partners™

Liz.mcdowell@ggapartners.com

title: Manager of Accounting
description:
The Manager of Accounting is part of the administration team and is responsible for the oversight of the accounting and reporting functions of Shalom Manor Long Term Care Home, Shalom Manor Non-Profit Seniors Assisted Living Apartments and Mount Nemo Christian Nursing Home. The manager will oversee the work of 3 staff and provide guidance on duties and manage workload responsibilities as they assist the manager with the accounting functions. The position will be required to liaise with resident families in support of billing, accommodation fees and trust transactions. The manager will be led by the Director of Finance & Administration whom will provide guidance, mentorship and growth opportunities. The manager will be expected to work in accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values of Shalom, applicable legislation and regulations, corporate policies and procedures and collective agreements. The position is seen as an integral part of the growth of Shalom Manor Long Term Care Home as we look to expand our services to Hamilton with the planned new campus build at Upper Wellington Street. 


Duties will include:

  • Preparation of monthly financial reporting including recurring journal entries
  • Oversight and preparation of government reporting to various ministries including the Canada Revenue Agency, Ministry of Long Term Care, Minister of Finance, etc.
  • Supervision of accounts payable, accounts receivable and bank reconciliation processes.
  • Oversight of payroll systems in accordance with the payroll administrator.
  • Management of promissory note renewals, payouts and interest payments.
  • Monthly billing support to third parties and resident accounts


Tools/equipment:

  • Sage 300
  • Nation Builder
  • Point Click Care
  • Staff Schedule Care
  • Sage APA
  • Online banking portals
  • Canada Revenue Agency My Account


Qualifications Required:

  • Professional accounting designation
  • University degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or other similar discipline
  • At least 3 years of supervisory experience, preferably in a health care setting
  • Demonstrated proficiency in operation and use of a computer, related technologies and software required for the role
  • Ability to work both independently (self-directed and motivated) and as part of a team
  • Demonstrated problem-solving skills and ability to address conflict positively


Interested applicants are asked to submit their covering letters and resumes to hr@shalommanor.ca

title: Accounting Manager
description:
CM Indigenous Consulting is an indigenous owned company, which specializes in First Nation Advisory, Debt Consolidation Solutions and Remediation, Process Redesigning, Accounting Services, and Operational Process Optimization for clients who need to change their business narrative and stay ahead of the curve. We also offer advisory to First Nations community on health programs, dispute resolution, project, and people management.
This role requires working closely with the president, co-managers and other key leaders to provide information that will facilitate strategic decision making, day-to-day management of the business, and coordinating the budgeting and forecasting processes. Primary tasks will include overseeing the client payroll, annual and monthly budgeting and forecasting, financial analysis, establishing internal controls and other administrative tasks.
The successful candidate will have experience producing accurate and timely financial information and will be comfortable working in a hands-on role supporting a small team. Previous management experience is essential, as one or two staff will report to the role.
QUALIFICATIONS
Accounting designation (CPA).
Must be detail oriented, analytical, problem solver and creative thinker.
The ideal candidate would have experience in general contracting.
Experience with Sage 300 or similar.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Ability to work independently and perform at a high level of accuracy.
Highly committed to meeting all deadlines and goals.
Strong organizational and communication skills.
Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to prioritize objectives in an intelligent and friendly manner.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build lasting relationships with team members and client.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
We are currently seeking an Accounting Manager for a family owned business in the marine industry that has been in operations for over 50 years. The organization continues to grow and requires a personable financial leader for their organization. This role will not only have your routine accounting tasks but a large part of this role will be responsible for costing/budgeting for future agreements/projects with the organization’s clients.


Responsibilities

Daily Tasks:

  • Cash flow update
  • Bank online transactions
  • Manage AP and payroll areas and issues
  • All preparation of yearly entries and forwarding year end documentation to year end accountants
  • Some personal record keeping for shareholder including forwarding personal tax information to accountants

Weekly Tasks:

  • Payroll remittances to CRA

Monthly Tasks:

  • Close and balance the AR and AP sub ledgers to the GL
  • Prepare monthly financials – involves series of other tasks
  • Reconciliations
  • Review Payroll and AP entries
  • Submit pension contributions to Manulife
  • Pay all company taxes – GST, PST, inc tax, Carbon tax, etc
  • Monthly entries of capital cost allowances and life insurance

Quarterly Tasks:

  • WCB payroll and dues report
  • Employer health tax submission
  • RBC reporting requirements

Annual Tasks:

  • OFSI reporting – federally regulated pension submissions
  • Audit engagement - prepare PBC lists, meet with auditors
  • Edit, reconcile and prepare T4’s for crew and admin

Ongoing tasks:

  • All functions of a Controller of a business and dealing with things as they develop and arise. Registered officer with company signing authority (non cheques).
  • Chair/Administrator of Pension Committee – semi annual meetings, ongoing requirements
  • Maintain strong relations with our Bank
  • Maintain communication and relations with our auditors
  • CRA related issues including filing of electronic ROE
  • Cost Analysis of ongoing and new projects
  • Managing/Tracking Budgets
  • Managing a small team (AP & AR Clerk)

Qualifications

  • CPA Designation
  • Project Costing & Budgeting experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities


Compensation

  • $115-130K base plus discretionary bonus
  • plus benefits and vacation
  • plus pension matching

title: Accounting Manager/ Logistics Industry
description:
Durham Recruiting has a unique opportunity for an Accounting Manager with their CPA for our client in Cobourg. With this role you will bring strong analytics, ideas/solutions, software implementation experience and training capabilities to the team. Due to the growth of this company this is a new role for the team, and they are super excited to add this type of bench strength to the team. With year over year growth of at least 30% expected for years to come this is a very exciting time to come on board.
  • Please note this role is 100% in the office due to the industry they service.
Job Requirement
  • Please note our client has an existing COVID-19 Policy in place for current employees – a copy of this will be available for your review if an employment contract is offered. It should also be noted that our client is also aware of the duty to accommodate under the applicable human rights legislation. If you have proof of an exemption you will be considered for the role with no issues. If there are any questions or concerns please let us know – you can email us at info@durhamrecruiting.ca
The Opportunity

In a nutshell, you will become a part of the senior team to ensure all aspects of the finance lifecycle, including planning, processes, reporting and ad-hoc projects.
  • Annual budget and monthly rolling forecast updates
  • Monthly management financial reporting and annual external financial reporting
  • Accountable for the integrity of financial systems and data
  • Accountable for adherence to internal control policies and procedures, including improvement and adjustment as required
  • Ad hoc financial & business analysis to drive decision making
  • SME for key accounting processes, including accounts payable, receivable, payroll, and time & attendance
  • ERP system maintenance and improvement
  • Financial policy review & development
  • Support to business commercial function, including customer pricing support
  • Support to business procurement function
  • Continuous process improvement
  • Team building & mentorship
What Stood Out For Us

As with every new client we bring on board; each and everyone has their unique reasons for being amazing! With this particular client the company as a whole is relaxed, able to work as cohesive team (as everyone’s roles are clearly defined), they love to have fun but then also know when to put their heads down and get to work!

The finance team has been together for just over a year now, with the Head of the Finance team having worked there for five years now. From the first year on-site the team has grown from 1 to 6 people! In a short time the team has become unified and are excited to bring in a senior mentor as there are a few on the team going through for their CPA. You will have the ability to not only help a company succeed but also grow someone’s career.

Why Choose Our Client
  • Full-Time Permanent Position – 100% in the office
  • $80, 000 to 90, 000 Base Annual Salary + Annual Bonus (10 to 15%)
  • 3 Weeks Vacation – negotiable with experience
  • A family-oriented company with a senior management team that cares about its people
  • Work hard / Play hard philosophy within the company and environment that encourages continuous professional and personal improvement
  • Small location with 15 in the office – super friendly group that loves to laugh
  • Benefits after 3 months + ERP program
  • Annual Physical Activity Benefit
  • ESPP – up to 5% of salary after 1 year of employment
  • Amazing Senion management team that is supportive, collaborative and encouraging
What We Need From You
  • Extremely positive, funny, outgoing and down to earth personality
  • Minimum 5 + years in a similar role – preferably from the Logistics/Warehousing or Manufacturing Industry
  • At least 3+ years experience supervising a small staff of at least 3+ people
  • Experience working with American Companies/Divisions is essential for this role – US GAAP or US State Regulations
  • Must hold your CPA to be considered for this role (this will be verified as a part of the process)
  • Credit check and Background Check will also be conducted as a part of the process
  • 2 References of people you reported into are also nessissary to be considered for this role
  • Experience with Excel(advanced), Microsoft Office, Accounting Software and CRM’s is a must to be considering for the role
  • Preference will be given to those that have experience with integrating new software into a company – there will be a software change in 2022 for this company
  • Excellent time management, multi-tasking skills and the ability to prioritize with ease
  • Proven ability analyze, problem solve and take initiative to improve the companies workflow, software use and accounting principles
We here at Durham Recruiting would like to thank all that apply but only those that are chosen to be a part of our Recruiting Process will be contacted. To see a full list of available jobs please visit us at www.durhamrecruiting.ca
  • Please note that this role will be posted fresh each Monday until the role has been filled.
Diane Kellow

Durham Recruiting

IND HIGH

Durham Recruiting is strongly committed to fostering diversity within our community. Our clients welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of their staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. Please note that all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. Please notify us if you require accommodation in the application process.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Russell Hendrix is looking for an experienced Accounting Manager join our Corporate Accounting team. You’ll be an integral part of the team’s operations, managing the AP department, and reporting directly to the Corporate Controller. This position requires a high attention to detail, the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize, and experience in successfully leading teams.


What You’ll Do:

  • Manage AP department – ensure that invoices are entered on a timely basis, with proper approvals, and correctly coded; ensure that Russell Hendrix KPI’s are met as pertains to accuracy and processing time.
  • Manage COA’s for Traverse ERP platform.
  • Prepare weekly listing of outstanding Accounts Payable for CFO review.
  • Organize and prioritize weekly payment runs and assist in preparation of weekly and other periodic cash forecasts.
  • Analyze expenses and prepare accruals on a monthly basis.
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of all intercompany transactions and resolve any discrepancies.
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of balance sheet accounts for review by Corporate Controller.
  • Prepare monthly bank reconciliations for review by Corporate Controller.
  • Approve disbursements within the Russell Hendrix banking portals, ensuring compliance with Russell Hendrix internal control matrix; complete bank transfers on a weekly basis.
  • Handle all sales tax remittances and assist in streamlining current tax reporting structure.
  • Review and approve monthly commission and rebate journal entries; review and approve monthly and quarterly commission and rebate payments.
  • Work with AP team to document and automate tasks.
  • Assist with preparation of contractual reporting to lenders.
  • Administer all corporate credit cards; manage and review employee expense report submissions to ensure compliance with Russell Hendrix guidelines.
  • Support annual audit and bank audits as needed.
  • Ad hoc duties as required.


Required Skills/Experience:

  • You have at least 10 years of progressive, hands-on experience in a similar role.
  • You have at least 5 years experience supervising or managing transactional teams.
  • Successful completion of university or college degree with a focus on accounting.
  • You have distribution/manufacturing/logistics experience within a sales-driven organization.
  • You have intermediate Excel skills, comfortable with pivots, lookups, etc.
  • You have experience with banking portals.
  • You have experience with high volume of transactions.
  • You have experience with complex manual reconciliations.
  • You have experience with process improvements within a highly manual multi-entity environment with non-integrated ERP functionality.
  • You are a detail oriented and responsible individual with a proven track record of demonstrating initiative and proposing/implementing solutions to address issues.
  • You have demonstratable organizational and time management skills in dealing with changing priorities in a fast-paced environment while meeting reporting deadlines.
  • You have a proven ability to work with all levels of the organization to ensure that goals are met.
  • You are comfortable giving and receiving feedback.


What’s In It for You:

  • Extended health benefits
  • $400/year gym subsidy
  • Dynamic work environment
  • Excellent employee discount
  • Opportunity for growth


Get To Know Russell Hendrix!


With locations across Canada and over 70 years of experience, Russell Hendrix is the Leader in the commercial Food equipment industry. We are service focused Foodies who value integrity, teamwork, resourcefulness, and fairness. Check us out on Instagram: rhfoodequip or visit our website: www.russellhendrix.com.

Russell Hendrix is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Russell Hendrix is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

title: Superintendent, Controls and Instrumentation
description:
Welcome to Vale in Canada. As a leader in the mining industry, our responsibility is to positively impact our people, communities and the environment. We value our workforce and offer continuous training and career development opportunities for our people.

Vale is a global leader in the production of iron ore and one of the largest producers of nickel. Active in Canada for over 100 years, Vale employs nearly 6,000 people across our corporate office in Toronto and sites in Manitoba, Ontario, Newfoundland and Labrador. Applying the latest technologies to sustainably produce nickel, copper, cobalt, platinum group metals, gold and silver is at the heart of what we do.

Our Sudbury Operations have been in existence for more than 100 years. With five mines, a mill, a smelter, a refinery and nearly 4,000 employees it is also one of the largest integrated mining complexes in the world. Sudbury is also home to several administrative sites serving both the Ontario Operations as well as all our North Atlantic Operations.

Port Colborne is home to our Refinery where raw materials from our Sudbury operations are processed into electrocobalt and precious metals and serves as a distribution centre for finished nickel products.

With our global headquarters in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and approximately 125,000 employees in over 30 countries, Vale is constantly growing and changing. We invite you to be part of our evolution.

Our Team

The Controls and Instrumentation team is integral to employee’s safety and Vale’s long-term operating strategy. Members of this team work across different departments to ensure fixed assets and instrumentation are functioning per design criteria. Team members are involved in equipment maintenance plan creation and execution, as well as controls and automation strategy development and implementation.

The Opportunity

We are currently seeking a Superintendent, Controls and Instrumentation to join our Plant in Port Colborne, Ontario. In this role you will provide technical leadership and support to the Port Colborne Refinery (PCR) through the technical services teams consisting of Process Systems Engineering, Process Control/Network services and Instrumentation services. You will also supply direction for business/growth opportunities, participate in selecting evaluating and leading technical services personnel, and collaborate closely with other business units of the Vale family in general areas of production scenarios, process engineering design and standard methodologies. Another component of this job is to deliver cost effective, innovative process control and data management solutions to solve strategic and operational business needs and to lead all IT projects at the PCR. This is a permanent position reporting to the Manager, Port Colborne Refinery.

Additionally, In This Position You Will

Technical
  • Deliver cost effective, innovative process control, automation, and data management solutions to solve strategic and operational business needs.
  • Lead all PCR IT (local and Corporate generated) requests and projects as well as IT support and maintenance work, including network infrastructure, process automation infrastructure, phones, servers, lab equipment, security video system, gas emergency modelling system, plant access card system, phone system, truck scale system)
  • Develop the 3-5+ year plan for process control, instrumentation and process systems upgrade.
  • Direct/lead execution of the plan, including purchasing of equipment, development, installation, and documentation and commissioning.
  • Creates a vision for long-term sustainability of instrumentation and process control systems
  • Lead projects (capital, operating)
Commercial
  • Accountable to supervise compliance to schedules and plans and implement process improvement opportunities to contribute to the operations.
  • Management of project costs
  • Business case preparation for projects
Safety
  • Coordinate and promote group compliance with Vale policies, procedures, and standards.
  • Develop and maintain policies and procedures for PCR Process Systems and Instrumentation groups.
  • Perform contractor safety and plant inspections.
  • Delivers on personal safety plan, including supervisory activities (e.g. job observations)
Leadership
  • Supervise a team of Process Control engineers and Instrumentation technologists to deliver process automation solutions and support to PCR Operations
  • Provide plant on-call support
  • Collaborate closely with PCR management team to ensure Process Systems and Instrumentation projects are aligned with divisional needs
  • Collaborate closely with Sudbury and Corporate IT to ensure IT projects are aligned with Vale business requirements and PCR operation’s needs
Job Titles Reporting Into This Position
  • Systems Engineering Specialist
  • Instrumentation Technologists
  • Process Control Engineers and Full-time Equivalents
  • IT Specialist (FTE)
About You

Education
  • The ideal candidate will possess a Diploma - Electronics Engineering Technologist or Equivalent
  • CET or P. Eng. Certified applicants are preferred
Experience
  • A minimum of 8 years of experience working in a refinery is required.
  • Communication skills (oral/written)
  • Must demonstrate the ability to coach and mentor
  • Proficient in SAP work notifications and Incident Management
How Can Vale Grow Your Career?
  • In addition to the responsibilities and career opportunities this role will provide, Vale Canada offers a series of benefits including:
  • Competitive salary
  • Attractive pension and benefits (company paid core coverage, flex health and dental coverage, flex accounts, disability plans and optional insurances)
  • Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation, flex, sick, top up for maternity/parental)
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Work culture dedicated to safety, diversity & inclusion and career growth
  • Grow your career in a large and global company, and mining industry leader
  • Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Online training and career development opportunities
Difference Makes All the Difference

At Vale, we are committed to ensuring an inclusive work environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. Vale encourages everyone to express their ideas and opinions and values the plurality of individual profiles. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or any other personal consideration that makes us different.

Vale is an equal opportunity employer seeking to increase diversity across our operations and improve equal opportunity at Vale and in the mining industry.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodation is available throughout our recruitment process for applicants with disabilities.

Apply By: Tuesday, May 10 th , 2022

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Company Description

For more than 30 years, Lorex has been a leader in the marketplace when it comes to innovative security technology for both home and commercial use. We achieve this by continuing to produce innovative monitoring solutions, all backed by cutting-edge technology and a dedicated team of forward thinkers. Using the latest technology and innovations, Lorex strives to produce solutions to both enhance security and fit your lifestyle.

Job Summary

The Accounting Manager is responsible for all areas relating to financial reporting. This position will be responsible for developing and maintaining accounting principles, practices and procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting and statements. This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including general ledger preparation, reporting (financial, compliance, regulatory, tax), year-end audit preparation, and the support of budget and forecast activities.


Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure.
  • Ensure an accurate and timely monthly, quarterly and year end close.
  • Ensure the timely reporting of all monthly financial, compliance, regulatory and tax information.
  • Ensure all key financial reconciliation are performed in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Supports budget and forecasting activities.
  • Collaborates with the other finance department members to support overall department goals and objectives.
  • Valuating, developing, and improving department controls, ERP systems, and procedures increase accuracy and efficiency.
  • Work closely with Accounting Group in overseas HQ to streamline the financial reporting and GAAP conversion process.
  • Advises staff regarding the handling of non-routine reporting transactions.
  • Work with the team to ensure a clean and timely year end audit.
  • Assist in development and implementation of new procedures and features to enhance the workflow of the department.
  • Provide training to new and existing staff as needed.
  • Support CFO with special projects and workflow process improvements.


Requirements:

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs)

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Accounting, Business, Finance or equivalent
  • Good knowledge of US / Canadian GAAP and IFRS
  • Knowledge or prior working experience with US tax including Federal, State & Sales tax is preferred
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills


Competency Profile

  • Self-motivated and ability to work to deadlines with good prioritization and time management skills
  • Ability to deliver high quality documentation paying attention to detail.


Background Experiences

  • 6+ years of progressive accounting experience with 3+ years being in a supervisory role
  • Prior working experience in public accounting firm or multinational companies is preferred
  • Qualified accountant (CPA / CA / CMA or equivalent) is preferred
  • Experience with SAP strongly preferred


Key Competencies:

Connects:

· Builds trust and establishes rapport with diverse colleagues and customers by listening, understanding their needs, and following through on commitments.

· Works effectively with people who have different perspectives, backgrounds and abilities while encouraging constructive dialogue and being sensitive and receptive to diverse views and opinions.

· Builds mutually beneficial working relationships to foster a positive and inclusive culture and engages with internal and external customers and stakeholders representing a variety of interests.


Teamwork:

· Works with others to share expertise and achieve outcomes that benefit the organization.

· Demonstrates strong communication skills to others on the team through active listening, summarizing, facilitating and "bridge building".


Inspires:

· Creates a shared vision by soliciting and valuing diverse input obtained from each team member on the vision of their work and the team.

· Uses a broad range of communication strategies and methods to communicate vision with enthusiasm and clarity, and to inspire confidence and generate commitment.

· Helps the team to embrace different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds by modeling positive leadership behavior and encouraging full participation.


Self-Awareness:

· Proactively seeks and obtains ongoing feedback to help understand ones' own strengths and development areas to work more effectively with team/department managers/clients.

· Understands and is aware of one’s emotions and the impact these emotions may have on others.

· Reflects on feedback and lessons learned and uses acquired knowledge in working with team members to achieve personal and professional growth.


Delivers:

· Ensures the timely delivery of programs, projects, and services, effectively adapting to tight deadlines and sudden changes in priorities to accomplish objectives.

· Plans for possibilities and contingencies, identifying opportunities and problems to ensure that best results are achieved.

· Recognizes and makes best use of the diverse skills, abilities, experiences of team members to achieve best outcomes.


Transforms:

· Takes initiative and sustained action to ensure the successful implementation of change by shifting strategic focus and embracing new ideas and building on past knowledge and success.

· Fosters a team environment where all are encouraged to think creatively and new and diverse ideas and approaches are heard, valued and considered for implementation.

· Seeks performance feedback and opportunities to invest time and effort to learn and expand knowledge to improve performance.


Accountability:

· Takes responsibility for clarifying the expectations of others

· Acknowledges how personal decisions, actions and standards of performance influence work accomplishments

· Accepts responsibility for work accomplishments

· Recognizes changes required to achieve better results going forward.


Creativity/Innovation:

· Identifies and evaluates unique ways to improve the organization (cost reductions, use of resources, policies/procedures, products), generating useful new ideas, approaches or techniques.


Integrity:

· Adheres to ethical standards and integrates Lorex values, principles and standards into practices and business transactions.

· Creates honest, trusting and successful working relationships with others inside and outside the organization and conducts all affairs with personal and professional integrity.

· Promptly addresses issues about discrimination, harassment, and unfair treatment and does not allow personal assumptions, biases and/or complaints to impact any work-related decisions in the team.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
About the Company

Our client is a Manufacturing company. They are looking to add a Manager, Accounting who will be an integral part of the Finance team and will be responsible for a variety of accounting matters to support the financial state of the Company.


Why Work Here

  • Very good, Fun & Engaging culture
  • Good Work Life balance
  • Supportive Management team and culture!
  • Warm, engaging and supportive work environment
  • Communicative leadership who is trying to increase morale!


About the Opportunity

  • Monthly, quarterly and annual financial reporting package, bank covenants and budgeting process;
  • Prepare consolidated monthly financial close process for the enterprise
  • Oversee variance analysis for SG&A on a monthly basis in comparison to budget;
  • Working collaboratively with the Manager, Project & Cost Accounting on month end close procedures and financial analysis
  • Oversee Accounts Payable and Balance Sheet for the enterprise
  • Annual financial audit process and quarterly Forecasting
  • Monitor, analyze, and manage intercompany accounts (receivables/payables, shared costs allocations)
  • Monitor shareholder account balances, prepare dividend payments and support as necessary
  • Assist in completion of any necessary corporate applications, i.e. insurance, credit requests
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to all Finance team members when appropriate
  • Main contact for year-end audit process by preparing necessary schedules, journal entries and or responses


About You

  • CPA is an asset
  • 5 - 7 years of related accounting experience
  • Previous supervisory/people management experience from a relevant industry
  • Knowledge in Sage 300 ERP or similar accounting software is a strong asset
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, Excel and Outlook


Salary Range

up to $115,000/year

title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:


The Director of Finance is responsible for the management of the accounting, finance, and payroll department and will provide key support to the business for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting. This includes the annual budget, forecasting future financial trends, performing variance analysis, and working with the Navacord team on financial projections and key initiatives. The individual will be a trusted advisor and influencer within the leadership team and will spend significant time establishing the financial performance strategy. The individual will be part of the Executive Team and participate in the strategic direction of the business.


RESPONSIBILITIES:


Strategy

·Fully engage and become an integral part of the leadership team to create and support the Company’s strategic vision

·Advise on the role finance can proactively play in planning for success – being more competitive and remaining at the forefront of the industry

·Translate the corporate strategy and executive mandate into formalized financial systems and processes to achieve strategic priorities and outcomes

·Partner with leaders from other departments and identify revenue and cost drivers

·Lead the organization’s budget development and oversight processes


Leadership

·Oversee the finance department including all transactions related to receivables, payables, trust accounts, Account Executive expenses, compensation schedules, payroll and financial reporting

·Provide support, guidance, coaching and direction to the various levels throughout the finance department

·Be present and engaged; be a role model of professional conduct pursuing excellence in execution, seeking opportunities for continuous improvement and producing creative and/or unique solutions

·Demonstrate an ability to anticipate outcomes and to adjust approaches and internal services accordingly

·Foster a high performance culture within the Finance team


REQUIREMENTS:

·Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field

·Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) strongly preferred

·A minimum of 10 years of experience working in a complex fast-paced environment

·Insurance Industry and Applied Epic knowledge considered an asset

·Proficient in using accounting information systems

·Experience in supervising and mentoring others

·Strong interpersonal skills are essential

·Exemplary work ethic and organizational skills

·Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook


COMPETENCIES & ATTRIBUTES:

·Strategic, forward thinker who can forecast potential service and operation vulnerability in the business and drive mitigating actions

·Collaborative and team focused leader with the ability to coach and mentor staff and build an empowered and accountable team

·Leadership skills that will incite enthusiasm, provide vision, motivate, create positive morale and role model standards of professionalism

·Demonstrated initiative and motivation to continuous improvement of self and company processes

·Strong personal belief in high standards of service; and an effective, accountable leader; a contributing member of the team and a champion for the organization.


Paisley is actively committed to support diversity, equity, and inclusion. We serve and recognize and respect human differences and similarities. We value the diversity of people and actively encourage women, indigenous peoples, members of visible minorities, people with disabilities, and lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ2+) persons to apply.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Valsoft Corporation is looking for an experienced and dynamic Accounting Manager reporting to the Head of Finance of one of the business units.


This individual will coordinate and manage period-end close and ensure accurate financial reporting and analysis for a portfolio of acquired companies, as well as lead projects impacting their accounting and handle the more complex accounting issues.


Here is a little window into our company: Valsoft’s focus is to acquire and grow vertical software businesses that provide mission-critical solutions in their respective niche or market. Since 2015, we have acquired over 50 businesses; today, Valsoft has over 2000 employees across 20+ countries. This business model creates a rapid growth environment allowing the acquisition of new companies based on profitable vertical performance. Our motto is Be Humble Stay Hungry!


What your day will look like:


  • Supervise and review the work of local and offshored accounting analysts – 3+ resources (journal entries, reconciliations, reports – including for AR, AP, billings and accounting transactions)
  • Supervise and implement appropriate application of GAAP accounting standards including more complex accounting situations such as percentage of completion
  • Coordinate the preparation of month-end financials for all the companies within the business unit (12+ subsidiaries in portfolio)
  • Supervise and lead the year-end closing for the business unit, as well as contribute in the audit process in support to the corporate accounting team
  • Prepare monthly financial analysis on key P&L items to better understand financial performance and variances between actual, forecast and budget, and support the reporting team during the month-end close
  • Review reporting needs and produce ad-hoc reports for the business, in collaboration with the FP&A team;
  • Build and review workflows, implement processes to optimize efficiency of reporting and put in place internal controls
  • Train, coach and provide support to the team
  • Collaborate with the integration team during the acquisition of a company to ensure the adequate setup of the accounting books
  • Contribute to the standardization of accounting processes with other business units and assist in the implementation of best practices
  • Strive for continuous improvement activities as part of day-to-day efforts
  • Support the Head of Finance of the business unit with special projects


About you:


  • 5+ years of experience in a similar role, including at least 2 in team management
  • CPA designation required
  • Fast-learner and adaptable – time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of French considered an asset
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Excel
  • Superior analytical skills, detail oriented
  • Excellent organizational skills and time management
  • Ability to manage risks by ensuring that effective and efficient internal controls are in place without compromising operational efficiency and flexibility
  • Working knowledge of Sage Intacct ERP (or similar) considered an asset
  • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • Team player


Perks working at Valsoft include:


  • Attractive compensation package including potential bonus
  • Training /Tuition Reimbursement Program
  • Free catered daily lunches, unlimited fruit and snacks, coffee, tea, hot chocolate
  • Work-life balance with a flexible working schedule
  • Free parking for all employees
  • Ping Pong and Foosball
  • Room to grow based on performance
  • Unlimited vacation after 3 years
  • Annual gym discount
  • Monthly on-site barber
  • Lounging areas


At Valsoft there is room for career growth, and we want you to feel like part of the Valsoft family! Valsoft Is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of; disability, race, ancestry, place of origin, color, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status or family status. We thank all applicants for their interest however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
