title: Accounting Manager
description:
The Firm

Hey, we’re glad you found this! We are the HGA Group.


What started as an accounting firm quickly evolved into the ultimate entrepreneurial resource centre: the first of its kind in Alberta.


Our team is innovative, highly skilled, and highly collaborative. We believe that bringing together every major resource that business owners need to succeed under a single banner, driven by the singular purpose to give entrepreneurs the resources they need, is the key to maximizing the potential of Alberta’s entrepreneurs.


In a sea of professional service providers, it is our mission to do things differently, to break from the norm, and help people build their dreams— not only those of our clients, but our team’s. We want to help you grow, develop, and enjoy the career that you have always wanted. Most importantly though, we want you to live the life you have always wanted.


Our employees drive the success of the HGA Group, and that means we pride ourselves in empowering our employees to grow with us. The HGA Group gives employees so many opportunities to learn and develop their skills. We welcome you to the team knowing that you are looking to grow your toolkit and make an impact. It all starts here at the HGA Group.

We love what we do, and you will too.


The Role

We’re on the hunt for a full-time Manager to become a part of the HGA Family and add value to our incredible team. The ideal candidate will take on the position of trusted liaison between partners and clients in reviewing client files, providing technical expertise, and assume leadership roles on complex files. The Manager will report directly to the partners and will mentor our junior and intermediate-level accountants.


Perfect for someone who understands the value of customer service, this individual will enjoy working alongside the partners to support our large range of clients and be equally as invested in who our clients are as people, as well as their business and the 'numbers'. A high level of accountability and initiative will be key to succeed in this role, as well as the ability to navigate and adapt to a fast-paced professional services environment.


Key Duties & Responsibilities

  • Supervising the preparation of financial statements of business clients, reviewing the work of Staff Accountants, and completing complex portions of the file;
  • Maintaining high quality control by overseeing and reviewing Compilation and Review Engagements;
  • Reviewing Corporate, Personal, Partnership and Trust income tax returns and other tax forms;
  • Reviewing, investigating and correcting discrepancies and irregularities in financial entries and reports;
  • Making recommendations based on analysis and status of reserves, assets and expenditures;
  • Performing technical research, developing and documenting tax planning recommendations for individuals and corporations;
  • Assisting with the execution of corporate reorganizations;
  • Overseeing the organization and prioritization of the work of Staff Accountants, including the management of engagement costs and billings;
  • Mentoring and supporting the professional development needs of Staff Accountants;
  • Managing a portfolio of clients, ensuring their needs are met and that relationships and accounts grow and develop; and
  • Contributing to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes.

Qualifications

Education & Experience:

  • Undergraduate degree in a relevant field;
  • CA or CPA designation, with a minimum of 5 years public practice experience dealing with the accounting and taxation needs of private companies and their shareholders;
  • Comprehensive experience in compilation and review preparation; and
  • Experience leading and supervising staff.

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Knowledge of relevant accounting frameworks and file documentation best practices;
  • Extensive knowledge of Accounting Standards for Private Enterprise (ASPE);
  • Proficient in Caseware and Profile;
  • Strong business acumen; and
  • Strong computer skills (MS Office).

Competencies:

  • Focus on client service orientation
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Strong awareness of attention to detail
  • Proven ability in results management
  • Strong ability to make sound judgement calls, based on experience and critical thinking
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to translate this into mentorship

What We Offer

Benefits & Perks

  • Comprehensive benefits package including: Extended Health Care, Dental Care, Disability and Life Insurance, etc..
  • Group Registered Retirement Saving Program (RRSP) with company matching
  • On-Site Gym with employee discounts and group fitness classes
  • On-Site Free Parking
  • Wellness Program


HGA is on a mission to provide meaningful and impactful opportunities that drive individuals to grow personally and professionally. We do this by offering competitive total compensation, challenging work, and engaging and collaborative work culture.


Our people are what set us apart, and we believe in providing an inclusive and diverse workplace where all individuals have the opportunity to succeed. We are committed to building and employing an inclusive and diverse work culture to serve our clients with excellence. Joining the HGA team means that everyone is welcome, and we can provide reasonable accommodation during the selection process, upon request, to meet your needs at any stage in the recruitment process.


If you are a passionate professional who is eager and excited to take on a challenging opportunity, this is it!


Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
About the Company

Our client is Canada's leading specialty footwear expert with over 27 national retail locations.


  • Employees: 250+
  • Revenue: Private
  • Ownership: Privately held
  • Reports into: CFO
  • Direct Reports: 4
  • Team: 11


Who you are:

The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of progressive accounting/finance experience and have a passion for working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.


The impact you will have:

Due to continued growth and long-term vision, the company is looking to bring in an accounting professional to become a part of the finance leadership team. This individual will lead the accounting activities within the organization while working closely with the CFO and other senior leadership team members to execute strategic growth plans. The Accounting Manager is responsible for the day-to-day management of an Accounting Team consisting of 11 people, 4 of whom the Accounting Manager will be managing. In addition, the Accounting Manager will be responsible for various financial reporting, establishing controls, and month-end and year-end related activities.


What are we looking for?

  1. 5-7 years of progressive accounting/finance experience in a similar role.
  2. Ability to provide superior customer service and be able to successfully communicate ideas to the internal leadership and finance team.
  3. Excellent ability to organize and time management in order to tackle multiple tasks simultaneously.
  4. CPA Designation or equivalent education.
  5. Leadership Experience: Has demonstrated their ability to coach, develop and motivate a team to continuously improve



Egility is committed to creating and fostering culturally diverse, equitable, and inclusive organizations. We recognize the value in a wide range of ideas, perspectives, experiences, and skillsets in our client’s workplaces. Our client is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with the Accessible Canada Act, 2019 and all applicable provincial accessibility standards, upon request, accommodation will be provided by both Egility and our client throughout the recruitment, selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.


Due to high volume, we will only be contacting applicants who meet all of the minimum requirements listed in the job description. Only those applicants who align most closely with our minimum and preferred qualifications will be contacted for an interview. The Recruiting team at Egility will retain your application materials and may contact you regarding future opportunities.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
A BIT ABOUT US.


Outhire is a new kind of agency that puts candidates first! Our innovative recruitment process is rooted in a digital first approach that aims to save candidates’ time, tailor the right fit, and give real-time updates throughout the process. Most importantly, our process guarantees that hiring managers see a complete picture of you and not just another name on a paper. When you work with Outhire, we make it a point to be a partner in your job search.


ACCOUNTING MANAGER – LOW-RISE DEVELOPER


Average Salary:

$100,000


Location:

Mississauga, ON


Office:

In-office 1st 3 months, Hybrid after


The Role:

Accounting Manager – this will be the first hire for the accounting and finance function with short-term plans to build a team around this role and transition some of the responsibilities. In the interim, the right candidate should expect to be doing everything from processing invoices to preparing annual reports.

  • 40% Full Cycle Accounting
  • 30% Management Reporting
  • 20% Ad-hoc & Process Setup
  • 10% Corporate Accounting


The Tasks:

Full Cycle Accounting

· May include but not be limited to the following tasks: day-to-day accounting operations, payroll, filing of tax returns, balance sheet and bank reconciliation, fixed asset accounting, AP, and monthly adjusting entries.


Management Reporting

· May include but not be limited to the following tasks: forecasts and budgeting on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis; collaboration with business units for active construction projects; support for tracking and reporting of key performance indicators (KPI); support for M&A analysis including the calculation of IRR, NPV, and EBITDA.


Corporate Accounting

· May include but not be limited to the following tasks: personal and holding level CRA filings on behalf of the owners, expense reporting, receipt and distribution of funds.


The Opportunity:

An excellent opportunity for someone looking to get in at ground level with a fast-paced, high-growth real estate development company. This role will be pivotal to the company. The Accounting Manager will be a strategic partner in securing the company’s financial resources with proper processes and controls while also enhancing project profitability and minimizing financial risks.


By Month 1

· Learned the business and taken the hand-off of the full cycle accounting deliverables from the incumbent consultant.


By Month 3

  • Achieved full proficiency with the full cycle accounting deliverables.
  • Gained partial proficiency with any cost accounting responsibilities, most notably the timely reporting to the cost consultants.
  • Developed a baseline relationship with key internal and external stakeholders.

By Month 12

  • Developed a robust understanding of the business and the management reporting deliverables.
  • Identified and proposed process improvement changes to the accounting and management reporting processes.
  • Became the trusted gatekeeper for any accounting-related issues and financial advisor to the partners.

The Company:

A privately-owned real estate developer operating in the Ontario region with five projects to date in the residential townhomes space.


The Team:

  • Under 10-person company.
  • Reporting directly to the Managing Partner.


The Perks:

  • Discretionary annual bonus.
  • Three weeks of paid vacation with an additional week during December.
  • Standard Benefits.[LS1]
  • CPA dues.
  • Flexible hours after six months.
  • Professional development support.


The Skill Set:

  • Minimum five years of accounting experience.
  • Designated CPA or equivalent.
  • Preference for someone with accounting experience in the construction, engineering, or manufacturing industries.


NOT QUITE THE ROLE FOR YOU?

Only qualified candidates will be contacted. Not the right role for you? Sign up at outhire.ca/registration to get earlier notices on job matches, full compensation details, real-time updates on applications, and more.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Humble & Fume Inc. is a leading Cannabis and Accessory distributor, and the most trusted partner and brand representative in the industry. With a strong North American footprint, and an unrivaled catalog of brands and products, we continue to be a selling organization that reflects the needs of cannabis retailers.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, motivated and driven ACCOUNTING MANAGER to join the Finance Team.

About the opportunity…

As an integral part of the “we can do that” operation, and reporting to the Director of Finance & Accounting, this position is responsible for overseeing the corporate financial planning and analysis. Also responsible for driving and monitoring financial performance, analyzing and interpreting operating results, investigating variances and unusual items; and evaluating their effect on operations.

We are searching for an Associate Accounting Manager with a strong presentation and communication skills, and a background in a consumer-packaged goods environment with a focus on analysis, forecasting, and business partnering.
This role is specifically to:
Manage the accuracy and productivity of day-to-day activities of accounts payable, cash disbursements, invoicing/billing, customer credit and collections, payroll, and inventory of assets
Prepare and analyze timely monthly, quarterly and fiscal financial statements for management
Responsible for cashflow management, reporting and forecasting
Build and manage reconciliation on the costs versus billing, calculate the adjustments and work with the operational managers to invoice the customers
Build and manage processes to separate costs for different subsidiaries
Review and approve accounts payables, accounts receivable and payroll, and all statutory and regulatory filings
Reconcile balance sheet accounts and confirm accuracy; investigate any discrepancies; review and balance of schedules
Ensure the efficacy of internal controls and compliance by conducting regular review and audit/continuous improvement planning
Ensure compliance with all relevant financial government regulatory bodies
Evaluate accounting and internal control systems
Oversee regulatory reporting and tax compliance
Ensure assets and liabilities of the Company are effectively managed; maximize return on financial assets by establishing financial policies, procedures, controls and reporting systems; safeguard assets and ensure accurate and timely recording of all transactions by implementing disciplines of internal audits and controls across all departments, including maintaining integrity of General Ledger and Balance Sheets accounts
Guide financial decisions by establishing, monitoring and enforcing policies and procedures
Monitor and confirm financial condition by conducting audits and providing information to external auditors
Prepare complex analysis to support projects ad initiatives
Supervise the performance of the Accounting Team and Payroll/Benefits Administrator
Assist in the training and development of accounting staff
Act as liaison between the organization and its shareholders, the investing public and external financial analysts
Participate in meetings and training, as required
Perform other tasks based on management instructions and performance requirements
Successful candidates will bring…

Professional accounting designation – CPA/CMA/CA- a must
Minimum two - three (2-3) + years relevant experience
Strong working knowledge of IFRS financial accounting standards
Experience with NetSuite or other ERP system
Advanced Microsoft Excel skill required (data downloading, efficient manipulation and analysis)
Excellent communication and leadership skills
Ability to work collaboratively
A desire to work in a high energy, fast-paced environment
A proven commitment to quality of work
An ability to self-motivate and be team-centric
Ability to prioritize and manage workload across multiple simultaneous tasks, in a fast-paced work environment, while ensuring delivery of high-quality work and meeting timelines
Why choose Humble & Fume Inc.?
We offer a competitive pay plan and life/health/dental insurance plan.
We offer paid vacation, sick leave and public holidays.
We offer career advancement.
We are a leading smoke/vape accessory distributor and manufacturer, well on our way to becoming the global leader in the distribution of cannabis related products.
We have an entrepreneurial minded attitude, that welcomes and supports individual ideas and strategies.
We provide investment and support into employees, and the room to learn, grow and develop their expertise.
Apply today. Come for the job…stay for the rewarding challenge.

Interested in becoming part of the Humble & Fume Inc. team? Send your resume for review and consideration. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those candidates selected will be contacted.

To learn more about Humble & Fume Inc, visit HumbleAndFumeInc.com

Humble & Fume Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from all people. Should you require accommodation or support in any aspect of the recruitment and selection process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Spécialiste de plateforme d’ordonnancement et d’automatisation (Control-M)
description:
Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.

Niveau d'emploi

NV-10

À titre de Spécialiste de plateforme d’ordonnancement et d’automatisation (Control-M), vous contribuez à l’efficacité informatique et participez à la mise en place de solutions innovantes et performantes.

Vous analysez, concevez, configurez, administrez, maintenez et faites évoluer les infrastructures d’ordonnancements (Control-M ) et d’automatisation au sein de notre organisation. Votre rôle de spécialiste-conseil et d’expert dans votre domaine permet d’offrir aux équipes une personne-ressource et un coach afin de les aider à produire des solutions simples, performantes, fiables, modernes et qui répondent aux besoins et exigences du marché.

Vous assumez un rôle de leader auprès des différents intervenants et des équipes de développement dans la relation d’affaires et dans le cadre de dossiers et projets portant sur du développement et des interventions stratégiques et complexes, à caractère novateur, tels que l’évolution, la prévention d’incidents, l’assurance-qualité et la maintenance des correctifs. La nature des dossiers exige des connaissances étendues et approfondies dans votre domaine.

Vous formulez des recommandations relatives au développement et à la réalisation de dossiers ou de projets à complexité opérationnelle et conceptuelle élevée. Ceux-ci nécessitent une analyse et une compréhension globale et détaillée du domaine d’affaires et de l’organisation. Les arrimages sont nombreux. Vous êtes appelé à interagir avec un grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés. La maîtrise des relations interpersonnelles, la curiosité et l’autonomie dans la recherche d’information, l’apprentissage des technologies, des tendances autodidactes et la capacité à agir comme facilitateur de changement, deviennent des compétences essentielles.

Responsabilités principales
  • Gérer des projets d’amélioration touchant l’automatisation et les bonnes pratiques de Control-M
  • Rédiger des documents de stratégie de planification
  • Développer, gérer et surveiller les flux de travail, définir ANS (Accord de Niveau de Service)
  • Auto-gérer les échéanciers et travailler au sein d’une équipe.
Conditions particulières
  • Lieu de travail : Place d’affaires Montréal ou Lévis selon la préférence du candidat retenu. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride
  • Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1
Profil recherché
  • Baccalauréat en informatique
  • Un minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinente dans un rôle d'administrateur TI
  • Expérience en administration, installation, configuration et déploiement de logiciel
Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées
  • Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire
Connaissances spécifiques
  • Connaissance des API, services Windows et WEB (REST, SOAP, XML)
  • Connaissance des traitements par lots (batch)
  • Connaissance des langages JSON, PowerShell, Python, Bash et XML
  • Connaissance des systèmes d’exploitation Windows, Linux et Unix
  • Connaissance des ordonnanceurs Control-M et Autosys (un atout)
  • Connaissance des transferts de fichiers MFT (un atout)
  • Connaissance en scripting/programmation (un atout)
  • Connaissance de l'anglais de niveau intermédiaire
Compétences transversales Desjardins

Apprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’action

Compétences clés au profil recherché

Avoir une bonne connaissance du secteur, Gérer la complexité

Lieu de travail

6125, boul. Wilfrid-Carrier C.P. 3125 Lévis

Syndicat

Non Syndiqué

Date de fin d'affichage

2022-05-27

Famille d'emplois

Technologies de l'information (GF)

title: CNC Universal Grinder - Advanced
description:
The CNC Universal Grinder, Advanced performs grinding operations to grind external and internal surfaces of metallic components as per engineering drawings, specifications or Job Instruction Sheets. The incumbent of this role is responsible for grinding a product to meet the customer’s quality expectations and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment. The incumbent has demonstrated experience machining components to tight tolerances and is familiar with working independently on CNC programs.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities Include The Following
  • Determine machining requirements, dimensional specifications, and set up requirements from programs, process sheets and blueprints;
  • Perform set up and operation of the CNC Universal Grinders;
  • Mount and dress the required Grinding Wheels;
  • Dress wheel and program for profile grinding;
  • Load CNC Program into machine control;
  • Write and edit programs, select and prepare tooling and grind tools to size, as required;
  • Set appropriate magnetic chuck or related jig to hold components securely for grinding operations;
  • Ensure efficient production of quality parts by completing in-process and final checks using gauges and measuring equipment;
  • Check blueprints to verify machining dimensions; use mounted grinding wheel to machine final desired dimension;
  • Ensure that all machining tasks are completed in accordance with specified run times;
  • Observe numerical displays on control panel and compare with data on process sheet to verify dimensional adjustments, feed rates and speeds or machining cuts;
  • Edit program to optimize and/or correct machine performance;
  • Coordinate operation of additional machines during controlled machining cycles;
  • Conduct minor preventative maintenance procedures as scheduled;
  • Complete minor troubleshooting as required;
  • Observes and listens to machine operation in order to detect malfunctions such as worn or damaged grinding wheels when possible;
  • Notify Team Leader or Lead Hand when run times are incorrect or product will not meet time lines;
  • Report discrepancies to the appropriate department;
  • Provide guidance and/or training for apprentices when required;
  • Make recommendations for productivity and/or method improvements;
  • Ensure ISO guidelines are followed; follow Job Instruction Sheets and Tag Procedures etc;
Skills/Experience
  • A minimum of three (3) year experience and/or training in a precision machining environment required. The incumbent should have experience machining components to tight tolerances (3-5 microns) and can work independently.
  • In order to successfully meet the customer requirements, an individual must be able to machine materials to very close tolerances and small dimensions; in addition, the individual in this role must be able to understand programs and paths in order to run programs and edit as required; ability to grind tools to required specification.
Education
  • Individuals must have a High School Diploma. Completion of a General Machinist Apprenticeship would be helpful, but not required.

title: TruScale Controller/Pricing Analyst, NA Region
description:
Why Work at Lenovo

Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology for all, so we spend our time building a society that’s brighter and more inclusive. And we go big. No, not big—huge.

We’re a US$60 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company serving customers in 180 markets around the world. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that power (through devices and infrastructure) and empower (through solutions, services and software) millions of customers every day and together create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society for everyone, everywhere.

The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...

Description And Requirements

What You'll Do:

This is a great opportunity to join Lenovo’s Solutions & Services Group.

We are looking for a Senior Finance specialist to assist building out our TruScale business model to define and support future subscription-based HW and SW offerings. This is a high-visibility, high-criticality role which will need to establish a timeline and work in coordination with functions across the business to drive success. This leader will need to leverage cross-functional resources near-term to build momentum.

As the TruScale Controller/Pricing Analyst you will provide financial leadership for TruScale business development, including costing, pricing, margin management tools and processes.

What will be your tasks once you join us?
  • Understanding cost models
  • Training sales on pricing, messaging
  • Implementing bid controls; providing quotes to clients
  • Measuring sales performance
  • Manage cost performance
  • Work risk pricing with financial partners

Position Requirements

Basic Qualifications:
  • Strong understanding of existing Data Center ecosystem dynamics and future trends
  • Strong grasp of ‘aaS’ economics – billing cycle, margins, cash flow
  • Pricing, Costing expertise
  • Strong deal and business modeling capability
  • Strong business partnership skills
  • Experience supporting Global deals
  • Contracting Support
  • Experience managing hardware leases, lease modeling
  • Advanced Excel skills

Preferred Qualifications:
  • HW/SW Solutions expertise
  • Experience supporting launch of new product, offering or channel
  • Profitability optimization
  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, or IT
  • 7+ years experience in Corporate Finance roles

What We Will Offer You:
  • An open and stimulating environment within one of the most forward-thinking IT companies;
  • Flat structures and fast decision-making processes;
  • A modern and flexible way of working to combine personal and professional life
  • An international team with a high focus on Gender Diversity;
  • Attractive compensation package.
  • Markham - Ontario - Canada

title: Revenue Supervisor
description:
Revenue Supervisor


PLASP Child Care Services is a charitable organization operating on a not-for-profit basis, providing high quality early learning and child care, for children up to 12 years of age. PLASP operates programs in more than 240 schools providing before and after school care. PLASP also operates 30 full-day early learning and child care centres and six EarlyON locations for children from 0 – 6 years.


PLASP is committed to hiring, training, and fairly compensating staff. All Ontarians have the right to equal treatment with respect to employment without discrimination or harassment. We believe that everyone has worth and value, and that all staff are entitled to be respected, supported, and treated fairly by their co-workers and supervisors.


Reporting to the Controller, the Revenue Supervisor will provide supervision and guidance to a team within PLASP’s Accounting Department as it relates to subsidy, collections and PLASP fees.


THE POSITION INVOLVES…

The successful candidate will provide a full range of duties, including:

  • Providing leadership, direction, and support to a team within PLASP Accounting Department
  • Supervising and processing payment runs
  • Maintaining CRM information fees
  • Supervising subsidy applications and payments from various government agencies
  • Supervising the collection of outstanding payments from parents
  • Approving Bad Debt Write Offs
  • Assisting the Controller with Special Projects
  • Due to Covid-19, occasional remote work environment in place


THE PREFERRED CANDIDATE WILL…

  • Have a diploma in Accounting, Business Administration, or related field an asset
  • Minimum of five years’ experience in accounting
  • Possess extensive knowledge of accounting principles
  • Demonstrated supervisory and leadership skills
  • Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft CRM and NAV software
  • A strong problem solver and team player
  • Self-motivated, flexible and the ability to work effectively in a team environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent customer service skills


PLASP OFFERS…

  • A positive and supportive working environment
  • Growth and learning opportunities
  • A competitive compensation package
  • An opportunity to make a difference in the lives of children


HOW TO APPLY…


To apply for this exciting opportunity, please apply directly to the PLASP careers website before May 10, 2022. PLASP invites all applicants to submit their resume and cover letter for consideration.


As part of PLASP’s ongoing commitment to Health and Safety and maintaining a safe learning environment for its staff, children and the larger PLASP community, PLASP has a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Disclosure Policy. As part of a condition of employment, new employees will be required to disclose vaccination status and provide proof of full vaccination against Covid-19 prior to the start date of employment.


PLASP Child Care Services is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). title: PwC Private, Accounting, Manager
description:
Line of Service

Tax

Industry/Sector

Asset and Wealth Management

Specialism

Entrepreneurial & Private Business (EPB) - General

Management Level

Manager

Job Description & Summary

A career in our Accounting and Tax Reporting practice, within PwC Private, will provide you with the opportunity to help private companies with a range of business advisory services to resolve their day-to-day business issues and to help them achieve long-term success. You will advise clients on their local tax affairs, while acting as a strategic consultant, and will help them manage their tax obligations across unique but ever changing tax specialties. Our team helps our clients with accounting and complex tax reporting. You will focus on planning and executing notice to reader and review engagements; drafting and filing local financial statements; reviewing personal trust and corporate income tax returns, and other tax reporting forms; and will assist with year-end planning and bookkeeping.

Our PwC Private teams help entrepreneurs, private business owners and family enterprises manage their ownership and growth at every stage, in a way that fits the needs of their business in today's changing global landscape.

What you’ll create and do

As a Manager, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to

  • Pursue opportunities to develop existing and new skills outside of your comfort zone.
  • Act to resolve issues which prevent effective team working, even during times of change and uncertainty.
  • Coach others and encourage them to take ownership of their development.
  • Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.
  • Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.
  • Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm’s/client’s expectations.
  • Develop a perspective on key global trends, including globalization, and how they impact the firm and our clients.
  • Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties
  • Focus on building trusted relationships.
  • Uphold the firm’s code of ethics and business conduct.
  • Managing interpersonal relations and building the morale of the team
  • Reviewing completed financial statements and related notes
  • Reviewing personal and corporate tax returns and other information returns and related correspondence
  • Providing assistance to clients with payroll, GST and other related compliance
  • Ensuring that all work is completed and documented in accordance with our prescribed standards and billed in a timely manner

What you’ll bring to this role

  • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work
  • A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences, developing and coaching diverse teams, and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard
  • Strong understanding of ASPE and Canadian personal and corporate income taxes for private enterprises
  • CPA, CA or other relevant professional designation
  • Proficient with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Experience with Quickbooks, Simply Accounting, Google, Caseware and Tax Prep an asset.
  • Strong analytical capacity, sound business sense and creative mind that have earned a reputation of providing excellence in client service.
  • Demonstrates integrity, ethical decision-making and behaviors that build trust across teams and with clients
  • . Builds a deep understanding of clients’ business and needs and independently manages client relationships.
  • Seeks out opportunities for innovation, and will consult with colleagues and stakeholders, also acts as champions for new processes

Why you’ll love working for PwC

At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc

Get to know us

Check out our careers blog to hear what our people have to say and discover a place where you can bring your passions and whole self to work. https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/blog.html

Applying at PwC

At PwC, we embrace new technology where you will learn to innovate and deliver differently. For Administrative, Specialist, Associate, Senior Associate, and Manager roles you may have the opportunity to participate in an on-demand video interview. To learn more about our innovative cloud-based online application interview process click here: https://www.pwc.com/ca/applytopwc

We take your privacy seriously. To protect your personal information, please submit your application directly through PwC Canada Careers: https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers.html

title: Accounting Manager
company: The Mason Group - Strategic Search Partners
description:
Our client, a family office in the real estate industry is looking for an Accountant Manager for their fun, young and growing small office, located in central Toronto.

As an Accounting Manager for a small company, you are an organized self-starter, who enjoys working in a small team, including front office client services. Experience at a small company is helpful. Property accounting and/ or family office experience are assets.

The Accounting Manager will be responsible for accounting under ASPE. A system savvy mind who likes to find and implement process improvements will thrive in this environment. Full-cycle accounting oversight, transaction-level support across multiple investments, and overall accounting system experience are just a few of the day-to-day duties.

This Accounting Manager opportunity provides great balance and stability as a 9am–5pm job. With a nice work environment, while reporting directly to the Owners. This is a five day a week in the office job.


Requirements


  • Accounting / Finance/ BComm. or related degree,
  • CPA designation is an asset,
  • Strong knowledge of ASPE,
  • Lead effective month-end accounting close and assist with an efficient year-end process,
  • Excellent skills working with accounting, reporting, KPIs and data analytics software,
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required to manipulate large datasets and present information in a clean, organized way for decision making,
  • Strong systems knowledge,
  • Previous experience within property accounting, real estate, and/ or a family office environment, as well as well-honed project management skills,
  • Exemplary communication, presentation skills with a positive can-do client service attitude,
  • Confident, articulate, and reliable with great emotional maturity,
  • Ability to quickly problem-solve, with an inherent critical thinking mindset.


If you are already registered with The Mason Group, please contact your Recruiting Consultant directly with reference to job #15966.

title: Controller / Office Manager
description:
Big Rock Dodge is currently looking for the right individual to fill the key role of Controller. This position contributes to the overall success of the organization by effectively managing all day-to day and strategic financial and administrative tasks. Duties and responsibilities include:

  • Managing all accounting operations including Accounts Payable, Sales Revenue, and Inventory Accounting, and Payroll
  • Preparing monthly financial statements
  • Preparation and management of year-end close processes and financial statements
  • Ensuring quality control over all financial transactions and financial reporting
  • Calculating, submitting and reviewing all payments to CRA including Source Deductions, GST, Federal and Provincial Tax
  • Maintaining relations with external Accountant and investigate their findings and recommendations
  • Monitoring cash balances and managing cash flow including bill payments, EFT transactions, and inventory payouts.
  • Maintaining banking relations
  • Ensuring record keeping meets all requirements of external Accountant and Government agencies
  • Working together with other departments to develop and document better systems to strengthen, simplify and improve internal controls
  • Implementing best operational practices at all times, being accurate, honest, and transparent while always practicing positive communication
  • Supervising, mentoring and conduct yearly reviews for any direct report positions.

The ideal candidate would possess the following qualifications:

  • Post-secondary degree in Accounting, Commerce, or Business Management/Administration
  • 5+ years experience in a similar role
  • Accredited accounting designation (CA, CGA, CMA, CPA) is preferred
  • Payroll and Human Resources experience is considered an asset
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications
  • Proficiency with PBS Systems software is considered an asset
  • Thorough knowledge of cash management and finance
  • Thorough knowledge of creating financial statements
  • Thorough knowledge of general ledger functions and all month-end/year end close processes
  • Excellent communication skills and strong leadership background
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize, as well as ensure a high quality of work completed within an acceptable timeframe
  • High attention to detail
  • Self-motivated and goal orientated
  • Capable of working independently and with others in a collaborative process
  • Strong understanding of the automotive industry

Big Rock Dodge offers a competitive wage and a comprehensive benefits package.
Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter by June 17, 2016.
We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

title: Instrumentation and Controls Technologist
description:
Requisition ID: 3127 

Department: Infrastructure & Water Services Department 

Service: Water Services 

Branch: Wastewater Collection Branch

Employment Type: 1 Full-time Temporary (up to 2 years)

Work Hours: 40.00 hours per week

Affiliation: CUPE 503 Inside/Outside 

Salary Information: $76,159.20 - $89,109.28  annually (2022 rates of pay)

Location: ROPEC, 800 Green's Creek  

City: Ottawa, ON

Job Category: Maintenance and Trades 

Application Close: 18/05/2022

Job Summary

The mandate of Water Services is to provide treatment and distribution of a sustainable supply of high-quality drinking water and is committed to protecting the environment by collecting and treating wastewater for the health and prosperity of Ottawa.

You are responsible for providing maintenance and support for all legacy analog and evolving digital instrumentation and controls systems within the operation of wastewater processes; providing technical expertise and detailed knowledge to improvements, and problem resolution for wastewater process control and monitoring; calibrating and maintaining all personal safety gas monitors of the Wastewater Collection or Treatment Branches; and adjusting wastewater process parameters and operating various equipment while fulfilling the forgoing duties.

Education And Experience

Completion of 3 year college diploma in Electronics Engineering Technology, Electrical Engineering Technology, Instrumentation Technology or related diploma program with demonstrated background in analog instrumentation and digital control systems

Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Electronics / Instrumentation Technologist in an industrial setting, preferably in a water or sewage treatment plant

CERTIFICATIONS AND LICENCES

Must obtain and maintain Ontario MOE Wastewater Treatment/Collection Operator Certificates at the appropriate level, within the timeframe determined by the employer

Must complete all required on-the-job training/certifications (e.g. WHMIS, fall arrest, confined space entry, etc.) within the timeframe determined by the employer.

Competencies, Skills And Abilities
  • Read and interpret schematics and process & instrumentation diagrams
  • Strong hand eye coordination and fine motor skills
  • Able to analyze problems to develop solutions to complicated technical problems
  • Proven ability to exercise judgment and to make reasonable decisions
  • Demonstrated ability to set priorities and deal effectively with multiple demands and conflicting priorities
  • Ability to analyze, assess and recommend improvements to work methodologies and operating procedures
  • Troubleshoot equipment and process problems
  • Work effectively with others
  • Work effectively with minimal supervision
  • Alertness
  • Dependability
  • Self motivating
  • Good listening skills and the ability to deal with all levels of internal clients in an effective manner
  • Lift heavy objects
  • Work from elevated platforms
  • Work in confined spaces
  • Perform shift work if required


What You Need To Know
  • Language Requirement: English oral, reading, writing
  • Police Record Check: The successful candidate will be required to complete a Criminal Record Check with the Police Services detachment in their jurisdiction to the City of Ottawa’s satisfaction.; Police record checks completed by a third-party company will not be accepted.
  • Driver’s License Requirement: A valid Ontario unrestricted G class driver’s license (or provincial equivalent) with no more than 6 demerit points accumulated
  • You may initially be paid 95% of your starting rate of pay, in accordance with the collective agreement.
  • Experience and formal training combined with demonstrated performance and ability may substitute for stipulated academic requirements.
  • Please save a copy of the job poster. Once the closing date has passed, it will no longer be available.


We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

The City of Ottawa promotes the principles of diversity and inclusion and adheres to the tenets of the Canadian Human Rights Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. We encourage applications from women, people with disabilities, Aboriginal peoples and persons of all races, ethnic origins, religions, sexual orientations, and gender identities and expressions.

The City of Ottawa provides accommodation during all parts of the hiring process, upon request, to applicants with disabilities. If contacted to proceed to the selection process, please advise us if you require any accommodation.

Accessible formats and communication supports are available upon request. Please contact the HR Service Centre (email: HRServiceCentre@Ottawa.ca) at 613-580-2424, extension 47411 HR Service Centre at 613-580-2424, extension 47411.

title: Infection Control Manager (Full Time)
description:
Description

Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible.

Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day.

Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. The vaccine must be a two-dose COVID-19 vaccination series approved by Health Canada. This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.

Mission

Reporting to the Executive Director (ED), the Infection Control Manager, supports in developing and implementing the person centered care philosophy; S/he is also accountable for establishing a culture of compliance and adherence to infection prevention and control (IPAC) while serving resident, families and colleagues.

Key Outcomes
  • Resident & Family Satisfaction- overall increased ratings as measured through satisfaction survey results
  • Employee Engagement- Highly engaged teams as measured through annual employee engagement survey results
  • Exceptional Quality Indicators- Successfully executed and sustained clinical outcomes
  • A culture of compliance to promote the safety of residents, staff and general public
  • Adherence to IPAC standards & requirements set under the legislation and Revera’s IPAC Policies and Procedures
Key Responsibilities

Resident Care, Quality, Infection Control and Compliance:
  • To plan, direct, develop, co-ordinate, implement and evaluate resident care
  • To develop and maintain a relationship with the local Public Health, laboratory representative and IPAC leads at the regional and national level;
  • To ensure resident satisfaction and continuous quality improvement initiatives are promoted;
  • To implement Revera’s IPAC policies and procedures and participate in the development, assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of the Home’s IPAC Program;
  • To participate in quality initiatives, perform and/or coordinate audits on a regular basis and prepare action plans to ensure adherence to IPAC standards and recommend improvements;
  • To ensure surveillance is completed, using the IPAC app, by the nurse/designate on the shift of symptom onset, appropriate interventions implemented;
  • To attend the regional Quality Team meetings and report the status of the Home’s IPC Program:
  • To identify, and report infections and/or outbreaks, and monitor, investigate and follow-up infections and outbreaks and identify areas of improvement;
  • To provide education to Residents, volunteers and visitors related to infection control principles;
  • To align resident care services with the defined needs of the internal and external community;
Role Profile Approved by: Date:
  • To participate in Care Conferences as appropriate, meet with residents/family to resolve problems/ concerns/complaints
  • To maintain a liaison with hospital, medical staff, community and health care related disciplines and partner to ensure the most effective provision of care delivery in the home;
Human Resources And Administrative
  • To oversee the financial and human resource management aspects of the IPAC function within the home;
  • To hire, direct, supervise, evaluate, promote or terminate care staff;
  • To ensure quality care and a safe, effective and efficient work environment;
  • To identify the educational and training needs in the facility and to coordinate and facilitate staff development programs to meet these needs, improve quality of care and foster Revera’s person centered care philosophy;
  • To coordinate and provide ongoing education to staff on the principles and practices of infection prevention and control and new emerging infectious diseases and organisms;
  • To ensure the availability and maintenance of IPAC supplies and equipment to meet the needs of the home in a fiscally responsible manner;
  • To assume responsibilities of the Executive Director and or other managers as required in their absence;
  • To be knowledgeable of the Resident Bill of Rights/Governing Principles and endeavor to promote it;
  • To uphold and promote Revera’s Core Values and Code of Conduct;
  • To complete all other duties as assigned.
Required Education, Credentials And Experience
  • Minimum of one (3) year of experience working as healthcare professional in the long-term care sector;
  • Minimum of three (3) years of experience working as in a managerial or supervisory capacity in a health care setting preferred;
  • Post-secondary education;
  • Prior IPAC experience and or education are nice to have;
  • Current CPR designation is required;
  • Demonstrated leadership and communication skills;
  • Professional competencies related to life-long learning, public relations and health environment awareness;
  • Possession of strong motivational, team building and time management skills.
  • Must be computer literate in Microsoft Office Suite;
  • Proficiency in a second language is considered an asset.
Revera Core Competencies
  • Accountability: Takes ownership and holds self and others accountable to deliver high quality, timely and cost-effective results.
  • Business Acumen: Understands financial and operational aspects and implications that are essential to achieve superior business results.
  • Coaching & Developing Talent: Building capability of self, individuals and teams by engaging in feedback, coaching, learning and development. Building capability of self, individuals and teams by engaging in feedback, coaching, learning and development.
  • Customer Focus: Keeping the customer in mind to deliver the highest possible quality of care, service and choices.
  • Execution Excellence: Optimizes available resources and pursues implementation to consistently achieve exceptional outcomes.
  • Innovative Thinking: Identifies, develops and implements new and innovative solutions to enhance opportunity, efficiency and quality.
  • Teamwork and Collaboration: Inspires and fosters a team environment and works collaboratively to achieve business goals and objectives.
Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request.

Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

title: Vice President/Head of Signalling & Train Control - Engineering & Asset Management
description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.


We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you!


Our Operations – Rapid Transit office is expanding and looking to build out its leadership team with five (5) Vice Presidents to provide senior strategic direction and leadership to the engineering and asset management activities related to the integration, delivery and support of GO Transit, UP Express, LRT, BRT and Subways.


The Vice President, Head of Signaling & Train Control will be the technical authority responsible for all railway signaling, train protection and train control systems including level crossing traffic protection and remote monitoring and control of railway infrastructure.


What will I be doing?

  • Provides strategic leadership and technical expertise to ensure the mandate of Engineering and Asset Management portfolio groups and their project-based activities are prioritized, aligned and delivered to meet critical project milestones
  • Creates and sustains a viable organizational structure to make optimum use of world-class talent, technology and systems
  • Leverages best-in-class processes and technology, and establishes teams to lead a world class asset management organization
  • Designs, builds and manages high performing teams to deliver a broad range of complex projects and programs
  • Fosters a culture of team spirit and innovation into the longer and short-term operations of the organization
  • Standard owner and author for the technical asset class, responsible for the sign offs and approval of derogations from the standards on behalf of the Chief Engineer.
  • Directs and provides oversight to the development of Engineering and Asset Management policy for the designated asset class, procedures and practices that ensure programs align with Metrolinx strategic goals
  • Provides leadership and direction to the definition and control of technical and functional interfaces between independent systems
  • Directs the establishment of a comprehensive plan to create Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to support both On-time Performance of all Metrolinx owed services, in collaboration with the Operations executive team and external Contractors
  • Provides oversight and direction to the establishment of service and quality standards consistent with Metrolinx strategic position
  • Directs the development of a strategic operating model and criteria to monitor the quality and performance
  • Directs and provides oversight to the establishment of a comprehensive plan to manage complex construction projects, program design, and implementation issues
  • Works with the Capital Planning Group delivery leads, Planning teams, and external Contractors to establish a comprehensive plan to manage complex construction projects, program design, and implementation issues
  • Provides consultation, direction, advice, and guidance regarding asset management, SOGR, project management and Safety
  • Directs and facilitates collaboration and cooperation between diverse stakeholders to effectively deal with escalated construction and complex engineering problems
  • Interfaces with various federal, provincial, and municipal agencies, to address issues concerning the safety of railway assets
  • Accountable for ensuring the development and implementation of engineering standards, engineering assurance and systems engineering integration across Operations for GO, UPE and Rapid Transit
  • Ensures engineering compliance with federal, provincial, and local/municipal legal, regulatory, and policy requirements related to railway, rail transit and transportation related facilities
  • Promotes the use of innovative and best practices for functional excellence
  • Reviews and consolidates budgets related to asset management, cost effectiveness and prudence management of projects
  • Responsible for compliance with Metrolinx financial and budgeting programs (protocols and reporting)
  • Provides senior leadership oversight for all investments, purchases, contracts, and other financial activities
  • Proactively assesses, establishes, and manages risk profile, financial and budgetary programs, and safety objectives
  • Demonstrates leadership and core competencies at a high level of development and is an exemplary model of living the corporate Values and Code of Ethics
  • Leads, mentors, and motivates a diverse workforce; sets the standards and expectations for work quality, organizational performance, and continuous learning; encourages innovation in other
  • Directs a large department through several subordinate directors/managers


What skills & qualifications do I need?

  • Completion of a degree in Engineering or a related discipline or a combination of education and experience deemed suitable
  • Minimum fifteen (15) years’ experience in progressively senior engineering leadership roles, experience leading large complex construction projects from conception to build, experience in the transportation industry and public sector in Canada an asset
  • Professional Engineering (P.Eng.) qualification or the ability to attain this status is required, international equivalent is acceptable until qualification is achieved as required by the asset group; MBA and/or a Project Management Professional (PMP) accreditation is considered an asset.; Must possess a valid driver’s license.
  • In-depth knowledge of Railway legislation (e.g. Railway Safety Act, etc.) and transport Canada Rules and Regulations, as well as applicable International legislation, regulations, guidelines and standards
  • Extensive knowledge of financial theories, principles and practices, procurement, fiscal planning, modern controllership frameworks and the overall business planning, estimates, expenditure and allocations plan processes
  • Knowledge of the principles of accountability and risk management
  • Senior leadership/management expertise to provide direction to an operating or function unit with multiple teams
  • Knowledge of budget development and management processes (annual and long-term budgets)
  • Knowledge of project management principles and practices, including budget and schedule controls
  • Highly developed political acuity to anticipate and recognize politically sensitive situations; anticipate resistance to proposals, plan strategically, nurture stakeholder relations and deal with emerging issues which have high impact and media scrutiny
  • Sensitivity to issues being faced at the VP, CCO, COO and CEO level, and how the political agenda may impact on decision making
  • Collaboration, partnership building, relationship management and negotiation skills
  • Interpersonal and oral/written/presentation communication skills


Accommodation:

Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance.


Application Process:

All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application.


Metrolinx employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with Metrolinx’s Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy as a condition of being eligible for the recruitment process. Proof of COVID-19 vaccination will be required. If you are not able to obtain COVID-19 vaccination for a reason related to a protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation, you can request accommodation from Metrolinx.


We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Our Client, one of the world’s leading manufacturers and marketers of vehicle lighting and safety systems, is looking for an accounting manager to add to their accounting staff. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, organized and have a minimum of three years’ experience in accounting at a senior level. The experience should be in a manufacturing environment. Experience with E1 (JDE) system an asset. The ideal candidate will be looking to advance their career in the accounting field. This position will report directly to the Controller.


Duties and Responsibilities

• Using the highest standards and practices to ensure financial documents comply with the law

• Collecting and verifying financial information

• Maintaining a general ledger by inputting daily financial transactions

• Overseeing payroll for the company

• Preparing financial statements, producing accounting reports, and checking them for accuracy

• Maintaining the standard costing of all products per corporate standards

• Monitor, observe and audit the warehouse cycle counts

• Assist with the supervision of the accounting staff

• Assist with the annual and quarterly budget process

• Assist with financial audits


Skills and Qualifications

• Strong understanding of mathematics

• Excellent time management and ability to meet constant deadlines

• Knowledgeable in financial computer software

• Good delegation skills

• Leadership skills

• Detail orientation

• Proficiency in Excel

• University degree in accounting or economics

Compensation and Benefits

• Competitive wages

• RRSP/DPSP program

• Competitive benefits package

title: Gestionnaire principal(e), opérations comptables corporatives
description:
Vous cherchez l’opportunité de vous joindre à une grande entreprise dont le but principal est d’alimenter les visionnaires de ce monde en leur fournissant des solutions technologiques d’infrastructure de pointe, adaptées à leurs besoins, de manière rapide, fiable et rentable ?
En tant que société de technologie de pointe basée à Montréal, Hypertec est un fournisseur mondial de produits et de services de technologie de l’information. Ses divisions stratégiques servent plus de 3 000 clients dans plus de 70 pays. Ses solutions sont utilisées par des organisations de toutes tailles, notamment des fournisseurs d'infonuagique, des médias et du divertissement, des services financiers, de l'aérospatiale, de l'ingénierie, des soins de santé, du gouvernement et de l'éducation.
Afin de poursuivre notre croissance rapide, nous recherchons un(e) Gestionnaire principal(e), opérations comptables corporatives pour se joindre à notre équipe en pleine croissance, tout en étant un exemple de la culture de notre entreprise.
CE QUE SERONT VOS RESPONSABILITÉS
  • Diriger 5 subordonnés directs et une équipe composée de 13 personnes;
  • Mettre en place des fonctions de services partagés « de premier ordre » qui sont efficaces et qui génèrent des mécanismes de contrôle interne solides dans l'ensemble de l'organisation;
  • Mettre en œuvre des projets d'amélioration à l'aide de la technologie et de la refonte des processus pour les services partagés transactionnels, notamment les comptes créditeurs, les comptes débiteurs, la facturation et le recouvrement;
  • Contrôler la fonction de trésorerie, incluant l'optimisation de la gestion de la trésorerie dans un contexte d'investissement et de croissance rapide, et agir en tant qu'interlocuteur privilégié auprès de l'agent administratif de la banque/du syndicat bancaire pour toutes les exigences relatives à la gestion de la trésorerie de l'organisation;
  • Être responsable des opérations de clôture de fin de mois pour tous les services partagés transactionnels;
  • Mettre en œuvre, consigner et maintenir des indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) et des contrôles internes adéquats et efficaces dans toutes les fonctions de services partagés;
  • Diriger des projets d'amélioration continue, incluant la formation à l'intention des finances et des clients internes;
  • Assister le directeur principal - finances corporatives et le directeur financier dans des projets ad hoc.
CE QUE VOUS APPORTEREZ
  • Une expérience minimale de 6-7 ans dans un rôle similaire;
  • Une bonne combinaison de capacités analytiques, un sens aigu des affaires, une capacité à établir des relations, une aptitude à communiquer efficacement et à persuader;
  • Des compétences avérées en matière de leadership et une expérience dans la gestion d'une équipe;
  • La capacité à traiter de multiples problèmes dans un environnement au rythme rapide et en constante évolution, nécessitant des compétences particulières en matière de gestion du temps et une capacité à respecter les délais;
  • De solides compétences en matière d'organisation, de gestion du temps et de communication;
  • De solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes;
  • Des aptitudes interpersonnelles qui sont souples et aisées à tous les niveaux de l'organisation;
  • Un souci du détail et une faculté à résoudre des problèmes;
  • De solides compétences dans la gestion de projets - la mise en œuvre de systèmes, l'amélioration des processus et la gestion du changement;
  • Être consciencieux en ce qui concerne le respect des délais et dans l'amélioration de la qualité de son travail;
  • Être parfaitement bilingue (anglais et français);
  • Une parfaite maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office, particulièrement d'Excel et des analyses de données;
  • La connaissance des logiciels financiers, ERP, CRM et/ou de gestion (SAP Business One est un atout);
CE QUE NOUS OFFRONS
  • Un environnement de travail dynamique et collaboratif;
  • Un environnement de travail hybride (télétravail possible);
  • Une rémunération concurrentielle;
  • La contribution de l'employeur à un compte de dépenses de frais de santé (jusqu'à 500 $ par an);
  • Des jours flottants rémunérés;
  • Un programme d’aide aux employés (PAE);
  • Une cafétéria sur place;
  • Le libre accès 24/7 à un gymnase entièrement équipé avec entraîneur;
  • Du plaisir au travail: BBQ, journées thématiques et autres événements d'engagement des employés;
  • Des opportunités d'avancement professionnel.
Êtes-vous prêt(e) à relever le défi ?
Hypertec est un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances.
Hypertec évalue les candidats qualifiés sans distinction de race, de couleur, de religion, de sexe, d'origine ethnique, d'âge, d'orientation sexuelle, d'identité ou d'expression de genre, de statut d'invalidité ou de toute autre caractéristique légalement protégée.

title: Instrumentation & Controls Technologist
description:
INSTRUMENTATION & CONTROLS TECHNOLOGIST

Location: Vancouver, BC - 1000 – 885 Dunsmuir St

Tetra Tech is a leading provider of consulting engineering, program management, construction management, and technical services throughout Canada. Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 400 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—21,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development. Tetra Tech employs more than 3,500 experts in Canada who are poised to take on the next challenge. From more than 50 offices across the country, our multidisciplinary teams have capabilities that span the entire project life cycle.

This Vancouver office location specializes in small to mid-sized projects for clients across Canada. The types of clients we work for include:
  • Heavy industrial Facilities
  • Oil & Gas
  • Refineries
  • Mining
  • Municipal & Utilities
Position Summary

We are currently searching for an Instrumentation / Controls Technologist to join our team in Vancouver. This role is a fast-paced, challenging position in designing, programming, and commissioning instrumentation and automation control systems for industrial clients. The ideal candidate enjoys working as a team player in an office environment and seeing the work followed-through at onsite visits.

Responsibilities
  • Work as an instrumentation and controls member of a multi-discipline design team with project teams in multiple offices.
  • Develop control strategies and control narratives; provide P&ID assistance to the Process Group.
  • Specify instruments and final control devices.
  • Prepare instrumentation and control system layout drawings and block diagrams.
  • Design automation systems including PLC, HMI, DCS, and communication networks.
  • Prepare network diagrams and PLC/DCS gateway interface lists.
  • Perform site visits to field verify design details.
  • Design PLC panels and prepare panel layouts, I/O module schematics, termination diagrams, bills of material, and cable schedules.
  • Prepare hardware and software specifications.
  • Participate in Factory Acceptance Testing for major equipment.
  • Work with electrical designers on electrical motor control systems including MCCs, soft starters, and VFDs.
  • Contribute to electrical area classification drawings.
  • Prepare instrumentation and controls construction work packages.
  • Develop PLC, HMI, and communication module programs.
  • Perform software simulations, acceptance testing with clients, pre-commissioning, and site commissioning of PLCs, HMIs, and networks.
  • Ensure that work is checked in accordance with the standards and procedures of Tetra Tech and the client.
  • Adhere to all health and safety policies and guidelines of Tetra Tech and the client.
Skills And Knowledge
  • 2 to 5 years of progressive experience as an Instrumentation & Controls Technologist is preferred
  • Experience in Consulting Engineering, Oil, Gas Refining considered an asset
  • Strong interpersonal skills required for internal team interfaces and client liaison
  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to adapt to new projects and quickly understand the defined scope
  • Fluency in one or more control system languages will be considered an asset
  • Project management skills
  • Adherence to safety policies and procedures
Software And Systems
  • Experience with computer design tools – AutoCAD, SPI Intools, 3D modelling
  • Hardware / software troubleshooting skills
  • PLC/HMI/DCS programming experience using industry standard software packages
  • SCADA system design and programming
  • Experience with Schneider / Modicon and/or Rockwell controller products
  • Experience with industrial network design and implementation including Ethernet/IP, DeviceNet, and Modbus
  • Formal training from control system vendor or industry software tools will be considered an asset
Education
  • Diploma of Technology in Automation and Instrumentation (Example: BCIT, SAIT, or equivalent)
  • Eligible or Registered with ASTTBC or ASET
Additional Information & Requirements
  • A requirement of working for Tetra Tech is that you are at least 18 years of age and legally entitled to work in Canada. A copy of a valid work permit may be required.
  • If you are considered for the position, clearance on all applicable background checks (which may include criminal, identity, educational, and/or credit) and professional reference checks is required. Some Tetra Tech positions require an enhanced level of background assessment, which is dictated by law. These positions require advanced criminal record checks that must also be conducted from time to time after commencement of employment.
  • To meet the physical demands required of some positions, candidates must be in good physical condition and willing to work in all weather conditions.
  • Periodic travel within Canada to client sites and regional Tetra Tech offices will be required
  • Clearance on pre-placement medical and drug and alcohol testing and background checks may be required for our client worksites
  • Must be able to adhere to our Office Vaccination & Covid Policies. We will be confirming your eligibility to comply with these requirements.
  • Current Working Environment: Hybrid Working Arrangement (In office & work from home)
Why Tetra Tech

In addition to rewarding job opportunities and continuous growth, we offer an attractive employee package including:
  • Competitive compensation and benefits
  • Rewarding retirement savings program
  • Professional development opportunities
  • Great working location
Tetra Tech is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties, including women; Indigenous persons; members of visible minority groups; and persons with disabilities. title: Bed Control Clerk
description:
Job Title Bed Control ClerkWork Site Patient Management - Richmond Hospital, Richmond, BCStatus CasualStart Date As soon as possibleSalary $25.42 per hourHours VariousReference# 161534-lba

Come work as a Bed Control Clerk with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Bed Control Clerk to join the Patient Management team at Richmond Hospital. Apply today to join our team!

As a Bed Booking Clerk working with the Patient Management department you will
  • Report to the Admitting Supervisor or designate, this position identifies available booking options and assigns beds.
  • Verifiy and process information required in the admission.
  • Discharge and transfer of patients utilizing a computerized admission.
  • Discharge, transfer (ADT) system.
Qualifications

Education & Experience
  • Grade 12, three years' recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience..
Knowledge & Abilities
  • Ability to keyboard at 45 wpm.
  • Knowledge of medical terminology.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https//my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.
