title: Controller Consultant
description:
RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations.

Working as a consultant you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments.

As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know:

  • We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them.
  • We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.
  • We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.

If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.

THE RGP CONSULTING EXPERIENCE
RGP has a unique consulting model that provides opportunities for consultants to work in different ways. Most consultants work in a model where they have the flexibility and autonomy to choose projects aligning to their experience, skills and desired lifestyle. Other opportunities exist in team-based, strategy and solutions work. In all models, you will feel the full support of RGP to assist you in your work and guide you on your chosen path.

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
As a Controller Consultant, you will play a pivotal role in assisting clients in a variety of challenging projects and the delivery of effective financial processes and controls that support business objectives and operational needs.

ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS WITH RGP

  • Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues
  • A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues
  • Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues
  • Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents
  • A strong personal identification with RGP's values - loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE

  • Work closely with Finance Directors and other key business leaders to provide support and drive financial objectives, make recommendations to support development of the company’s overall business strategy and act as a true business partner to the client’s leadership
  • Manage the month-end accounting close, ensuring accurate and timely results that are in accordance with US GAAP requirements, review and analyze internal financial data to identify issues, opportunities and trends to provide business owners and senior leaders with financial data that will support decision making
  • Install and maintain a proper control environment and culture to limit business risk and exposures.  
  • Lead people to implement change through coaching, training, and clear objective setting in order to meet the client’s short-term needs and long-term goals



DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting or related field required
  • Master’s Degree preferred
  • CPA, CMA, CFE, CIA preferred
  • 10-plus years of professional experience in public accounting, related consulting and/or industry experience 
  • Strong knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP); SEC reporting experience is a plus. Experienced with general ledger accounting, month-end close, reconciliations, financial statements, and variance analysis 
  • Excellent communication and facilitation skills, ability to build relationships and foster trust at all organizational levels
  • Experience working with large ERP systems and advanced technical skills

Equal Opportunity Employer
RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.

title: R&D Automation Control
description:
At Weighpack, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Our diverse and multi-disciplined team of professionals are fun and exciting to work with as our general population is skilled labor committed to growth. We are a transparent work environment driven by Passion, Collaboration and Excellence.

We are seeking a R&D Automation Control will lead electrical development of amazing new products based on state of the art primary and secondary technology.


In this role you will:


  • Deliver new products that meet customer requirements and provide confidence to our sales organization.
  • Perform detailed research and prepare project scopes and budgets.
  • Document test failures and successes
  • Create, electrical design architecture.
  • Create Bill of Materials (BOM) and schematics.
  • Perform PLC programming, HMI design, SCADA design, electrical design, motion programming, vision programming, robotic programming, and communication design.
  • Ensure machines compliance to the Canadian, American, and European standards (CSA, UL, CE).
  • Research new electrical materials
  • Develop and customize electrical products by studying customer requirements, researching, and testing manufacturing and assembly methods and materials.
  • Test finished products and system capabilities (test the sequence and functionality). Document test failures and successes.
  • Write procedures and identify programming parameters for VFDs, ServoDrives, temperature controllers and other electrical instruments.
  • Prepare product reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
  • Participate actively to meetings and respect the established deadlines
  • Research and develop new technologies and integrate them into the company’s product line.
  • Follows global industry standards and company’s practices, rules, and procedures.
  • Execute proper closing procedures and ensure proper archiving of documentation
  • Respects the company’s standards such as punching rules, policies, procedures

We’d like to hear from you if you have:

  • 5+ Years of relevant experience most preferably in a manufacturing, electrical or automation industry.
  • College degree in electronics or automation.
  • Experience with Omron PLCs, Weintek HMIs, AutoCAD Electrical, SolidWorks PDM, and Collaboration tools would be an asset.
  • Regulatory experience (CSA, UL, CE, PHSR, USDA) is considered as an asset.
  • Curious, creative, and have strong work commitment.
  • Fast learner and detail oriented
  • Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced manufacturing environment facing constant changing priorities.
  • Experience in PCB design, Microcontrollers, Linux, Python, PHP, MySQL

Why People love working for us:


Our employee’s time and commitment are extremely valuable, so we strive to give back to our team. Here is what you get when you join Weighpack:


  • Amazing peers! We truly have a fun, dynamic and friendly team who support each other’s success.
  • An ultra-modern and brightwork environment at the intersection of highways 13 & 40.
  • Monthly social event, sports teams, wellness workshops and more.
  • Competitive salary and flexible hours.
  • Exponentially growing business.
  • WeighPack University, where we offer learning and career advancement opportunities.


If you are ready for a challenge in a great working environment, and this position sounds like you, we would like to hear from you! Send us your resume!

Visit us at www.weighpack.com

We thank all the candidates for their interest, however only those selected will be contacted.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
This K-W designer-manufacturer of electronic, electro-mechanical components has built a solid foundation based on new product development. It has grown to the point that the Controller now needs an Accounting Manager to support all daily Accounting functions and monthly reporting to head office.


Joining the management team, the Accounting Manager will liaise with Leaders of Engineering, Quality, Operations, Production, and Human Resources reviewing and analysing operating results at a micro level as well as with the Controller and General Manager at a macro level. In support of junior Accounting staff, the Accounting Manager will be called upon to guide and mentor their professional development.


Our ideal candidate is a recently accredited CPA with solid manufacturing industry accounting experiences highlighted by in-depth standard costing experiences. Superb verbal communication skill is an essential hiring criteria. In return, this client can offer employment stability in a successful, collegial environment.

Notre client, une entreprise dans le domaine manufacturier et de l'aéronotique située sur la Rive-Sud de Montréal, est à la recherche d'un contrôleur de gestion. Il s'agit d'un mandat d'une durée de 14-15 mois (remplacement d'un congé de maternité). Vous travaillerez dans un environnement francophone selon un horaire de 40 heures par semaine et gagnerez un salaire entre 80 000$ et 100 000$ par année (selon votre expérience).

Relevant du vice-président des finances, vos responsabilités seront:
  • Responsable des analyses des résultats versus les budgets et prévisions financières des différentes unités d’affaires;
  • Responsable du suivi, du contrôle et de l’analyse des coûts et des inventaires;
  • Superviser le processus de clôture mensuel des transactions liées aux inventaires;
  • Préparer les analyses de profitabilité par produit et par usine;
  • Superviser la préparation des indicateurs de performance et des divers rapports de gestion;
  • Coordonner le processus budgétaire et de prévisions;
  • Membre de l’équipe responsable des réclamations de crédits d’impôt R& D;
  • Maintenir de bonnes communications avec les divers intervenants;
  • Participer au dossier de fin d'année avec les vérificateurs externes;
  • Participation aux projets spéciaux et toutes autres tâches connexes.
Requirements

  • Deux (2) ans d'expérience dans un poste similaire;
  • Bilinguisme;
  • Esprit d’analyse et ingéniosité;
  • Sens de l’organisation et de la planification;
  • Capacité à travailler sous pression avec des délais restreints;
  • Capacité à exercer des suivis et contrôles;

title: Régulateur / Dispatcher
description:
Newrest recrute des Régulateurs pour son Unité de Dorval.

Humilité, simplicité, efficience, et sens des responsabilités, telles sont les valeurs de Newrest. Premier acteur mondial indépendant du catering aérien, Newrest est le seul opérateur à intervenir sur l’ensemble des secteurs : catering aérien, bases-vie, catering ferroviaire et retail. Fort de ses 29500 collaborateurs présents dans 57 pays, le groupe a réalisé un chiffre d’affaires de 1.07 milliard d’euros en 2020.

Newrest s'engage à améliorer et à innover constamment pour ses clients, à assurer le bien-être et le progrès de ses employés et de ses cadres, à assurer un développement durable et soutenable de l'entreprise, et à respecter les valeurs sociales et environnementales dans toutes ses activités. Pour plus d’informations sur Newrest :

Vous exercerez votre fonction sous la responsabilité fonctionnelle du Responsable Approvisionnement et sous la responsabilité hiérarchique du Directeur Unité de Dorval.

MISSIONS:
  • Gérer la communication avec les différents services en interne ;
  • Assurer la communication avec nos partenaires externes ainsi que nos clients ;
  • Prendre connaissance du contenu de chaque réajustement / croisement appareil / retard avion, etc. pour chaque impression ;
  • Surveiller l’arrivée des mails et prendre connaissance au plus vite des informations ;
  • Veiller à récupérer la check-list de chaque véhicule ;
  • Veiller au respect des consignes de sécurité (port chaussures de sécurité, gilet jaune…) ;
  • Contrôle des flux de vab, plombes, présents, entrées sorties ;
  • Prendre en charge les retours des Compagnies (BoB, Duty free)
  • Gestion du parc véhicule ;
  • Établir le pointage des vols via Winflight et les commandes (classeurs) ;
  • Établir les Bons de Livraisons de J+1 ainsi que les plombs ainsi que tous les documents de sûreté pour les vols du jour J+1 ;

PROFIL:
  • Expérience similaire d'un an minimum ;
  • Expérience dans le secteur du catering aérien ou à l'aéroport est un plus ;
  • Parfaitement bilingue en anglais et français ;
  • Dynamique et réactif ;

description:

title: Accounting Manager, Disbursement
description:
Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa teamYou’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team! Our Finance Department located at our head office in Richmond, BC currently has opportunities for:Accounting Manager, DisbursementThe Accounting Manager, Disbursement is responsible for managing the Accounts Payable department within PeopleSoft and related general ledger account reconciliations. This position involves tight deadlines, accounting for multiple companies and a variety of accounting activities including general ledger transactions, financial reporting, inventory valuation, year-end audit working paper preparation, and the support of budget and forecasting activities. Key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintain processes and procedures that ensure accurate, meaningful financial reporting in accordance with applicable accounting standards.

Protect and maintain confidentiality of all financial and operational information.

Ensure that work within the Accounts payable team is properly allocated, monitored and completed in a timely and accurate manner.

Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure within PeopleSoft and related operational systems.

Preparation of schedules and reconciliations in support of monthly, quarterly and annual financial statement preparation.

Collaborates with the other finance department managers to support overall department goals and objectives.

Ensure all related policies and procedures are up to date.

Monitor and analyze department work to develop efficient procedures and use of resources.

Foster a high degree of accuracy and professionalism within the Finance department.

Advise and mentor staff regarding the handling of non-routine reporting and transactions.

Manage, monitor, and report various aspects of the distribution cost.

Assist in managing various aspects of inventory management

Respond to inquiries from vendors and customers

Respond to inquiries from business Unit Managers, Controller, Assistant Controller and other finance and company-wide managers regarding financial results, special reporting and other financial requests.

Responsible for accruing and analyzing operational costs related to distribution activities.

Works with the Assistant Controller and Controller to ensure a clean and timely year end audit for the interim review and year end.

Assists in the development and implementation of new processes, procedures and technology to enhance workflow efficiency within the department.

Provide training and mentoring to new and existing staff as required.

Support Controller & Assistant Controller with special projects and workflow process improvements.

Ensure ongoing and continuous performance management of all staff.

Any other job-related duties required by the Assistant Corporate Controller.

The successful candidate should possess the following:

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Adapts easily to change.

Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.

Sound judgment and ability to effectively problem solve as required.

Ability to work quickly and accurately under pressure.

Highly organized and able to multitask effectively and work under changing priorities.

Ability to exercise professional judgment, delegate and follow-up.

Ability to interact and communicate effectively with customers, vendors, employees, and fellow management throughout the organization.

Strong leadership skills, with an emphasis on managing all individuals within a team.

EDUCATION & KNOWLEDGE:

A designated CPA

Strong technical accounting skills and in-depth knowledge of ASPE

Minimum One Year Of Supervisory Or Team Leadership Experience.

Experience working in a large retail chain or head office.

Advanced PeopleSoft setup and functional knowledge.

Must have strong computer skills and advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word.

London Drugs offers advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, salaries commensurate with experience, as well as a comprehensive benefits program including:

Medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family (Ensuring you and your family are taken care of)

Employee Discount Program (Sharing our success)

Employee Recognition Program (Tangible rewards for great work!)

Company matched RRSPs (Helping you plan for your future)

Ongoing In-House Training & Education Courses (Lifelong learning)

Employee Family Assistance Program (Free confidential counseling)

Community Involvement (Giving back to our communities)

If you are a well organized, self-motivated, individual who has a positive attitude and a commitment to achieving Company objectives, then we have the opportunity for you to excel! Apply Now!We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
We are currently hiring an experienced Accounting Manager to join our client’s growing team. This is a full-time, staff position. Reporting to the Executive VP, this role is responsible for the monthly accounting functions and day to day administrative, HR and financial tasks. The successful candidate will need to have a good understanding of contracts, strong payroll and HR knowledge/skills and need to be self starters, prepared to take on challenges.

Responsibilities:

  • Preparation of detailed monthly financial statements.
  • Oversee all financial and administrative functions for the company.
  • Coordinate corporate budgeting process.
  • Training and supervision of support staff.
  • Ensure the company complies with government reporting requirements.
  • Analysis of actual job costs vs estimates.
  • Implement and maintain office procedures.
  • Ensure credit granting processes are adequate to ensure no bad debt is incurred.
  • Monitor corporate cash flow to ensure company needs are met.
  • Lead the yearend review process.
  • Review legal and contractual documents.
  • Process payroll for certain employee groups.
  • Administer the benefits plan for certain employee groups.
  • Attendance at various workshops, courses etc. as directed and required to fulfill job responsibilities.
  • Other tasks, projects and responsibilities as may be assigned by the Executive Vice President.
  • Comply with company Health & Safety Policy.
  • Familiarize and adhere to all company policies.
  • Cover for employee absences and assist other team members as required.

Requirements:

  • CPA designation.
  • 5 years’ experience in a financial or administration management role.
  • Strong knowledge of the Employment Standards Act of Ontario and similar governmental rules and regulations related to employment matters.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong analytical and mathematical skills.
  • High level of organizational skills.Good understanding of the basics of contract law.
  • Proficient computer skills including ability to use standard office software at an advanced level.
  • Positive attitude.

What We Offer

Why apply through Brunel? Finding the next step in your career can be a fulltime job in itself. We manage the process for you: from submitting your resume to coordinating interviews to extending offers and assisting with on-boarding. We’ll get you going while you get on with the job.

About Us

Brunel has a reputation for working with some of the best in the business. That’s what we continually strive for. Over 45 years, we’ve created a global network of interesting clients and talented individuals working together through a vast array of services.

title: Senior Accounting Manager
description:
The Senior Accounting Manager will oversee the month-end close process, ensure accuracy in the reported numbers, ensure compliance with CSI accounting policies, and that deadlines are met without exception.


Responsibilities :

  • Review and ensure accounting systems and processes are working properly
  • Complete monthly results certification for corporate on WD4 and WD6 for business units including new acquisitions.
  • Send out the monthly variance file to the FAs/GMs. Review variance commentary by FAs and provide commentary.
  • Highlight any material (>$25k) accounting surprises before the distribution of the BU reporting package (i.e. before WD5)
  • Review monthly balance sheet reconciliation and ensure any issues are resolved in a timely manner.
  • Drive accountability of balance sheet reconciliation amongst the BU finance team and ensure standardization of balance sheet reconciliations across the division.
  • Work with the BU finance teams to put in-process controls for recurring accounting issues
  • Recording of centralized accounting processes & providing guidance for journal entries, close process, coding expenses, and leading execution of PER Corporate Accounting policies.
  • Provide IFRS-16 Lease Accounting & IFRS-15 guidance to BU accounting teams
  • Quarterly impairment testing for CSI corporate. Take the lead with reviewing and assessing impairment models when an impairment is triggered
  • Work with FAs on a $1M new contract checklist for CSI corporate (Due quarterly) for PER Corporate.
  • Prepare Quarterly variance analysis and Quarterly division FS Checklist for PER Corporate
  • Oversee the internal/external audits for the BUs & drive resolution accountability to mitigate risks
  • Ensure optimized use of contour amongst the BUs.
  • Assist the teams with the hiring and onboarding of new accounting resources.
  • Assist BU finance teams with new acquisition hiring, task assignment, and contour utilization.
  • Ad-hoc corporate projects as defined by management


Technical and Educational Qualifications

  • Completion of a professional accounting designation program (CPA, CMA, CGA) is a plus.
  • Experience of 5-7 years in accounting & finance is essential.
  • Excellent analytical, research, and problem-solving skills;
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Excel;
  • Strong communication and people skills;
  • Ability to meet deadlines in a rapidly changing business environment;
  • Ability to work independently and balance competing demands;
  • A strong understanding of accounting guidelines, particularly IFRS-15 revenue recognition guidelines is strongly preferred, and acquisition accounting is a plus.
  • Ability to manage and prioritize competing deliverables in a fast-paced environment.
  • Knowledge of Great Plains, Jedox & Concur is an asset.



WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT US

  • Doing work that has a direct impact on customers and an industry
  • Working with a team of confident, self-starting, and persistent people with visible passion
  • Opportunity to work outside of one’s comfort zone and within the thrill of a fast-paced environment
  • Corporate bonus program
  • Great health and dental insurance benefits

title: Infection Prevention and Control Lead (IPAC) - Country Village
description:
Southbridge Care Homes are currently looking to add a caring, passionate, and enthusiastic Infection Prevention and Control Lead to join our community, who can serve our lovely residents, to keep them safe, healthy, and happy.

Reporting to the Regional IPAC Specialist, the IPAC Lead will be a resident safety expert who leads the planning, development, implementation, coordination, and evaluation of system-wide improvements in infection prevention and serve as a role model to promote the goals of the IPAC program within the context of the vision and mission of Southbridge. You will facilitate change through interpretation and application of standards and provide best practice recommendations with the ultimate goal of improving resident outcomes and preventing disease outbreaks.

As an IPAC Lead you will be accountable for…
  • Coordination and implementation of infection prevention and control practices for the home;
  • Participate in the planning of an infection surveillance program and lead the management of outbreaks in consultation with the local public health unit;
  • Perform daily infection surveillance and develop the monthly surveillance report;
  • Educate staff on the principles and practices of infection prevention and act as a resource regarding infection prevention and control;
  • Maintain current vaccines for all residents; ensure the home is in compliance with the infection control guidelines mandated by the Long-Term Care Homes Act;
  • Plan, develop, deliver and implement all training/orientation for current and new employees in accordance with legislation and health care standards, and in consultation with the Leadership Committee;
  • Regularly evaluate training programs to ensure the needs of the home is being met;
  • Identify and report safety hazards, conduct regular safety inspections and follow safe working practices and behavior;
  • Provide expert guidance on facility design, maintenance, and construction projects;
  • Lead the implementation of changes mandated by regulatory, accrediting, and licensing agencies (includes reporting communicable diseases to the local public health);
  • Monitor staff compliance with infection prevention guidelines regarding the disposal of sharps and biomedical waste, use of personal protective equipment, hand hygiene practices and provides reports to the Infection Prevention Committees;
  • Analyze infection trends, risk factors, and evaluate prevention and control strategies;
  • Perform program assessment and make recommendations for correction and improvement;
  • Lead the annual influenza vaccination campaign;
  • Lead outbreak response efforts in coordination with the local public health unit;
  • Conduct research and interpret evidence-based literature in developing IPAC best practices, guidelines, tools, and resources.

The ideal candidate will have the following qualifications and skills:
  • RN/RPN degree or diploma.
  • Bachelor’s degree in other healthcare related field, e.g., Microbiology, Epidemiology, Public Health, Health Science, Medicine or Occupational Health.
  • Current Certification in Infection Control (CIC).
  • A minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience in infection control is required.
  • Previous experience in long-term care as well as knowledge of applicable legislation is an asset.
  • Experience and proficiency in the following:
    • resident care practice
    • microbiology and infectious diseases
    • epidemiology and Biostatistics
    • outbreak response

title: Accounting Manager, Canada
description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?

At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

Our Finance and Accounting teams build the financial infrastructure to scale our growing company. We combine analytical and strategic thinking to develop a sound financial future for our global brand. We work closely with teams across the company, international subsidiaries, as well as with external partners to ensure a world-class finance organization. Our team contains experts from fields like tax, treasury, purchasing, FP&A, and more.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a senior finance professional to join our growing International Controllership team as Accounting Manager for Canada. This role is to be based in Montreal and will support Epic’s significant growth aspirations within both Canada and Internationally.

You will work alongside existing members of the International Finance team and partner with them and others within Epic to integrate Epic’s Canadian subsidiaries, acquisitions and investments into Epic. This will include defining and building robust financial reporting processes to enable the complete and accurate financial reporting for the US Group and EMEA sub-groups.

This role will enable Epic to continue to grow its finance and accounting presence within a key International market. The role will report into Epic’s International finance team (based in Switzerland and the UK) but will work closely with senior leadership within the wider Epic Group, such as Corporate Tax, FP&A, HR and Legal.

The role will take responsibility for building best in class reporting and control structures to ensure that Epic’s financial and operational performance is optimized, scalable and clearly communicated on a timely and accurate basis.

In This Role You Will
  • Be responsible for the management of the financial accounting and reporting for all of Epic’s Canadian subsidiaries and equity investments, including building the foundations for future finance team growth in Canada.
  • Ensuring the swift and accurate reporting of month end reporting, oversea subsidiary month-end closing processes and ensuring policy compliance.
  • Assist with ad-hoc requests from management, auditors and other external bodies (as required).
  • Provide input into and local ownership of complex accounting topics, as they arise (such as Leases).
  • Design, implement and operate key business process controls to ensure that the company has an effective and scalable internal controls framework.
  • Have a continuous focus on process and control improvements that are required, and the ability to communicate these to Management.
  • Build cross-functional working relationships within the company and externally, and provide technical guidance, training, and support to the Finance, Legal and Business Development teams.
  • Own the relationship with the external auditors to ensure that both group and statutory filing obligations are met.
  • Partner with the existing Canadian leadership teams, operations and out-sourced accounting staff to ensure that there is a strong holistic view of accounting and finances, and that finances are managed, controlled and presented in a way that is representative of business operations.
  • Partner with operational leaders to understand the various capital projects that are ongoing within Canada, including status, accounting considerations, budgetary oversight and tracking, and implementation of capital project controls and processes.
  • Partner with cross functional teams to implement a new ERP (Workday) with regional customization and support change management to associated front end processes.
  • Analyze financial information and summarize financial status in order to have an overall, holistic view of the businesses finances.
  • Regularly report and present to both International and US management about the overall finances of the Canadian subsidiaries and equity investments.
  • Represent Epic’s controllership function in the implementation of a flexible and suitable scaled internal control environment that is robust and stands up to external audit.
  • Direct internal and external audits to ensure compliance, including risk assessments and reviews of risk areas
  • Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls and ensure alignment with Epic group policies.
  • Ensuring Canadian territory specific regulatory compliance from a finance perspective.

What We're Looking For
  • Fluent in both French and English.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Accounting, or related field.
  • Chartered Accountancy qualification or equivalent (preferred but not required).
  • Already residing in Canada or a right to work in Canada.
  • 5+ years financial accounting experience, preferably within both an International and Canadian business and accounting environment.
  • Ability and willingness to “roll up their sleeves” to achieve Controllership activities, whilst having team management experience.
  • Knowledge of international transfer pricing principles and “cost plus” recharging.
  • Good knowledge of both US GAAP and Canadian GAAP, including a deep knowledge and understanding of Canadian tax and legal financial reporting obligations.
  • Experience of dealing with External Auditor requests.
  • Strong communications, presentation, and interpersonal skills, including the ability to summarize key accounting and operational issues to management.
  • Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel (complex formula, VBA, macros and pivot tables) and proficient with other Microsoft Office applications.
  • Experience of working in different ERP systems and system migrations.
  • Knowledge of international digital sales taxes and transfer pricing requirements..
  • Complex analytic problem solving and project management skills.
  • Independent and self-starter with a “can-do” attitude.
  • Someone who is user-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative.

About Us

Epic Games spans across 12 countries with 32 studios and 3,000+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!

Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

title: Controls Simulation Integration Engineering
description:
Job Description

The Controls Simulation Integration Engineer (SIE) is responsible for supporting the integration of full-vehicle cross-functional co-simulation packages focused on vehicle dynamics and related fields. This position is highly collaborative, involving partner teams throughout VDDV (Virtual Design Development and Validation), CTC innovation/ATW, ADAS (Autonomous Driving and Active Safety) and VMEC (Vehicle Motion and Embedded Control). The role deals with multiple new technologies, and constant pursuit of moving to virtual engineering is key to its success.

Responsibilities
  • Advocate for adoption of virtual methods for vehicle design, development, and validation
  • Build and/or integrate vehicle system plant models for co-simulation package, including suspension system, engine, powertrain, EPS, brake and tires, to enable virtual vehicle dynamics and chassis controls design, development, and validation
  • Validate plant models with proper fidelity needed for HIL and SIL testing
  • Lead resolution of program issues by rallying co-simulation partners to meet the demands of the problems faced, accurately balancing the associated technical and timing aspects
  • Validate supplier co-sim packages, and work with them to ensure consistency of deliverables in terms of quality and timing, raising issues as appropriate
  • Ensure co-simulation packages meet standards as defined by the SIE governance team
  • Align software releases, cal milestones and vehicle hardware release milestones to ensure the virtual vehicle co-simulation package is consistently up-to-date
  • Define strategic opportunities for innovating the virtual processes and methods
  • Forecast and plan needs, and get support for required resources for CTC active safety and Controls ATW projects
  • Work with US counterparts and other Agile teams to resolve concerns on co-simulation usage and ensure maximum re-use of models between HIL and SIL platform and simulations
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Required

Qualifications
  • BS Mechanical, mechatronics, or automotive engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Software Engineering or Computer Science.
  • 3+ years of relevant automotive experience.
  • Proven experiences on multibody and/or controls integration CAE tools such as ADAMS/MotionView, CarSim, CarMaker, AmeSim, MATLAB/Simulink or other similar CAE tools
  • Familiar with Python, C programing
  • Strong interpersonal communication and organizational skills
  • Proven track record to work in teams, balancing technical theory with practical limitations.
Preferred
  • Masters in related engineering field
  • 5+ years of proven experience
  • Knowledge with the Functional Mock-up Interface (FMI) standard
  • Knowledge with automotive HIL and SIL platforms
  • Knowledge of automotive communication technologies such as CAN, LIN, SPI, and Ethernet
  • Familiarity with version control systems (VCS) tools like Git, SVN and TFS.
  • Participation in automotive teams - Mini-Baja, Formula SAE, PACE, Eco-Car, etc.
Notice
  • Successful candidates will be required to attest to, and be prepared to provide proof of, their vaccination status and that any job offer will be conditional on the candidate being fully vaccinated.
About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities. Should you be contacted by General Motors of Canada, please advise if you require accommodation. General Motors of Canada values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Director of Finance and Accounting
description:
Our Client is recruiting for a seasoned finance professional who will bring strong accounting, reporting, analytical and communication skills to a Director, Finance & Accounting role. In addition, the successful candidate will be highly insightful, respectful of deadlines, detail‐oriented, with a continuous improvement mindset and a demonstrated ability to effectively prioritize multiple workflows and deadlines. The successful candidate will work well in a team, will be keen to learn, and thrives in an entrepreneurial, fast paced environment.

Advantages

Opportunity to lead, develop, and motivate a team of accounting professionals to deliver value to the broader organization. Mentor and grow a high-performance accounting team through a deep understanding of ‘what good looks like’.

Responsibilities
  • Oversee the accounting team’s completion of month end and quarterly deliverables, including preparation / review of internal reports, third party reporting and completion of requisite variance analyses versus budgets
  • Develop internal management reporting to assist senior management make informed decisions as part of companies transition to an

asset manager
  • Oversee the centralized cash management, treasury and accounts payable/receivable function services Corporate and Forum’s platforms, that include familiarity with setting up and maintaining a cash management structure across several legal entities, along with cash positioning and banking administration
  • Review and sign-off on monthly and quarterly financial statements and related schedules and financial reports
  • Coordinate and manage interim and year-end audits for all entities

Qualifications
  • Accounting and a Professional Accounting Designation (CPA, CGA, CMA)
  • 8-10 years of relevant experience in a complex environment, with a minimum 4 years of post- designation and 2 years of management/supervisory role.
  • Proficiency with ERP systems
  • Strong analytical, attention to detail and technical accounting (IFRS and ASPE)

Summary

Our Client is seeking a seasoned finance professional who will bring strong accounting, reporting, analytical and communication skills to a Director, Finance & Accounting role.

title: Manager, Assurance & Accounting
description:
Inspirational, innovative and entrepreneurial - this is how we describe our empowered teams. Combine your passion with purpose and join a culture that is thriving in the face of change.

Make an impact with our Assurance & Accounting team as a Manager. This diverse team of professionals are dedicated to exceeding clients’ unique needs within a rapidly evolving business and financial reporting landscape. As a trusted advisor, you’ll provide comprehensive, tailored financial information that enables clients to make informed decisions with confidence.

MNP is proudly Canadian. Providing business strategies and solutions, we are a leading national accounting, tax and business advisory firm in Canada. Entrepreneurial to our core, our talented team members transcend obstacles into opportunities and are successfully transforming mid-market business practices.

Responsibilities
  • Lead client facing engagement teams to complete audits, compliance tax engagements, budgeting, internal controls and financial/accounting transactions

description:
Description

An exciting opportunity exists to join a dynamic small public practice firm with a staff complement of ten amazing people. The company offers either an in-office setting from one of two Lower Mainland office locations, a Hybrid work model, or Work from home. Work / Life balance is advocated by this exciting emerging group. The team does not audit and focuses entirely on personal and small to medium-sized clients with a keen interest in emerging new companies.

The Company Offers The Following
  • A wide range of clients – engaging industries and complexities
  • Ability to work at either of our two locations – Ladner & South Vancouver (Marpole)
  • Flexible and relaxed work environment
  • Competitive salary, benefits, sick days, flex days, paid professional development
  • Team building activities & events
  • Growth – this is a position that will grow and evolve over time
Requirements

The position of Manager requires the following:
  • Manage and review notice to reader financial statements and tax engagements.
  • Deliver completed product to the Partner on a timely basis.
  • Plan and complete routine and complex Notice to Reader financial statements – including related corporate tax returns, working papers, and communication with clients.
  • Plan and complete routine and complex Review engagements – including preparation of related corporate tax returns, working papers, communication with clients, and supervising junior staff.
  • Preparation of personal, trust and GST returns, year-end tax forms (T4 & T5) and resolve accounting and tax issues in client documents and working papers.
  • Supervise and mentor junior staff.
The Ideal Candidate Requires The Following
  • CPA designation.
  • Minimum 5 years in public accounting.
  • Demonstrate a focus on detail, thoroughness, and accuracy.
  • Demonstrate the ability to prepare their own files while assisting with the review of junior staff files.
  • Ability to see the big picture, develop efficiencies in files while supervising and training junior staff.
  • Proficiency in MS Office, Caseware, Sage 50, Quickbooks, and TaxPrep.
  • Excellent communication, both verbal and written with common sense and solid judgment when dealing with coworkers, clients, and government offices.

title: Manager, Assurance & Accounting
location: City of Langley, British Columbia, Canada
description:
Inspirational, innovative and entrepreneurial - this is how we describe our empowered teams. Combine your passion with purpose and join a culture that is thriving in the face of change.

Make an impact with our Assurance & Accounting team as a Manager. This diverse team of professionals are dedicated to exceeding clients’ unique needs within a rapidly evolving business and financial reporting landscape. As a trusted advisor, you’ll provide comprehensive, tailored financial information that enables clients to make informed decisions with confidence.

MNP is proudly Canadian. Providing business strategies and solutions, we are a leading national accounting, tax and business advisory firm in Canada. Entrepreneurial to our core, our talented team members transcend obstacles into opportunities and are successfully transforming mid-market business practices.

Responsibilities
  • Lead client facing engagement teams to complete audits, compliance tax engagements, budgeting, internal controls and financial/accounting transactions
  • Deliver industry and technical expertise in audit and assurance through client interactions, reports, technical work, management presentations and high-quality deliverables
  • Manage a portfolio of clients while understanding their business, key risks and ways to deliver added value; ensure clients’ needs are met and that relationships and accounts grow and develop
  • Accountable for engagement planning and scheduling as well as project financials (i.e., budgets, WIPS, timely billing, collection, variance recognition)
  • Maintain quality control and apply specialized knowledge to anticipate, identify and address issues relevant to the client’s business, financial entries and reports
  • Network in the local business community, consider business development opportunities and contribute to the preparation and delivery of competitive proposals to meet client needs
  • Mentor, motivate and coach team members towards professional and personal development by setting clear expectations, providing feedback and conducting performance reviews
  • Maintain flexibility to travel, as necessary

Skills And Experience
  • 6 years of relevant accounting experience
  • Working towards a CPA designation is considered an asset
  • Strong understanding of business, accounting, management and practice development principles
  • Proven people management, relationship building and leadership skills
  • Experience working with accounting and tax software

MyRewards@MNP

More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.

Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment and more!

title: Infection Prevention & Control Lead (IPAC Lead)
description:
Southbridge Care Homes are currently looking to add a caring, passionate, and enthusiastic Infection Prevention and Control Lead to join our community, who can serve our lovely residents, to keep them safe, healthy, and happy.

Reporting to the Regional IPAC Specialist, the IPAC Lead will be a resident safety expert who leads the planning, development, implementation, coordination, and evaluation of system-wide improvements in infection prevention and serve as a role model to promote the goals of the IPAC program within the context of the vision and mission of Southbridge. You will facilitate change through interpretation and application of standards and provide best practice recommendations with the ultimate goal of improving resident outcomes and preventing disease outbreaks.

As an IPAC Lead you will be accountable for…
  • Coordination and implementation of infection prevention and control practices for the home;
  • Participate in the planning of an infection surveillance program and lead the management of outbreaks in consultation with the local public health unit;
  • Perform daily infection surveillance and develop the monthly surveillance report;
  • Educate staff on the principles and practices of infection prevention and act as a resource regarding infection prevention and control;
  • Maintain current vaccines for all residents; ensure the home is in compliance with the infection control guidelines mandated by the Long-Term Care Homes Act;
  • Plan, develop, deliver and implement all training/orientation for current and new employees in accordance with legislation and health care standards, and in consultation with the Leadership Committee;
  • Regularly evaluate training programs to ensure the needs of the home is being met;
  • Identify and report safety hazards, conduct regular safety inspections and follow safe working practices and behavior;
  • Provide expert guidance on facility design, maintenance, and construction projects;
  • Lead the implementation of changes mandated by regulatory, accrediting, and licensing agencies (includes reporting communicable diseases to the local public health);
  • Monitor staff compliance with infection prevention guidelines regarding the disposal of sharps and biomedical waste, use of personal protective equipment, hand hygiene practices and provides reports to the Infection Prevention Committees;
  • Analyze infection trends, risk factors, and evaluate prevention and control strategies;
  • Perform program assessment and make recommendations for correction and improvement;
  • Lead the annual influenza vaccination campaign;
  • Lead outbreak response efforts in coordination with the local public health unit;
  • Conduct research and interpret evidence-based literature in developing IPAC best practices, guidelines, tools, and resources.

The ideal candidate will have the following qualifications and skills:
  • RN/RPN degree or diploma.
  • Bachelor’s degree in other healthcare related field, e.g., Microbiology, Epidemiology, Public Health, Health Science, Medicine or Occupational Health.
  • Current Certification in Infection Control (CIC).
  • A minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience in infection control is required.
  • Previous experience in long-term care as well as knowledge of applicable legislation is an asset.
  • Experience and proficiency in the following:
    • resident care practice
    • microbiology and infectious diseases
    • epidemiology and Biostatistics
    • outbreak response
Southbridge Care Homes welcomes those applicants with disability-related needs and those whom need for accommodation in the recruitment process. Please provide notice of your need for accommodation to the hiring manager upon scheduling of an interview. To know more about Southbridge culture, please visit.

In Ontario, Extendicare, ParaMed Home Health Care, and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodation needs must be provided in advance. To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting.

title: Dispatcher / Equipment Control
description:
Position Title:Dispatcher / Equipment Control

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Requisition ID: 15962

Company: Day & Ross Inc.

Job Responsibilities
  • Arrange for daily deliveries, assign pick up requests, and entre orders in the computer
  • Set up appointment freight, manifest shipments, coordinate ETA's with Central, check for expedited shipments and enter missed pick-ups
  • Answer phones and take pick-up requests
  • Perform a dock and yard check to ensure freight is not missed and trucks are on schedule
  • Coordinate drivers to come back for second round of deliveries, manifest skeleton and make linehaul orders
  • Coordinate local P&D requirements
  • Track lumpers hours and review requirements
  • Monitor driver performance and report finding to manager
  • Identify areas for improvement and efficiencies
  • Other related duties as may be required
Experience, Skills, And Education Requirements
  • Minimum of secondary education, with preference of post-secondary education (Supply Chain or Logistics Management, or a combination of education and experience.
  • Previous Transportation or operational experience is preferred, various roles within transportation would be beneficial. New graduates or current students are welcome.
  • Communication skills - advanced
  • Computer skills – accuracy, MS products, AS400, web based programs
  • Demonstrated customer relationship skills
  • Able to work deadlines in high transactional environment
  • Ability to champion business needs in a collaborative manner to colleagues
  • Strong sense of urgency and ability to respond to demands in a calm manner.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills to manage demands and resolve issues with drivers, co-workers, etc.
  • Ability to work independently; a self-starter
  • Strong problem solving skills with the ability to implement proactive solutions to support operational demands and efficiencies.
  • Ability to work a flexible work schedule
  • Results focused
  • English, other languages an asset
  • Able to work with little supervision
Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.

We thank you for your application, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

As a federally regulated employer, The Day & Ross fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Reports to:

Director, Property Accounting



Summary:

The Accounting Manager will maintain departmental controls and accounting policies and procedures. The Accounting Manager will be directly responsible for the mentorship of the reporting Project Accountants. Leadership, accountability and responsibility are three critical assets to the position.



Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team with approximately 2 direct reports
  • Review the preparation and reporting of financial results including cash flow reporting and distribution before they are submitted to clients
  • Implement departmental policy and procedure regarding all direct reporting project accounting staff
  • Review and maintain internal controls
  • Involved in review process of EFT transmissions
  • Knowledge of GST regulations and requirements to provide support in reporting and audit coordination
  • Coordinate and maintain operating cost reconciliation process and schedule in coordination with Budget Manager
  • Liaise with clients and client representatives
  • Encourage positive working relationship with Real Estate and Administration departments
  • Coordinate external audits as required by tenants for recovery purposes, clients for property books



Qualifications and Competencies:

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting/commerce or related field required;
  • Accounting designation or working towards a designation an asset;
  • 3+ years of experience in property accounting;
  • Supervisory experience is considered an asset
  • Relationship Skills - Ability to communicate effectively, both oral and written in English and French (an asset); ability to develop and sustain cooperative working relationships; team player;
  • Organizational/Multi-Task Skills - Ability to allocate time effectively, work under pressure and manage tight deadlines; ability to handle multiple demands, competing priorities, ability to work at a detailed level; willingness to learn in a dynamic environment that includes new ideas and change;
  • Computer Skills – intermediate to advanced skills in Excel, Word, and other Microsoft Office programs; knowledge of MRI or Yardi an asset.



Canderel is an equal opportunity employer. We believe a diverse and inclusive workforce drives innovation and makes our company stronger. We are committed to fostering a safe and positive environment that respects people’s dignity, ideas and beliefs. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants to join our team as we continue to grow and build a strong and varied workforce reflective of today’s diverse world. title: Team Manager - Accounting
description:
Let’s impact lives for the better!

Alberta Blue Cross® is Alberta based, not-for-profit and dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting the wellness of all Albertans. We believe in what we do—and place trust in our employees to deliver our vision.

Working at Alberta Blue Cross® means having a career where you’ll be recognized for your contributions. We value diversity, encourage our employees to maintain a healthy work-life balance and provide opportunities for training and career growth.

OVERVIEW:

Working in a flexible work style, Alberta Blue Cross® has an immediate opening for an enthusiastic, team-oriented and results-driven Team Manager to join our Accounting team. Reporting to the Manager of Accounting and the Team Manager will be a a natural collaborator with a great attitude, work ethic and ability to see things from a customer’s perspective and experience. As the successful candidate, you will bring a CPA designation and previous managerial experience to coach and mentor your staff and drive results.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:
  • Supervision of accounting staff, including mentorship and contributing to annual reviews.
  • Reviewing general ledger reconciliations and journal entries.
  • Preparing complex reconciliations between sub-ledgers and general ledger, including resolving or recommending action on reconciling items.
  • Contributes to coordinating the distribution of monthly, quarterly and annual financial reporting.
  • Significant contributor to the coordination and execution of the year end process.
  • Oversee continuous improvement projects in Accounting.
  • Contribute to Corporate level projects as a subject matter expert.
  • Responsible for supporting and working within the internal control framework.
  • Communicating with all levels of management on accounting issues, results, and business initiatives.
  • Contributes to the research and recommendations regarding the treatment of accounting issues that comply with IFRS.
  • Support department vision and strategic planning.

WHAT YOU WILL HAVE:
  • CPA designation is required.
  • Five or more years’ experience in full cycle accounting operations and/or public practice with preference given to those with prior managerial experience.
  • Must have the ability to develop staff through coaching, mentorship and personal career development.
  • Must have the ability to develop and grow meaningful and strong relationships with all stakeholders including senior management.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Experience with reconciliations and posting journal entries.
  • Experience with external & internal audit.
  • Treasury Management experience is an asset.
  • Strong business acumen and ability to understand business requirements.
  • Ability to identify opportunities for change and improvement, research issues and formulate recommendations.
  • Project support including defining requirements and testing.
  • Good understanding of IFRS.

Alberta Blue Cross® is an inclusive employer committed to a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We empower and are advocates for our employees by welcoming, respecting and valuing their unique perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in an innovative, high-energy team-focused environment. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, apply online at careers.ab.bluecross.ca

COVID-19 Vaccination Notice: Alberta Blue Cross has a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that applies to all of its employees. As a condition of employment, successful job applicants will be asked to confirm their COVID-19 vaccination status and may be required to provide proof of a valid negative COVID-19 test or a valid exemption pursuant to applicable human rights law if not fully vaccinated.

title: Gestionnaire de la comptabilité (Hybride)
description:
Valsoft Corporation invite un ou une gestionnaire de la comptabilité alliant expérience et dynamisme à joindre son équipe!

Notre entreprise en quelques lignes: Valsoft est spécialisée dans l'acquisition et le développement de firmes logicielles verticalement intégrées proposant des solutions essentielles dans leur créneau ou leur marché respectif. Depuis 2015, nous avons acquis plus de 50 entreprises. Aujourd'hui, Valsoft compte plus de 2000 employés répartis dans une vingtaine de pays. Ce modèle d'affaires jette les bases d'un environnement favorisant la croissance rapide et permettant l'acquisition de nouvelles entreprises selon une stratégie verticale axée sur le rendement et la rentabilité. Notre devise : Soyez humble, mais voyez grand!

Relevant du chef des finances de l'une des unités commerciales, la personne titulaire du poste coordonnera et gérera les procédures de clôture de fin d'exercice et veillera à l'exactitude des analyses et rapports financiers pour un portefeuille de firmes acquises. Elle dirigera également différents projets touchant à la comptabilité et traitera des questions comptables plus complexes.

Votre rôle au quotidien:
  • Superviser et examiner le travail des analystes de la comptabilité sur place et à l'étranger – équipe de trois personnes ou plus (écritures de journal, rapprochements, rapports – y compris pour les comptes clients et fournisseurs, la facturation et les opérations comptables);
  • Superviser et mettre en œuvre l'application adéquate des PCGR, y compris dans des situations comptables plus complexes telles que la comptabilisation proportionnelle du profit;
  • Coordonner la préparation des états financiers de fin de mois pour toutes les entreprises de l'unité commerciale (le portefeuille comprend 12 filiales);
  • Superviser et diriger la clôture de l'exercice pour l'unité commerciale, et venir en aide à l'équipe de la comptabilité dans le cadre du processus d'audit;
  • Préparer les analyses financières mensuelles concernant les principaux postes de pertes et profits afin de mieux comprendre les performances financières et les écarts entre les chiffres réels, les prévisions et le budget; épauler l'équipe chargée de la production des rapports lors de la clôture de fin de mois;

Votre profil:

  • Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication verbale et écrite;
  • Connaissance du français (atout);

  • Connaissance pratique du logiciel ERP de Sage Intacct (ou d'un logiciel comparable) – un atout;

title: INTERMEDIATE INSTRUMENTATION, CONTROLS, AND ELECTRICAL ENGINEER
description:
INTERMEDIATE INSTRUMENTATION, CONTROLS, AND ELECTRICAL ENGINEER


Our ideal candidate will be an essential member of our Electrical, Instrumentation, and Controls (EIC) engineering team. Also having strong knowledge of industrial processes in various industries. As a member of Lanmark’s EIC team you will perform work as part of a multi-discipline design team with project teams in multiple offices, providing instrumentation, controls, and electrical engineering support to project managers and project teams.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Instrumentation Specification (selection, technical data sheets, bid analysis and recommendations) and Procurement for field instruments and control systems
  • Provide instrumentation support to project managers and project teams
  • Design and review engineering work packages and construction work packages including: data sheets, installation details, instrument location drawings, loop diagrams, wiring diagrams, instrument lists; I/O lists and assignments, instrument UPS load requirements lists, location plans, area classification drawings, control system architecture diagrams, communication block diagrams, building layout, control room layouts, MCC layouts, control panel, marshalling cabinet, junction box, communication cabinet layouts, AC power distribution, DC power distribution, load list, single line diagram, IO schematics, logic diagrams, cause and effect diagrams/shutdown key, instrument index, material requisition, vendor packages
  • Reviewing and maintaining project schedules, and tracking engineering tasks and deliverables in conjunction with project management
  • Participating in design reviews and HAZOPs as required
  • Maintaining current knowledge of industry and regulatory standards
  • Adhering to Lanmark’s Quality Management System (QMS)
  • Ensuring design is in accordance with applicable codes and requirements, including Lanmark and client specifications and standards
  • Assigning and outlining work for others, and reviewing work for technical accuracy and adequacy
  • Authenticating documentation with a professional engineering stamp as required
  • Performing FAT, pre-commissioning and commissioning activities
  • Ensuring that all work is properly checked in accordance with Lanmark and client Standards & Procedures
  • Responsible for adhering to all health and safety policies and guidelines

Qualifications:

  • Engineer with eligibility to obtain a P.Eng. and registered with Apega
  • Minimum of 3 years of EIC engineering experience in the energy or petrochemical industries
  • Bachelor of Science in engineering from an accredited Canadian university
  • Extensive knowledge of pneumatic and electrical instrumentation specification selection for various energy and petrochemical processes
  • PLC, DCS industrial control network knowledge
  • Strong knowledge of control applications including control loop definitions and interlocking systems
  • Design and specification experience with single-line, control loop, area classification drawings
  • Comprehensive understanding of interdisciplinary engineering deliverables for project execution specific to the energy and petrochemical industries
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills combined with a positive, team-oriented attitude


Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada

title: Manager Accounting NA
description:
About Staffbase

At Staffbase we believe that Internal Communication moves people, and people move companies. Our mission is to empower leaders and communicators to drive transformation through internal comms solutions, strategies, and insights. Our most recent Series E funding led by General Atlantic, officially launched us to 🦄 UNICORN 🦄 status!

We're headquartered in Chemnitz, Germany, with offices in many locations throughout the world, including Vancouver, Kelowna, New York, Amsterdam, London, and several locations in Germany! Our international team counts roughly 600 employees from 45+ nationalities and we have a growing base of 1000+ enterprise customers that want to transform their employee experience. We are rapidly scaling, post-Series E ($115 million funding), have strong-growing revenue, and our customers love us.

We would like to expand the Accounting & Controlling team within our Finance organization and we are looking for someone to lead the North American Accounting & Controlling team (currently 3 people) with passion and willingness to take on responsibility for all things accounting for the North American market.

As a digital first company, we offer greater flexibility in working locations. You would be able to work in a hybrid model from one of our locations, ideally Vancouver. Fully remote option available as well!

The role requires that you can build strong relationships in- and outside the company, move quickly, not be constrained by how things "used to be" and most importantly that you are ambitious, curious, and passionate leading a team on the one hand but also about doing accounting in general on the other hand.

Your tasks include but are not limited to:
  • Heading the NA accounting team
  • Ownership for timely and accurate financials of our NA entities (SB Inc. US, SB CA Systems Inc. and more to follow)
  • Oversee all full-cycle accounting processes from procure-to-pay, order-to-cash, and record-to-report within NA
  • Coordination of local statutory (tax) reporting and corporate income tax returns with internal and external stakeholders for US and Canada
  • Setting up and monitoring our sales and use tax strategy including all processes & tools around evaluating US nexus positions and the collection, remittance, and reporting of local taxes
  • Pro-actively contribute within the global accounting team which is leading the company-wide IFRS conversion, group consolidation procedures and the general up-leveling of our accounting practices
  • Support the year-end close audit procedures with our Big4 auditors
  • Bring in your experience, ideas, and support regarding the development, optimization and documentation of internal processes and policies
  • Support and proactively participate in special projects such as post-merger integrations

Your profile:
  • CPA (or equivalent) with 5+ years of related experience (could be a team lead, and previously in accounting role progressing into a management role)
  • You would describe yourself as communicative, persistent and eager to improve things
  • Ideally experience working in Big4 (audit or tax) or field accounting in a SaaS environment
  • You enjoy leading a team of currently 3 accounting professionals (and growing!)
  • Previous exposure to IFRS standards
  • You have group consolidation knowledge and are willed to work yourself into the topic, group consolidation experience is a plus
  • You've been part of professional audit processes
  • Workday ERP experience is not a must, but also a big plus

Office : Vancouver, Kelowna or remote North America

Our Global Benefits

Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP)

Staffbase offers you a benefit plan which entitles you to an ownership interest in stock options in the company. We're in business to create value for our shareholders and we want our employees to benefit from that shared success as well.

Ongoing Learning

We thrive on personal and professional growth. Every employee gets €1,800/$2,200/£1,650 per year to spend on personal and professional development.

Feel Good Fridays

Summertime means extended vacation time at Staffbase! During August we run the 4-days workweek which means that during this month Fridays are off for all employees.

Flexibility

When it comes to your personal life, it's not our place to dictate your schedule. We offer flexible schedule including work-from-home options.

Parental Leave

We recognize that one of the most special events in an individual's life is the birth or adoption of a child. We offer paid parental leave options for all employees.

Read More About Our Benefits Here.

We Love Diversity - Equal Employment Opportunity

Our platforms are for everyone, and so is our workplace. We are passionate about equity, inclusion, and diversity at Staffbase. Read more about our policies here.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
BE authentic. BE influential. BE the expert. Be all that and more at Colliers.

At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.

Who You Are

Reporting to the Controller, you will lead property accounting activities for your team, including the budgeting and reporting process, within a specific portfolio of assigned commercial properties. During busy times you’re not afraid to roll-up your sleeves and jump in to work side by side with your team. You’ll have the opportunity to mentor and share your expertise with your team and to continuously work with and develop high-performing property accountants. You’re always looking at the bigger picture yet overseeing detailed work and producing high-quality reporting for our clients.

What You Bring
  • 3 years of progressive leadership responsibilities and accounting experience within the commercial real estate industry
  • Experience in leading and developing high-performing teams
Bonus skills and experience

  • Advanced education in accounting; CPA designation is an asset
  • Experience with audits, strong understanding of accounting standards (ASPE / IFRS)
  • Reporting at a portfolio level, including MD&A style lease and operations reporting
What Success Looks Like
  • Ensure accurate and timely performance and reporting of real estate accounting activities for a national, diversified portfolio of Retail, Office, and Industrial properties.
  • You continuously evaluate the effectiveness of internal processes to seek opportunities for process improvements.
  • You develop and sustain a highly engaged team through strong leadership, open communication, and ongoing coaching and mentoring.
BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.

Please be aware that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Colliers professionals in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated to attend any Colliers workplace. As a condition of commencing any role, you will be required to self-report your vaccination status and provide verifying documentation. Should you require medical or religious accommodation related to vaccination please discuss with your Talent Acquisition Advisor.

Direct applicants only please, no agencies.

Colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@colliers.com.
