title: Accounting Manager
description:
The Firm

Hey, we’re glad you found this! We are the HGA Group.

What started as an accounting firm quickly evolved into the ultimate entrepreneurial resource centre: the first of its kind in Alberta.

Our team is innovative, highly skilled, and highly collaborative. We believe that bringing together every major resource that business owners need to succeed under a single banner, driven by the singular purpose to give entrepreneurs the resources they need, is the key to maximizing the potential of Alberta’s entrepreneurs.

In a sea of professional service providers, it is our mission to do things differently, to break from the norm, and help people build their dreams— not only those of our clients, but our team’s. We want to help you grow, develop, and enjoy the career that you have always wanted. Most importantly though, we want you to live the life you have always wanted.

Our employees drive the success of the HGA Group, and that means we pride ourselves in empowering our employees to grow with us. The HGA Group gives employees so many opportunities to learn and develop their skills. We welcome you to the team knowing that you are looking to grow your toolkit and make an impact. It all starts here at the HGA Group.

We love what we do, and you will too.

The Role

We’re on the hunt for a full-time Manager to become a part of the HGA Family and add value to our incredible team. The ideal candidate will take on the position of trusted liaison between partners and clients in reviewing client files, providing technical expertise, and assume leadership roles on complex files. The Manager will report directly to the partners and will mentor our junior and intermediate-level accountants.

Perfect for someone who understands the value of customer service, this individual will enjoy working alongside the partners to support our large range of clients and be equally as invested in who our clients are as people, as well as their business and the 'numbers'. A high level of accountability and initiative will be key to succeed in this role, as well as the ability to navigate and adapt to a fast-paced professional services environment.

Key Duties & Responsibilities
  • Supervising the preparation of financial statements of business clients, reviewing the work of Staff Accountants, and completing complex portions of the file;
  • Maintaining high quality control by overseeing and reviewing Compilation and Review Engagements;
  • Reviewing Corporate, Personal, Partnership and Trust income tax returns and other tax forms;
  • Reviewing, investigating and correcting discrepancies and irregularities in financial entries and reports;
  • Making recommendations based on analysis and status of reserves, assets and expenditures;
  • Performing technical research, developing and documenting tax planning recommendations for individuals and corporations;
  • Assisting with the execution of corporate reorganizations;
  • Overseeing the organization and prioritization of the work of Staff Accountants, including the management of engagement costs and billings;
  • Mentoring and supporting the professional development needs of Staff Accountants;
  • Managing a portfolio of clients, ensuring their needs are met and that relationships and accounts grow and develop; and
  • Contributing to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes.
Qualifications

Education & Experience:
  • Undergraduate degree in a relevant field;
  • CA or CPA designation, with a minimum of 5 years public practice experience dealing with the accounting and taxation needs of private companies and their shareholders;
  • Comprehensive experience in compilation and review preparation; and
  • Experience leading and supervising staff.
Skills & Knowledge
  • Knowledge of relevant accounting frameworks and file documentation best practices;
  • Extensive knowledge of Accounting Standards for Private Enterprise (ASPE);
  • Proficient in Caseware and Profile;
  • Strong business acumen; and
  • Strong computer skills (MS Office).
Competencies
  • Focus on client service orientation
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Strong awareness of attention to detail
  • Proven ability in results management
  • Strong ability to make sound judgement calls, based on experience and critical thinking
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to translate this into mentorship
What We Offer

Benefits & Perks
  • Comprehensive benefits package including: Extended Health Care, Dental Care, Disability and Life Insurance, etc..
  • Group Registered Retirement Saving Program (RRSP) with company matching
  • On-Site Gym with employee discounts and group fitness classes
  • On-Site Free Parking
  • Wellness Program
HGA is on a mission to provide meaningful and impactful opportunities that drive individuals to grow personally and professionally. We do this by offering competitive total compensation, challenging work, and engaging and collaborative work culture.

Our people are what set us apart, and we believe in providing an inclusive and diverse workplace where all individuals have the opportunity to succeed. We are committed to building and employing an inclusive and diverse work culture to serve our clients with excellence. Joining the HGA team means that everyone is welcome, and we can provide reasonable accommodation during the selection process, upon request, to meet your needs at any stage in the recruitment process.

If you are a passionate professional who is eager and excited to take on a challenging opportunity, this is it!

Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Researcher — Quantum Control
description:
Your Role

1QBit is looking for an expert in quantum control to work on theoretical and experimental aspects of emerging quantum devices. Our Hardware Innovation Lab (HIL) team is interested to hear from high caliber scientists who are excited to contribute to the various layers of the full stack of quantum computing. HIL collaborates with its hardware partners, employing its expertise in classical and quantum computing to develop technologies that will enable scalable and applicable quantum computing. This position can report to one of our three offices in Vancouver, BC, Waterloo, ON or Sherbrooke, QC.

What You'll Do
  • Work alongside peers with unique and creative backgrounds in physics, computer science, mathematics and engineering
  • Constantly learn through your work as well as active engagement with the academic community
  • Present to and learn from collaborators
  • Design and analyze algorithms
  • Design and implement numerical and lab experiments
  • Perform simulations and benchmarking
  • Take part in generating reports, drafting patents, authoring publications, and attending conferences

What You'll Bring

Members of our team bring a confluence of personality, skills, and intent that contributes to their individual development and our collective growth as an organization. The knowledge and mindset you will bring to our team include the following:
  • PhD in computer science, physics, or mathematics (or equivalent training)
  • Basic understanding of circuit-model quantum computation, quantum algorithms, quantum error correction, etc.
  • Strong foundation in quantum and classical control theory
  • Sound grasp of convex optimization methods, with a focus on gradient ascent and pulse shaping (applied to classical and quantum systems)
  • Good understanding of foundations of noise models in quantum devices (e.g., basics of CPTP maps, Kraus representation, quantum operators and superoperators, noise models and methods for their characterization, dynamics of open quantum systems, etc.) and hardware-specific noises (e.g., low-frequency noise for superconducting qubits, the operational noises in trapped ions, or alike notions in other quantum technologies)
  • Theoretical and/or experimental expertise in one or multiple of quantum hardware technologies: superconducting qubits, silicon-photonics, trapped-ion systems, quantum optics, cold-atom qubits, spin-based qubits, etc.
  • A strong research track record in optimal quantum control in experiments, demonstrated by peer-reviewed publications and top-tier conference presentations
  • A passion for quantum computing
  • Experience with Unix/Linux and strong programming skills (e.g., Python, C/C++)
  • Ability to work well with others towards a common goal
  • Research independence: the ability to take responsibility and initiative to conduct your research as it is required in working towards the common goal

Who We Are

The Hardware Innovation Lab is a unique division in 1QBit that works to address the computational challenges of building performant alternative computing devices, including quantum computers and classical HPC devices. With expertise in quantum information science, quantum control, machine learning, optimal control, and optimization, our drive is to support and accelerate the development of advanced computing hardware. We are constantly developing our tools, methods, and expertise, in order to support our hardware partners and experimentalist collaborators.

About 1QBit

1QBit is dedicated to solving the world's most intractable challenges by recasting problems to harness the power of quantum computing. We identify demanding industry problems and apply breakthroughs in computation to machine intelligence and optimization science to build software that allows applications to continually benefit from advances in both quantum and classical hardware. We believe that quantum technologies will form the next pillar of computational progress. We research, benchmark, and build software development kits, online platforms, and applications that make the power of quantum computers accessible to researchers, developers, and industry-leading organizations so they can solve their most difficult problems in fields such as optimization, simulation, and machine learning.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
The Role and Opportunity

You've always been the kind of person to mentor your team. This trait enables you to elevate organisational performance, and consistently deliver on expectations. As the Accounting Manager for CMHA Toronto, you'll use these skills to good effect. Working with both junior and senior staff, you will deliver senior-level accounting and advisory services to wide range of internal and external clients. You'll create alignment within the team between organizational outcomes and program manager needs. Highly motivated with exceptional communication skills, your ability to delegate tasks, mentor, and build relationships across the levels of an organization and your clients will be critical to your success. If you're a CPA, with 5+ years experience and want to join a culture that prizes collaboration and open communication, apply today!

Reporting to the Director of Finance and Shared Services, the Accounting Manager is responsible for the effective operation of the accounting function for the organization. Managing the accounting team, the position maintains and supervises the daily activity of staff to ensure the efficient operation of the team. The position ensures financial records and reports of the organization are accurate and timely and seeks to improve processes and procedures as the organization grows and develops.

About CMHA Toronto

Canadian Mental Health Association (CMHA) is the most established and extensive community mental health organization in Canada. We?identify and respond to?Canada’s?most pressing mental health priorities.?At the national level,?we?push for?nationwide?system?and policy change.?At the community level,?millions of?people?in?Canada?rely on CMHA’s?extensive grassroots presence. Since 1918, CMHA has grown to provide mental health services and supports across Canada in over 330 communities. CMHA Toronto was, established in 1953. CMHA Toronto proudly provides services to over 10,000 clients per year, in 31 programs at 13 locations across the City of Toronto. Our services are delivered by a passionate and diverse team. Join us in providing high quality mental health and addictions services, advocating for a better mental health system, and providing education and mental health supports to clients across Toronto.

Responsibilities
  • Manage the Accounting Team, including Payroll, according to the organization’s policies including orienting, managing, developing, and evaluating reporting employees
  • Ensure the integrity of financial information and reporting for the organization
  • Monitors and controls the assets of CMHA Toronto, ensures that management controls are in place and utilized at all times
  • Responsible for oversight and approval of journal entries for posting to ledgers, month end reconciliations and preparation of supporting schedules.
  • Manage month and year-end reporting processes, ensuring that transactions are posted, and reports prepared in a materially correct and timely manner, and are in accordance with Canadian GAAP (and related guidelines)
  • Supports the Financial Reporting and Budget team and other areas of the organization to evaluate and improve finance business rules, including financial policies and procedures
  • Oversee and review HST, GST and, ensuring that they are prepared consistently with respective regulations, accurately reflecting the underlying transactions, and filed
  • Manage reporting and relationship requirements with financial institutions
  • Responsible for annual external financial review, budget, cash flow management, and forecasting process
  • Lead the year-end audit and coordinate with external auditors at year-end, ensuring that all client assistance schedules, and other special audits are prepared, reviewed and submitted to the auditors as required
  • Manage Accounts Payable and Account Receivable functions ensuring timely processing of all payments and ensuring collections due from customers are settled promptly.
  • Provide finance, accounting, and technical support across the organization relating to financial accounting policies and procedures
  • Be the subject matter expert for Ontario Health Reporting Standards (OHRS) and provide support across the agency to ensure compliance with OHRS requirements.
  • Additional duties as required ensuring the effective operation of the NDT Finance and Accounting function
Skills You Bring
  • University Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related disciplines
  • 5 – 7 years of general accounting experience
  • 2+ years in people management experience
  • CPA Accounting designation
  • Proven working experience as Accounting Supervisor, Accounting Manager, or Finance Manager
  • Advanced communication skills (written and oral)
  • Acute attention to detail and accuracy
  • Expert knowledge of accounting principles (Canadian GAAP), practices, standards, laws and regulations
  • Familiarity with laws and regulations pertaining to Canadian charities
  • Expert Microsoft Office Suite knowledge, specifically with Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP’s, complex formulas and functions)
  • Proficient at using Great Plains 2018 and other financial systems in day-to-day transactions
  • Familiarity with ERP solutions such as Netsuite (Oracle) or Business Central (Microsoft) is an asset
  • Excellent time management and ability to handle multiple priorities
  • Take initiative and ownership of actions and outcomes
  • Capable of leading and developing highly motivated team members through change and challenging circumstances
  • Ability to identify strengths of team members and delegate appropriately
  • Ability to develop effective working relationships with staff at all levels and external stakeholders
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
WHY CHOOSE CMHA TORONTO?

Our Benefits Include

If you care about mental illness and mental health and you have the right skills, then CMHA Toronto may be the place for you. We have a positive and fair workplace culture, where staff are provided with opportunities for learning and advancement. We are also big believers in wellness and work-life balance.
  • Health Care of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP), a predictable, secure monthly income upon retirement
  • Comprehensive Group Health Insurance – Health, Dental, Vision, Paramedical
  • Short-term and Long-term Disability programs and life insurance to protect your income upon illness or injury
  • Work-life balance and flexibility – to ensure you have time for the things that matter to you
  • Annual Professional Development Funding for career learning and advancement
  • Work with like-minded, passionate individuals and make an impact on mental health service delivery
  • Build genuine and authentic connections, with colleagues and clients, with the goal of making a difference
Salary Range: $80,000 - $95,000

CMHA Toronto is committed to promoting a workplace culture of inclusion, openness, mutual respect, and a ‘no blame and accountable’ environment. Our staff report that they value the flexibility in work schedules and the work-life balance CMHA Toronto encourages. They appreciate the training and development opportunities provided to staff and the encouragement for continuous learning. Staff often comment on the sense of family and personal support that exists throughout the organization.

CMHA Toronto is committed to an equitable, diverse, inclusive, anti-racist and anti-oppressive workforce reflecting the diversity of the communities within which we work and is an equal opportunity employer. As such, we encourage equity-seeking candidates to apply, especially those who identify as black, Indigenous, people and women of colour, people with disabilities, 2SLGBTQ+ or women. We recognize and honour the intersectionality of equity-based identities. Personal experience with mental health issues, either through self or a loved one, is an asset. If you are contacted by our offices regarding a job opportunity, please advise prior to the interview should you require any accommodation.

To be eligible for this role candidates will be required to adhere to our COVID-19 policy and provide proof of vaccination.

description:
Job Description

PURPOSE

The Manager, Accounting is accountable to the Controller for overseeing performance of a variety of accounting functions for an assigned portfolio ensuring the integrity of all financial information is recorded in strict compliance with corporate policies and procedures and existing internal controls.

Duties And Responsibilities
  • General Accounting Responsible for and is personally involved in the day-to-day accounting activities, including analyzing records, preparing financial statements and liaising with various departments, peers, service providers and executives, to ensure the integrity of all information recorded and accurate reflection of the financial state of a given portfolio .
  • Reconciliations Oversees the preparation and approves monthly/quarterly accounting, compliance and vendor/tenant reconciliations and ensures closure of any steps required to resolve. As assigned, prepares and/or reviews calculations for recovery of operating costs from tenants, including interpreting the financial aspects of lease clauses relating to recovery of costs .
  • Continuous Improvement Reviews, contributes to the development and implementation of company-wide policies and procedures within the accounting team and across functional lines , in order to improve efficiency as well as recommend any necessary changes to reflect changing business process or external accounting practices and regulations environment .

title: Infection Prevention And Control Hand Hygiene Observer Co–Op Student
description:
Job ID 1673238 Date posted 02/17/2022

Job title :INFECTION PREVENTION AND CONTROL HAND HYGIENE OBSERVER CO–OP STUDENT

Community :TRAIL

Facility :KOOTENAY BNDRY RGNL HSPTL

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

Hand Hygiene is the most important way to prevent the transmission of infection. Several years ago Interior Health formed a Hand Hygiene Program to improve patient safety. Part of the program involves observing healthcare workers cleaning their hands and recording the observations.

Who are we looking for?

Interior Health Infection Prevention and Control department is hiring a Hand Hygiene Observer Co-op Student at the Kootenay Boundary Regional Hospital in Trail, B.C.

This is a four-month term position, from approximately May 2022 to August 2022. Hours of work per week may vary, some early mornings included.

What will you work on?

As an integral part of the infection prevention and control team, the Hand Hygiene student will observe healthcare workers hand hygiene practice and may provide feedback to staff among all levels of healthcare. The Hand Hygiene observer will work closely with the Infection Control Practitioners, providing them with hand hygiene feedback.

The student will be included in development, implementation, and evaluation of education strategies. Interior Health utilizes the observation tool that was developed by the Provincial Hand Hygiene Working Group under the direction of the B.C. Ministry of Health.

Typical Duties And Responsibilities
  • Conduct hand hygiene audit observations including electronic data collection
  • May provide education to staff on hand hygiene practices when knowledge level allows
  • When knowledge level allows, may engage staff in the hand hygiene process through questions, discussions and interactive demonstrations
  • Identify staff learning needs (knowledge gaps)
  • Assess barriers to effective hand hygiene practice and provide feedback of missed opportunities
  • Assist in hand hygiene promotional activities
  • Assist in other Infection Prevention and Control initiatives or projects
How will we help you grow?

We provide you with an orientation customized to meet your needs, and immediate support and access from excellent colleagues. You will have access to work in an interdisciplinary environment where patients are at the centre of care.

Reasons to Apply at Interior Health... What we can do for you

We offer a work environment conducive to growth and development of strong skills. The opportunity to have a balanced lifestyle that allows you to maintain the quality of life you desire.

Come live, work and play where others only vacation. Apply Today!

Qualifications

Education, Training and Experience:
  • Current undergraduate student in a coop program, with completion of at least one year of university education
  • Interior Health will provide hand hygiene observation training
  • Drives an Interior Health vehicle(must have valid class 5 BC license) across a wide area within the health authority to conduct hand hygiene observations
As Part Of Your Application, Please Ensure To
  • Upload your resume, cover letter;
  • Indicate if you are enrolled in a co-op or internship program;
  • Include your co-op coordinator's contact information (name, email, phone);
  • Indicate if you are available for the full work term;
  • Include your expected graduation date.
Skills And Abilities
  • Must have physical ability to perform the duties of the position
  • Must be able to work with related equipment (smart device/phone)
  • Must have strong computer skills including proficiency with MS Office as well as database and internet applications and tools
  • Must be creative and innovative
  • Must have excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • Must be able to work independently and have a high degree of personal initiative and motivation
  • Must be available for overnight travel
  • Must have a keen sense of direction
Successful applicant must have a valid class five B.C. driver’s license and strong computer skills. Must be available for overnight travel.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.

title: Ground Control Dispatcher
description:
Job Description

Distributes incoming air traffic information to pilots and ground handlers and follow up with update information as required.

Communicate flight release and fuel load information to appropriate operations.

Job Responsibilities

Communicates flight release and fuel load information to appropriate operations.

Maintains lines of communication with line operations and air carriers through the use of two-way radios.

Coordinates with departments in billing for services rendered and compile information for each flight and submit the final bill preparation.

Make arrangements for accommodations when flight delays occur.

Handle phone traffic.

Assist in the planning and control of the gate assignment.

Assist with passenger services as required.

Recommend weight and balance preparation in accordance with airline requirements.

Meet the station's attendance standards.

Job Qualifications

High School diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Excellent verbal and interpersonal skills.

Possess/maintain a valid driver's license and other FAA Airport required identification/seals or authorization.

An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Vet

title: Manufacturing Accounting Manager
description:
Cardinal Health, with over 1300 employees in Canada, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.


Cardinal Health-Gananoque manufactures many life impacting medical devices that help our customers thrive in a changing world. We are your humble partners, striving each day to make healthcare more efficient and effective and our patients as healthy as possible. We are more than 450 employees with 119 years of Canadian history, a deep understanding of the medical devices we manufacture every day and a passion for innovation.


Cardinal Health is seeking a Manufacturing Accounting Manager to add to our location in Gananoque, ON. Under general direction of the Manufacturing group Controller, this position manages the functions of, General Accounting, Cost Accounting, Payroll, and Taxation. Directs the annual budget process and the monthly preparation and analysis of financial statements and forecasts. Analyzes and interprets financial data and recommends changes to improve systems and financial performance. We are seeking an innovative leader who can help up improve and grow.



Your Contributions to the Organization will be to:

  • Oversee General Accounting, Cost Accounting and Payroll functions
  • Responsible for all cash reporting and disbursements activities that includes A/P payments, wire transfers, Hedging, Netting and Cash Pooling. Monitoring and reporting on Pensions Plan activities including the preparation of the annual Financial Statements
  • Responsible for seeing that all financially related tasks are performed in a manner that complies with Corporate Policy
  • Responsible for Provincial and Federal government reporting activities that includes coordinating any audit activities
  • Coordinate local income tax activities including income tax return preparation and transfer pricing analysis with Corporate Tax.
  • Complete annual SOX assignments as an Assessor, Design and Effectiveness Reviewer.
  • Work with plant management to analyze and improve plant variances. Report and interpret monthly results including financial variances, cost reduction program and KPI’s.
  • Complete annual budget and product costing as well as monthly & quarterly forecasts.
  • Ensure maintenance and safeguarding of fixed assets and construction in progress.
  • Establish, modify, document and coordinate implementation of accounting and accounting control procedures.
  • Compile and analyze financial information to close the books and reconcile general ledger accounts.


This Job might be for you if you have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting CPA– CGA, CMA or CA
  • 7+ years experience with manufacturing background
  • Advance working knowledge of Excel is required.
  • High integrity, business acumen and desire to drive and influence meaningful change.
  • Excellent communication skills, able to use logic and critical thinking to analyse complex situations and implement innovative solutions to drive effective business changes.


Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting an accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

""

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, colour, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by law.

title: Manager Accounting
description:
Job Description

The Manager of Accounting shall be responsible for assisting the Divisional Controller with the management of overall financial operations within Brandt Tractor Ltd. and will work collaboratively to provide accurate financial information for the Operations, including preparing financial reporting, account reconciliations. This role will direct and manage the day-to-day accounting functions and produce monthly financial results for the applicable operating branches within Brandt Tractor Ltd. It will report and provide analysis on monthly results to the Divisional Controller and Director of Financial Reporting and Control, manage the monthly and annual financial reporting; and various projects within the Finance Department.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Manage the day-to-day accounting functions including the entry of journal entries, payroll, accounts payable, accounts receivable and statutory reporting.
  • Monitor internal controls to ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with established legal regulatory and company policies and procedures.
  • Hire, supervise and evaluate accounting staff, ensuring that all personnel are adequately trained and have up-to-date job descriptions;
  • Prepare, analyze and present monthly, quarterly and annual operating results for each department.
  • Work with the Divisional Controller and Operations to define, measure, analyze, improve and control current processes which impact customer quality and influence internal operating efficiency.
  • Work with external auditors on year-end audit.
  • Assist with research and development on various accounting requirements along with various CRA requirements.
  • Responsible for the accuracy and timeliness of financial information.
  • Monitor internal controls with respect to financial policies, processes and procedures.
  • Provide advice and guidance on all accounting matters including financial systems, record keeping, analysis, and reporting.
  • Assist the Divisional Controller in setting the priorities within accounting group.
  • Assist with the coordination of the year-end audit and preparation of audited financial statements.
  • Assist with the coordination of all other customer and government audits.
  • Assist with the preparation of monthly financial statements and external reporting to financial institutions, ensuring that all reporting requirements are met.
  • Assist with all other financial reporting to various companies and agencies (Insurance, Stats Can, etc.).
  • With input from the CFO, VP of Finance and Director of Financial Reporting and Control, work with the Divisional Controller on the formulation of accounting policies, procedures and controls.
  • Specific projects and other related duties as required.
Required Experience
  • University degree in Business/Accounting, with advanced degree or professional accounting designation (such as CPA) preferred.
  • Experience and knowledge of all aspects of corporate accounting and financial management, including accounting principles, practices and applications as well as financial analysis and budgeting experience.
  • Knowledge of all relevant Federal, Provincial and local requirements regarding financial records, pension, profit sharing, and the like is essential.
  • Able to efficiently lead a team of employees, work as part of a team and work independently as well.
  • Able to work well under pressure and meet set deadlines.
  • Good organizational, leadership, time management and prioritizing skills.
  • Ability to interpret and implement company policies and procedures.
  • Attention to detail in all areas of work.
  • Proficient communication, interpersonal and organizational skills are vital to the role.
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Office and Excel.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Good problem solving skills.
  • Knowledge of ERP computer systems an asset.

title: (Home) Infection Prevention and Control (IPAC) Manager - Full-Time
description:
(Home) Infection Prevention & Control (IPAC) Manager - Extendicare Mapleview

Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of over 115 operated senior care and living centres, as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 individuals are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada.

Candidates are invited to apply for the Full Time position of (Home) Infection Prevention & Control (IPAC) Manager to to work at Extendicare Peterborough a 174 Bed facility located in Peterborough, Ontario.

Reporting directly to the Administrator, the (Home) IPAC Manager at Extendicare Peterborough will be a safety expert who leads the implementation, coordination, and evaluation of improvements in infection prevention and control and serves as a role model to promote the goals of the IPAC program within the home. The (Home) IPAC Manager will be responsible for carrying out a range of activities related to the surveillance, detection, prevention, and control of infections within the home. This role will also conduct relevant analyses to identify risk factors or outbreaks and develop interventions for the prevention and control of the disease, often in consultation with the IPAC Consultant for the region. This role will facilitate change through application of IPAC standards within the home and provide best practice recommendations with the goal of improving resident outcomes and preventing disease outbreaks

Responsibilities
  • Leads the LTC home’s IPAC program, consulting with the IPAC Consultant for the region as required in the development and evaluation of the home’s IPAC program.
  • Ensures the IPAC program in the home is consistent with standards, best practice and key principles established by applicable provincial standards and protocols and with Extendicare policies and procedures;
  • Supervises the various roles & interdisciplinary team, responsible for carrying out the IPAC program in the home and chairs all home IPAC Committee meetings;
  • Trains staff, residents, and care providers on IPAC standards and practices as outlined by Extendicare policies and procedures and applicable provincial directives at the commencement of their employment, annually, with any change in policies/ practices, as well as upon onset of an infectious disease outbreak in the home;
  • Performs regular IPAC audits in the home and leads the investigation of IPAC breaches;
  • Conducts IPAC risk assessments in the home, and leads development of corrective plans of action, reporting on progress at the IPAC Committee meetings quarterly;
  • Represents the home as the point of contact with local public health units, Extendicare corporate IPAC consultants and Hospital IPAC partners;
  • Oversees the emergency stockpile inventory in the home, including personal protective equipment (PPE), and other critical supplies required in an outbreak (e.g., testing supplies, cleaning supplies, etc.);
  • Oversees the mask fit testing process for all staff in the home and ensure retesting requirements are maintained and tracked as per policy;
  • Coordinates implementation of any immunization programs, including reporting and data collection to corporate IPAC program for trending and analysis Initiates and leads outbreak management protocols for the home;
  • Oversees any required surveillance, testing, and contact tracing associated with infectious disease outbreaks in the home, in partnership with the local public health unit and local hospital (as appropriate);
  • Oversees internal surveillance and monitoring processes, including internal line listing, and related outbreak management requirements;
  • Leads outbreak management meetings within the home and in partnership with the local public health unit and corporate IPAC consultants;
  • Conducts regular and proactive communication with residents, families and staff related to infectious diseases outbreaks and protocols;
  • In partnership with the Administrator/Executive Director and regional IPAC Consultant, ensures that the outbreak management protocol and pandemic plan are reviewed and evaluated annually in alignment with Extendicare’s policies and procedures;
Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a health profession, or Regulated Health Professional in good standing with respective regulatory college;
  • 3-5 years’ experience working in health care, including public health sector, with several years in an IPAC lead capacity;
  • LTC home operational experience, considered an asset;
  • Current Certification in Infection Control (CIC) is preferred, or, willingness to complete by April 2025;
  • Demonstrated working knowledge of infection prevention control principles and practices;
  • Knowledge of relevant legislation, including provincial Occupational Health and Safety Act and other provincial Acts/Guidelines/Regulations;
  • Experience training health professionals using adult learning principles, practices and techniques
  • Strong organization skills;
  • Demonstrated excellence in verbal and written communications;
  • Proficient computer skills including the use of health care information systems (e.g., PointClickCare) and sufficient ability using Microsoft Excel to create and manage line lists for outbreak management;
  • Ability to make decisions in a timely manner using data and best practices related to the precautionary principle.
CLOSING DATE: May 13, 2022.

Please Forward Your Résumé To The Attention Of

Name: Jamal Mohamed, Human Resources Advisor

E-mail: JMohamed@extendicare.com

In Ontario, Extendicare, ParaMed Home Health Care, and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodation needs must be provided in advance. To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting.

Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

title: Manufacturing Accounting Manager
description:
Cardinal Health, with over 1300 employees in Canada, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.

Cardinal Health-Gananoque manufactures many life impacting medical devices that help our customers thrive in a changing world. We are your humble partners, striving each day to make healthcare more efficient and effective and our patients as healthy as possible. We are more than 450 employees with 119 years of Canadian history, a deep understanding of the medical devices we manufacture every day and a passion for innovation.

Cardinal Health is seeking a Manufacturing Accounting Manager to add to our location in Gananoque, ON.  Under general direction of the Manufacturing group Controller, this position manages the functions of, General Accounting, Cost Accounting, Payroll, and Taxation. Directs the annual budget process and the monthly preparation and analysis of financial statements and forecasts. Analyzes and interprets financial data and recommends changes to improve systems and financial performance. We are seeking an innovative leader who can help up improve and grow.

For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings.

Your Contributions to the Organization will be to:  

  • Oversee General Accounting, Cost Accounting and Payroll functions

  • Responsible for all cash reporting and disbursements activities that includes A/P payments, wire transfers, Hedging, Netting and Cash Pooling. Monitoring and reporting on Pensions Plan activities including the preparation of the annual Financial Statements

  • Responsible for seeing that all financially related tasks are performed in a manner that complies with Corporate Policy

  • Responsible for Provincial and Federal government reporting activities that includes coordinating any audit activities

  • Coordinate local income tax activities including income tax return preparation and transfer pricing analysis with Corporate Tax.

  • Complete annual SOX assignments as an Assessor, Design and Effectiveness Reviewer.

  • Work with plant management to analyze and improve plant variances. Report and interpret monthly results including financial variances, cost reduction program and KPI’s.

  • Complete annual budget and product costing as well as monthly & quarterly forecasts.

  • Ensure maintenance and safeguarding of fixed assets and construction in progress.

  • Establish, modify, document and coordinate implementation of accounting and accounting control procedures. 

  • Compile and analyze financial information to close the books and reconcile general ledger accounts.

This Job might be for you if you have: 

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting CPA– CGA, CMA or CA

  • 7+ years experience with manufacturing background

  • Advance working knowledge of Excel is required.

  • High integrity, business acumen and desire to drive and influence meaningful change.

  • Excellent communication skills, able to use logic and critical thinking to analyse complex situations and implement innovative solutions to drive effective business changes.  

Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting an accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

""

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

The Accounting Manager, will manage a team of professionals while designing and implementing best-in class accounting policies, procedures and internal controls. They are going through a period of transitions , all companies are moving to Microsoft Dynamics 3
  • This means they have to participate in the migration of the data into the new system, coming in to clean up the books, streamline, bring their ideas, encourage the team to be create & think outside the box.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the timely review and approval of monthly balance sheet account reconciliations for the group.
  • Ensures group financial reporting is delivered timely and accurately with strong attention to detail.
  • Performs monthly group P&L review of expenses and provides variance analysis.

  • Guides, develops and motivates a team of accounting professionals.

  • Participates in streamlining processes and month-end close for the group entities.
  • Participates with the review of income tax and sales tax accounts and related schedules on a monthly basis including the annual corporate income tax returns and working papers for accounting and tax compliance purposes. Assists the tax department with any tax audits.

  • Participates in the budget process and ad hoc projects, as required.

  • Using one’s knowledge of economic, financial, market, and industry trends to understand and improve individual, work group, and/or organizational results; using one’s understanding of major business functions, industry trends, and own organization’s position to contribute to effective business strategies and/or tactics

title: Manager, Assurance & Accounting
description:
Putting people first, every day

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, our professionals provide exceptional service, helping clients with advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an award-winning environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.

Your opportunity

Our Montreal office is looking for a Manager to join the Assurance & Accounting team and own the following responsibilities:

  • Efficiently prepare year-end engagements and tax returns for your clients in a variety of industries
  • Perform audits and reviews on a variety of organizations, prepare working papers and financial statements per regulatory standards
  • Build positive working relationships with clients and effectively respond to request and suggestions
  • Participate in business development initiatives and identify new business opportunities with existing clients
  • Effectively communicate with team members regarding progress updates and issues on an ongoing basis
  • Engage in training staff and invest in the professional development of your team

How do we define success for your role?

  • You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect and Collaboration
  • You understand your client’s industry, challenges, and opportunities; clients describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
  • You identify, recommend, and are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
  • You share in an inclusive and engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
  • You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
  • You grow your expertise through learning and professional development.

Your experience and education

  • You have completed your CPA designation.
  • You have at least 3 years of audit experience in the public accounting industry.
  • You enjoy working within the non-profit industry and are keen to develop further knowledge in this area.
  • You value teamwork, client service, and quality in detailed work.
  • You display strong problem solving, analytical, and communication skills.

Why BDO?

Our people-first approach to talent has earned us a spot among Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2022 . This recognition is a milestone we’re thrilled to add to our collection of awards for both experienced and student talent experiences.

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:

  • We enable you to engage with how we change and evolve, being a key contributor to the success and growth of BDO in Canada.
  • We help you become a better professional within our services, industries, and markets with extensive opportunities for learning and development.
  • We support your achievement of personal goals outside of the office and making an impact on your community.

Giving back adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market-leading personal time off policy. We’re committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours, and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed without barriers. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion, Equity and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, equity, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us .

Hybrid new normal: As a hybrid workplace, all BDO personnel are expected to spend some of their time working in the office, at the client site, and remotely unless accommodations or alternative work arrangements are in place. To protect the health and safety of our people, clients, and communities, we may require all partners and employees to be COVID-19 fully vaccinated in order to enter a BDO office. Individuals that cannot be fully vaccinated with a Health Canada approved vaccine due to medical reasons or another protected ground under Human Rights legislation may request an accommodation.

Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click “Apply now” to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page . #LI- JD1

title: Infection Prevention And Control Hand Hygiene Observer Co–Op Student
description:
Job ID 1673199 Date posted 02/17/2022

Job title :INFECTION PREVENTION AND CONTROL HAND HYGIENE OBSERVER CO–OP STUDENT

Community :NELSON

Facility :KOOTENAY LAKE REGNL HSPTL

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

Hand Hygiene is the most important way to prevent the transmission of infection. Several years ago Interior Health formed a Hand Hygiene Program to improve patient safety. Part of the program involves observing healthcare workers cleaning their hands and recording the observations.

Who are we looking for?

Interior Health Infection Prevention and Control department is hiring a Hand Hygiene Observer Co-op Student at the Kootenay Lake Regional Hospital in Nelson, B.C.

This is a four-month term position, from approximately May 2022 to August 2022. Hours of work per week may vary, some early mornings included.

What will you work on?

As an integral part of the infection prevention and control team, the Hand Hygiene student will observe healthcare workers hand hygiene practice and may provide feedback to staff among all levels of healthcare. The Hand Hygiene observer will work closely with the Infection Control Practitioners, providing them with hand hygiene feedback.

The student will be included in development, implementation, and evaluation of education strategies. Interior Health utilizes the observation tool that was developed by the Provincial Hand Hygiene Working Group under the direction of the B.C. Ministry of Health.

Typical Duties And Responsibilities
  • Conduct hand hygiene audit observations including electronic data collection
  • May provide education to staff on hand hygiene practices when knowledge level allows
  • When knowledge level allows, may engage staff in the hand hygiene process through questions, discussions and interactive demonstrations
  • Identify staff learning needs (knowledge gaps)
  • Assess barriers to effective hand hygiene practice and provide feedback of missed opportunities
  • Assist in hand hygiene promotional activities
  • Assist in other Infection Prevention and Control initiatives or projects
How will we help you grow?

We provide you with an orientation customized to meet your needs, and immediate support and access from excellent colleagues. You will have access to work in an interdisciplinary environment where patients are at the centre of care.

Reasons to Apply at Interior Health... What we can do for you

We offer a work environment conducive to growth and development of strong skills. The opportunity to have a balanced lifestyle that allows you to maintain the quality of life you desire.

Come live, work and play where others only vacation. Apply Today!

Qualifications

Education, Training and Experience:
  • Current undergraduate student in a coop program, with completion of at least one year of university education
  • Interior Health will provide hand hygiene observation training
  • Drives an Interior Health vehicle(must have valid class 5 BC license) across a wide area within the health authority to conduct hand hygiene observations
As Part Of Your Application, Please Ensure To
  • Upload your resume, cover letter;
  • Indicate if you are enrolled in a co-op or internship program;
  • Include your co-op coordinator's contact information (name, email, phone);
  • Indicate if you are available for the full work term;
  • Include your expected graduation date.
Skills And Abilities
  • Must have physical ability to perform the duties of the position
  • Must be able to work with related equipment (smart device/phone)
  • Must have strong computer skills including proficiency with MS Office as well as database and internet applications and tools
  • Must be creative and innovative
  • Must have excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • Must be able to work independently and have a high degree of personal initiative and motivation
  • Must be available for overnight travel
  • Must have a keen sense of direction
Successful applicant must have a valid class five B.C. driver’s license and strong computer skills. Must be available for overnight travel.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.

title: Manager, Audit - Quality Control and Accounting Standards
description:
Manager, Audit ( Quality Control and Accounting Standards)

Richter is one of Canada's largest independent accounting, business advisory and consulting firms. Innovation is the key to our approach, combined with the ability to generate results quickly. Richter offers a full range of advisory and consulting services, supported by in-depth industry knowledge and national and international experience.

Dedicated to the success of our clients, our people, and our community, we foster a strong sense of family that has been a part of our DNA for more than 90 years. We value our team, work together, and challenge the status quo; we work with people who aspire to create a better world.

It’s Your Talent, Make it Count!

Professional Practice Group (PPG)

The team that forms the Professional Practice Group (PPG) is made of professional accountants who have strong technical skills and several years of practical experience. The objective of the Professional Practice is to ensure the quality of the services rendered in assurance by the firm in terms of ethics, independence, training, methodology and financial reporting. To do this, PPG has developed a unique approach to provide our professionals with high-level training and support in the application of our audit methodology. PPG is also involved in all matters relating to ethics and independence.

Furthermore, PPG through its Financial Reporting Advisory Services group, directly assists clients and professionals dealing with complex accounting issues (e.g. business combinations, hedge relationships, variable interest entities) and with audit questions relating to clients in particular, the conversion from GAAP to IFRS or the financial reporting obligations of public companies.

The Professional Practice group also manages all aspects of professional staff training and is responsible for developing the firm's audit methodology, as well as training, implementation, and monitoring.

A day in the life of a Manager, Audit (PPG)
  • Participate in internal consulting services (organize them, direct them and carry out research) to determine the appropriate accounting treatment for certain transactions, in accordance with various GAAP, including ASPE, IFRS and US GAAP;
  • Assist in the provision of financial reporting advisory services to assist non-assurance clients in accounting for particular complex transactions (for example, convertible debentures, business combinations, depreciation etc.);
  • Monitor the activities of all accounting standard-setting bodies (ie. FASB, SEC, AICPA, EITF, IASB, CPA Canada etc.) and evaluate the impacts of any change in the firm's clientele;
  • Participate in the development, implementation and support of the audit strategy;
  • Perform the quality control review of financial statements;
  • Assist in the preparation and facilitation of various training and courses on GAAP updates to professionals and partners of the firm;
  • Provide support in the resolution of complex accounting problems;
  • Participate in the development of sectoral guidelines on accounting and auditing.

What we are looking for:
  • CPA auditor designation;
  • Minimum of four years of relevant work experience as an auditor (including at least two years in professional practice and/or quality control);
  • Great facility for written and verbal communications in French and English
  • Strong technical knowledge of ASPE and IFRS (US GAAP, an asset);
  • In-depth knowledge of auditing and accounting;
  • Ability to train various professionals and partners (ability to verbalize the information and facilitate workshops);
  • Excellent analytical skills;
  • Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize and complete tasks in a timely manner;
  • Team spirit;
  • Willingness to offer high quality services to internal and external clients;
  • Ability to adapt to various work environments.

What Richter offers you?

Our Montreal office is conveniently located on McGill College. We have regular volunteer opportunities and a variety of team social events. Learning is encouraged, and courses are reimbursed for our team members.

A competitive compensation package, insurance benefits, a retirement savings plan, an employee and family assistance program, a health and well-being program, as well as professional development are also offered. To accommodate your personal and family obligations, a variety of work arrangements are available which may include a flexible schedule and working remotely.

title: Contrôleur de projets - gestion de portefeuille TI
description:
Joignez-vous à l’équipe de Cofomo, fière lauréate du concours Les Sociétés les mieux gérées au Canada de 2020!

Vous avez un profil convaincant de contrôleur de projets - gestion de portefeuille TI? Un de nos clients à Montréal a besoin de votre expertise. Votre succès professionnel nous tient à cœur et nous espérons vous avoir dans l’équipe!

Découvrez ce que l’on attend de vous pour réussir ce mandat.

Les Responsabilités Du Poste Sont
  • Participer aux discussions du plan stratégique des produits/programmes;
  • Supporter les activités de planification trimestrielle des produits/programmes et en assurer le bon déroulement;
  • S'assurer de la qualité des livrables en gestion de projet, du respect des coûts et des échéanciers;
  • Collaborer avec les chargés de projets afin que les documents soient conformes aux exigences et disponibles à temps pour les différents comités;
  • Préparer les rapports financiers mensuels des produits/programmes et analyser les écarts entre SAP & EPM;
  • Valider la planification des ressources en préparation pour les différentes revues financières;
  • Coordonner la réalisation des revues de progrès des projets et assurer un suivi continu du plan d'action;
  • Contrôler l’application du modèle de gestion et du « plan de projet EPM» au moyen d'audits et identifier les mesures correctives;
  • Implanter les processus et outils requis afin d'améliorer la qualité des données;
  • Fournir des avis, la formation et le soutien en matière de gestion de projets ou de programmes;
  • Conseiller les bonnes pratiques pour l'utilisation des différents outils;
  • Proposer des améliorations au niveau de la gestion de projets ou de programmes;
  • Assister le chargé de programme dans les différentes activités de gestion du portefeuille.
Le Profil Recherché Est Le Suivant
  • Posséder sept (7) années d’expérience à titre de contrôleur de projets;
  • Disposer d’une expérience en coaching/accompagnement et amélioration de la qualité des données;
  • Détenir une connaissance approfondies de MS Project, Excel et EPM;
  • Avoir démontré une grande rigueur dans le suivi des projets, suivi budgétaire, suivi de l'échéancier, identification des écarts;
  • Connaître SAP suivi financier et Jira (un atout);
  • Faire preuve d’autonomie, d’organisation et de rigueur;
  • Être bilingue en français et en anglais, au parlé et à l’écrit.
Pourquoi choisir Cofomo?
  • Intégration et suivi personnalisés;
  • Service de gestion de carrière;
  • Programme de référencement attractif;
  • Club social dynamique;
  • Selon les politiques de nos clients, possibilité de travailler en télétravail ou en horaire variable.
Postulez dès maintenant pour faire avancer votre carrière!

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Job Description

Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
  • Provides financial services such as cash management, budgeting, management reporting, general financial support, and forecasting.
  • Participate in preparation of monthly financial statements: GL account analysis; Journal entries
  • Interface with Russian Subsidiary Accounting, Review and convert financial statements to US GAAP.
  • Coordinate and explain results with US Accounting and Forecasting teams in Arizona.
  • Comparing actual to budget to projections and investigating variances
  • Responsible for analyzing certain accounting files such as R&D tax credit, deferred revenue
  • Cooperate in the development of several projects, such as improvement of accounting processes
  • Preparation top level income statement & balance sheet projections
  • Preparation 1 st & 2 nd bottoms up plan updates (budgeting)
  • Preparation Corporate income taxes
  • Preparation R&D tax credit analysis / by project
  • Manages reports and special analyses as required and provides financial and business administrative services required by the project.
  • Cooperate in the development of several projects such as improvement of accounting processes

Profile (requirements)

The candidate must also have the following requirements:
  • At least 5 to 10 years of increasing experience in accounting and finance
  • The flexibility to work outside of normal business hours on occasion.
  • Must be highly motivated, self-initiated and thrive through excellence.
  • Excellent verbal & written communications skills, preference given to those who speak Russian fluently.
  • Excellent organizational and analytical skills with great attention to detail.
  • Strong sense of urgency and ability of set priorities
  • A team player, who demonstrates innovation, perseverance and commitment
KNOWLEDGE PRE-REQUISITES
  • Bachelor Degree in Accounting
  • Hold on accounting professional title (CPA)
  • Advance Excel Skills

Description Du Travail

Les responsabilités particulières comprennent, entre autres :

・ Fournit des services financiers comme la gestion de la trésorerie, la budgétisation, les rapports de gestion, le soutien financier général et les prévisions.

・ Participer à la préparation des états financiers mensuels : analyse des comptes GL ; Entrées de journal

・ Interface avec la comptabilité auxiliaire russe, examen et conversion des états financiers en US GAAP.

・ Coordonner et expliquer les résultats avec les équipes américaines de comptabilité et de prévision en Arizona.

・ Comparaison entre le budget réel et les prévisions et étude des écarts

・ Responsable de l'analyse de certains dossiers comptables tels que le crédit d'impôt pour la R-D, les revenus reportés

・ Coopérer à l'élaboration de plusieurs projets, tels que l'amélioration des processus comptables

・ Préparation du compte de résultat de niveau supérieur et des prévisions de bilan

・ Préparation des mises à jour du plan de mise à niveau des 1er et 2e niveaux (budgétisation)

・ Préparation Impôts sur le revenu des sociétés

・ Préparation Analyse du crédit d'impôt R&D / par projet

・ Gère les rapports et les analyses spéciales au besoin et fournit les services financiers et administratifs requis par le projet.

・ Coopérer à l'élaboration de plusieurs projets tels que l'amélioration des processus comptables

PROFIL (EXIGENCES)

Le candidat doit également satisfaire aux exigences suivantes :

・ Au moins 5 à 10 ans d'expérience croissante en comptabilité et finance

・ La flexibilité de travailler en dehors des heures normales de bureau à l'occasion.

・ Doit être très motivé, auto-initié et prospérer par l'excellence.

・ Excellentes habiletés en communication verbale et écrite, préférence accordée à ceux qui parlent couramment le russe.

・ Excellentes compétences organisationnelles et analytiques avec une grande attention aux détails.

・ Sens aigu de l'urgence et capacité d'établir des priorités

・ Un joueur d'équipe qui fait preuve d'innovation, de persévérance et d'engagement

CONNAISSANCES PRÉREQUISES

・ Baccalauréat en comptabilité

・ Détention du titre professionnel comptable (CPA)

・ Compétences Excel avancées

title: Accounting and Assurance Manager
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced, motivated and client-driven individual to join our accounting and assurance team in the capacity of Manager.

What You Can Expect …

At McCay Duff, you can have a rewarding and exciting career. We understand that financial services are about far more than numbers; they are about dreams and achieving success. We feel the same about your career.

At McCay Duff, we take care of our people. We understand that our staff is our greatest asset so we offer a competitive salary, health and dental benefits and a team environment. We also provide annual merit-based increases that reflect your value and contribution to our Firm.

Success in this role will require prior experience in business development activities, managing both assurance and non-assurance client engagements and staff development.

Who You Can Become …

You will become a key member of our multi-disciplined team whose role will be focused on business growth, as well as helping clients achieve their goals through expert assurance, business advisory and tax services. Successful candidates will also mentor and assist with the development of professional staff as they progress in their professional careers.

As a Manager You Will
  • Apply technical expertise and research in formulating client-related recommendations in accordance with professional standards and Firm policies;
  • Actively participate in business development activities to recognize and seize business opportunities including the use of marketing skills to attract new clients, as well as identifying potential opportunities to provide additional services to existing clients;
  • Manage multiple engagements concurrently with sound project management principles;
  • Develop and maintain meaningful relationships with assigned clients;
  • Conduct pre-engagement planning with the engagement team and scope, plan and manage assignments for maximum profitability while maintaining Firm standards;
  • Complete the detailed review of assurance and non-assurance engagements to ensure they are in accordance with professional and Firm standards;
  • Participate on committees in developing and implementing Firm management policies and professional standards;
  • Coach staff to their highest potential by developing their skills and competencies through supervision, consistent recognition and encouragement, mentoring and assignment of client files;
  • Conduct internal and/or external presentations and training related to area of expertise;
  • Participate in interviews to assist in the selection of talented candidates, and;
  • Conduct and/or provide input on performance evaluations.
Qualifications
  • Professional accounting designation (CPA);
  • Manager: a minimum of five years’ experience in public practice with a minimum of one year at the supervisor experience level;
  • Advanced accounting, auditing and tax skills;
  • Demonstrated experience in business development and growth;
  • Experience with CaseWare, Caseview and TaxPrep considered an asset;
  • A team player able to rally resources and work with others to meet the needs of the client;
  • Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence;
  • Strong interest in coaching and development, with a commitment to personal growth;
  • Proven ability to deliver the full cycle of project management accountabilities;
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills;
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple deadlines;
  • Ability to work flexible hours;
  • Experienced with engagement problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, decision making, documentation, managing client expectations and team leadership;
  • Support the Vision, Mission and Values of the Firm;
  • Ability to anticipate the long term impact of decisions and take a comprehensive approach to problem-solving, and;
  • Bilingual in English and French considered an asset.
If you are interested in a great career opportunity with our firm, please apply by e-mail atcareers@mccayduff.com and address your application to Krista Mason.

Please identify in your application the source from which you heard of this position.

We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

McCay Duff is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, or disability.

McCay Duff welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your application.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and McCay Duff’s Policies on Accommodation, McCay Duff provides reasonable accommodation so that qualified applicants with a disability may participate in the selection process.

title: Complex Accounting Manager
description:
Complex Accounting Manager - (Calgary, Alberta, or Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada)

Note This role is flexible in job banding at either Senior Accountant or Manager level. All interested & qualified internal applicants are encouraged to apply and will be considered at the appropriate job level given their respective education, experience, and qualifications.

At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With approximately 23,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.

This position reports to the Senior Manager, Complex Accounting

This position is located in Calgary, Alberta, or Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada and is available for hybrid work.

What You Will Do
  • Preparation and review of the quarterly accounting and reporting for defined contribution pension, defined benefit pension, and other post-retirement benefits plans
  • Providing complex accounting support for curtailments and amendments of defined benefit pension plans
  • Responsible for review of complex contracts
  • Responsible for assessing accounting guidance changes on the Center of Excellence teams, corporate and production locations
  • Responsible for overseeing and maintaining the companies Authority Limit Policy and related Governance, Risk, and Compliance approvals
  • Preparation and review of other month-end close activities as assigned
  • Ad-hoc data analysis and financial modelling support
  • Provide technical accounting assistance to other professional members of the Corporate Accounting, Tax, Treasury, and IT in the application of complex accounting issues; including acquisitions and divestures, corporate restructuring, researching accounting and reporting issues as they arise and staying abreast of IASB and FASB developments
  • Support on-going initiatives and projects as needed
What You Will Bring
  • Professional accounting designation (CPA/CA/CMA/CGA) with minimum of 5 years post-qualification experience
  • Minimum of 10 years’ experience in positions of expanding responsibility
  • In depth and up to date technical knowledge of accounting ethics and Canadian and U.S. regulatory compliance requirements
  • Detailed knowledge of IFRS
  • Understanding of US GAAP would be an asset
  • Experience with a large ERP (SAP experience preferred)
  • Enterprise-wide exposure to accounting issues within a large public company
  • Eye for detail while also having a broad conceptual understanding of the application of accounting and materiality in a multifaceted business environment
  • Problem-solving skills with regulatory and compliance issues within complex accounting transactions
  • Previous involvement in transaction support and/or acquisition accounting
  • Exceptional skills in effectively managing multiple tasks, under pressure and within defined timelines in a project driven environment
  • The ability to direct and coordinate the efforts of a team and interface with various levels of administration in a multi-task, deadline oriented, team environment
  • Ability to exercise excellent professional judgment
  • Critical thinking and strategic mindset and initiative
  • High degree of initiative and self-motivation
  • Highest level of verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel (vlookup, pivot tables)
Are you a good match? Apply today!

Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled. In accordance with Nutrien policies, you will be required to undergo a background check and may be required to undergo a substance test. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

To stay connected to us and for the latest job postings and news, follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter
  • EOE race/color/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/disability/veteran
